title: cheese@beer
reviews: Nice place to be there on a sunny day  )). It could be better, but overall it's nice and vibrating. You can walk there and take a sip of any kind of beverage. It's crowded and it's fun to see other people there.

title: A short stroll should do it
reviews: Nice to walk around during the day, but in the evening it gets a bit dicey. And stay near the hub... too close to Hastings Street and you'll feel the socio-economic shift.

title: Welfares
reviews: Allot of welfares live here, just look for the big red W! It was once Woodwards Department Store, now it stands for Welfare bums!!!

title: Not impressed at all
reviews: Perhaps it was because our visit was on a rainy weekday evening, but I was underwhelmed by Gastown.   Most of the stores were closed, except for a few selling souvenirs.  Many restaurants were closed, however there were a number of brew pubs open.  I wanted to see this area, as my parents grew up just blocks away.  Maybe if we visited during the day, or on the weekend, it would been more interesting, however that will have to wait until another trip to Vancouver.

title: ü§Æü§Æ
reviews: Way too many homeless people. Honestly they creep me, if you are okay with them, there are couple of good places to sit. One is right next to the gas clock.

title: Very disappointed
reviews: Such a beautiful area with a lot of history however, the morning we visited was a disappointment. The streets were very pungent. They smelled very strongly of urine. There were many people sleeping on the streets there. Also, due to construction, it was extremely noisy. Not a pleasant visit at all.

title: Must see!
reviews: From the steam clock to the amazing boutique shopping, Gastown is a MUST! You will find amazing appetizers and drinks along the way! Flying Pig or Pourhouse for Happy Hour is a can‚Äôt miss!!

title: Steam Clock @ Gastown
reviews: As the birthplace of Vancouver, Gastown is a MUST VISIT! Gastown is accessible from the Waterfront Skytrain Station and is full of unique shops, restaurants and bars.The Steam-clock puts on a show every 15 minutes and it is neat to see and hear.

title: Fun time in Gastown!
reviews: We visited Vancouver in April 2019 and loved Gastown with it's historic streets, great shops, coffee shops and pubs. The Gastown Steam Clock is a must see, make sure you are there on the hour when the clock whistles and puff steam from its top. Gastown is where the pioneers named the city Vancouver in 1885. Gastown was named after the founding father, "Gassy Jack" John Deighton, the Deighton House Hotel saloonkeeper known for his 'Gassy' monologues. The Hotel burnt down in the 'Great Fire of 1886'.

title: A must see
reviews: If it is your first time to Vancouver, put this area on your must see list. The historic steam clock offers a great photo op. Lots of shops and restaurants to check out. Vancouver is such a walkable city. Walking offers a great way to explore.

title: Went to see the Gastown Steamclock
reviews: Went to see the Gastown clock and Walk the street as well as Walking Coal Harbour. Kids though it was pretty cool.

title: A Contrast to the ambiance of Robson Street
reviews: This area is more quaint and less metropolitan than Robson Street.It is the original settlement that became the core of the creation of Vancouver and is named for "Gassy" Jack Deighton, a Yorkshire seaman, steamboat captain and barkeep who arrived in 1867 to open the area's first saloon. He was famous for his habit of talking at length (or "gassing").It has distinctive and historic architecture that is a little quaint, the streets are cobblestones and narrower than other areas and this gives it a personable atmosphere. It is a mix of "hip" contemporary fashion and interior furnishing boutiques, tourist-oriented businesses (generally restricted to Water Street), restaurants, nightclubs, poverty and newly upscale housing. In addition, there are law firms, architects and other professional offices, as well as computer and internet businesses, art galleries, music and art studios, tattoo parlors, and acting and film schools.

title: A Great Walking Tour of Vancouver the Way It Was
reviews: Tourists should seriously consider spending a few hours in this neighbourhood. It is relatively flat - easy to walk - and close to a major transportation hub. So, leave the car at the hotel, and come enjoy food&drink, history, and souvenir schlock all in one compact area.My recent visit was mainly to see the Covid related murals, near Maple Tree Square, but I ended up spending a fair bit of time enjoying all the other interesting sights Gastown has to offer - Gassy Jack statue and the steam clock to name but two.If I want to walk through a forest, I go to Stanley Park.If I want to walk through Vancouver's history, I go here.

title: We felt unsafe - be careful!
reviews: My sister and 10-month old nephew and I tried to have a wander around Gastown after reading it was one of the top 5 Vancouver sites from a google search. We were sorely disappointed. The cobblestone streets and hanging flower baskets were pretty, but couldn't distract from feeling completely unsafe in the area. We saw (literally) hundreds of homeless people / addicts as we were driving in and on the surrounding streets after we parked and tried to make our way to Water Street. Once we finally made it (treading carefully over all the used needles), the smell of urine and weed on in Gastown did not help our nerves. The steam clock was cool, but not worth the accompanying stress that the whole outing brought.

title: Legalize pot
reviews: Evidently in the last 60s there was a protest march to legalize maraguna and some police brutality happenEd. Even though pot is legal there‚Äôs still a protest or rally to commemorate this event. Stalled out of a near by restaurant into the fray.  Otherwise it‚Äôs a nice neighborhood with lots of Art Deco building s.

title: Gotta Go!
reviews: No visit to Vancouver would be complete without a visit to Gastown and the Steam Clock!  It's a really fun way to spend a little bit of time strolling the streets, maybe stopping in for a bite to eat, and posing for some fun photos!  Must

title: See the history of Vancouver City from this perspective
reviews: See the history of Vancouver City from this perspective - cobble stone streets, steam clock and lots of tourist type places.  The area is a great place to visit but also harbours a lot of street people and homeless folks.  Most just need a 'hello' but I've seen several who are aggressive.  Next: see Granville Island and Kits Beach!

title: Great area to visit
reviews: Great area to visit , the gas clock is a must , we visited the Spaghetti Factory four times in a week, the food and atmosphere was lovely, felt very safe in the area

title: Fun Safe plenty to drink
reviews: We visited after the Rugby and had a great time!  The area is full of bars and restaurants.  Loved the ambiance with the street lights and trees with light bulbs.  Felt very safe the whole time.  We hit 3 bars and loved them all.  Lots of foot traffic and just a wonderful area of the city.

title: Good nightlife scene
reviews: Very cool part of town. Lots of activity with trendy bars and restaurants.  This neighborhood and Yaletown are where to go at night.

title: Lots of tourists shops and places to eat
reviews: The steam powered clock is a must see.  There are plenty of great places to eat and drink in gas town.  You can also stock up on plenty of Canada souvenirs as there are souvenir shops galore!

title: Beautiful part of town
reviews: Gastown is the historical part of town. It is great to stroll around, check out the houses and shops

title: Pleasant area
reviews: Pleasant area with a range of shops, bars and eateries. Plenty of choices so a nice, relaxing area to walk around and the obligatory visit to see the steam clock.

title: It's a nice place
reviews: It's nice place but a bit crowded. The smell of weed is everywhere. The atmosphere is nice. Easy access when you are downtown.

title: Great fun
reviews: Bars, caffe‚Äôs and restaurants, great fun. Souvenir shops for great gifts. We spent a good couple of afternoons, early evenings just walking around, stopping to eat and drink.

title: Plenty to see and do...
reviews: I very much enjoyed exploring this area. From interesting architecture to shopping and food, there are a number of unique things to both see and do for a visitor. Sight seeing and eating are must in this sort of ‚Äúold town‚Äù portion of Vancouver.

title: Worth a bimble
reviews: Pleasant architecture with the steam clock etc.We found a nice cafe for breakfast and enjoyed the ambiance.

title: Dine around
reviews: Was here for a conference and we did a dine around of three restaurants in Gastown. Plenty of restaurants to please everyone

title: The Original Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is Vancouver‚Äôs most historic district and neighbourhood and was finally designated a National Historic Site of Canada in 2009. Named after John ‚ÄúGassy Jack‚Äù Deighton, this area of Vancouver is unique for its ability to maintain its historic charm while concomitantly looking forward towards the future. In other words, Gastown is able to provide a near-perfect synthesis of the old and new: Victorian and Edwardian-era architecture meets contemporary and chic boutiques, shops and restaurants. Because of this, any visit to Vancouver would ultimately be incomplete without some time spent in and around Gastown. It is home to some of the best the city has to offer, and it does all of this in a truly unique ‚Äì attractive ‚Äì environment.History is perhaps one of the primary reasons one might have for an initial visit to Gastown; and, believe me, this area has plenty of it. Established in and around 1867, when John Deighton sought to open a saloon (and did so within 24 hours!), Gastown very quickly became the fledgling city‚Äôs trading, commerce, cultural and social hub. Because of its proximity to the waterfront, Gastown proved to be an ideal location for business to take root. With the influx of workers to the area, many a hotel, eatery and pub popped up, creating what I‚Äôm sure was an interesting cultural mosaic of sorts. In this respect, one could argue that the area essentially functioned as Vancouver‚Äôs original downtown core.In fact, it was exactly because of all the hustle and bustle that Vancouver city council held their first official meeting in Gastown, specifically Maple Tree Square (see my earlier review on this site), following incorporation in 1886. Unfortunately, most of the original Gastown burned to the ground barely two months later in what has been dubbed the Great Fire of 1886. Not to be dissuaded, though, Gastown was very quickly rebuilt and, today, the majority of the buildings that stand in this neighbourhood date from 1886 to 1914, giving us a beautiful historic window into the past. For those particularly keen on architecture and style, Gastown is rife with buildings reflective of the Victorian and Edwardian period, right down to the 100+ year-old lampposts that line the streets. If one is on a limited schedule, however, I would recommend visiting the Waterfront Station (technically on Gastown‚Äôs border on Cordova), seeing the Byrnes Block building (built 1886) and viewing the Hotel Europe (built 1909). Each of these architectural gems have their own tales and help to give Gastown its historical character.Beyond the historical aspect, Gastown has become a cultural and foodie hub since its initial revitalization in the late 1970s and 1980s. For at least the last two decades, many an eatery and resturanteur ‚Äì casual and formal ‚Äì has set up shop in Vancouver‚Äôs most historic neighbourhood. Of note: L‚ÄôAbattoir, Bauhaus, Birds and the Beets, Coquille, The Flying Pig, Meat and Bread, Old Spaghetti Factory, Pidgin and Tacofino. It‚Äôs such a shame that the Crab Park Chowdery went the way of the dodo last year as their ‚Äúchowder‚Äù options nicely complemented the rest of Gastown‚Äôs foodie options. Regardless, whether you‚Äôre looking for a romantic night out, or just a casual bite and drink, Gastown has more than enough to offer. For my money, the Old Spaghetti Factory is top notch and, in its own way, highlights some of Gastown‚Äôs attractive character (see my earlier review on this site). Regardless of where you choose to go, though, all of these establishments are housed within the historic brick and timber buildings of the area.Gastown is also home to some of the Vancouver area‚Äôs best shopping. With its fine and fair mix of the traditional touristy shops, independent fashion boutiques and First Peoples art galleries, you‚Äôll be sure to find something worthy to take home for friends and family. I mean, who wouldn‚Äôt want some maple syrup or, more importantly, a miniature version of Gastown‚Äôs famed Steam Clock? In all seriousness, there is some good shopping to be had here, including the flagship Fleuvog store.At day‚Äôs end, what you decide to do in Gastown and how long you stay in the area is entirely up to you. It‚Äôs Vancouver‚Äôs oldest neighbourhood; it‚Äôs full of vintage structures that call back to an earlier time; it‚Äôs also shockingly modern in taste and appeal; and there‚Äôs plenty to do for tourists of every stripe. Just want to visit the Steam Clock and Maple Tree Square for a quick selfie with Gassy Jack? That‚Äôs fine. Want to patronize some restaurants and boutique stores? You can do that, too! Want to spend more time in the neighbourhood, take a ‚ÄúLost Souls of Gastown Tour‚Äù and learn about its unique ghost lore? Awesome! There‚Äôs just no shortage of things to do and it is for that reason that Gastown is a ‚Äúmust visit‚Äù when in Vancouver.‚Äã

title: Wear your walking shoes
reviews: Gastown is one funky place. Cobblestone streets, secret basement nightclubs, back alley restaurants, dive bars, high end shopping. This tiny neighbourhood has it all. And it‚Äôs family friendly. There is always something to do. Watch and listen to the steam clock sing every quarter hour. Painters and sketchers on street corners. Metal artistry selling the Van City skyline. Don‚Äôt be afraid of the homeless population- most are very nice and keep to themselves.

title: A ‚ÄúMust Not Miss‚Äù on your to do list!!!
reviews: I wish there were blocks and blocks and even more blocks where one could wander around Gastown!  You feel like you‚Äôve stepped back in time...back in time to where ladies wore long dresses and men were, well, let‚Äôs just say they were gentlemen!  See the World famous steam clock, go visit the ghost who purportedly resides in the Old Spaghetti Factory (ask some of the long term staff about him), and just wander around and enjoy the cobbled streets and the beautiful architecture!  A real beauty in a bustling city...

title: Stay away from Gastown
reviews: We had some friends in town and one of the places they wanted to go was Gastown. As a resident of Vancouver we haven'r been to Gastown in years and apparently we haven't been missing anything.Sure the street has some architectural charm and nice restaurants however it is overrun with bums and druggies and vagrants. Why aren't the cops doing their job?We were constantly being asked for money and having to run a gauntlet of bums was annoying. I wouldn't want to walk this street as a female or after dark as it feels quite unsafe.Oh yeah, there is also an abundance of tourist trap junk shops selling "souvenirs" to the tourists.Do yourself a favor and stay away from Gastown until it gets cleaned up.

title: Gastown
reviews: Love the architectural designs and age period of the buildings and speciality shops in the Gastown area, which is accessible by the hop on hop off bus tours from Canada Place and the steam clock is impressive.

title: Old Vancouver before the sky scrapers
reviews: Worth a visit, old colonial buildings, now mostly restaurants and art galleries, and the World famous steam clock.

title: Some good shops emerging ...
reviews: .. but still many tacky tourist shops. Some newcomers have brought relief to this including some independent cafes. Still nice area to wander around on the cobbled street.

title: Great place to have lunch and a couple of drinks.
reviews: Pretty nice vibe in the neighborhood, a fantastic place to go for a mid-range to luxury meal and have a couple of drinks afterwards, just steer away from Cordova st (2 blocks away) since it's a street that is packed with people shooting drugs and homeless individuals.

title: A must to walk, shop and dine!
reviews: Found this area while driving in the rain. What a gem! Eric, owner is a great fisherman. Richard has a cool hotdogs business and the shops are an extensive selection of goods worthy of purchase!

title: Great place to eat and shop
reviews: This area runs close to the waterfront near the harbour. Lots of restaurants and a number of shops. Some quite trendy and expensive but also lots of souvenir shops too.There is also a steam powered clock! Good place to go for an evening meal and a few drinks.

title: Historic Trendy Area
reviews: Great area well worth a look.  Lots of up market cafes, shops, cobble stone streets and a really cool steam clock

title: Beautiful part of the city worth visiting
reviews: Definitely worth a visit for the architecture if not just for the clock. There are some beautiful old buildings in the precinct and some have been done up beautifully inside. Loads of souvenir shops, eateries and bars to take your pick from. Only a short walk for most downtown hotels, Gastown is a great way to spend a few hours exploring.

title: Gastown Vancouver
reviews: Not sure if I would recommend visiting this end of town very sketchy and not a lot to see other than the Steam Clock

title: Just checkout the steam clock and go!
reviews: Gastown, if you're a tourist like me, is really just about seeing the steam clock. Other than that, you'll see plenty of souvenir shops, couple of other shops (Herschel is there btw), and that's it. There's one coffee shop that is really good (forgot the name) so it's worth a try. Other than that, there are other places around town to go to. :)

title: Gastown Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a great area of Vancouver if you like craft shops, art galleries and local goods. The whole area is set up for visitors alike, from cafes,restaurants and bars catering for all tastes, tip check out the steam clock in gastown it‚Äôs very unique

title: Out & About Boutique - We like it!
reviews: My husband and I visited Out & about Shop at 321 West Cordova Street, Gastown, Vancouver B.C. on Boxing Day 2019. It was a good experience to us. We like the setting and design of this boutique. Goods are displayed nicely and attractively. The shop owner - Sheila - is nice and friendly. She invited us to go downstairs and there we found lot more fahsionable items. It is a must to visit Out & about Boutique if you have a chance going to Gastown in all seasons.

title: Good spot for souvenirs
reviews: This is an old part of Vancouver that is fun to explore. Lots of souvenir shops with competitive pricing. The steam clock is a great photo op and super interesting to see.

title: Good Old Vancouver.
reviews: We walked in to Gastown from the Waterfront Station to have a look at the Steam Clock. It is fascinating to watch when it blows it‚Äôs whistle and sounds like a hissing Big Ben. We had to wait for some time before it blew so we had a small walk around Gastown.Gastown is one of the first settlements which gave rise to the city of Vancouver around the 1860s. Since then it has metamorphosed a number of times from a centre for trade and commerce to an area of warehouses to load logs and timber. Later it became the centre for the city‚Äôs wholesale produce distribution, and also the centre of the city‚Äôs drinking life. After the depression the area went into decline and came to be known as the Skid Row. After the 1970s Gastown has been slowly rehabilitated and now has a number of respectable businesses like fashion and interior d√©cor boutiques, restaurants, nightclubs, bars as well as professional offices of law firms, architects and computer firms, music and art studios and film and acting schools, and a few art galleries. Of course, there are still some areas in Gastown where we saw some destitute people begging or just hanging around the streets. It is best to avoid these areas after late evening.We enjoyed our short walk and had a good look at some of the old heritage buildings lining the cobbled sidewalks. We then came back to see the most important tourist landmark of Gastown, the Steam Clock doing it‚Äôs hourly job.

title: eclectic mix of upscale and inexpensive
reviews: its the go to street for tourists for sure tour buses everywhere.  some interesting restaurants to try and lots of shopping abounds

title: Vancouvers equivalent to Sydney‚Äôs Rocks Area
reviews: Lots of fabulous food choices with restaurants offering up market down to cheap pub food or Tacos. Atmosphere gave a real vibe & sense we were in VAN.

title: Neat place
reviews: We had some great meals here and stayed at a really amazing hotel but the place is really overrun with homeless and drug addicts.  It is an interesting cultural introspective if you can see it as a commentary on humanity and not get grossed out by the syringes and alcohol swabs on the sidewalk.  I love the art and culture seeping up through the cracks in this historic place.  See it for its beauty and you will have a great experience.

title: Awesome steam clock
reviews: The seeds of Vancouver were planted here. The city slow sprang from the first settlement in this area. It has been cleaned up over the years, and not as seedy as it was about 40 years ago. Lots of bars, eateries, and cafes in the area. It is a tourist and sightseers haven.

title: Walking thru the Old VanCity
reviews: Enjoying the walk with my wife, visiting the Old Can City along Gas-town, picture taking with the Famous Steam Clock while enjoying the old city ambience of Rain city

title: Great vibe
reviews: Gastown feels like a whole other place in Vancouver. We really enjoyed spending time there. Cool cafes and shops. The steam clock was entertaining.

title: Gastown has something for everyone
reviews: Gastown has something for everyone with many restaurants, stores, and bars. It has the famous steam clock and Gassy Bill.  I would be careful where you walk at night but during the day felt extremely safe.

title: Picturesque area of Vancouver
reviews: A place to walk... Several streets lined with shops of various kinds, including native aboriginal art, gift shops, clothing stores, and restaurants/coffee shops of various kinds.  Very near the cruise ship terminal.  Walk from there.    You can easily spend 3-4 hours there.

title: A good place to stroll and shop
reviews: I don't know how to describe the place but one thing for sure was, my stay in Vancouver was super wonderful. Having strolled the streets in Gastown made me feel to have the urge of coming back to this place one day. It's like the quieter New York with vibes of Melbourne.

title: Great time. Lots of shopping if you want.
reviews: Great part of town.Only downside is if you have a car, the PARKING is very expensive. $24 For 4 hours.Next trip, I think I will Uber to the area and skip the parking lot

title: Nice to wander But ok to shop
reviews: Gastown has cool things like old brick buildings, scenic views, the steam clock, cobble stone streets and some interesting venues. Too many souvenir shops and a lot fewer independent artsy shops that used to be there. Many that are high in prices. Great to walk for the flavour of the old city but not the best for shopping.

title: Not safe, no police presence
reviews: Too many beggers, homeless people sleeping on the sidewalks, harressing tourists. City of Vancouver collects lots of taxes but don't care about tourists or its citizen. You don't feel safe in the area. More police presence or clean up your city.

title: Great area
reviews: Gas town gives of that real historic feel.  The area is full of great little shops, amazing architecture and sights.  We loved it that much we will be back.

title: Romantic Neighborhood
reviews: Love this place! There are few restaurants and bars located in this area. The side walk (pavements) are wide and are made of red-bricks, producing romantic nuance. The icons of the area are the steam clock (that make sounds every 15 minutes) and the Gassy Jack statue. If you have very limited time, skip the Gassy Jack statue, it is rusty and doesn't look really pretty.

title: Old city
reviews: The area stretches along the coast, there are a large number of attractions - Gassy Jack, Steam Clock, etc. Here it is interesting to walk day and evening.

title: Best Area in Vancouver
reviews: There are of course many fastastic areas to see in Vancouver which we visted for the first time for 5 nights from October 12. We always seemed to end up back up Gastown at night before heading back to the hotel. Great bars, Great Food and a really good coffee shop just at the entrance to a little group of shops, - on other side of the street passed the Steam Clock - yes good place to go

title: Get A Flavor of Vancouver Here...
reviews: There are lots of good restaurants, the steam clock, souvenir shops - the olympic cauldron is just a few blocks away also... The surrounding area is the business district - there is also a growing homeless population but they are not a bother to anyone.

title: Don‚Äôt miss this spot
reviews: Can anyone visit Vancouver and miss this area? No way!!!Specially at night, you should just walk, enjoy the atmosphere and beautiful lights. It seems like walking in a live movie to me!

title: The oldest area in Vancouver
reviews: Classic old town with cobble stone streets and unique, historical buildings. The area has a lot of fashion boutiques, restaurants and usual tourist shops. But Gastown is very close to downtown Eastside/ East Hastings street. This is an area of extreme deprivation, homelessness and open drug use on the street. It is easy for tourist to accidentally wonder into this area, be aware of where you are.

title: unique architecture and history
reviews: Gastown is a charming area in Vancouver with culture & live performances. Quite a few bars and restaurants. Several art galleries, shops, boutiques. Main tourist attractions, other than the unique architecture and history, is the old Steam Clock blows steam & plays music and the statue of Gassy Jack. The OK Boot Corral is a great shop adjacent to the Gassy Jack statue.A very interesting place to visit

title: Europe in Vancouver
reviews: It is a cute part of Vancouver that look like Europe. Lots of bars and good restaurants, i love walking around Gastown!

title: intersting part of the refurbish Old town in the modern city
reviews: Lot of good gift shops and nice Restaurant along the street. can grap some pizze for quick bite or Ice cream along the street easily accessible by the Subway.  A good place to grab your take home gift for your friends, family and love one. to me its a a must go place in Vancouver.

title: Really nice Tourist attraction
reviews: Very pleasant area to walk and shop. The Steam clock is amazing. We took several pictures but it took a while to get a clear shot.

title: Nice Walk for Shops & Restaurants
reviews: Full of shops & restaurants/bars. Highly recommend Steamworks Brewery for families or friends & Peckinpah for BBQ. Steamworks Clock blows steam & music at 6pm & Gassy Jack statue is right in the centre.

title: Pleasant place to visit
reviews: Gastown was very similar to what I was expecting as per the reviews but it was still nice to visit. It had and old fashioned charm to it, and the steam clock was fun to experience. Overall it is a nice place to walk around, it is full of quaint restaurants, bars and cafes. The decorative lights that were on display in January too were a nice touch, I am unsure if they are out year round

title: Unique Beautiful Neighborhood.
reviews: Gastown is a charming area in Vancouver with its unique features like it's architecture, culture & live performances. Quite a few bars and restaurants. Art galleries, shops, boutiques. A very interesting place to visit.

title: Fun to walk around and stroll
reviews: Nice place to take a stroll and walk around in Vancouver. Its a few minutes from the port is a good place to spend a few hours when in vancouver.

title: Did we miss the attraction?
reviews: We had read and seen reports that Gastown was a must see. Unfortunately our visit did not fill us with glee. Yes, you may get a sense of the original Vancouver; street layout, buildings etc, however the negatives far outweigh any positives. This is a small area, before you know it you've stumbled into some run down back street. In the main area tourists are falling over each other as they crowd the attractions. The number of overpriced tacky souvenir shops is shocking.

title: Must‚Äôve visited at the wrong time
reviews: Was excited to see gas town per reviews on here. Apart from the steam clock I was confused as to what the fuss is about. Maybe I visited too early in the day and the was missing the ‚Äòvibe‚Äô of it all.Out of all the places I visited in Vancouver this is where I come across most of the homeless approaching us for money.

title: Amazing Vancouver
reviews: My husband and I visited Vancouver in September, Gastown was the first place we had a look around, it was really lovely, the trees were all lit up of a night, lots of great restaurants and you felt very safe walking around the place of an evening.  We had an incredible meal at a restaurant called The Old Spaghetti factory, they had an old caboose inside the restaurant which had been restored and used as a dining room.  There is a ghost story associated with this restaurant, which you can find out about there.

title: Good old style architecture
reviews: Main attraction is the steam clock.its nice.we walked roughly whole of the gastown area.the architecture is very appealing. Lots of eateries are there.Loved the place

title: Cool
reviews: We just drove through it on a city tour and it looked like a great place to walk around, tons of history here. Our tour guide told us the street is run off steam and there is a steam clock in the center that‚Äôs really cool

title: Lovely area
reviews: Nice downtown area with plenty of shops and restaurants around. You can walk to the pier or just stroll the streets and enjoy it all.

title: Tons of restos, bars and shopping
reviews: Always enjoy spending time in this part of YVR, and is a close walk to Chinatown as well. Will always visit when in town.

title: lots of shopping
reviews: lots of cheap merchandise but also a lot of homeless to make your way through, and I'm talking aggressive, loud, yelling homeless.Sad, nice historic part of town.

title: Neat area
reviews: Had limited time here but it was so neat to visit and see the whistle clock as well as the area.  Would want to go back and spend more time in this location.  You do need to know the boundaries of the area and stay in that area.

title: Fun to wander
reviews: Gastown has a stop on the Hop On Hop Off Bus. Definitely, you should hop off. It is interesting to learn about the history of the area. There are shops and restaurants and it is just generally fun the wander there. You will have a stop at a very old working Steam clock. Be there on the hour to observe the best of the clocks in movements.

title: Army and Navy
reviews: Visited here while on an across Canada trip on 26th September. On our last morning in Vancouver, we went souvenir shopping. Plenty of places, most selling the same or different versions of the same. Some streets are pleasant with trees but others, frankly, ones to avoid. We saw the Gassy Jack statue and the Steam Clock. Highlight was a visit to the Army and Navy stores (no longer in UK) to buy a real Lumberjack Shirt (sad I know).

title: The clock & pubs
reviews: We visited Gas town in September , the steam clock whistles ever 15 mins. There are nice pubs around . Do not walk towards east side ,you might not like too many homeless people around.

title: Cute area with lots of souvenirs
reviews: Wanted to stop and check out the steam clock and hunt for some souvenirs.  It did not disappoint. This time of year, most of the souvenir shops had discounts and some clearance clothing.

title: Interesting part of town
reviews: This was a short walk from our hotel. It is a beautiful old part of Vancouver. Watch your step...cobblestone streets. There are many restaurants, bars and shops. The most interesting feature is the steam-powered clock. Just look for the cloud of steam--you can't miss it.

title: Oldest Neighborhood
reviews: Enjoyed walking around the narrow streets of Gastown. Lots of charming older buildings with character. Numerous pubs, restaurants, cafes and shops. I arrived via public bus (#19) which dropped me off a block or two from the heart of Gastown. Be sure to check out the Rube Goldberg-like Steam Clock while in the area.

title: Great shops, historical buildings and a steam clock!
reviews: Gastown   is the oldest part of Vancouver and full of history. Lots of shops, restaurants and cool cobblestone sidewalks. There is also a steam powered clock that still works. Plan on spending a while there to see everything.

title: shady characters
reviews: Made the trip to see the steam clock. Had a nice lunch at the Local brew house and did some souvenir shopping. Couldn‚Äôt help notice the homeless and junkies on the street.

title: Mr
reviews: Visted during this part of Vancouver for shopping at unuaual outlets including Army abd Navy ...unusual choices of eating places in an unusual part of Vancouver ...many vistors include tourists.

title: Homeless haven
reviews: Not so safe to walk around if you are not familiar with the area. We were quite shocked to see so many people in one place..

title: History in Vancouver
reviews: This place was one the first neighborhood in Vancouver and the building have this architecture. There are many stores to buy gifts and greats restaurants.

title: Pretty area to explore
reviews: Gastown is a really quaint area full of boutique shops and cafes. Very atmospheric to have a coffee and watch the world go by. The steam clock is a must...!Very close to the area is the Vancouver Lookout, an observation deck with unparalleled views of the city and surrounding area (assuming a clear day). The glass lift travels to the observation deck on the outside of the building, so be aware if you're scared of heights - no problem at the top as it's fully enclosed and the views are fabulous.

title: Afternoon in Vancouver
reviews: We went to visit Gastown, a little place with lots of small stores bars and restaurants.  We had drinks and dinner and enjoyed the vapor clock

title: Live Music, Fun, Can be Sketch
reviews: Gastown is a fun area to visit in Vancouver. There is tons of great live music all over-- make sure you check it out. Of course, the steam clock is worth a quick 5min visit, but watch where you walk. Basically, the area is really tourtisty, but if you walk down any of the alleys, you may see some heroin use or some other unsavory things. Although Blood Alley is a really cool name, avoid it at all costs!

title: Interesting
reviews: This was a quite interesting place.  Too many homeless around. Saw lots of syringes lying around on the footpath. The smell of urine was quite bad. Yes it has some history but not woryh going there.

title: Gift shops galore
reviews: A quick walk thru gas town. The steam clock goes off on the hour, so time your visit. Don't stray from the main street as lots of homeless people are just outside the vicinity.

title: Water Street
reviews: Out of Waterfront Station, turn left and Water Street is not far away. Steam Clock is the first attraction. Keep going and on the same side there is a restaurant The Old Spaghetti Factory. We had lunch there and were impressed. A must for dining. Down the road to the corner of Carrall Street there stood the Gassy Jack.

title: Authentic ‚Äòolde Vancouver‚Äô!
reviews: Vancouver City Centre is glitzy and extravagant.  For a balanced view you must also visit Gastown.  It‚Äôs a bit down-at-heal, but it is authentic!

title: Maybe I picked a bad day!
reviews: I have read reviews from others about the beauty and appeal of Gastown and I was disappointed.  Vancouver is not a large city and areas run into one another and I felt I had to be aware of where I was walking.Gastown is a mix of old and new buildings with a number of expensive 'top end' shops but my overall impression was that it was rather run down and in need of developing.  It could be that my visit was 'mid-cycle'.I did not enjoy walking streets lined with homeless people or the open drug abuse that could not be missed or avoided.  I never felt in danger but it was not a pleasant experience.

title: Worth a look.
reviews: If you have time, stroll along to the Gastown section of Vancouver. Old and new buildings abound here and there are two many to mention. The "gas clock" of course is only one.

title: Quaint
reviews: Only a few blocks long.Steam clock located on Water street.Lots of shops for souvenirs. Busy with pedestrians and car traffic.

title: Busy with tourists
reviews: The spot is historic but jammed with tourists and shops catering to such. We watched the Steam Clock go off and then left. Rogers Chocolate is worth a stop, however!

title: A traveler to Vancouver
reviews: It has been a wonderful experience walking through this magnificent part of Vancouver. the waterfront is spectacular with the seaplanes and dining all at  your fingertips. dont forget to visit the brewery for craft beer and the Steam Clock

title: Always a good walk
reviews: Always a good walk around Gastown.. looks of unique shops and restaurants.. make sure you don't miss the Steam Clock!

title: From pub to metropolis, take a walking tour to learn about true Vancouver
reviews: Find out about Gassy Jack, about Woodwards, witness the gentrification with cafes on one side and homeless on the other. Vancouver is the definition of globalisation, good and bad - fascinating and captivating nonetheless.Start your Vancouver discovery here.

title: A "GAS" of a town!!
reviews: A truly eclectic mix of interesting shops and restraints.  Great fun to walk and observe your surrounding.

title: Founding point
reviews: Gastown is smaller than I thought but as a great buzz and atmosphere to the place. Oldest part if the city and still as cobbled streets. Large amount of restaurants and trendy stores plus the clock and Jack.

title: nice to visit but doesn't need a lot of time
reviews: As a designer John Fluvog flagship store was a must. A wander around the streets and watch the clock once. Pretty much just another big city. Granville markets and waterfront a good day out, take a small boat ride to see the city from another angle. Also take note of some pretty amazing buildings. On our return from the east coast we had another 5 days in vancouver but opted to head up to Whistler which was a good decision. we found East vancouver much more interesting and great for food and bars.

title: Morning Visit
reviews: Run down and didn‚Äôt feel safe, lots of homeless people begging and witnessed a fight after 2 shopkeepers chased down a cyclist who had stolen goods from a shop.  Saw the statue and the gas clock but other than that I wouldn‚Äôt bother.  Did a foodie tour there in the afternoon and we got approached again by homeless people.  Restaurants we visited were good but the area isn‚Äôt welcoming

title: Worth a visit but about an hour should suffice
reviews: We visited Gastown via the Hop on Hop off tour bus and then walked back to the city centre.It is very touristy and very busy with some decent shops and plenty of cheap souvenir shops. Predictably loads of eateries, some in old and converted/renovated buildings - attractively done as are the main streets. The two main tourist points are the steam clock and the large statue of 'Gassy' Jack, the sort of founder of Gastown. Getting a decent picture of the steam clock can be a challenge because of selfish tourists hogging it - a sharp word or gesture usually has the desired effect.If time allows Gastown is worth a visit and if not eating, an hour is all you should need.

title: Downtown historical area
reviews: The oldest part of the town with charming well maintained original architecture. However, as the city's tourist hub, it is very busy with souvenir shop after souvenir shop and cafes.

title: Great Area
reviews: We really enjoyed wandering around Gastown. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Enjoyed the Gastown Clock. Tip: make sure and stay about to hear the clock play its steam tune in the hour and at each quarter of the hour. Lots of parking garages nearby.

title: Revitalized commercial district, touristy
reviews: We walked down there from our hotel and we went through some seedy areas to get there. Overall there are some great little restaurants, some very touristy places to stop in and buy things, there is also a great Chocolate place called Roger's and the steam clock.  I would suggest taking your time and enjoying the scenery, and the frequent the small shops and restaurants to support the community.

title: Pretty but Overrun by Tourists
reviews: Gastown‚Äôs buildings and famous steam clock are pretty, however the area is overrun with tourists.  The shops selling souvenirs of Canada, if time is an issue would focus more on the plentyful sights of Vancouver.

title: Fun area to visit
reviews: We spent a couple hours here just wasting time and really liked the area.  There are restaurants and sightseeing.  It was a good area to just walk around and get something to eat.  I‚Äôm sure there is more to do, but we were limited in time.

title: Great Oysters!
reviews: This is a great place to visit. Full of small cafes leather shops artist shops and oyster bars definitely worth a visit

title: Touristy and over-rated
reviews: We got down to Gastown to see the steam clock , which was interesting but completely overrun with tourists who stopped for the obligatory photo and then plowed on.  Gastown itself is pretty and has some lovely boutiques alongside shops selling tourist tat.  If you can tolerate jostling with people who aren't really interested in appreciating their environment,  then it's probably worth a visit.

title: Nice Neighborhood
reviews: The main reason that we visited Gastown was to see the Steam Clock.  The neighborhood was nice.  There were various shops and restaurants. Lovely street lamps and flowers lined the main street; however, the clock was the main attraction for us.

title: Gastown
reviews: Well worth a visit we liked the "steam clock" good place for something to eat. Lovely atmosphere day or night.

title: Nice old world charm
reviews: The steam clock was a big attraction and the shops all around have an old world charm, though some were quite rundown. Enjoyed the walk around the souvenir shops which had a lot to offer.

title: Steam clock
reviews: Loved stopping at Gastown during the day. Very quaint, lots of souvenirs shops. Checked out the leather shop next to glassy jack statue. Husband brought bison leather belt. The shop is full of leather cowboy boots. Got to Gastown by the hop on off bus. If not stopping for a bite to eat, you only need 1-2 hours to explorer Nd take photos.

title: Old Spaghetti Factory
reviews: We enjoyed seeing the Steam clock and the Gassy Jack Statue in Gastown. Nestled between them was the Old Spaghetti Factory. We visited the restaurant twice during our visit in Vancouver. Both times we were seated in under 5 minutes. The food was good and reasonably priced.

title: Cool
reviews: Great spot for shopping, souvenirs, plenty of tshirts and sweatshirts, eating, drinking,cool steam clock.

title: Don't miss the steam clock
reviews: Steam clock and statue of Gassy Jack definitely worth a visit. Several blocks of souvenir shops and boutiques to explore along Water St., good for a couple hours of wandering.

title: Boring.
reviews: Over rated tourist destination. Too many tourist shops. A lot of homeless people. Some nice shops and cafes. Interesting steam clock but that was about it.

title: Shopping and steam clock
reviews: Gas town was an interesting stop on the hop on hop bus. Lots of souvenir shops, if you like these. Plenty of other shops and placed to eat. The old steam clock was quirky. Not sure what it would be like at night, quite a few homeless people around.

title: Nice area to stroll
reviews: Had great time walking the area, lots going on, some great Italian  food, ate there twice. Lots of energy

title: Delightful Stroll...
reviews: What a great section of town, shops, old restored buildings, Steam Whistle Brewery, The Steam Whistle Clock, cafes, trendy little restaurants, charming art, to name a few parts of the journey! A definite must along the tour of the downtown.

title: Clock was cute
reviews: Overall Gastown was okay. The clock was cute to visit and the shops were cool but the neighbourgood next door was very scary. We didn't feel safe at all so be careful when walking to Gastown that you enter from the Stanley park side

title: Shopping and Bums
reviews: visited Vancouver on a recent trip to Seattle.  The weather is similiar to Seattle, but cooler by a few degrees.  We found parking in GasTown.  It is an older area, well kept, looked like they were planning building projects.  We found Gassy Jack and the Steam Clock.  While near Gassy Jack's statue my husband was approached by an apparent Drug User trying to offer services for cash - while I am with him during the middle of the day - so there is that.  We did see several that looked like they lived on the streets - but we did not have any other episodes.  We had lunch in the area and everyone was great.  Several eating/drinking options to choose from.There were a lot of people out on a Sunday - so it would be safe if you were in the area alone.

title: Great Evening Environmwnt
reviews: We started out trip to Vancouver with a Friday evening walk in Gastown.  Parking is a little tricky to locate (metered or parkade) with the number of people visiting the area.  We lucked out with a metered spot that evening and did the parkade on Sunday afternoon when we returned to pick up souveniers.Lots of restaurants with patios and shops.  Definitely worth an evening out.  If restaurant reservations are available, it is definitely worth pre-planning as there was quite the line up at a few.  We found this area to have the most Vancouver souveniers and t-shirts/hoodies.

title: Make sure you hop off and spend some time
reviews: Make sure you leave plenty of time in your travels to explore Gastown - great atmosphere, shopping and places to eat. Don't leave Vancouver without visiting.

title: Go for the Clock, but not via Hastings St!
reviews: Dropped by here to see the steam clock and the birthplace of VancouverIf you walk there via Hastings Street however, it's more like seeing the death of Vancouver, depressing to see all the closed shops, homeless people and scent of Mary Janes tobacco and other aromas in the air, it made Skid row look like like Beverly Hills.The Gas Clock was interesting for a few minutes, not sure how long you can stay after you've read the plaque, seen it blow off steam, taken a picture and taken note of what time it is.Gas Town had some interesting old buildings, lots of tourist shops, bars, restaurants and other high end shops, was quite a few people begging in the area.Worth a quick visit for the Steam ClockIt was daytime when we visited, so can't comment on the pubs,.clubs and eateries in the area.

title: Worth a visit (in the day)
reviews: We visited Gastown three times on our 6 day stay in Vancouver (once at night). It‚Äôs a must see location  in the city & has lots of good places to eat. Note: there is a massive homeless issue in Vancouver with a large majority staying in between Gastown & Chinatown area. In large the homeless folk keep themselves to themselves and are polite, but for those of a nervous disposition it‚Äôs worth bearing this in mind. It‚Äôs very upsetting to see such a large number of homeless people living on the streets. Go to Gastown, but do go in the day time when the visibility is better.

title: Worth the visit
reviews: Gas town is a lovely strip that accommodates everyone, from high end to bottom end in pricing. There are plenty of places to eat, sit and just view. Glassy jack is situated at the bottom, steam clock half way up. There are vagrants dotted around and will stop you but they are harmful but stay alert

title: High recommendation for adults
reviews: There are a lot of british-style authentic bars. Although this area is some kind of infamous for homeless people, it‚Äôs not so dangerous than I‚Äôve ever heard.Definitely recommend for adults.

title: Lovely
reviews: Worth a visit. Great restaurants and bars.  Steam clock worth a visit for a few minutes. The lookout is worth doing on a clear day.

title: Be a bit careful!
reviews: So it‚Äôs a quaint place, but apart from the Steam Clock there‚Äôs really not that much to see. Lots of touristy shops. We decided to walk a different route back to the hotel, and less than five minutes from Gastown we found ourselves in an area that was popular with drunks and addicts. We were approached for money several times. I didn‚Äôt feel threatened, but I did feel uncomfortable, so don‚Äôt stray off the beaten track!

title: Bar Hopping
reviews: Uber fun place to pub crawl....also some great shopping ...pretty historic area ...safe ...defs be back ...not really missing anything bar food wise

title: Great fun
reviews: A great area of the city to let your hair down. Loads of bars and restaurants with great atmosphere. Good shops aswell. A must when in Vancouver.

title: Sad
reviews: It is a very interesting place, with many shops and restaurants. It is in an historic section of town that makes wandering around inviting. We could not take ten steps without being stopped by a beggar. There were homeless people sleeping on the street, with signs inviting you to donate. We usually are generous with others less fortunate, but this was overwhelming.

title: Well worth the visit
reviews: A very quaint part of downtown Vancouver. A wide variety of stores ranging from souvenirs to jewelry and clothes.  The steam clock is a must see.  The whole area brings back the thought of an older age of shopping.

title: Must stop and see
reviews: Walking through gastown and seeing and listening to the bustle and hustle, you must see the steam clock and gassy jack storyLots of food places to stop at

title: Shops, restaurants and bars to explore
reviews: Gastown is home of some good shops, restaurants and bars and is worth a wander. I'd particularly recommend L'Abattior as a good place to eat and the Diamond as a good place for cocktails. Be aware that just east of Gastown is a sketchy neighbourhood - not unsafe, but it has high levels of drug use and homelessness - that is quite easy to cross over into.

title: Night Tour Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Nice to see Vancouver by night if you don‚Äôt have a car to do this.Tour was informative interesting. Not a lot of time to get off the bus and take in some of the views. Alex MacDougal was a great driver & host. Had lots of interesting info to share & made the tour very worthwhile.

title: Fun
reviews: Lots of shops to look at and food choices. The steam clock was very cool. Lots of people and lots of exploring! Worth a look!

title: Beautiful Vancouver!
reviews: So nice! It‚Äôs the older part of Vancouver, with beautiful old style palaces. Spent a morning wandering around, and worth every minute! Loved the steamclock

title: One single atraction
reviews: We spent 2 nights and one full day at Vancouver, the steam clock at whole Gastown is the only atraction worth, but it is not good reason to visit Gastown at all.

title: Cool and Quaint Area of Vancouver BC
reviews: We spent several days in Vancouver and often ended up in this area.  Many restaurants, local shopping and coffee shops.  Touristy, but very positively so with locals mixing in as well.

title: Historic
reviews: In Vancouver things are relative; historic means over 50 years old. Pleasant area with plenty of restaurants, bars and shops. A very pleasant evening stroll.

title: Interesting Sights
reviews: This area is the original Vancouver. There are lots of shops and store here to shop as well as restaurants and bars. The famous attractions are the statue of Gassy Jack and the steam operated clock.

title: Interesting
reviews: The experience of walking through Gastown changes as you move away from the Seymour St. end towards the Main St. end and not in a good way.  The upper part of Gastown is well worth visiting.  The part closer to Main St. can readily be avoided.

title: Cute
reviews: This is as cute area to walk around and have dinner or lunch in. It's mostly a shopping area but the building are Victorian and it all has an artsy feel.

title: Enjoyable District
reviews: My Canadian friend took me to this district and it had lots to offer.  I saw lots of attractions like The Steam Clock and Gassy Jack.  There were lots of shops, cafes and places to view.  Most enjoyable

title: Historic
reviews: Nice to see the architecture and shops , but a lot of them sell rubbish Sad to see the many Homeless people nearby .Not a great area nearby

title: Very Eclectic
reviews: The city has spent money and effort on building up and preserving this area.  Very walkable.  Many restaurants and shops.  The famous Gassy Jack statue and the Steam powered clock are a few blocks apart.  Short walk from Canada Place and the Cruise dock.  Be advised, just a few blocks inland the tents, homeless, and drug use is open and disturbing.

title: Gastown used to be nicer
reviews: When I was little (approx. 20 years ago), my parents would take me to Gastown and my mom and I would browse the antique shops and stop at the quaint cafes.  But the last few years that I have been visiting Vancouver has really changed my perception of Gastown.  The homelessness and drug problem of East Hastings has spread into surrounding areas including Gastown.  The antique shops have been replaced by tawdry souvenir shops.  The streets are littered with debris including cigarette butts, ancient pieces of gum, and needles.  Everywhere smells like urine and I no longer feel entirely safe there especially at night.  My advice: skip Vancouver and visit Victoria instead.  Yes we still have a major homelessness and drug problem but it's not as bad, widespread or as dangerous feeling.

title: Good walk area
reviews: Great area to do a afternoon walk. Good restaurants,stores,hotels in area. Close to water. Good people watching

title: Spend the day in historical Gastown
reviews: Start from one end, walk to the opposite side, switch sides of the road and head back. There are many places to pop in for a quick drink/snack and then on to the next one. Don‚Äôt miss the steam clock either.

title: Touristy
reviews: Had read about Gastown and the steam clock so wanted to see it.  The area was busy and sadly contained some beggars asking for coins (get them in most cities).  We experienced the 11 o‚Äôclock strike of the steamclock and was well pleased.  Worth seeing if you‚Äôre passing through.

title: Don't bother
reviews: Horrendous in some areas. The main street is interesting to look around but side roads are full of homeless drug addicts. Such a shame the roads stink of urine. We saw a guy coming out of a shop like a zombie, another with a syringe in his arm lying on the pavement. Didnt feel too safe and would definitely not go there in the evening.

title: Architecture
reviews: We visited Gastown during our recent Vancouver City Tour.  The Victorian architecture is lovely.  The gas clock is a focal point.  We loved touring the different neighborhoods and areas in Vancouver!

title: Pub Crawl in Gastown
reviews: One of our favorite things to do when visiting Vancouver is a little pub crawl through Gastown. We always start at The Black Frog and go with the flow from there.

title: Cool area
reviews: Definitely worth a visit, by pass all the tourist shops and see the local architecture. The gas clock is well worth seeing.

title: Cute
reviews: Been to Vancouver three times and this is our first time to Gastown. Very cute Cobblestone streets and stores. Lots of souvenir shops. Lots of great restaurants. Wish we had been there starting from the get go. Recommend Bauhaus if you need dinner or Friday lunch

title: Historical area
reviews: Gastown is a nice stroll down a old cobblestone street that has been well preserved with interesting buildings. Lots of bars, restaurants,  and of course the steam clock. Don't stay from this area, a kid row is right around the corner.

title: Nice restoration of old area
reviews: Nicely preserved but overwhelmed by tourists. Worth a stroll through to admire architecture but if you are a European it‚Äôs nothing special.

title: Gotta Do Gastown
reviews: Lots of restaurants, bars, tourists and the steam clock and Gassy Jack statue. Just gotta do it as a part of visiting Vancouver

title: Interesting and famous area in the city
reviews: Vancouver's original downtown main street. Lots of  interesting shops and  excellent restaurants, but the city has managed to maintain it's historic feel ,This area is well worth the visit, Set aside a half day and check out the many interesting shops and lunch at any of the excellent  sidewalk restaurants. Don't forget to check out the famous Steam Clock while your there .

title: A relaxing end to a busy day.
reviews: Took a stroll at dusk and finished up in Gastown.  Stopped off at a couple of bars and found a great little Italian restaurant near by.  A relaxing way to end a busy day.  Plenty of people doing like wise and lots of the unique little shops were open, and happy for you to browse.

title: Dont stray off the one street
reviews: It's essentially one street decorated with hanging baskets, expensive shops and restaurants, plus a steam clock for the tourists.  Dont stray too far south or you'll be in the land of drunks and vagrants who bed down on the streets for the night.  Dont expect too much.

title: Awesome foodie area
reviews: Lots of great restaurants and shops    Check out the steam clock, Gassy Jack and the flat iron building.

title: Gastown
reviews: Take a walk to Historic Gastown while visiting Vancouver. Known for its whistling steam clock and souvenir shops, you‚Äôll find its fun to just walk around. Also, there are wonderful cafes trendy food and great beer and wine! enjoy

title: Are there really ghosts down here?
reviews: Strolling through Gastown gives you the feeling like you are being watched, or are you?  The Old Spaghetti Factory is reported to have a ghost... dare you enter to find out?  I know that I have stopped at some locals and have found that their spirits are AMAZING!   Love the history of Gastown, love the architecture.

title: Great restaurants
reviews: Had lunch at Three pigs or something like that. Excellent food and drinks, then walked around enjoying the old buildings.

title: Meander some time away
reviews: If you are in Vancouver at least a few hours meandering this part of town. Usual tourist shops and cafes. For me a must to visit Fluvog flagship store of designer shoes.

title: Not a safe area
reviews: We came here for the steam clock and instantly left. Very unsafe area and that‚Äôs coming from someone who‚Äôs from Winnipeg. Didn‚Äôt feel safe very quickly so we left and then made sure to avoid it the rest of our trip. If Vancouver would get more police in this area and shoo out the crime and beggars then this area would be a 5/5. I loved the way it looked and the shops. It definitely has potential. Not sure if it‚Äôs always been bad but it definitely was when we went recently.

title: Nice area
reviews: This had a bit of charm to it and seemed older than typical tourist spots. A pretty area with lots of flowers. Lots of bars, restaurants and gift shops. Main event here is the steam clock. Surrounded by tourists taking pictures but goes off every 15 minutes so you're sure to get a picture. Nice to wander around and felt safe and vibrant.

title: Historic and Beautiful
reviews: Just a few blocks away from some questionable areas, you‚Äôll find some great restaurants, beautiful shops, and some history along the way.  It‚Äôs an incredible part of Vancouver you would hate to miss.

title: Buzzing
reviews: Gastown is a really buzzing area of Vancouver with the iconic steam clock as a major attraction. There are some excellent places to eat and seemingly lots of people at all times of day. The hop-on-hop-off bus stops in this area and it‚Äôs well worth getting off to explore.

title: Overcrowded tourist trap
reviews: The ONLY reason to bother visiting is for the Steam Clock - it is so overcrowded let alone with those ridiculous tour buses coming down the cobble streets - an abundance of tacky overpriced souvenir shops.  Yuck.

title: Gastown is a fun spot
reviews: Gastown is an area we visit when staying in Vancouver.  Usually something going on there.  A good amount of restraunts and bars.  Some tourist shopping.  Some new building or remodeling going on this summer so some new stuff will pop up.  The number of homeless people has gone up compared to other times I had visited.  I had more than a few people decide to sleep on the sidewalk.  And a few folks will talk crazy to you.  Only one time did I have a panhandler get aggresive.  But for the most part, you leave them alone, they leave you alone.  It is an interesting area, lots of stuff to see so I would recommend taking a look.

title: Quaint & Interesting
reviews: Our trip to Gastown was very surprising as it is a quiet little shopping strip with plenty of eateries ranging from fast foods to fine dining. The Gastown steam clock gave it a nostalgic feel as well going off every 15 minutes. It is well worth a visit whilst in Vancouver.

title: Interesting place
reviews: My husband and I rode the bus here because I was told this neighborhood was very eclectic, had a neat steam clock, lots of neat shops and restaurants. All very true.

title: Best part of Vancouver
reviews: Very quaint old part of Vancouver.  Lots of interesting shops including art galleries, clothing, novelty souvenirs, and restaurants.  They have an old steam clock that chimes a different tune every 15 mins.  A lot of people stand around to wait for it to go off.  The area is not too large covering maybe 6 blocks total so easy to walk the whole area.  We enjoyed it and bought a few items in the shops.

title: Gastown
reviews: When in downtown Vancouver to forget to stop by Gastown Enjoy the local restaurants, bars bake shops in a bustling street full of locals and tourist alike. Stop by to take a picture of the famous steam clock.

title: Not worth a special trip
reviews: Went to Gastown based on tourist brochure hype. If you want a bunch of bars and Canadian chain restaurants on the edge of some scary neighborhoods, you'll love it.  Otherwise, go somewhere else.

title: Nice area but up to a point
reviews: Gastown is a nice area to walk with nice shops, cafes and restaurants with tile streets taking you to past times. It also has the famous steam clock. However, beyond the steam clock the situation gets dirty and ugly with dozens of drug addicts, injecting in open space during daytime and falling over. Travel guides did not warn us about it and we really felt uncomfortable.

title: Run down, dirty, poor quality shops
reviews: Not worth it. With the old brick buildings and green large trees, this place could‚Äôve been trendy, unique and fun. However, it‚Äôs not well maintained, streets aren‚Äôt clean, and we saw many homeless and beggars. Shops and restaurants aren‚Äôt unique either. Disappointed.

title: Loved it!
reviews: Great place to walk around ... lively place ... nice  stores and the steam clock was worth it. Parking was easily available .... definitely worth going if you want to experience the downtown kinda life

title: Crowded and not so special
reviews: Crowded and not as special as I had hoped...the steaming clock is unique and the old houses are of course a contrast to the skyscrapers but unfortunately there are only a few buildings with some vintage charm ...most of them are just stuffed with souvenir shops

title: Steam clock the only reason I gave it a 3
reviews: Very dirty run down and smelly. Be careful not to take any wrong turns as there are a lot of homeless, many begging. The clock was cute and the shops were OK but definitely tourist prices.

title: Great atmosphere
reviews: Lots of families and young children walking along the streets. Lots to see heaps of retail therapy and at least 4 souvenir shops. Lots of restaurants to chose from. Carry your wallets close to your person. Otherwise a great way to spend a couple of hours.

title: Wonderful atmosphere
reviews: I felt a little bit like in San Francisco... Walking through Gastown is very relaxing and there are many street cafes and restaurants. Don‚Äôt miss the steam clock! As soon as you wander out of Gastown there are many homeless people though.

title: Steam Clock
reviews: A must see if you visit Vancouver, some great bars and eateries in the area, the much smaller than anticipated steam clock is also intriguing.

title: Gastown, Vancouver...very trendy.
reviews: Gastown is really worth a visit when in Vancouver. Plenty of great places to eat and drink, tons of souvenir shops and other funky places. A variety of cafes, pubs and restaurants catering to all price ranges.

title: Pretty average compared to others
reviews: The steam clock (don‚Äôt think it was original) was interesting and there are a few half decent shops and eateries but mostly a tourist trap and a bit rundown in nearby streets.

title: Very Scarey, Run-down Place
reviews: This area is full of dark, dirty buildings with bums hanging around everywhere.  There are also several cannabis shops that spread their nasty smell down the street. I did not feel safe walking here, especially in the evening, and I wouldn't recommend it!

title: Great vibe
reviews: A great vibe in this area. Quirky shops along with the usual tourist souvenir shops! Good selection of cafes restaurants and bars. The steam clock is unique and worth seeing.

title: So Very Fun!
reviews: Having only 1 1/2 days in Vancouver we took one of the hop on-hop off tours. One look at Gastown and we knew we‚Äôd go back for dinner and to stroll. So we did the complete tour, but stayed on to go back to Gastown‚Äîand eat at the Flying Pig! Delicious!Great area and so fun to stroll!

title: Best part of Vancouver
reviews: For us the best part of Vancouver, but like an tiny island historical island in a busy and modern city.Nice bars, great food and fantastic stores, we loved it and went back every day during our stay

title: What Happened to Gas town...Let me tell you!
reviews: It's been since 1973 I was in Gas town ...I remember the streets full of street merchants making there crafts and making wired rings right in front of you, while you waited. Musicians playing there music on every corner. Ty Dyed clothing, hand painted -shirts. costume made treasures.open food stands. It was wonderful back than. Now Gas Town are small stores from handmade soaps, clothing, homemade food restaurants, Upper class stores Gucci, Holt Renfrew and many more exclusive shops. I kinda miss the 70's but Gas Town has the Rustic look still, with new age shopping and pleasant shops that have handmade local merchants still visible in the part of Vancouver BC.

title: Vancouver's oldest neighborhood
reviews: Everyone should take a stroll down Water Street to see the charming historic buildings, lampposts, Steam clock and statue of Gassy Jack near Maple Tree Square. Variety of shops and restaurants.

title: Very beautiful
reviews: Nice place to walk through. Great retail stores and lots of restaurants. Unfortunately the restaurant we chose to eat in was disappointing.

title: Nice place for an afternoon
reviews: Very touristic but nice... lot of shops and nice restaurants... the flying pig.. highly recommend üôÇ

title: Escape down into Gastown
reviews: Gastown is a must when visiting Vancouver with souvenir shops and eateries lining the footpath. For those looking at leather- belts and boots walk right down the bottom to the OK Boot Coral.And don‚Äôt forget to stop st the Gastown clock.

title: Great Walking area
reviews: Of course we had to see the Steam Clock, but also those few blocks held lots of restaurants & some beautiful flowers. There‚Äôs also a few shops along the main area. Worth taking the walk & spending a little time there.

title: good dining & shopping
reviews: this neighbourhood has some good canadian history if you care to learn. super architecture tours spend a couple of hours looking at the various structures here. there are more restaurants than i could possibly list here ... from budget friendly and/or family friendly to high end and night clubs. it's rather touristy but, if you care to put in a little effort, there's a whole lot more to the area. don't flash signs of wealth or gawk at people and you will remain safe.

title: Vibrant place to visit
reviews: Great place to go for an evening for restaurants and bars and through the day for gift / souvenir shopping. You  can see Gassy Jack statue, maple square (a building like the NY flat iron) and the steam clock. Its a fun place to visit.

title: Great place and close to China Town but be careful if walking between the two
reviews: Gas Town is a quaint place that has a lot of charm and oldie worldie goodness to it. It features lots of places to eat in the evenings (not much for breakfast) and great souvenir shops. Access from the metro is easy and is a straight shot from the airport.One Warning. The area between Gastown and China town gets very rough and there is a big homelessness issue once you get to the outer area.

title: Over rated
reviews: I really made my way down to Gastown to see the steam clock and try to locate Herschel‚Äôs. I succeeded in both. All in all it is extremely crowded and I wasn‚Äôt in s shopping mood.

title: Beautiful neighborhood
reviews: Really nice neighborhood with many good restaurants and good bars as well. Easily walkable also offering a lot of stores.

title: It's a Gas
reviews: Great place to get on the Gas and also lots of good eateries. Touristy but full of people just relaxing and having a good time. We ate here a couple of times and ejoyed the food and the vibe.

title: Uniquely Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a must-see in Vancouver.  It is a fairly small area full of shops and places to eat.  Generally speaking, the stores are smaller and somewhat unique (i.e., most are one of a kind and definitely not big chain stores).  Gastown is also the place to see the famous Steam Clock.Gastown has a fascinating history; it is worth taking a tour which includes this area if you have a chance, so that you can hear the stories properly.  The area is highly walkable but can get busy/crowded.  I would advise consulting a map and being conscious of where you are walking; Gastown is very tourist friendly but it borders with an area which you might rather avoid for comfort/safety/security reasons.

title: An eye opener!
reviews: Definitely worth the effort to go and watch the steam clock and see how it works. A nice piece of mechanical engineering from past days.This area is quite old and hasn‚Äôt been fully rejuvenated as yet so don‚Äôt expect trendy shops and cafes. Although it is slowly moving that way.The Australian Boot Company and the Boulet Headquarters is worth the effort to see some very nice boots for sale if you have $500 plus in your pocket.Head for the nearby Chinatown district and visit the peaceful park and puruse the interesting Chinese market shops. If you want Chinese dumplings, you will have to queue on the footpath! Don‚Äôt walk past the World‚Äôs narrowest building without taking a photo.Be prepared, when negotiating these two districts, to see a massive number of misplaced and homeless people living on the streets!!I was not expecting this number of people living on the streets in Vancouver. Very sad.

title: Interesting, busy street
reviews: Was very crowded due to Canada long weekend in Summer holiday period, but enjoyed browsing all the shops around Gastown. OPrices were a bit higher than most places but great range on offer.

title: Interesting, Yes...
reviews: Gastown is touristy and local at the same time.  It's really not that exciting but what is are the shops around the area.  We wanted to take advantage of maybe taking a photo with the famous Steam Clock where we actually heard the whistles but we can't believe that there is an actual line to take turn with this opportunity.  We ended up skipping it because it isn't really a big deal to warrant waiting in line.

title: Just a Walk and shop hour.
reviews: Gastown is lovely! Many awesome restaurants to choose from, bakeries, brunch, happy hours, finedining and more. Lots of Tourists shops, but lots of proper boutiques too. Great old buildings to get pics of, then there is the clock (pictured). Cute cobblestone part of town and easy to stroll the area without getting lost. Little traffic and drivers have to go very slow and carefully, so quite nice for pedestrians.

title: A fun part of vancouver
reviews: Always fun to explore the smaller sections of any city and Gastown was no different Most famous for the steam powered clock that blows it steam whistle every 15mins and a full show on the hourThe small shops are worth a visit as many are independently owned

title: Steam clock
reviews: This is where you will find the steam clock, which is very quaint. Lots of people want pictures of it or with it but doesn't take long to get a good look. Lots of souvenir shops in the area

title: Ya Gotta Love the Tree Lined Streets
reviews: We walked to Gastown from the Fairmont and ate at the Flying Pig, one of many funky, trendy restaurants.  We happened to go past the Steam Powered Clock just when it sounded the quarter hour. How cool is that!   Gastown features interesting architecture and a friendly ambience.  As we walked around Vancouver I wondered where the homeless people were. We found them on our Hop On/Off‚Äîthey are clustered just a few blocks from Gastown.  The bus went by very quickly but what I saw was appalling‚Äîit looked like the city had decided to push all the addicts and homeless people together in a crowded block or two.

title: Gorgeous.
reviews: Stroll the streets and enjoy the architecture of Gastown. And most importantly boost the steam clock which sings and whistles every 15 minutes. It‚Äôs something special.

title: Catch the Steam Clock
reviews: At 6pm, the steam clock will sound music and produce steam. That's an interesting sight. You can also find some good souvenir shops and other apparel shops in Gastown too.

title: An Interesting Place To See
reviews: The steamclock is the highlight of this area of Vancouver. There is a good selection of restaurants and small cafes. However, the number of homeless on the street was surprising, but then this seems to be a problem across the city.

title: Fun
reviews: Area is fun, but needs some family and young children activities. We enjoyed, but young kids were getting antsy.

title: Tourist Trap
reviews: Two reasons not to go . One. The area is blighted by homeless people, and drug addicts and not just a few, if you include adjacent streets hundreds would not be an exaggeration. Two. The shop prices are ridiculous especially souvenir store who you might think are price matching each other, or maybe owned by the same people So if you want over priced shop soiled stuff from China help yourself. Below Trip Advisor will ask ‚Äú How long would I suggest you visit for I have put less than 1 hour. I mean don‚Äôt go.

title: Beautiful town with a tremendous homeless problem
reviews: I cannot remember having seen another city with such a tremendous homeless problem. The junkies are everywhere, sleeping in the entrances of the nice houses and stores. You don‚Äôt want to walk through there alone at nighttime. It is a great pity, the government cannot get a control on this problem. It has been like this for 25 years and it is only getting worse. A reason not to come back.

title: What a waste of time....
reviews: If this is what Vancouver calls a tourist attraction then think again. Apart from a quaint steam clock, it‚Äôs a dump! The shops wait for tourist mugs to come in and when you feel you have had enough and keep walking...you end up in the ghetto .If you have time to waste and are bored then it‚Äôs worth a visit otherwise avoid.

title: The unforgettable experience!
reviews: Gas Town! What a place! The short walk is really worth watching the night life of this vibrant city! The bars and food options are great and we just loved the whole experience!

title: A visit with Excitement
reviews: We stayed in Vancouver in July on the way to Europe. Hotel was well situated. We wandered down the street and came across an annual local Cycle Marathon... What fun! Teams of about 8 in various colours, madly cycling around a few shut off streets. Supporters with the craziest little bells (cross between a cowbell and something used in the mountains)..was great to feel a part of the shouts of encouragement etc.  The area of Gastown has beautiful street lights and the amazing Steam Clock that has pride of place in Water Street. Built in 1977 it still works.  There are some great eateries, the City line/Airport line tube trains underground, buses if you prefer.

title: Fun
reviews: Water street has lots of shops and restaurants. It is fun to watch the steam clock  You are close to the Harbor Tower so you can go up and get a great sky view of the area and city

title: Lots of nice places to eat
reviews: Gastown is great, beautiful street with gorgeous hanging plants. Lots of tourist shops, some clothes stores and lots of nice food. Suggestion is to have a wander through and then stop into a bar/restaurant that has happy hour food. Homelessness is a problem in Vancouver so there will be lots of homeless folk along your travels.

title: Night life
reviews: We walked down through Gastown one week night.  Lots of great restaurants and activities.  Traffic was steady but not impacting our walk.  We admired the statues and the steam clock.  Plenty of food options around.

title: Good mix.
reviews: Gastown is an excellent place to visit. You can just wonder around taking in the local atmosphere. There are many excellent place to eat from cafe, pubs and restaurant.   Here you can get you souvenir gifts or something a little more  special.

title: Trendy, quirky, and not to be missed!
reviews: Gastown is an important location within Vancouver city, since it is the site of the earliest township and bars. It is quaint with cobbled streets, trendy restaurants, and multiple iconic tourist attractions such as the Steam Clock and statue of Gassy Jack standing upon his famous whisky barrel. I recommend googling the history and then going to Gastown for some excellent tourist photos!

title: Gas clock was worth the visit
reviews: Steam clock . Only one in the world . Iconic but worth the visit . It is small , not very big but still really awesome. Ok

title: Plan your time there accordingly
