reviews: You can walk up and down this street in a few hours.  There are a few nice shops but don't get caught there in the afternoon or evening as Vancouver has decided to give the city away to all the crack heads in that country.  If you like to watch people shoot up then hang near the end of the street and there will be hundreds to watch and in the morning you can walk over them as they are sleeping (or are they dead!) on the streets.

title: Brilliant area to visit
reviews: Really special place to visit when you are in Vancouver. Great place to walk around and soak up the atmosphere. Lots of bars,cafes and some great quirky shops.The old buildings are so nice and of course the icing on the cake is the Famous Steam Clock. Equally good during the day or night ,a must see.

title: Lovely place to walk around
reviews: We were just for few hours but was worth it , nice area with plenty and coffees and bars , shops for everything including tourist shops for gifts

title: Fantastic
reviews: A lovely area of Vancouver which we enjoyed walking up and down. The clock is really cool and something to be seen.

title: Lovely area
reviews: An historic area of Vancouver. Full of character. The gas clock is a must see. Tree lined Water street us just beautiful.

title: Better places to go and see in Vancouver
reviews: Honestly?We had fond memories of this place from 16 years ago, when it seemed quaint and vaguely romantic in the evenings with its little lights on the pavements..We visited on a Sunday morning and found endless souvenir shops selling the same tat and all offering 30% discount for some strange reason. Few coffee shops open, and a crowd gathered around the steam clock like it was the Statue of Liberty or something...We returned at night, hoping to rediscover some of Gastown's missing charm, only to find half the lights unlit at 9.30 pm, and the restaurants looking unappealing.Worth popping along for a look if you have the time, but there are too many other places in this city which have so much more to offer.

title: Gastown is unique
reviews: The original location of now Vancouver.  Lots of trendy restaurants,  bars, shops, and the coolest and largest steam clock in North America.

title: Great for Dining, Strolling & Picture Taking
reviews: This district was in walking distance from our hotel and we ate in this area twice, each time making sure to view the famous steamclock going off. In summer the hanging flower baskets,  big shady trees, and charming lamposts make this a very picturesque area and there are a variety of types of restaurants to eat at. Good for picking up souvenirs but also some magnificent art galleries featuring First Nations and Inuit art. We easily spent 2-3 hours just walking around, eating dinner, shopping, etc.

title: Saturday night dinner visit
reviews: Nice walk around prior to dinner.Clock tower is a must(wait for the display on the hour).Nice pubs and restaurants scattered around the area.

title: I love Gastown
reviews: I worked in the Gastown area for almost 10 years and I absolutely love it. The amount of food that you can find that is genuinely delicious within a short walking distance is amazing. I love the mix of old and new, the variety in different people you see, and the overall Good Vibes in Gastown. If you are a tourist and you're not aware, Gastown Neighbors the downtown Eastside which is an extremely condensed area of drug addicts / homeless. For me this is not an issue whatsoever as the residents of the downtown Eastside are not there to bother anyone, I just thought I would include this as a heads up for any tourist that may wander out of Gastown and into the downtown Eastside without realizing.

title: Fun tourist district but don't get into the wrong area
reviews: There are some a terrific restaurants, bars and shops in this little tourist haven, one of Vancouver main attractions. Start at the corner of Cordova and Water Street and walk slowly down towards the The Steam Clock, which always gets attention in the middle of Water Street. However, the challenge for tourists is not to wander too far and into the troubled Downtown Eastside area where the ambience quickly changes from urban chic to grungy unpleasantness with alarming scenes of drug addiction, homelessness and squalid street-culture. Walk as far as the statue of Gassy Jack and then turn back and return to the city centre. There are some nice restaurants and bars around the Gastown block, For lunch, consider Steamworks or Rogue Kitchen (in the station building), Nicli Antica Pizzeria, Nuba or The Flying Pig. For evenings, check out the Pourhouse, Water Street Cafe, Jules Bistro, Bauhaus and L'Abattoir.  There are many others, but these all deliver a quality experience. Gastown is a historic area and it looks beautiful when the old-fashioned street lamps are turned on and it can have a special charm in the rain when the sidewalks are wet and shiny. Don't let the fun of your visit be spoiled by the shocking streets scenes are exists in the neighbourhood next door.

title: The heart of old Vancouver
reviews: This is where settlement started for Europeans putting down roots in the area. From fashion, art, and novelty shops, to a great variety of eating establishments and historic sites, Gastown (essentially Water Street) is a must-see Vancouver location.Tip: Wandering west and south from Gastown is fine but beware of going east of Carrall St as the neighbourhood gets rougher quickly. Not dangerous as in violence, but a lot of illicit drug use and poverty pervades neighbouring Downtown Eastside.

title: Hip area for nightlife
reviews: This is the place to be at night...open air bars, people watching, strolling through the district with its decorative lighting. We enjoyed our evening

title: Kitchen and Bar
reviews: My husband and son had the fish and chip.  I had the fish tacos. They had the onion soup and I had the chowder.  The place smell bad and the food was awful.  It was us $89.00 what we had.  This was the worst meal we had at the Gastown.

title: Iconic part of Vancouver
reviews: We went down to see the old steam clock and realized there‚Äôs so much more to Gas Town! Great walk along the shop lined streets. Very busy and trendy.

title: History and clocks
reviews: This area has become a busy place for tramps and homless alongside curious tourists wandering on its cobbled streets in search of the syeam clock , which strikes the time every quarter of an hour.Apart from that, I would not like to be around at night: some people really loook weird!

title: A National Historic Site of Canada (2009)
reviews: Who can argue with that?  Smarter people (than we are) presumably know what merits this distinction and honor.  The community nearly vaporized during the 1886 "Great Vancouver Fire" which, when the embers burnt out, reduced all but 2 buildings to ash.  But 1886 is not like yesterday and the town rebuilt in a mish-mash of Victorian Italianate, Edwardian, and Romanesque.  The community has fiercely fought to preserve these roots.  This is a pleasant respite from the glass modern towers which make their home throughout Vancouver.Our favorites were a fun little souvenir shop (oh well, we are tourists, after all) and the landmarks of the steam clock and Gassy Jack, and the hanging flower baskets, suspended from the white glass globed lamp posts (evoking the 1880's period).  The overall impression was that the 1880's were alive and well here in Gastown.An amusing factoid is that in 1971 there was a riot between police and hippies over marijuana.  Fast-forward to the here-and-now and it is legal; eating it, as well, becomes legal later in August of 2019.  Who would have guessed?  Times change.  The answer my friend, is blowing in the wind ...Eating in Gastown may require a reservation or a long wait.  Everywhere we went, we saw long lists.  No surprise here, as Gastown has great food.

title: Big change from 3 years ago.
reviews: Not even the same place as before.  Last time we were here, there were dozens of wandering homeless and the streets were dirty with human waste.  Not even the same place now.  Vibrant streets with dozens, yes, dozens of new shops and eateries everywhere.  Lots in international tour groups wandering about to fill those shops.  Parking was ample and affordable.  Old buildings that looked like they should be flattened are not filling up with trendy shops and cool dining options.  Where there were a limited number of shopping options, the stores go on and on, to include inside quiet courtyards.  Exceptional turn around in such a short time.

title: Used to be fantastic, now run-down, crowded with homeless & drug smell
reviews: Don't get me wrong this district is still worth seeing, but only just. The great restaurant and bier-garden culture is hardly visible any more. The steam clock was showing the wrong time. The street was dirty and not well maintained and many buildings look empty. Some Tourist shops resemble Chinese 1$ markets. There any so many homeless around.I think the local government should look into restructuring and renovating this area. Even Chinatown was looking better!

title: Walkable area
reviews: Gastown is a great neighborhood, it is completely walkable to a variety of good to great restaurants, shopping, souvenir hunting and interesting sights.    Easy access to transportation (rail, cruise ships, sea planes, bus lines, hop on/hop off tour bus...

title: Gastown
reviews: Gastown is an easy walk from downtown Vancouver.  It is a touristy area with many tourist shops, small bistros and public houses.  Seeing the steam clock and 'Gassy' Jack statue is the highlight of the area.

title: Well worth a visit
reviews: Gas Town has oodles of character, lots of interesting architecture and is an easy walk from Canada Place.  Lots of pubs and eateries with various kinds of food and touristy shops make this an interesting place to visit.  We loved the numerous hanging baskets full of flowering plants and the steam clock which is very popular with tourists.  On the outskirts of Gastown you will encounter homeless folk.  On the main, we did not feel threatened by them or unsafe, even in the evenings.  Gastown is well worth a visit.

title: Oldest Part of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is the oldest part of the City of Vancouver. It has old buildings and cobble stone roads. There are lots of restaurants and pubs. Lots of chic boutiques too. More and more buildings are getting renovated. So, you could see some homeless people in the outskirts.

title: WORTH SPENDING A FEW HOURS EXPLORING
reviews: An easy walk from Canada place, Gastown is a busy touristy area full of souvenir shops, eateries & interesting architecture...the famous Steam Clock is definitely worth a look.

title: History and Exploration
reviews: Spent an afternoon exploring Gastown, eating good food, and learning the history of the area. There is a lot of unique architecture to see, pubs/patios to relax in and curio shops for the interested. Some of the sites and shops are tourist traps and parking/traffic can be a bit of a challenge. I recommend taking the Sea Train into the area or taxi as an alternative.

title: The fun town.
reviews: Ya gotta go. Gastronomic need demands you sample the town! A little artsy and Bohemian, with great food and drink!

title: Take a stroll
reviews: This is a great part of town to walk around in - lots of restaurants, bars and coffee shops and a very pedestrian friendly feel.

title: Interesting place to go
reviews: Had a wander around this area of Vancouver and it was quite fun.  Some interesting shops, nice cafes and of course the steam clock.

title: Gastown
reviews: Nice little town with restaurants and shops. Tried eating at a bar restaurant but wasnt‚Äôt allowed to dine with our 18 year old, because the drinking age is 19.Nice atmosphere in the area!

title: Foodie Paradise... and more!
reviews: My wife and I visited Vancouver for the first time earlier this month, and intentionally sought to stay within walking distance of Gastown... and we were SO glad we did.Gastown is bustling with energy. The cobblestone streets and varied architecture give it unique character.  People congregate there for the restaurants and cafes and bars... and to shop at a variety of boutiques and specialty shops... and to browse the myriad souvenir stores for just the right shirt or hat or magnet... and to see the steam clock! And to people-watch. So much fun!We dined at MeeT in Gastown, where we had the butter chikkin. Yummm!!!

title: Bustling area
reviews: I loved my wander through the Gastown area. Full of quaint little specialty shops, cobbled streets & lots of places of interest. Visit the steam clock if you have a chance, great eating options. Just a really wonderful area to enjoy.

title: No thanks.
reviews: This is supposed to be a wonderfully quaint, historic district with character and local flavor.  Well....not so much.It look nice, yes.  But most of the shops are tourist tchotchkes- T-shirt‚Äôs, hats, fake First Nations artifacts. That kind of thing.  Then there are the overpriced clothing stores.  There may be some nice restaurants, but this crowded, noisy, tourist-filled magnet area was not my cup of tea at all.Drive through it on the hop-on-hop-off and you can say you‚Äôve been there.

title: An interesting area with lots of souvenir shops and restaurants.
reviews: Wandered the streets of Gastown on a wet day so we‚Äôre in and out of the shops. There were some interesting statues and monuments and the steam clock was particularly interesting. Almost bought a pair of leather boots but luggage allowance persuaded me to abstain! A great selection in the Western shop.Had lunch and caught a taxi return.

title: Quaint area to spend an evening
reviews: Lovely area full of restaurants and bars. Everyone gathers round the steam clock on the hour to hear it sing and chime. Great atmosphere and felt very safe there

title: Tourists galore
reviews: You could say Gastown is a tourist trap but we were happy to comeback three years after our first visit.  We felt there were ‚Äòbetter‚Äô shops this visit.  Home to the steam clock and souvenir shops also plenty of cafes.    Yes interesting and worth a visit.

title: Touristy Area But Worry Visiting
reviews: We went to Gastown to have lunch and to shop.  Parking can be a challenge and it was easier to park in public garage (a challenge for larger vehicles though).There are lots of options for food and shopping.  The steam clock is unique and definitely allow time to watch it play the whistles (every 45 minutes I think).  There was an extremely good artist painting and selling local art near the clock.  His work is excellent and he signed the painting we bought of the steam clock.We ate at The Lamplighter Public House and it was very good.  The shops are a mix of touristy souvenirs and eclectic options.  There is a lot of interesting history on the area and worth checking out the various plaques and markers to learn more about the area.Do note that the area adjacent to Gastown has a large homeless and transient population.  If you stay in the area you will have no worries.

title: Don‚Äôt veer off in the wrong direction
reviews: Very charming neighborhood but don‚Äôt veer off in the wrong direction.  Gastown if full of charm with quaint shops and restaurants but a few blocks away we saw pure horror.  A few streets filled with drugs users shooting up.  How they are allowed to do this in public is pure insanity.  It truly looked like a zombie apocalypse, quite honestly the most horrific thing we have ever seen.   Stick to the main Gas Town area by the steam clock because in between Gas Town and China Town is an area where you don‚Äôt want to be and certainly don‚Äôt want children to see.

title: Interesting
reviews: This is an interesting place to visit, but there are issues here. There are lots of cool bars and restaurants/shops and interesting buildings and a great steam clock. It is quite touristy and there are areas where the homeless hang about in groups and appear to be in great need. I didn‚Äôt notice any security, but also had no problems during my brief visit. There appears to be renovation work taking part in areas, which make it look a little shabby in parts. Not somewhere I‚Äôd want to hang around late at night. Still worth a visit though.

title: Anniversary trip
reviews: Gas town was pretty cool, the only concern was that is merged with China town that houses most of the homeless people, as long as you stay off Hastings street you will be fine.

title: Not worth it
reviews: My husband and I took a walk through Gastown and wanted to grab a bite to eat for dinner. We were seated in an outdoor patio area, but quickly lost our appetite. Gastown is very close to East Hastings street and has several SRO hotels for the homeless, mentally ill, drug addicted right next door to the restaurants. We‚Äôve never seen so much IV drug use out in the open. Very disturbing. There are much better areas to walk around/ eat in. Go elsewhere‚Äîespecially if you‚Äôre traveling with children.

title: Great corner of town
reviews: Lots of shops and some nice restaurants here. We ate and walked and enjoyed watching the crowd watch the clock.

title: Scruffy and too many cars
reviews: OK the steam clock is special and the gassy jack statue is interesting however the wider area is greatly underwhelming with far too many cars driving through pedestrian crossing areas

title: Wonderful cosmopolitan area full of history
reviews: Awesome gift shop (Michelle‚Äôs) that stocks a huge variety of Canadian items. Lots of fabulous shops & places to eat. Avoid walking to Chinatown as there are a lot of homeless people along the way (they don‚Äôt bother you but they line the streetsüò¢). Definitely recommend a visit. Enjoy!

title: Stroll through Gastown
reviews: Sweet little area to take a walk around and see an older area down by Vancouver Waterfront. Gassy Jack, Steam clock and cobblestones.  Nice restaurants and shops for some mementos.  I live here and love it to meet friends for lunch on a nice day...then walk around Canada Place, Convention Center and a drink in the lounge at the Pan Pacific!

title: Mixed,
reviews: It has a small array of quaint shops and restaurants in older style buildings. Highlights were also the founders statue, Gassy Jack and the steam clock. Other it‚Äôs a bit run down and felt less comfortable on the outskirts.

title: Lots of shops and lots of walking
reviews: Very crowded area.  Many shops and restaurants.   Something to see and be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes.  Tourist area to be sure.

title: A feeling of previous times., with modern places.
reviews: The old classic buildings, mixed with tourists, good restaurants.  A lot to see.  A nice walking tour.

title: Cool Vibe
reviews: Gastown is a cool funky place, open 7 days a week there is always something happening. Fun, food, coffee and shopping. History is strong in this neighbourhood. Be careful if you walk to many blocks you are in trouble, stick to the path or you‚Äôll be on skid row.

title: Beautiful!
reviews: Great place to dine and walk around. Water street is beautiful and charming. The steam clock is fun to watch.

title: Gastown - a great place to visit day & night
reviews: I enjoy walking (bus #50 passes by that area) by Gastown day or night. There are a lot of shops -- souvenir shops, fashion & shoe shops, restaurants and schools (English language school & film schools). You can find the best rated restaurants in the area, too. Many tourists & locals alike enjoy watching the Steam Clock or observing people while having a meal in one of the unique restaurants or coffee shops in the area.

title: Quaint area of the city
reviews: Really nice traditional area of Vancouver with a great buzz at night. You must see the steam clock which draws in quite the crowd.

title: Nicest part of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown has many bars and restaurants with outdoor seating and the view of the area is nice as well.  Although right at the border of Gastown you will encounter many homeless and junkies.  If you are walking around the city, do ask your hotel which streets or blocks to avoid as it is a center for junkies.Frankly, Vancouver skyline and beaches pales in comparison to other metropolitan cities.  The city appears to be a hub for vapor and tattoo shops!  We had a relaxing time in Vancouver, visited a few parks and beaches, took the tram to the top of the mountain and saw a refuge for rescued bears; visited Gastown and Chinatown.  At one beach there was a series of laughing sculptures dedicated to: "May this sculpture inspire laughter, playfulness, and joy in all who experience it".

title: Funky
reviews: lots of quirky shops and restos to try out.. generally a very chilled out vibe in this place.. but watch out.. you walk 2 blocks to far to the east and you are in a REALLY sketchy par tof town!!

title: Gastown
reviews: Recently stayed in Vancouver at the Pan Pacific Hotel. It is within walking distance of the Gastown district. It is an older part of the downtown that has become a trendy area of shops, restaurants and bistros. It was a nice walk and hand dinner a The Spaghetti Factory. It was clean and busy but beware of the amount of panhandlers. They can be aggressive. One in particular approached my wife and swore at her. I interviewed and he moved on.... to another woman. He was targeting women. One thing I did not see was any police presence in that area. I think that would be necessary. However I did see a large police presence at the Starbucks...Hmmmm. The photo is of a steam powered clock. Pretty cool. It was a neat area to see if u have a little to spend by the port in Vancouver.

title: Tourist
reviews: Beware of the junkies. Our car was broken into in a parking station and valuables and passports stolen. We realised the whole area around Gastown is awash with homeless people and junkies actually shooting up in the streets and doing deals very openly. The police told us to walk down the street and check out what stolen goods were available....ours would very likely be amongst them. We didn‚Äôt find our stuff. Violent brawls also took place amongst addicts on the streets while we were there. Just appalling and very very sad to see sick addicts in such numbers. Certainly spoils the area for tourists.

title: Trendy
reviews: I liked walking this area of the city.  There were a lot of bars and restaurants, mostly smaller, and lots of street life.  I liked the whole vibe and look of the place.  Everyone was enjoying themselves on the nice sunny evening we were there.

title: Nicest part of Vancouver
reviews: A lot of downtown Vancouver is made up of pug ugly tall buildings. Gastown is the exception, it has a nice feeling to it, loads if shops and nice pubs and resteraunts in a lowrise setting.

title: nice to see
reviews: The gastown was very unique .A must try for eating is the old spaggetti factory .Very reasonable food and nice shops to shop in

title: Great historic part of Vancouver
reviews: Great place to go for a stroll, take pictures, shop or have some amazing food.  Lots to see here and check out while spending a day or few hours.  Walking through the area is good rain or shine.  If you are not into crowds, then avoid this on a cruise ship day or a warm summer evening.  The restaurants are some of the best in the city and have all kinds of food,

title: Return visit
reviews: The main attraction is the gas clock which operates on the half and full hour. Not seen one anywhere else in the world. There are lots of shops, restaurants and pubs in the immediate facinity. Well worth a visit.

title: Real character
reviews: Lived the feel of Gastown and all the shops etc. The steam clock is worth a visit especially on the hour! A nice feel to the place

title: Area of great character
reviews: Lovely area of the city with lots of bars and restaurants plus shops. The steam clock in the centre is a real treat.

title: Shopping precinct with local character
reviews: I enjoyed strolling and shopping in this precinct as it has many heritage buildings, local designs and interesting shops. So much better than sipping at the mall as I can find unique things here.

title: It's ok.
reviews: Trendy hipster style area it was ok but nothing more in my opinion. Some areas a little grubby/ rubbish about and drunken beggars.

title: Nice area to walk around
reviews: Gas town is a nice area to walk around. Lots of restaurants , bars and souvenir shops. The clock is a must see if you are around.

title: Victorian Buildings, steam clock, tourists shops
reviews: Nice stroll from any of the hotels close to the Cruise Ship Dock.  Steam clock is fun to see and hear.

title: Ok for a quick walk!
reviews: Gastown   is one road of restaurants and souvenir shops geared towards tourist coming in from the cruise ships. Being that we were staying in North Vancouver it was not very exciting to visit. The walk over there was a little sketchy. We had to walk through areas around Chinatown Which is filled with the homeless and clearly people who are in need of assistance. The steam clock was definitely cool to see.

title: Steam clock
reviews: My wife and i have just got back from our trip to Canada. one of our places of interest was the steam clock in gas town Vancouver.If you are in the area it's well worth a visit. A very remarkable piece of engineering.

title: Little bit of history preserved
reviews: Gas town still has the cobble stone streets. A steam clock and the historic Blood Alley. There‚Äôs a lot of nice eatery that‚Äôs for all budget. It‚Äôs more happening at night with its night life, especially on weekends. Small pockets of fine dining

title: History meets modern times
reviews: From the steam powered clock, to great food and shopping, you'll find it in Gastown. Sitting beside the sidewalk, eating a fine meal, is a great way to experience Vancouver at it's finest.

title: Picturesque, definitely worh it.
reviews: Gastown, from what I heard it is where it all started. It is a nice area of the town with cool bars and restaurants and plenty of shops that can help you overspend. It is also a place great do to some sightseeing and find old little gems that Vancouver has to offer. The steam clock... does not seem much at first, just wait for the o'clock and you will he awarded for your wait.

title: Great place to visit
reviews: This is a lovely historic place to visit.  Great buildings, lots of shops.  Not far from Sky Tower which has 360 degree viewing and is also worth a visit.   My favourite was the Steam clock in Gas Town really fun to watch it play a tune.

title: Great area!!
reviews: This small area in Vancouver is very charming and unique. There is TONS of shopping and food!!! Check out the clock!

title: Antique clock in beautiful street
reviews: Gastown steam clock is beautiful attraction in Vancouver downtown. Walkable distance from Waterfront train station. Every 15 minutes steam clock is whistling and every hour like 7 or 8 or 9... big whistling .Must watch. Street is so beautiful , evening time lighting and steam clock is good to experience.Antique clock. Too good. Must visit. Try to visit evening time.

title: Too close to East Hastings
reviews: Deplorable street lined with hundreds of drug addicts most of whom are probably suffering from mental illnesses. This is a national problem that even a world class city like Vancouver cannot possibly handle on its own. As Canadians we could do a lot better for those who cannot look after themselves. After all, that is the true measure of a society.

title: Busy! Busy! Busy!
reviews: Gastown is a tourist trap.  It‚Äôs a good place to buy souvenirs and eat, but there wasn‚Äôt much to do.  This was the first time we felt like we weren‚Äôt safe in Canada.  We bought a few trinkets at a souvenir store; the owner was kind of rude.  I was looking at some t-shirts on a stand.  She said those were the ‚Äúextras‚Äù and the ones for customers to look at are hanging on the walls.  It made zero sense to me!  Anyway, we grabbed a delicious and affordable sushi dinner at Momo Sushi then left.  We‚Äôll definitely skip it next time!

title: Nice area and clean!
reviews: Nice area and clean too. Many restaurants to pick from including a brewery. Good local shopping and a liquor store too. We were in this area a day before our cruise and good area to walk around and eat and drink and don't forget shopping too.

title: Gone downhill rapidly
reviews: Amazed at the difference in two years - unless when we were here before Gastown areas drug addicts had been cleared out for the 150 year Csnada day celebrations Last time we were here we enjoyed the atmosphere of the outdoor bars and cafes and the energy of the area - this time we could wait to get out of the area - from individuals in a zombie like state to full on ranging in your face or openly shooting up in front of you - the amount of drug users was unbelievable and has turned the area (for us) into a no go area as we felt unsafe.So sad for the people and the area

title: Reminded me of NYC's Greenwich Village Area
reviews: On a recent vacation, we visited the Gastown neighborhood of Vancouver.  It was conveniently located east of the Seabus ferry terminal in Waterfront Station.  As we were staying in North Vancouver, we were only a 15 minute ferry ride from Gastown.Gastown reminded me of NYC's Greenwich Village with its trendy restaurants, bars and edgy clothing and furniture stores.  Water Street is the main strip of Gastown and you can easily cover the area within 1-2 hours.  On the day we visited, the bars were full of fans watching the Toronto Raptors game.Expect to be part of the large crowd of tourists that gather around Gastown's famous steam clock that is located on Water Street.  It was more fun that I expected - at the top of the hour, it plays a tune, toots and lets out steam.  On the quarter hour, it just toots and lets off steam.

title: Pleasant walk but came back the wrong way.
reviews: The area around the station is called Gastown. Shops and restaurants all very pleasant. We continued walking and ended up in downtown Eastside an area full of homeless and drug addicts. It was sad.There were a number of unconscious addicts. In Vancouver, the downtown east side is the epicentre of the drug problem, and much of the area's drug is supply tainted with the powerful synthetic opioid Fentanyl.But under the city's unusual approach to the problem, users can access supervised injection sites, which allow people to use illegal drugs with trained staff present.We have read up and are impressed with the city‚Äôs approach to the issue.

title: Hyped
reviews: Some lazy chinese and locals seen along with some statues etc.....of no great interest.. The steam clock was the only piece of interest.

title: Great area to visit
reviews: Lots of restaurants, shops and pubs to keep u busy.The famous steam driven clock is worth a look.It‚Äôs a busy area and is near the harbour for trips by seaplane.It‚Äôs definately worth a visit

title: A great place to shop!
reviews: This area of the city is a buzzing hive of people!  Lots of souvenir shops with great prices, eateries, and everything going on.  A must place to visit when in Vancouver.

title: VICTORIAN BUILDINGS
reviews: Lively Gastown is known for its whistling Steam Clock and mix of souvenir shops. Chic cocktail lounges, restaurants and art galleries.

title: Tourist shops - Drug takers & Homeless beggars
reviews: The only thing to visit and  see is the " Old Steam Clock " - the place is crowded with tourists . The big put off is the homeless people begging in the street & what appeared to be drug takers. My wife & I spent less than 30minutes & left.

title: Not as charming as one would believe
reviews: Through research on YouTube and other travel sites we were led to believe that Gastown is a must visit when in Vancouver. Wrong. I have felt safer on the streets of Dublin, Edinburgh, & London than I did in Gastown on a Sunday evening. We were accosted by 2 homeless people and approached by several others. We had just arrived and had no cash on hand when one man asked for change. We politely told him so and he asked for my credit card. The entire area reeked of urine and just a few blocks over is an entire tent city of homeless. This does not make for a pleasant tourist attraction. We felt duped for having made it a priority to check it out. Lesson learned.

title: Great spot for stroll
reviews: Nice spot to come for a stroll, shopping, and lunch. It is busy during tourist season and there are some street people doing their thing. But interesting to see the steam clock and see some unique shops.

title: Touristy
reviews: Spent time walking around gas town on a Sunday evening. A number of restaurants most of which were marginal in terms of food selection and quality. Rather crowded with a lot of tourist type shops. There were significant numbers of homeless people some of whom were very aggressive especially approaching women in a very forward, vulgar way. Gastown left a very poor impression of Vancouver but our trip to Grandville and Stanley Island got us back on the right track.Surprise that the local police don‚Äôt have a stronger presence giving the number of people and the number of homeless in that area.

title: Finally some character!!
reviews: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, downtown Vancouver is beautiful, but it‚Äôs all so new. I kept thinking to myself where is the historical part, then it appeared when we finally went to Gastown. This is the older part of Vancouver, it was like stepping back in time. The buildings, the streets, the chained linked sidewalks. Make sure to go early, because the shops close around 7, then mostly restaurants and pubs are open. The highlight is the clock, even though it was built in the 70‚Äôs, it still felt pretty old. It was so charming every time it chimed, which is every 15 minutes. We sat at the restaurant across from it to enjoy it fully. We were so lucky to be there when the Raptors won, made it even more exciting to be there. As you walk into the heart of Gastown look at the lights, there are fun things written on them.

title: Old fashioned town
reviews: Despite the abundance of shops the GasTown area is very reminiscent of the down town in which some of us grew up.  Not necessarily quiet, but familiar and comfortable.  There are plenty of place to stop, have a snack and watch the world walk by.  Don't forget to watch the "Steam Clock" operate.  Fun stuff, eh.

title: A definite visit
reviews: Definitely worth a visit for a couple of nights for restaurants and pre-dinner drinks. Some good souvenir shops too.It does border Chinatown so don't stray into there (see Chinatown and Hasting street reviews).

title: Cool, but a bit disconcerting and depressing
reviews: Lots to do for nightlife scene. Also some cool shops. However, there are a lot of homeless people and people passed out on drugs in the area that take one out of the experience and makes you be little for your safety and for the state of some of the people you come across.

title: WOW
reviews: Gastown is worth the walk through. Stopped and had cheesecake, coffee and two main sites, being Steam Clock and Gastown Statue of Gassey himself.Great day and food. Everyone so friendly.Thank you

title: Busy, clean and fun
reviews: Lots of places to shop for Canadian trinkets! Lots of visitors. Even though the streets were crowded, it was pleasant. Quite a diverse group of places to eat or have a tall cool one! We enjoyed the Steam Clock, one reason we made sure to visit

title: Great place to visit
reviews: This is a lovely historical place to visit in Vancouver. If you can try to do it as a free walking tour which will give you a better insight to the area. As you walk around remember to look up as well as down.

title: You can find lunch or dinner here
reviews: This is a great area of downtown Vancouver. The story of Gassy Jack or the steam clock got us here but we stayed for the food and drinks.

title: Brilliant
reviews: Gastown has funky shops, amazing food, lovely galleries, and super friendly.  Definitely worth a visit!

title: Lots of trees and shade
reviews: Got off bus. Wonder atmosphere. Gas lamps,hanging flowerpots. Cobble street. Very pedestrian friendly. This was the best area to visit of all of Vancouver.

title: Nice area
reviews: The main attraction is the steam clock but it is a very enjoyable area with many old buildings, souvenir shops and restaurants

title: Like all great Canadian Cities, Vancouver was founded by a bar keep and a barrel of whiskey!
reviews: Gastown is a wonderful exploration of Victorian, downtown Vancouver. Funky shops, patio restaurants and touristy souvenirs abound. Don‚Äôt miss the steam clock.

title: Now Upscale
reviews: This used to be an edgy part of town full of drunks.  I think the huge number of cruise ships that dock nearby have had an influence and now the area is full of shopping, eating and coffee.  Some of the stores are unique.  And the lovely old architecture is shown to its best advantage.  The drug users are off on the edge of the area.

title: Steam clock
reviews: The steam clock is the main attraction here, but you will be spoilt for choice of eateries in this very busy area

title: Fun for an hour or so.
reviews: It a little touristy but still we had to say we visited there. There are plenty of souvenir shops, lots of cafes and restaurants and of course the Steam Clock. I enjoyed the atmosphere with the historic buildings. It's worth a visit.

title: Stinky
reviews: Staying in Vancouver and decided to explore gastown.  Cannot believe a city like this has so many overt drug users strewn around street.  Pavements smelt just foul.  Nothing would have persuaded me to eat here.  Consider this a big problem for Vancouver.  Tough action needed to reclaim streets and aid to endeavour to rehabilitate those who wish to escape the spiral paramount.  Very sad this is happening in 2019.

title: Worth a visit or more than one visit.
reviews: Touristy area with a lot of gift shops etc but there is still a lot of charm.  Beautiful street lamps, old buildings, flowers and all things to beautify the area.  Several really good clothing shops and also terrific shoe stores.  Plenty of places to eat, some with patios. Very enjoyable.

title: Visit to Gastown
reviews: My visit to Gastown was a great experience, loved the buildings, shops, statue of Jack, and of course the clock !!!  Love the way it steams, sings and everything else. Worth a visit !!

title: Natural charm
reviews: A few streets with some nice pubs and restaurants and the usual gift shops. Clearly a great spot to stop and eat with a colourful history and the famous steam click.Sadly the streets between Gastown and Chinatown should be avoided.

title: My favourite part of Vancouver
reviews: We've been in the city for a couple of days pre cruise.The location of the steam clock and 'gassy Jack's statue. Lots of fabulous restaurants and bars

title: Lovely place to look for a place to lunch or dinner
reviews: Many wonderful restaurants as you walk around.  Lovely walk on the after around the steam clock. The enjoyed coffee and muffin on a sunny lovely afternoon. Worth the visit.

title: A lovely place to visit
reviews: Nice place to visit..felt at home there..people were friendly..tour bus to Whistler was interesting with the tour guide being very informative ...Tour around Vancouver was very enjoyable..even saw a black squirrel in a park..A place you would go back to....

title: Lots of things to do
reviews: Good commercial district. Many shops to see and buy . Souvenirs . Restaurants . Even food trucks . Aside from the architecture made Victorian style , locals and tourists come here to see the steam clock. Take photos and videos of the clock spewing smoke , it is a sight.

title: Great in many ways
reviews: Loads of funky shops and amazing restaurants. We were in Vancouver for five nights and spent time in this area daily.

title: Steam clock worth seeing
reviews: Walked along Water St to GastownOlder buildings and some interesting shops. Steam clock well worth seeing...performs each quarter hour but best to be there on the hour if possible. We got a good view from across the street....diagonally opposite. I wouldn‚Äôt go much further down this street as sadly there are a lot of druggies and beggars. Quite intimidating, openly using drugs. There‚Äôs a statue of Gassy Jack....the founding father of Gastown

title: Lots to do in this part of town
reviews: Lots of shopping - both for locals and tourists. Plenty of pubs and restaurants and the big Waterfront Skytrain/Seabus station is here as well. A good central location to meet up with people.

title: Mixed area
reviews: Expensive stores, hipster restaurants interspersed with souvenir shops.   Cool area, but adjoins a grimy area with homeless encampments and heroin nodders.  Stay closer to the water.  Gastown clock is fun...only steam powered clock I know.

title: A Unique Area of Vancouver
reviews: Wonderful area to stroll and enjoy the sights, shops and streets cape.  We went early and had a really pleasant stroll before the crowds arrived.  Don‚Äôt miss the steam clock, just fascinating.

title: Vancouver
reviews: I only had two to three hours to spend in Gastown area of Vancouver but this is a vibrant area with restaurants shops and people just hanging out enjoying what was and absolutely beautiful day in June. There‚Äôs a lot of history there. My wife and I truly enjoyed this area. The age of most people I engaged with would probably average in age of 25 -40 . Exciting and laid back at the same time

title: Not What I Expected
reviews: We wandered through Gastown mainly because it was mentioned in a lot of tours I was considering. It has plenty of pubs and coffee shops and looks like it caters to an older party crowd. It also has a high incidence of homelessness in the area. This area is. It the best choice for families, but it is near places that are.

title: Eclectic
reviews: Very eclectic and hip- but do not wander- there is a large concentration of homeless who recently injured a tourist-

title: Casual stroll
reviews: We walked to this area for our hotel (the pinnacle).  Several shops and lots of restaurants.  However, most restaurants do not open until at least noon.  As the day progressed, lots of stores and restaurants opened (just a little lag time in the process).  We had lunch at Local.  Great food and drinks...nice environment!  All in all,  not bad to spend a couple of hours.

title: Nice restaurants but touristy
reviews: Gastown is cute but it‚Äôs very touristy.  There‚Äôs lots of places to eat but it gets very crowded with the Hop on buses coming through and any cruise tours.  Outdoor restaurants have to be careful of homeless urinating nearby (we had to move our seats because of the smell!). The steam clock is fun.  We were there in the day so night may be different.

title: Great shopping and food
reviews: This is the area where Vancouver city started in 1800‚Äôs. A chap called Gassy Jack (nicknamed because he talked a lot) started a saloon there with a barrel of whiskey. You will see a monument to Gassy here. Gassy built his saloon and gave the locals that helped him free whiskey. Today the area has trendy eateries, interesting shops and is an easy walk from city Waterfront. The area is said to have the only stream driven vintage clock in the world. Worth spending a couple of hours and a relaxing lunch here.

title: Charming neighborhood
reviews: Historical area of Vancouver with famous steam clock. An area with local designer shops and trendy restaurants and pubs. It‚Äôs distinguished by its red brick sidewalks and vintage light posts. Nice for a stroll.

title: Saw the Steam Clock
reviews: We literally tripped across this district by getting lost and going beyond the cruise terminal. It looks slightly run down but think Bohemian and you will get it. A mix of small specialist shops as well as the usual tourist traps. We watched the Steam Clock peep its way through an on the hour experience - one of few steam clocks still in existence, then ate at the Black Frog, adjacent to rail yards. Good tasty food.Only thing against Gastown was number of beggars, homeless, Vancouver seems to have a lot of this anyway.

title: Great Shops and Restaurants
reviews: Gas Town is within walking distance from the cruise terminal Filled with lots of trendy shops and lots of restaurants a great place to visit while in Vancouver

title: Don't miss the TOURGUYS
reviews: wonderful 2 hours tour, lot of informations . While waking  I learned about history, culture and night life in Gastown.

title: Interesting place to Visit
reviews: We visited Gastown using the hop-on and off tour bus.  We then walked to the Vancouver Lookout and caught the bus again when we got to Canada Place.  The steam clock was fascinating and we even had our photo taken with the statue of Gassy Jack, the history of the area was fascinating.

title: Trgdm
reviews: Easy walk from the Delta Hotel where we were staying.  Enjoyed our stroll, looking in shops and checking out menus.  Good variety of restaurants and prices.  Given our schedule we grabbed a slice of pizza at MegaPizza.  Hot and good NY style pizza.

title: History
reviews: This is a continuation of downtown Vancouver, it‚Äôs very nice to walk around and see if you are in the area. Definitely stop at the steam clock for a photo opportunity!

title: Nice area to visit
reviews: We were able to walk to Gastown from the Fairmount Pacific Rim. Really nice area with nice shops and restaurants. We loved the steam clock !

title: Lovely Place
reviews: Visited Gastown after our cruise from Alaska.  We fell in love with this area of Vancouver with its array of souvenir stores, cafes and restaurants located right near the wharf.  There is a grand old Steam  clock in the main street that lets out steam every quarter of an hour.  Its worth waiting around for

title: Part of tour
reviews: This was a really fascinating area to visit and the gas clock was icing on cake.  It activates on the half hour and it's a must to video and bring back as something to show your friends.  I will not spoil the little surprise.

title: Great atmosphere
reviews: Awesome place to wander and spend a few hoursGreat old style ( over 100 year old)Buildings lots of tourists shops Fantastic eateriesNot forgetting THE clock

title: A fun walking tour.
reviews: The area is small enough to walk through, even for those with mobility challenges. The area offers history, attractive period architecture, shops of all types, a variety of dining options, both as to price and cuisine. Spend a morning walking, stay for lunch or do an afternoon tour and enjoy dinner there.

title: interesting
reviews: very interesting and different part of Vancouver. It seems quite old and unique. there are some people begging but they dont hassle you. It has a very lively vibe.

title: Good and bad
reviews: Called to a restaurant in Gastown. Walked passed the fasinating steam clock. Was browsing the shops and was accosted by a vagrant, of which there are many. Rather spoils the atmosphere. Many nice eateries.

title: HISTORIC GASTOWN WITH CHARMING CLOCK
reviews: A visit to Gastown is a must with a special treat to see the old steam clock celebrate on the hour.  Tourists will gather to see the performance by this antique clock which is very exciting,

title: Interesting, but dirty
reviews: It's a dilemma when your tourist area overlaps with your "vulnerable population." Not many of the homeless were actively panhandling, but we had to watch our step for human feces on the sidewalk and saw three instances of criminal activity within a many hours: a bashed in back window of a parked car, a guy recovering from pepper spray, and the theft of a bike from a guy sleeping on the sidewalk. Lots of interesting shops and great restaurants, but stay aware of your surroundings.

title: Gastown
reviews: Gastown is great to walk around with many different great restaurants and things to see.  The only problem is that in certain areas there very strong smells of urine.  Many homeless people do live there.

title: Great night out trying happy hours
reviews: We spent an early evening taking in the sights at gastown starting with the clock and then taking advantage of happy hours at a few places for snacks and drinks.  We did a walk around taking note of happy hour times and then went back to a few places we liked the look of.  Loved the vibe and there were heaps of places to choose from.  Would have gone back again if we were staying longer.  Highly recommend this area for a night out.

title: Must see
reviews: Nice area.  Lots of shops and restaurants.  Not a lot of parking from what I could see.  Must see tourist area.

title: Quaint
reviews: Nice area of vancouver with good shops, cafes, restaurants and bars. The steam clock chimes every 15 minutes and always attracts a crowd.

title: Cute, worth a peak
reviews: Super close to the downtown waterfront about a block or 2 from train station and cruise terminal. The area is historic with some original old buildings, shopping and some nice restaurants and bars. Check out the steam clock on the corner and a hot dog from the venders

title: A Must See
reviews: The historic part of old Vancouver quite well preserved in the form of expensive shops and a wide variety of restaurants and bars. Caters to locals and tourists for eats and drinks but the shops and galleries are really aimed at the cruise ship crowd with limited time and less limited credit cards. More and more beggars in the street but they‚Äôre not bothersome. Well worth a stroll through.

title: Nice but
reviews: Nice old buildings, plenty of eating and coffee places. Shops weren't to my taste. A number of beggars /down and outs spoilt it a bit

title: Bustling historical area
reviews: If you are visiting Vancouver then this area is a must see. Find "Gassy Jack" then walk along Water Street to the "Steam Clock" to get the best experience. There are many places to get food and drink, lots of shops and the oldest buildings in Vancouver surrounding you. Really interesting...

title: Great selection of pubs and restaurants but pricey
reviews: A great area to visit whilst in Vancouver much quieter than downtown area and has great craft beer pubs and good cross selection of restaurants. However the prices here are considerable higher in many of the pubs than in downtown.

title: Lovely area
reviews: A really nice part of the downtown area with plenty restaurants and nearby local attractions.The steam clock is in the heart of gastown and the architecture is old and traditional - quite a contrast to other parts of Vancouver

title: Fun little area
reviews: Fun little area in Vancouver, right near the waterfront. Historic gas town features the steam clock also gassy Jack who founded gastown back in the day. Also features a great food scene and shops

title: Vancouver WOW!
reviews: Gastown has all the restaurants one needs after a day or two of walking this marvelous city. Capitlano Park, Stanley Park, Granville Market, Grouse Mountain, the BC Anthropology Museum - we love them all - repeatedly.

title: Walked through Gastown
reviews: Went through Gastown on the basis of YouTube, things to see in Vancouver etc, however saw lots of homeless people, people with mental health issues and straight out druggies/thieves. At no time did I feel safe here. Took a photo of the clock and got the f*ck outta dodge. When travelling here make sure of your personal space and stay in places with lots of people and support. Not sure of the reported crime rate here but according to the Vancouver PD reports, you are probably more likely to be a victim in downtown Vancouver than Whistler. Didn‚Äôt see any cops here but did see about 20 cops on bicycles heading for Stanley Park in riot gear funnily enough I felt pretty safe over there????.

title: Nice for a walk
reviews: Nice for a walk. Many shops and restaurants. Quite touristic. Just explore it and crush now and than into bar or restaurant for a bite and a drink

title: Interesting area
reviews: This is such a unique place to visit.  You can walk around for hours and see so much history of the area.  There are lots of shops and great restaurants.

title: Great Vibe
reviews: Lots of cool little shops and places to eat. A great feel and some history too. Saw Gassy Jack and the Steam Clock. :)

title: Great cultural street
reviews: Great cultural street to experience Vancouver day or night and walk far enough to see the clock. A lot of shops and places to grab food.

title: Great location to visit
reviews: Good place to walk around.  Rifght on waterfront and close to skytrain station.  Quite busy with tourists so lots of touris shops, cafes etc.   still worth the visit.   Gas clock on the street is well worth looking at

title: An interesting historical area
reviews: Definitely worth a wander around this historical part of the city. The gas clock is really interesting.

title: A nice walk
reviews: We arrived via the hop on hop off bus and walked through the center of Gastown , having seen the steam clock and statue of the founder. There were lots of retail stores and souvenir shops and a minimum of architectural splendor.

title: Not a huge amount to it.
reviews: The title says it all. It certainly won‚Äôt blow your mind. The only thing is we visited in the daytime & it may be more fun at night.

title: Nice place to visit.
reviews: I had a very pleasant time wandering the streets. Touristy but offered plenty of different food options I didn‚Äôt find a lot that I wanted to buy there, however I did enjoy watching the steam clock.

title: homeless problem
reviews: Named after a Yorkshire captain and resident, "Gassy" Jack Deighton this is a gentrified neighborhood of old buildings, boutiques, coffee shops, ethnic eateries and gastropubs.  Not that different from hundreds of places across Europe/Americas... what makes it different is the legion of homeless lining the streets, screaming, mumbling, lying in torpor on doorsteps, waiting in long lines at soup kitchens. The local hipsters do not seem to think twice about them as they step over the bodies and evade the inebriated/stoned. The homeless in Gastown appear to comprise all races, genders and ages but the city seems to have given up and leaves them to fend for themselves. I've heard a lot of screaming but no violence which I guess is good but overall this is much worse than Santa Monica or Tenderloin... which says a lot. For me, seeing the suffering on the streets together with the apparent absence of an organized city-wide response seemed pretty dispiriting. No amount of good food and entertainment can compensate for it.

title: Cobbled streets and cool bars
reviews: Worth a look, less commercial than downtown and a cool vibe. Got to see the statue and bars on the corner of water. But also make sure you go to main street if you are like me and like your craft beer. Very cool.

title: Good attraction.
reviews: You will wonder through streets of Gastown with MANY other tourists, wondering what is this all about. It has a character and it is changing constantly. Just walk about, have a snack, coffee or a drink and soak it in.

title: History mixed with modern all in a tight geography
reviews: Where can you see a steam clock at the same time as being in a high tech office space or a nich garment shop and take in some interesting and satisfying eateries ? Of course it‚Äôs is Vancouvers Gastown area just off of the waterfront .The traditional stone roadways bring your mind back to the days of the tram cars that served the old town . While in the area make sure you visit the various garment shops like ‚Äúone of a few‚Äù that will delight you in its selection of designer dresses , pants , shoes and accessories . Tired after taking in all the history , shopping and people watching , then take a break by visiting one of many eateries in the area . Any choice you make will be memorable and restore your strength before finishing your visit .

title: A taste of Europe in North America
reviews: Surrounded by skyscrapers, this section of ‚ÄúOld Vamcouver‚Äù is a must visit.  All sort of bars and restaurant plus the charming of the old buildings.  Of course, Gassy Jack Statue at a main intersection of the area.

title: Its just a clock
reviews: Good place to take a pic because of the history but thats It :) i was thinking It was in a middle of a park or something but I Guess you have to go there while you are near by

title: The Neighbourhood Where Vancouver Began
reviews: Tourists - please take the time to look beyond the dozens of t-shirt shops and look at the architecture behind those big windows full of schlock. Many of these buildings, particularly those in the eastern part near Maple Tree Square, were built in the 19th century, and have been faithfully preserved. Many Gastown sights have their own TripAdvisor reviews: Hotel Europe, Maple Tree Square, and Gassy Jack Statue to name a few. I enjoy the history displayed here, and hope you will too.

title: Interesting neighborhood- great steam clock
reviews: We spent a rainy afternoon poking around in Gastown.  The steam clock is fun and interesting.  We found several places to get good snacks and hot chocolate on a cold wet day.

title: Nice place but bad neighberhood
reviews: We are currently on a trip through the West of Canada. We started the trip in Vancouver. We visited the City about 10 years ago already. We already knew the neighborhood of the historic Gastown is bad. We hoped this has been improved since then but we just found out it got even worse. In case you plan to walk from Gastown to China Town you will go through a dangerous area with Junkies and strange people looking for rests of cigarettes, asking for money to buy drogs, shouting around, checking you out...If you are young and healthy: Watch your back. If you are a bit older or anxious: Call for a Taxi. Gastown is nice but keep on the main street and don‚Äòt go to some of the smaller streets in the neighborhood. I don‚Äòt understand why the City of Vancouver still concentrates all these problems in a small spot. Other cities around the world have tried this and failed. I expected the Chinese would take care of this situation and keep China Town clean. But it is actually the other way around. Also China Town is going down. The Drugs and the dirt are taking over command. China Town in Vancouver is not a nice place anymore.

title: Gassy Jack Lives!
reviews: Gastown is an older part of Vancouver that has that lived-in feeling for sure.  Older buildings with character and that Steamclock is totally worth waiting for!  There are some really cool art galleries with excellent Native art and jewelry that I buy for myself and as gifts for friends.  The souvenir shops down here are good, too, because normally it's just keychains and bobbles-- the big shop here (forget the name) has tons of stuff and decent quality.  My FAVORITE thing about Gastown is LIQUID AMBER, which is my tattoo shop!  The artists there are amazing and I've had two tattoos by Nicki Lochmatter that are totally killer!  There are plenty of really great restaurants, too, from cafe's to full-on dinner.  It's a great place to walk around and check out some interesting spots you won't see in modern parts of Van.  :)

title: Vancouver delight!
reviews: Gastown has a history, a charming & quality shopping layout, popular eateries. It‚Äôs a must visit. I loved the clock after which this area is named.

title: Like any old restoration there is room for improvement
reviews: No doubt Gastown is a must visit. it is the old part of Vancouver going back to the day Skids were on the muddy streets wherein Skid Row was founded. The older of Vancouver buildings restored and modernized inside with Yuppie offices, clubs, lofts, and tourist gift options. The massive Cruise Trade docks just next door and spill out of visitors establishes Gastown as a walkabout location to pick up both cheap and expensive gift items. It also allows for some local eateries to satisfy the cravings and has some built in attractions such as the Vancouver Steam Clock. All a good use of time. The home of Gassy Jack who built a local bar and hotel as well as the city's first jail. Unfortunately it sits all on the edge of our street society with their drugs and needles et al. You shouldn't run into any but it can happen when they spill over into the new Gentry of Gastown. If you have the time it is a short walk to old China Town as well. All worth a look. The bedrock of the city. Gastown is still in need of more action to make it an economic success 12 months a year. They are trying.

title: Interesting shops, galleries & restaurants
reviews: Great place to window shop, buy souvenirs, shop interesting clothing stores, as well as get drinks & food.  Being the beginning spot for settling Vancouver, the story of Gassy Jack etc.  makes it a spot to see.  There‚Äôs an Inuit art gallery which has beautiful contemporary art for sale.  On the down side: it‚Äôs smelly & dirty in places, and there are vandals and thieves in the area apparently given the warnings.  We had no problems.

title: Disappointment
reviews: Clearly a divide in this community which is a shame, there is a large population of homeless many of which are clearly on drugs. It did stop us going to parts of the gas town. However there are some lovely restaurants in the safer parts. I have to say I wouldn't come back to gas town due to the homeless issue

title: Interesting
reviews: Had a fun afternoon exploring Gastown and the many interesting shops and restaurants. Well worth the time!

title: Interesting shops & architecture
reviews: A nice walking area that offers a lot of souvenir shops, art galleries and ‚Äúfood experiences‚Äù. I visited with a student architect who was captivated by the many graceful and charming old buildings. We spent a very pleasant afternoon walking the area and then had difficultly choosing where to have dinner as there were many restaurants with very interesting offerings.

title: Steam Clock
reviews: you have to visit Gastown. It's a really ancient and stylish place. A lot of shops and restaurants and also the most important thing: the steam clock! One negative aspect are some beggars around the area.

title: Took the wrong road!
reviews: Headed for Gastown from the Vancouver lookout tower. (Which was great). We took one wrong road and ended up in the ‚Äòreal‚Äô part, probably the bit that no one wants tourists to see. Very very rundown, lots of homeless and I mean loads, drug smells lingering everywhere and lots for sale. Sad we missed the clock, but felt it was appropriate to leave before we all got high.

title: A must see
reviews: Enjoy a stroll along water Street with the steam clock and cobble stone road and tons of souvenir places. Beautiful at night with lighting

title: Not Too Special
reviews: My family walked all around Gastown and we didn't think it was all that special. There are lots of souvenir shops, some small restaurants, etc. Nothing too special. We stopped to the Steam Clock, but there was a city crew of 3 trying to fix it, so no photo-op.

title: Fun area great restaurants
reviews: Our hotel was near by and so we walked about and ate at The Old Spaghetti Factory and also saw the first steam clock. Lots of great finds and adventures. Be careful of the souvenir shops. Much cheaper to purchase at the airport than in this area

title: Do not walk east or south of gastown
reviews: The area immediately surrounding historic Gastown is a nightmare stay away do not venture into the small streets or Hastings Street. So many drug addicts filth and dispair.  Just don't go.

title: Smoke town on Saturday night.
reviews: The street is permeated by the disgusting smell of people smoking pot almost everywhere. Fine if thats your thing but was not ours and ruined a evening stroll, so we took a walk and our business to fresher places closer to the ocean breezes.

title: Was expecting I alittle more!
reviews: Lovely old buildings that are home to shops, cafes and bars.Was expecting to see more.Can easily walk round in a couple of hours.The steam clock was very unique.

title: LOVELY
reviews: After attending a conference downtown Vancouver we went for a stroll into Gastown. There is a great selection of pub/bistro restaurants and shops. I had to also stop by the Jade shop to pick up another piece of Canadian jade jewelry. The funky shop down the street is amazing as well

title: Love Gastown
reviews: Great place to get a bite to eat and some shopping. A definite place to visit. Lots to do. Very safe and clean.

title: So nothing much to see here...
reviews: The clock was nice and we saw the gas man.  The vibe in the area is hip but busy.  Everyone is rushing around, just living their lives.  It didn‚Äôt feel like a tourist destination.  It felt like it was walking through a few streets in midtown Manhattan - some side streets honestly, nothing special.  The one cool thing we noticed was they left a gap between buildings for the mountains to peek through, which made it feel more airy and open than a usual city area.  There were also plenty of little restaurants and souvenir shops.  Parking was easy.

title: Interesting area to visit
reviews: Diverse range of shops and eateries. Tourist destination due to history of area. Loved the steam clock which whistles every 15 minutes plus distinctive crescendo on the hour. The authentic gas lights are lovely to see. Nice vibe in the area with some lovely places to stop and have refreshments.

title: BEAUTIFUL OLD VANCOUVER
reviews: All I needed to be sold on visiting this part of town was that it‚Äôs the old part of town and the clock. Also, we saw some art galleries, and beautiful jade. Do visit this area when in Vancouver.

title: Who Knew?
reviews: Visiting Vancouver with friends for a week. I'd actually heard of Gastown before but, because of its name, assumed (falsely) that it was an industrial area. Ut-oh! Great area for eating, shopping, and even Geocaching!

title: Delicious Eat & So Cute at Night!
reviews: We spent nearly every evening in Gastown! The food options are plentiful and the overall environment is just magical at night. We ate dinner and viewed the city from the Observation deck nearby.

title: interesting area
reviews: Nice to walk round but mostly tourist shops and caf√©s now - the big attraction is the steam clock - it makes noise every quarter hour but the hourly show is the big attraction and makes a bit of noise.

title: Quaint area
reviews: We walked around here one afternoon to check out the clock.  I was a cute area with shops, restaurants, and coffee shops.  There wer a lot of souvenier shops in the area too.

title: Overrated
reviews: Gastown is rightfully a source of pride in Vancouver. It was rescued from the wrecking ball by conscientious citizens, but sadly it needs another dose of that kind of civic pride.Gastown is about a 4 square block area of buildings from the late 1900s. There are many  charming structures among them. Unfortunately, we had the sense that this area is on the decline. It was the most run down part of Vancouver by far during our visit, with lots of graffiti, trash blowing around, and just general wear along the streets. There were many empty storefronts and lots of souvenir shops selling pretty much the same merchandise. It was kind of a disappointment even though we generally like to visit historic old towns.Having said all of that, the steam clock is kind of cool. There are also a larger number of interesting independent stores toward the east end of the neighborhood (find the steam clock and just enjoy the next three blocks or so as you walk eastward.Be sure to stop in the Eames furniture store, which is almost like a museum of modern furniture and has lots of cool stuff even if you can't afford it or can't quite imagine seeing it in your home.

title: Cute area of Vancouver
reviews: Gaston was a nice little walk from our hotel in Yaletown. Lots of neat shops and good restaurants. The waterfront is very pretty. Good way to spend 3-4 hours.

title: Worth a Short Visit
reviews: We strolled through Gastown on a Monday morning in mid-March so it certainly wasn't as vibrant and lively at this time of day/year as I imagine it would be at other times. There certainly are some unique one-off stores/restaurants/coffee shops worth visiting. There are also a fair number of same-'ol tourist stores. If you have a number of days to spend in Vancouver it would be worth a visit, for sure but if you're tight for time I would not make it a priority. And be aware where you're walking as the edge of Gastown skirts the downtown east side, so you certainly see a element of that part of the population spill over.

title: Gastown Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is worth a visit. It is a lively trendy part of Vancouver. There are many restaurants and shops to see. Not too far from The Classical Chinese Gardens  And very near China town. The best thing to see in Gastown is the Old Steam  Clock. It is definitely worth seeing.

title: A great part of Historic Vancouver
reviews: This is a great place to experience some of the history and cultural experiences of Vancouver. Lost of nice dining and artistic stores. However, the homeless population is quite large and very evident.

title: First time
reviews: When I was in Vancouver my dad told me about the clock and then I went with him,I took some pictures

title: Great Stop while in Vancouver!
reviews: Gastown was a bit of a hike from our hostel, but it was definitely worth it!  This district had, by far, the best shops that we encountered.  There were not only souvenir shops but also boutique's as well (yes we are tourists and wanted souvenirs- this was a great place for that).  In addition, the bars/breweries that we stopped in were great!  The architecture in this area was just jaw-dropping as well.  And at night when it started to get dark you noticed Christmas lights in the trees, which was a beautiful touch.  Last but not least, make a stop at the steam clock - pretty neat to see!

title: Lovely part of the city
reviews: Great area to explore on foot. Old fashioned lanterns, lots of shops, cafes.The steam clock, the statue of Gassy Jack. From here a short walk to Chinatown.

title: Gastown
reviews: Gastown is a great place to visit. Besides the famous steam clock, the shops nearby are great place to look for souvenirs.

title: Best cafes around.
reviews: We've regularly visited gastown as it has the best cafes, coffee and food in Vancouver. Be sure to go check out the famous steam clock... Nemisis cafe has the best coffee and a really cool atmosphere, though can get very busy; Momo sushi is delicious, so cheap with great service; Meat & Bread is ridiculously delicious, we had the porchetta version with pork crackling; and Purebread is in a really funky building here, with their usual delcious baked goods, try get a seat by the window and do some seriously good "people-watching".

title: Steam clock and cafes
reviews: Cool neighborhood with plenty of cafes. Main attraction is a steam clock (3 in the world).Good starting point going to Stanley Park by foot

title: A must see in Vancouver
reviews: Take your picture with the old steam clock and your Gassy Jack's original neighborhood of the blue collar, working class original residents. Bars, shopping, night time entertainment now mixed with boutiques, coffee shops, a theater mall, and quaint stores of local items. If you like microbrewery restaurants try Local at the end of Gastown area, best burgers, amazing veggie burgers too (handmade), great sangria and local beer. Of course there are so many great casual and fine dining restaurants, like Pourhouse, Flying Pig (they have a great happy hour). Easy walking on sidewalks in an area with cars driving over cobblestone streets. Right next to industrial transport, port, helijet, and so Vancouver!

title: Meh
reviews: I‚Äôve been to gas town a few times. It‚Äôs an older neighbourhood, that needs some cleaning up. There are a few nice places to eat and a few shops. The steam clock is neat but I wouldn‚Äôt come just for that. The biggest issue in this area is the large homeless population. For the most part they are homeless but I have seen them make a scene a few times making it feel a bit sketchy. Come during the day or with a group if it‚Äôs in the evening.

title: Part of history
reviews: The place is nice to walk around My son really enjoy the clock blowing steam and whistling This place has a lot of history and is a close walk from downtown

title: I am in Love!
reviews: I am in love with this area - its so magical! Beautiful buildings, mountains and water can be seen, great restaurants, shops, cafes! What a great vibe - I cannot wait to be back!

title: Shopping and eating
reviews: We often pop into Gastown for a little shoe shopping at Fluevog. Then a bite to eat. The street is a pleasant place for a relaxed stroll. There are several pubs and trendy restaurants to visit. The sky train is close, as is Canada place so it‚Äôs an easy place to get to. If your from out of town this would be a convenient place to find souvenirs.

title: Bright and sunny in Gastown
reviews: Never have enough of this energetic and friendly historic area. The whistling Steam Clock and the victorian buildings are a delight to the eyes.We had lunch at the Flying Pig on Water Street. We have been there quite a restaurant few times because we love the ambiance, the food and the service.

title: Looking at Vancouver's Past
reviews: An old steam driven clock is Gas Town's Star of the show.  It's basically one street of carefully preserved original downtown Vancouver buildings. You can walk here from the cruise ship and train terminals so it's popular with tourists. You will find a lot of restaurants, coffee shops and a mix of retail on the street combined with the expected souvenir shops and stores selling Canadiana. The whole of downtown at Granville and Georgia is walking distance from here

title: Steam Clock
reviews: One of the main attraction is the Steam Clock, the idea behind, still working and people all around the world coming to take a selfie. Amazing, truly amazing, I watched people taking selfie's with the clock and not even care reading the explanation and how it works?Also, with shops and interesting really cool art works in those souvenir stores are great place to spend your afternoon. Lovely place, visit some stores with local owner, some young hip people, they also educate you and give you some feeling to be local. Avoid those souvenir stores which their sole purpose is to make money and no idea about surroundings. Some store owners were watching people like all of them are criminals.

title: Friendly
reviews: A walk in there is suggested, many souvenir shop and restaurant, nice buildings, good parking spaces, so i would recomend it

title: iconic Vancouver attraction
reviews: take a walk back in time , lots of history, lots of places to grab something to eat or drink,something for everyone

title: The city of Vancouver started as the Town of Granville. Gastown was named after "Gassy" Jack Dayton
reviews: The original town of Granville burnt to the ground in a matter of hours. When it was rebuilt, mostly stone and brick was used instead of wood. The town was renamed Vancouver after Captain George Vancouver. A historic area of Vancouver, Gastown is now home to eateries, shopping and the arts. Many of the older buildings have been renovated into modern offices, residential lofts and artists studios among other uses. This is a must visit area of Vancouver. Photos courtesy of ProPics Canada

title: Steam watch
reviews: Very close to the Sea Bus station. Maybe just five minutes slow walk. Other than the steam watch we did not find any other interesting sight seeing.

title: Great for foodies
reviews: Look on trip advisor for restaurant recommendations.  I did and was glad I did.  Easy afternoon to browse and enjoy this quaint area.

title: So cute barrio
reviews: If you are visiting vancouver, you must to go, its the oldest barrio in the city, nice shops for souvenirs, the mechanical clock its stunning and the atmosphere looks different to the rest of the city

title: Great Restaurants and Shops
reviews: Loved this neighborhood with its history and sights! Awesome restaurants and nice local shoos to pick up touristy goodies as well. My hotel was in Downtown and it was a 10 minute walk to Gastown so super easy to get to!

title: Compact area with good food and shopping
reviews: Many positives... The original John Fluevog store is here with a very good selection of sale shoes. Many restaurants along the water and within a few blocks inland. A reasonable longer walk to the Rogers for a Canucks game. I didn't use it but the large train station is right here. Just 20 minutes from the airport by cab.  I'd stay here again.

title: Walk through Gastown
reviews: It doesn‚Äôt sound attractive but the old building facades will change your mind in a minute. Easy walk from City Centre train station. Tons of restaurants, breweries, etc.

title: Interesting area, kind of touristy and plenty of homeless street people
reviews: Gastown was a major renovation project 40 years ago when the city was considering knocking it all down for a new freeway expansion. Instead they put a lot of money into revitalizing the area, rebuilding infrastructure as well as getting new business to open here. There are some cool things like the Steam Clock and nice shops and restaurants but at the east side the smell of urine from folks who live on the street is pretty strong. I notice where I parked, just 50 meters from the Gassy Jack statue someone had had their car window smashed out so I guess crime is on the up. I would not walk here after dark for sure. By the way Trip Advisor has the location pin wrong on the map. The area starts at 1 Water Street and goes west from there.

title: Ho hum
reviews: Apart from the steam clock this place had little to offer to be honest. If you are a hipster and want to hang out in a trendy neighbourhood give it a go. Perhaps at night it gets it vibe on.

title: pretty little town
reviews: when walking down Water Street, one side of the street is historical while the other is "skid row". on that side, there are homeless people, trash, graffiti, and all around yuck. several people warned us not to be there during the nighttime. literally across the street are beautiful buildings restored to their look when the city of Gastown was founded. the steam clock is cool.

title: Gastown @Vancouver, BC... Historical
reviews: We set aside a half day to leisurely meander in this neighborhood.Known as a starter village, in the vast region known today as Vancouver, today one finds historical buildings, trendy eateries, cheesy souvenir shops as well as some nice shops.An easy walk from the Convention center train station.

title: Worth a look around
reviews: There‚Äôs a paid parking lot in the middle of this strip which makes it convenient to spend some time looking around. You‚Äôll find a variety of eateries and bars here (tried my first Poutine) along with boutiques, souvenir stores and art/craft galleries.There‚Äôs an old clock run by gas on one of the street corners which chimes on the hour and half hour.The area is characterised by old black lamp posts with white lights which gives it an historic feel.

title: old OLD Vancouver
