reviews: Tourists abound in this area, as it is easy walking distance from the Cruise Ship Centre and the Convention Centre. While there are admittedly many cheap souvenir shops, if have the patience, you will find some great indigenous art, and other legitimate keepsakes not made in China. Consider, too this is the area where Vancouver began - there is some great history here, as you will see if you read the many plaques scattered throughout.

title: Historical and Touristic
reviews: Gastown is the place to visit if you happen to be in Vancouver. It is close to the Pan Pacific Hotel and Canada Place on the shore, and with lots of shops selling souvenirs and restaurants offering a variety of cuisine. The historic steam whistling clock that still works, attracting crowds to see and to take pictures with. There is a statue of  "Gassy" Jack Deighton, a steamboat captain who opened the first saloon in 1867.

title: Very touristy
reviews: Apart from the steam clock that is an engineering marvel, the rest of the area is extremely touristy.

title: Perfect area to see Old Vancouver
reviews: Wandering around Gastown gives you a brilliant sense of what Vancouver used to look like. The steam clock is a must see. Highly recommend a visit.

title: Buzzing!
reviews: Was the verg briefly but it was a very vibrant, lively part of town. Loads of bars, restaurants and places to hang out.

title: Recommend
reviews: Nice area to spend a few hours walking around and shopping. There are a nice variety of restaurants and shops.

title: Great Historical Area of Vancouver
reviews: We walked from the downtown area. When you walk into Gastown there is a whole different vibe. It's older brick buildings are beautiful and well maintained. Steam Clock located in the heart was a great point of interest. At 4:15 it blew a short whistle. You can see some of the inner workings of the clock.

title: Cool Neighbourhood of Vancouver
reviews: Our hotel was on the edge of this neighbourhood (the excellent Victorian), and so this was our goto for eating out & coffee. Quaint cobbled streets and pretty streetlights and fairy lights. Interesting history & worth a look at the steamclock (try to see it on the hour). Didn‚Äôt have a bad meal there and all competitively priced but our favourite was probably Nuba. Gastown reminded us a lot of NYC‚Äôs Greenwich Village. Only negative is that there are a lot of homeless and beggars in the area, particularly at night which is very sad to see. We weren‚Äôt hassled and never felt threatened though.

title: Beautiful streets to walk, it is a must if you're visiting Vancouver and also recommended to buy some souvenirs.
reviews: Beautiful streets to walk, it is a must  if you're visiting Vancouver and also recommended to buy some souvenirs and have a coffee

title: Dirty and full of drug addicts.
reviews: Gastown is quite small and looks lovely if the weather is good. Unfortunately there is a lot of homeless people there and drug addicts who destroy this nice view. Good for walk if you are in Vancouver and there are relatively good restaurants there.

title: Lovely quaint area of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is great to wander around browsing the shops and sightseeing. Make sure you find the steam clock on your travels as this is very unique.

title: To look and see what was there. It was the first time to look in stores, etc
reviews: Was not impressed with the atmosphere of the neighbourhood and Would not be interested in going again.

title: Tourist prices tourist items
reviews: Very unique and cute little area.  Full of tourist shops.  If you want Canada or Vancouver T Shirts etc this is the place to go

title: Overrated
reviews: Gastown seems overrated. The steam clock is interesting enough to but the shops selling souvenirs all have the same goods and are over pricef. Too much is made in China which defeats the idea of taking something back home from Canada.not overly impressed. Found Main street more interesting.

title: With a visit
reviews: A would recommend checking this part of town out.  Especially to have some fun (bar or restaurant).  It has a Shoreditch, Lower East Side vibe.  Once was probably a very down trodden part of town but is now ‚Äúup and coming‚Äù with a great vibe.  The gas clock also worth a look.  Amazing bit of engineering.

title: Amazing and beautiful area!
reviews: We were told that we had to visit this area.  It was amazing!  There are a lot of shops, restaurants, and bars/pubs.  The buildings in the area a beautiful and the people were very friendly.  There were a couple of spots where their were some folks that you would want to steer clear, but for the most part pretty good.

title: Great place
reviews: Quirky and interesting part of Vancouver city centre with some cool shops and plenty of places to eat and drink.

title: Awesome food and gift shops
reviews: This has awesome food options and cheap gifts.Way less than grandville island for the sameMerchandise. Shop around prices vary but great options. Awesome food options as well to pick from

title: Tourist heaven
reviews: Had to come down for the memories, but it is all about the souvenirs. And watching the steam clock chime on the 15s. The neighborhood isn't any more interesting than that. Some of the restaurants are really good, if you want to people watch.

title: Historic District
reviews: One of the most historic districts of the city, this is pretty much where the original city was.  Lots of old buildings in good condition.  It can be a little sketchy, but it's always safe.  Lots of eating and drinking.

title: Tourist trap
reviews: Was very disappointed. It‚Äôs a street of old buildings next to a railway yard with faux olde world lampposts and endless tourist souvenir shops.  Go to Stanley park instead.

title: Quaint
reviews: This downtown area is quaint, historic, and full of great souvenir shops perfect for the traveler who wants to come home with mementos of a great trip.

title: Where it all happens
reviews: This street is a definite must to visit. Plenty of bars, cafes and bespoke shops. Something for everyone. Go see the steam clock a real attraction on the street and enjoy food drink and good company.

title: Gassy Jack at his Finest
reviews: The history of Gastown intertwines with my great grandfather, Jack Dearing, who immigrated from England to Canada and lived a bit of a ‚Äòrascal‚Äô lifestyle. He lost one eye  and used it to his advantage, challenging the unsuspecting to wager against him on billards games, then he would clean house and collect the üí∞!Gastown is worth a visit if you haven‚Äôt been there. It‚Äôs got many touristy shops and prices to match. Traffic plows through unrelenting - wish the managers would make it foot traffic only, like towns in Europe. There is coffee (eg., Starbucks at the adjacent waterfront station, üòè), food, and views of the north shore (take the sea bus across to Lonsdale Quay just for the experience, and a cup-o-soup at the food court). But parking is difficult and dear, and if you drive there from Highway 1 the soberingly unpleasant journey through the down-and-out section of east Hastings serves as a reality check - none of us are far from a ruin, save for the turn of a friendly card. The highlight of this particular visit to Gastown was seeing and hearing Gassy Jack tooting and wheezing out the hours notification. Rainy cold evening, afforded us a view of Gassy Jack performing at his finest!

title: Very Boho
reviews: We strolled along , and admired the gastown clock and steaming away the steam, the world's first steam powered clock keeps whistling. This one is the highlight of Gastown, arty stores one we admired was a shoe shop, restaurant with funny names like the flying pig..etc one must walk along

title: Historic must seen in Vancouver
reviews: Nice for a walk, good variety of stores to buy souvernies, steam clock is the best. This is a public and free attraction.

title: Good but be careful!
reviews: Gastown is a really great piece of Vancouver history and it is easy to get to by downtown and the cruise ship terminal.  My only reservation, as a Vancouverite, is that it is so close to a really nasty part of Vancouver and I would advise people to basically just stay on Water Street until  the statue at the end, Gassy Jack, the founder.  Don't go wandering too much away from there, as there is a real drug and alcohol fueled no mans land close by.

title: Gastown is a must see for all tourists visiting Vancouver!!
reviews: My wife and I took about two hours to stroll thru the wonderful cobblestone streets, hip retail fashion stores, restaurants, coffee shops, artisan jewelers clothing & accessories stores and enjoyed picking up some chocolates from Rogers and souvenirs from a few shops in AWESOME Gastown!!We witnessed the Steam Clock doing its whistle & smoke show and enjoyed the festive decorations while sipping on a traditional Xmas warm drink. Lots of high end restaurants, bars & craft beer establishments too. Very nice way to spend a few hours.

title: THE old street of Vancouver
reviews: Don‚Äôt miss this special street! A bit touristy but nice souvenirs shops and shopping  and plenty restaurants to choose from. Just nice to walk down the street from Canada Place. Enjoy the steam clock as well!

title: Popular destination
reviews: Popular destination for both tourists and locals. Many nice restaurants. Walking distance to SkyTrain.

title: All touristy now...
reviews: Gastown used to be a local hangout but no longer is. Its nice to visit for tourists if only to get a superficial impression of Vancouver. Years ago there were a number of interesting restaurants and night clubs but now theres only a few restaurants on the periphery. Remeber, this is a local writing so if being a tourist dont worry. We need you to come and spend money to support our thousands of homeless. Make sure not tontake a wrong turn onto Hastings or you will turn right intonthe middle of it all. Hoping that in a few years this problem will be fixed once and for all. Big eyesore on our beautiful cityüòå

title: A very ‚ÄúOld Timey‚Äù vibe
reviews: One of the original areas of Vancouver, it is a heritage area with amazing pubs, restaurants and shops-full of atmosphere and cobblestone!

title: Boutique shopping heaven
reviews: Coffee shops and boutique shops aplenty.For an array of lesser known brands this is the place to be. Have a mooch, take photos of the steam clock, and spend some money.

title: Must see!
reviews: I live in Vancouver and every time we can, my husband and I enjoy walking in Gastown.Don‚Äôt miss the steam clock and quite often, you might see film shooting as many movies are made in Gastown.

title: Gastown
reviews: Me and boyfriend walked to Gastown from our resort maybe a 1/2 mile away. The weather was beautiful (sunny blue skies in van) and the streets were not to crowded. We had breakfast at catch 22, and then proceeded to see the historic gastown Steam clock. We then walked over to Chinatown and admired all the old time architecture. If you have time to walk/drive through this cute little town 10/10 recommend.

title: What a Gas!
reviews: Great place for shopping and lunch, see the sights of the old wolrd and of course the gas town clock-spectacular! Great for all ages.

title: lots of Vancouver history
reviews: Quite central area; two minute walk from Canada Place.  You can have a nice walk & see lots of renovated buildings which look like they're straight out of a 1950's movie.  Gastown was one of the earliest parts of Vancouver to be settled, then it became a bit of a red light district, then a sort of skid row, then the City Council (or whatever they're called) decided to tidy things up & suddenly Gastown became a quirky, interesting neighbourhood well worth a look.  Of course this is where you'll find the steam clock & police museum, which are both well worth your time.In answer to the TripAdvisor question about 'skipping the line'... this is a self-guided walking tour / stroll; no queue / line.

title: Beautiful @ night & day!
reviews: Great place just to walk around, shop, eat, drink, and learn a bit more from where Vancouver started!

title: Great neighbourhood
reviews: Such a great area to walk around.  Lots of great places to eat, good shops and souvenir stores.  Love the steam clock. Was a nice time to go, streets were lit up with Christmas lights.

title: Stroll, people watch, shop, eat
reviews: You can have some great people watching. Lots of restaurants, cafes, bars, etc. The boutiques are abundant.

title: Must See in Vancouver!
reviews: Awesome architecture in the buildings, hustle and bustle in the streets and something for everyone in the shops.  Lots of pubs and eateries!  A must see in Vancouver!

title: Quaint part of Vancouver
reviews: Always lovely to walk through gastown - with all the different restaurant options and interesting stores! Currently lights are up for Christmas time so looking lovely at night time for a stroll down and window shopping.

title: Stop by Gastown!
reviews: I highly recommended stopping by Gastown if you are in the Vancouver area. It‚Äôs got a lot of great shops and restaurants! I just love the vibe in that neighborhood. The architecture of the buildings and the cobblestone streets reminded me a little of Europe. Do yourself a favor and check out Gastown!

title: Beautiful Historic Buildings, Cute Shops, Unique Steam Clock, Good Photo Opportunities & Delicious Food!
reviews: Gastown is a popular area in Vancouver that is worth exploring. It is one of the oldest area of the city with the charming cobblestone streets lined with historic brick warehouses which have been renovated and restored and now house upscale restaurants, boutiques, trendy shops, and souvenir shops. The neighbourhood was close to downtown, making it accessible. It was a small area and was easy to explore on foot. I enjoyed walking the streets and browsing the shops during my visit in May 2017 along with photographing the beautiful architecture.Water Street was the main street through Gastown. It had some great photo opportunities and was picturesque. The Steam Clock is a popular attraction at the corner of Water and Cambrie Streets, which lets off steam from the top every 15 minutes or so and plays a short song. It was pretty crowded there but still a good place to take a photo and check it out. I felt safe wandering around in Gastown during the day but would advise against going here in the later evening or at night. It was very close to the Upper East Side, known for its high number of drug users, and they have been known to hang out in Gastown as well. There is a delicious vegan restaurant in the neighbourhood called Meet in Gastown, which had a great selection of amazing plant-based food. I would recommend checking out Gastown when in Vancouver.

title: What A Gas
reviews: We visited Gastown whilst in Vancouver, not once but several times. The buildings, the history, the people were all there to marvel at. The historic steam clock was a highlight and drew the attention of hundreds of onlookers when it "performed" on the hour.

title: Night views of Gastown
reviews: Gastown Evening Views. It was late in the evening. at around 17:00pmÔºÅThe sky was turning darkÔºÅIt's a charming walking street in the cityÔºÅ

title: Cute neighborhood
reviews: This neighborhood is a nice walk in Vancouver. Lots of restaurants, pubs and cafes. The architecture is very pretty too.

title: Unique food & shopping
reviews: Gas town offers a variety of food, drink & shopping experiences. Independent shops and small art gallery shops cater to higher-end shopping as well as a sprinkling of tourist shops.

title: A great place to eat and shop
reviews: This is one of the 'must see' neighbourhood while in Vancouver.  The old buildings and cobblestone streets remind me of small town Europe or Boston's Beacon Hill.There are many unique shops offering clothes, shoes, home decor, furniture etc.  It is nice to be able to shop in boutiques rather than large chain stores.  There are also artists who will occasionally set up shop on the street and you can purchase their art from them directly.  If you are hungry, you will find many eateries there to satisfy your cravings.This is a must see while in Vancouver.

title: Beautiful buildings, Unique Clock and Yummy food!
reviews: Vancouver is a cultured place with lots of different things to do and see, including, Gastown. Some of my family and I (group of 7) just felt like walking around and site seeing. We decided on Gastown, which I fully suggest! we had a great time! there are many stores to look at and go into, as well as many restaurants. there is also the famous Steam Clock that is a must see for sure. it is a short stop, as there are usually many people gathered around (although it is a nice place for a family picture). after seeing most of the sites (probably around 2h) it was supper time to we decided on "The Old Spaghetti Factory". It was packed, so I would suggest having supper before or after 6:30). However, we where unable to make reservations they only took "walk in's". although there many people waiting before us we where still seated sooner than expected. with an hour to eat, It took around 3 hours all together. This includes almost all walking so be sure to where walking shoes and bring a camera for all the interesting architecture and designing on the buildings and clock. Overall, fully suggest this as a tourist stop, especially if you want time to just enjoy the walk and surroundings.

title: Expensive
reviews: We visited Gastown to find a place to eat, as we were staying nearby.  The restaurants are kind of pricey, but they say Vancouver in general is expensive.

title: Great place to kill some time. See the steam clock!
reviews: Nice area to walk around and get souvenirs.  Lots of local items and most shops had decent variations of stuff, not same stuff at each one for the most part. Good selection of restaurants.  Make sure to stop and see the steam clock, that was cool.

title: Gastown
reviews: Must see in Vancouver. Visit the steam lock for sure. The best show is at the top of the hour or lesser show on the 15s.  Great variety of dining, nightlife and great souvenir shops.

title: Shops and restaurants
reviews: Don't miss the steam clock! Lots of shops and specialties to see. Also lots of food and juice options. Nice way to spend a couple of hours in downtown Vancouver.

title: Step Back into Vancouver's Past
reviews: After the Great Fire, Vancouver was rebuilt with bricks, rock and mortar in the late 1800's. The only place to view any of Vancouver's original buildings is around the Gastown area of the city. Start at the Historic CPR Train Terminal (now Waterfront Station) at the foot of Granville street. From there head East down Water Street to the Steam Clock (1 block) and other historic attractions including Gassy Jack Square and Blood Alley (3 blocks). You will also see the iconic Europe Hotel and many Heritage protected buildings with explanations of their historic past posted on plaques at their entrance doors.

title: Fun area
reviews: Interesting area of restaurants and shops.  It is near the cruise port.  A fun area to walk and soak up some ambiance of Vancouver.

title: Loved this area
reviews: We enjoyed Gastown several times on our recent trip for shopping and eating!!! Beautiful area with great character.

title: Magic nights!
reviews: Magic nights in Gastown in November. Walk down the main street and enjoy its beauty. Lights on the trees, fashion shops and cozy places to have a drink

title: Worth the time
reviews: Trendy shopping and restaurant district East of Canadian place (maybe a 5-7 minute walk).  Decent shopping choices and the famed steam clock was a centerpiece.  Worth checking out!

title: A Vancouver Must
reviews: Visit the tourist or little boutique shops. Of course the Steam Clock is a must.  There are plenty of places to dine or just enjoy a drink at the boutique breweries. You must also take advantage of happy hour and taste the many beers on offer.  Just be aware there are areas near to be wary of.

title: Interesting and historic place
reviews: This is a quirky, historic and pretty place to visit. There is lots of history here and great places to eat and shop.

title: Busy area, avoid walking toward Chinatown from here
reviews: We had a nice coffee and wander through Gastown. We made the mistake of heading to Sun Yat-Sen Gardens from the lower end of Gastown which took us through a dense population of street dwellers, on both sides of the road for a block. Slightly unnerving if you aren‚Äôt used to this. Suggest a bus if you want to do move from one area to the other.

title: Unusual
reviews: We were 1st time visitors to Vancouver had reviewed about gas town for and against just come absolutely fabulous main attraction the gas clock but all round was special tree lined shopping area called in small bar happy hour only 4 $ per drink but just come make it number 1 on your list to visit and take in the atmosphere carry on walking down to the right eventually you will get to China town and that's another place to visit.

title: Our favorite Vancouver neighborhood!
reviews: Full of history, old architecture & so many fun shops and restaurants- Gastown should be near the top of everyone‚Äôs list when coming to visit Vancouver. Whether in rain or in sunshine this is a great place to explore & take in patio life if you can!

title: Experiencing a bit of Gastown while on vacation.
reviews: My daughter, sister and I walked a bit thru Gastown while on vacation.  We didn't have time to go in many stores, but we enjoyed what we did see and do.  We recommend going there.

title: Nice walk
reviews: Nice area to stroll and see nice shops and visit restaurants. Vapor clock a must see. Try to be for the hour or at least for the quarters worth the wait. Not to nice if you go couple of blocks to the east, does not feel safe, otherwise no problem. Nice area.

title: Gastown - a must do
reviews: The ambience of Gastown will not disappoint. The history infused with hip restaurants, pubs and great shopping. A must do in Vancouver.

title: Pretty but don‚Äôt stray too far
reviews: We‚Äôve visited here regularly and there is a vast array of restaurants and bars to choose from as well as escape rooms. It is a very pretty part of town with cobble stone pathways and old style lanterns. However don‚Äôt stray too far as approx 2 blocks over you hit homeless central where drugs are actively being dealt and taken. I have never been so directly exposed to this. Was a big eye-opener!

title: Friends from UK had heard of Gastown... so we had to go... and loved it
reviews: Friends of our UK friends had recommended they see Gastown during a visit to BC. We had time to spend a couple of hours there, and it was a great visit. There is a wide variety of things to see. Some are a bit too touristy for me ‚Äî lots of knicknacks for sale. But there are historical aspects of interest. And there are many great options for food and drink.

title: Touristy but atmospheric
reviews: Worth a visit but full of tourists and although the restaurants were good there are better places around if you look a little further afield.

title: A Bohemian sort of place
reviews: This is a famous part of Vancouver, so we decided to visit. It was within walking distance from where we were staying. The Clock is probably the main icon in this area.

title: Great place to stroll and go to dinner
reviews: This area would mostly appeal to the tourists, but there are many fine restaurants and it‚Äôs a nice place to stroll on a summer evening. Parking is limited, but we were able to find (expensive!) street parking on a Sunday at 5 pm.

title: Gastown a City within a City
reviews: When visiting Vancouver, one of the "must do's is a stroll through famous Gastown, named after "Gassy Jack Deighton" a Steamboat Captain who came to port of Vancouver in 1867 and opened a Saloon. Gastown  was the original Downtown City centre and  hasn't changed it look much since. The exposed brick Victorian style buildings line the Cobblestone streets. Even the streetlights look period correct, a Steamclock in the middle of town blows a steam whistle every quarter hour, it can be heard across Vancouver. There are many eateries from Fine European to Pizza shops,and pubs & Clubs. Local Native and local art can be seen and purchased at galleries there, as well as at the many souvenir shops . Even if you only have time to zip through Gastown, its worth it to see where Vancouver started!Thanks

title: Grace in History
reviews: This part of Vancouver on the Burrard Inlet, is where Vancouver took birth. It is a testimony to the City Council who have maintained Gastown as one of the prettiest parts of the city. We visited in the evening and were charmed by the atmosphere- the gaily lit Water Street with its hundreds of classic lights, its restaurants, bars & shops crowned by the Old Steam Clock which leaves people gaping and taking videos. The area seems to possess a perpetual Xmas atmosphere with the brightly lit Harbour Centre Tower looming above. We loved every moment and stayed for dinner. I wish I had visited in the daytime as well!

title: Very touristy
reviews: Lots of great bars, gastown definitely has it's charm but much too crowded, pretty overrun by tourists

title: An interesting walk
reviews: An interesting walk through Vancouver's best looking (in my opinion anyways) old street.  Dont expect to spend countless hours there but the opportunities for pictures and drinks are there.  A must see for tourists.

title: Not a tourist trap any longer
reviews: I have lived in Vancouver for over 50 years and for much of this time Gastown had a reputation with the locals as a tourist trap with just a few good restaurants.  I was down there recently, with people from out of town and I must say that Gastown has had a rebirth.  It's probably been trendy for years already but I am just starting to go out more now that my kids have become more independent.  There are many good restaurants in Gastown now.  There are also a lot of nice shops (Oak + Fort, Herschel, and many others).  There are still a few tourist shops that sell mainly souvenirs but they are now in the minority.  For shoe lovers, do not miss Fluevog shoes.  Some unique designs that will be immediately recognized by shoe aficionados and very well made and comfortable shoes.   John Fluevog still designs the shoes in the studio at this location.   Gastown is no longer just a convenient shopping area for cruise ship passengers with a few hours in Vancouver.  Now Gastown is a great place to hang out for locals too.

title: Don't wander too far!
reviews: Gas Town itself had a good vibe and plenty of souvenir shops and cafes etc for all ages.We were warned not to venture past the Gassy Jack statue by a tourist guide as the area becomes a little unsavoury so we heeded his advice and o a later trip in our hire car understood why, past the statue the area becomes overrun with homeless people and does certainly not look like a area you would venture with kids.

title: Charming area in downtown Vancouver
reviews: This is THE people place neighbourhood for tourists and more. Great vibe and eateries plus galleries. Stay along Water Street vicinity though- the area by east Hastings between Gastown and Chinatown (also interesting to visit) can be troublesome.

title: Great place for a walkabout
reviews: Enjoy ambiance, some talented buskers and lots of places to go to for food and drink. Taxis easily available to drop off and pick up. Well lite easy going atmosphere. Cool poster shop and great East Indian restaurant called the SITAR.

title: The neighbour is stunning.
reviews: This was quite a surprise for myself. I always thought places that looked like Gastown were something that tv and films made up to look like. It‚Äôs very pretty especially with the fairy lights with trees. The only thing I do say at night perhaps don‚Äôt venture too far on Hastings alone but other than that the locations and restaurants in the Gastown area are fantastic and really fit in with the neighbourhood.

title: Good atmosphere and good shops but perhaps lacked something
reviews: Family holiday visit for a few hours, which we enjoyed but left feeling that the area lacked something i.e. street entertainment, but this may have been due to mixed weather including rain showers.  Welcoming, friendly and safe atmosphere with some nice shops which offered a mix of tourist souvenirs but also some leather goods etc, as well as what looked like some nice restaurants.  Hop on hop off bus stop, which worked well as would not be sure where we could have parked the car.  Some historical monuments noted but with only the bus guide to briefly point these out, we could only find minimal further information.  Worth getting off the bus for though.

title: Historical and beautiful
reviews: Gastown is an interesting, older section of Vancouver.  It‚Äôs brick roads, lanterns, lights, building facades are all true to an older time.  The steam clock is amazing to see.  The shops are quaint with a variety of items from native art to tchotchkes, with price points from cheap to extravagant.  There are coffee shops, restaurants and bars.  A fun, interesting place to see.

title: Shops, restaurants and sights!
reviews: You can get great souvenirs or top fashion. All types of cuisines, and, of course, the delightful Steam Clock!Not to be missed!

title: Too Touristy
reviews: We're tourists. We also live in a "tourist town" But this area was too, too touristy for us. Yes, the architecture is wonderful. The steam clock is fun to watch (and hear on the quarter-hour), but the never-ending crowds made me feel almost claustrophobic. There are several nice shops and interesting-looking restaurants. There are also numerous huge souvenir shops--which kind of says it all.

title: Atmospheric part of Vancouver
reviews: This area has plenty of atmosphere and a happy buzz.  There are lots of cafes and restaurants which all seemed to be well patronised the two times we wandered through the area.  Artisan shops and galleries were interesting but quite expensive.

title: Old town feeling buried in tourist shops
reviews: Gastown is interesting, but the old town feel is buried in tourist shops - how many can there be?  There are some trendy Canadian shops that have interesting merchandise as well. There are a lot of restaurants to choose from.  The architecture really gives you a feel for the early days of Vancouver.  The streets are mostly cobblestone so careful if you have difficulty walking or if you have concerns about uneven surfaces.  One of the best items is the vintage Steam Clock.  Way cool!.  Don‚Äôt wander too far over toward China town area at night.  That area is full of homeless people and we didn‚Äôt feel safe.   Interesting to see.

title: Wandering aroynd
reviews: Great place to wander and look at the architecture and the local pubs and restaurants and of course the steam clock

title: Fun Place
reviews: Such a fun place to be at night.  Many places to eat and shop.  Don‚Äôt wander too far over to what I think might be the China town area at night.  That area is full of homeless people and we didn‚Äôt feel safe, so we turned around.

title: Fun place to view interesting shops
reviews: Here‚Äôs a cute neighborhood in which to stroll and take in the sights. The streets are mostly cobblestone so beware if wheelchair-bound or if you have concerns about uneven surfaces. You‚Äôll see a vintage Steam Clock on the corner along with eateries and shops. Street parking is challenging!

title: Interesting steam clock
reviews: Very interesting steam clock, a few nice restaurants, souvenir shops.  Busy little street, worth a visit, maybe combine with Chinatown or Canada Way plus Harbour

title: Underwhelmed
reviews: Worth a visit but apart from the Steam clock it‚Äôs just more shops. Expected more. Don‚Äôt stray too far as the adjoining area is very down at heel and best avoided.

title: A must for a long afternoon
reviews: The Gaslamp district is definitely worth a visit. The Lamplighters pub one ur favourites on this trip. Gassy Jack story well worth reading. A mixture of shops, bars and eateries to cover every corner of the globe. The only issue is the amount of homeless. This seems to have quadrupled since our last visit in March 2017. Chinatown is full of homeless people and it‚Äôs extremely filthy.

title: Interesting with lots of shops and restaurants
reviews: It consists mostly of one street in old town Vancouver  with a steam clock that goes off every half hr. Enjoyable walk.

title: Touristy but worth checking out
reviews: This is where we purchased souvenir sized bottles of maple syrup and got an obligatory steam clock photo but all touristy gimmicks aside,there were some lovely cafes and eateries and it was a safe enjoyable place to walk.

title: Gastown is a Gas
reviews: The 'first suburb' of Vancouver certainly has retained its charm and is a MUST SEE when you are in Vancouver. Cobbled streets... excellent little bars dotted around... souvenir stores everywhere and the omnipresent - Starbucks! Great during the day... better at night.

title: Gastown is amazing. The sights and food is memorable
reviews: There is so much to do. We walked.  We toured by bus. We toured restaurants and the shops.  We expkored the architecture.The area is geared to tourism.

title: European flair
reviews: To do this attraction justice you must go at night. During night area has a Sherlock Holmes type of atmosphere. Lots of people are out and about going to restaurants and walking. Area is lit up and really festive.

title: Good boutique shops
reviews: A neighborhood that is dotted with cafes and boutique shops. Enjoy if not crowded and grab a sidewalk seat if possible

title: Love Gastown very lively and historical
reviews: Arrived in Vancouver from Paris on Oct. 8/17, and I had a layover for like 11 hours so I decided to come into the city to see what Vancouver was like, this was the first time being in the city, much less the Gastown neighborhood.I took the Canada line train from the airport and thought of which stop to get off of cause I wanted to see a part of Vancouver and I decided to get off at the Waterfront station, I really thought this area was pretty nice and lively and has streets lined with many small businesses and shops, as well as trees and the like, I came across the Gastown historical clock and a statue of Gassy Jack the person that founded the area.I wandered around the area for quite a while and eventually wanted to find a good place to eat lunch and I did find a place called Steam works Pub.The history of this area is deep and is worth coming here.5 out of 5 for the beauty of the area5 out of 5 for many places to choose from to eat5 out of 5 for the busyness of the area 5 out of 5 for the cool statues around town5 out of 5 for great water views

title: Fun walking area
reviews: Had fun walking around. Lots of places to ea and shop.Lots of people around. Clock was an attraction where people gathered to watch

title: Must GO!!
reviews: If you are a visitor or live in Vancouver.  You must go there, you can find many special restaurants around there.  The restaurant size is small but tasty.  You can find for Vegan food, Italian food, bar, sightseeing point, handmade gifts, etc

title: Lovely, historic area.
reviews: Just a short walk, past the Railway Station, from Canada Place. Tree lined, very picturesque. The gas clock is a must see. Continue down Water Street to the Gassy Jack statue, on a beautiful cross roads, with some super buildings.If you want souvenirs, there is no shortage of tourist shops, as well as restaurants, coffee houses and other lovely, individual shops.The only reason I gave a 4 was because this is the only area where we were prevented from leaving a coffee shop courtyard by a person asking for money.

title: Typical olde world tourist area
reviews: This area is well on the tourist trail but it is still worthwhile visiting.  Old Vancouver is there with well preserved buildings and numerous boutique shops.  It is close to the passenger liner terminal and you will also see the steam clock.  You can spend a morning here just relaxing and drinking in one of the many cafes or bars.  There is a great atmosphere but you will pay for it on making a purchase.

title: Great place to do on foot
reviews: Gastown is a area with lots of quirky things to see and do. The Steam Clock is amazing. Lots of restaurants and coffee shops. Visit the Inuit Art Gallery diagonally opposite the Clock. The work is beautiful.

title: Great place
reviews: The gas clock that goes off on the hour is superb. Nice bars, restaurants and shops! Well worth a visit. Flying pig is a must

title: Lovely area
reviews: My favourite part of the city, really old school, love the buildings and some good shops too! The sky train last stop is at the waterfront which is right on the edge of gastown, some nice places to eat and souvenir shops aplenty!

title: Unique place as for the name goes
reviews: The clock operates on steam. Steam goes off every 15 minutes. One of the famous and must see attraction of Vancouver.

title: Interesting
reviews: Gastown was very busy but is a must visit. Good souvenir shops and there is a choice of cheap and also quality products.Great breweries and some nice eating places although we only had coffee it was nice to sit and watch. Interesting whistle clock that is a popular little spot for photos. A bonus is the waterfront rail station, ferry and buses are close by.

title: A very pleasant area
reviews: An easy place to spend a few hours.  All types of shops from designer to souvenir.  Plenty of places to eat and drink and make sure you you listen to the steam clock,

title: Historically Interesting
reviews: A pleasantly interesting stroll with loads of unusual shops , bars, coffee shops and restaurants. Worth a visit to take in the old atmospheric part of Vancouver.Recommend a visit.

title: Not as good as I had hoped it would be!
reviews: Walked about half-an- hour from hotel, Saturday. Had trouble finding it even with a map. When we  located, we were initially underwhelmed. Had heard so much from friends about its‚Äô bohemian atmosphere. It was deserted. We checked out Gassy Jacks‚Äô statue and the quaint steam clock and then found more streets and shops than we previously thought were there, which improved our opinion. Spent several happy hours. Had a nice refreshing drink at a quaint little cafe run by two gents, names Carlos and Peter and then headed for ho e. That was when we began to notice a huge influx of what I could only describe as undesirable drifters and the smell of cannabis filled the air and our lungs. Bohemian, it was not! We felt distinctly uneasy. One person, obviously suffering from some mental illness continually screamed at his poor dog to lie down. No- one blinked an eye. No sign of cops, either plainclothes or in uniform.All in all, we would not feel comfortable going back there,even in broad daylight.

title: Sisters visiting
reviews: Plenty of history and atmosphere. Spaghetti factory was great, had lead lighting in windows and lights, prompt service, spacious eating area.Plenty of souvenir shops and some nice decor shops. Access by hop on hop off bus and taxi for our visits.

title: Good for a stroll
reviews: Trendy, souvenir shops, some great old buildings with fire escapes. Nice eating establishments- great place to stroll - don't miss the whistling steam clock on the pavement.

title: Trendy tourist spot
reviews: Great way to spend time waiting for your cruise departure time. Plenty of shops and cafes to visit and enjoy.

title: Nothing special except the clock!
reviews: Visited Gastown and didn‚Äôt really see what was different about this area. The steam driven clock was interesting but the rest of it was tourist shops interspersed with one or two interesting ‚Äòupmarket‚Äô designer shops.Sorry Gastown but I obviously didn‚Äôt get it!!

title: Loved this area. Like a little SoHo
reviews: Lots of upscale shops and great places to eat, get a bear and just enjoy the quaint area. Loved the steam clock and hearing about the history of this area. Great food and shopping.

title: A cross between "steam punk, the1800's gas lit England and the Wild West"
reviews: "Go forth and make your dreams come true" - is the best way of describing Gastown.   The mix of the old, new, the history and the modernity had a way of having a person step back in time with the advances of today.  Spent half a day exploring Gastown, the China Gate and the surrounding Port.  Beautiful, exciting, full of life, and bursting with energy that you could taste.

title: Architecture and History
reviews: Yes, Gastown has a lot of touristy stuff, like bars, restaurants, and t-shirts. But, it also includes some important areas in Vancouver's history. Towards the east end is Maple Tree Square, where, it is said, the city began. At the west end of the neighbourhood is the railway station where the first train from the east arrived. In between are various old buildings still in use.Take a moment to read the plaques, and learn who was walking where you are now one hundred years ago.

title: Weekend stay
reviews: Stooped in history this is a good place to visit. Plenty to see and do and plenty of variety. Well worth the walk around.

title: Electric City Vibe!
reviews: There were 4 of us getting into Vancouver and wanted to go to a neighborhood with a cool vibe and was turned onto Gastown. Had lunch there at a place called The Local for burgers and beer.Place was rocking at lunchtime and really liked our food.Walked around a bit before heading back to Hotel.Would definitely recommend for anyone who likes a city energy laid back vibe!!

title: Stick to the main streets
reviews: This really is a lovely little area of Vancouver with its cobbled streets and old fashioned street lights. A nice mix of shops, cafes and not too many souvenir shops. The gas clock is amazing although just try to get a photo in front of it, day we were there it was full of tourists (like me üòÜ). But be warned, do not venture too far away from the area, we were looking for bathrooms and saw a sign for pigeon park. It‚Äôs where the homeless and drug users congregate, although they ignore you it‚Äôs not a pleasant feeling being in their midst. There also was a market of sorts but once again it was undesirable people selling anything they could find for money.

title: Nothing special
reviews: The steam clock of course is interesting and unusual but for me that's about it. A few nice shops but what struck me is the number of homeless people, not begging or bothering anyone but nevertheless a little unnerving

title: Touristy
reviews: I liked the steam clock the best.  The buildings were interesting and the shops nice but it seemed a bit too tourist focused and very packed.  It‚Äôs also right next to a huge homeless encampment.

title: A Blast at Gastown
reviews: We loved Gastown so we went there three times.  Why, you ask?  There is great food, great drinking places, fabulous shops, a unique clock, unusual architecture and an interesting array of people.  We did it all, including walking there and back from our hotel.  But no worries there are plenty of taxis around as well.

title: Great architecture Interesting shops
reviews: Walked there from our hotel on Davies Street.  Bit of a walk, but easily done.  Gastown has beautiful architecture, quaint buildings and some great stores.  Lululemon Lab and Karma are both down there if you love yoga and similar athletic gear like I do.  Stopping by the Steam Clock is a must for every person.  Especially when you close to the hour or quarter hour. Great way to spend the afternoon or morning walking around here.

title: Interesting architecture
reviews: Walked all around Gas Town which was interesting and busy.  Good buildings to look at and lots of bars and restaurants and souvenir shops.

title: Worth the wander
reviews: Hopped off the tour bus to walk around the area which has plenty of fascinating shops, good bars and restaurants to meander away a few hours. A tourist hot spot for people staying downtown

title: Every city has one.
reviews: Every city has a historic area with restaurants and bars.  Probably not as big of areas as most but it was fine.  Lots of shops, food and bars.  Also the steam clock.  That is a huge tourist stop.  That is worth seeing.  Overall fine area with multiple things to choose from.

title: A fun visit to Gastown
reviews: In Vancouver for the day after getting off the Norwegian cruise ship "Jewell".  We were here 35 years ago and it hasn't changed.  The steam clock and the statue of Gassy Jack. Lunch at the Steamworks Brewery and Pub.  Great place to have some fun.

title: A tourist destination
reviews: Great history here, some quirky shops and lots of tourist shops. Heaps of cafes and of course the clock. Worth a visit but not essential if time is limited.

title: Atmospheric place
reviews: Good eating places and pubs. Go there! Great place to people watch from restaurant table. Can be pricey though.

title: wrong item in bag!!
reviews: Just got back with my wall plate, different one chose, guy who served me switched them. NOT HAPPY as back in UK too late now. Not impressed!!

title: Not the best city‚Äôs place
reviews: It is a good place, with some restaurants (definitely go to The Old Spaghetti Factory) and local artists, but compared to the others attractions of the city, this is indeed just regular. Go there, complete the check list, and go enjoy other places.

title: Great neighborhood
reviews: We visited the neighborhood while in Vancouver for the first time.  It was fun shopping and looking at the unique stores.  Of course getting pictures of Gassy Jack and the Steam Clock were a must.  We ate at Vera‚Äôs burgers and enjoyed our burgers.  A must see for Vancouver.

title: Fun place
reviews: Lots of shops and restaurants.  A wonderful place to spend a few hours.  The apron shop and the broom shop are two places to visit.  A number of restaurants from pricey to inexpensive as well as an indoor market featuring fresh foods, souvenirs and nibbles.  Outside walking and inside shops good for the whole family.

title: An experience not to be missed
reviews: A great place to amble along looking at the world around. Lots of touristy shops. Plenty of places to eat and drink. The clock is very popular. Constant beggars are a nuisance.

title: Nice to walk around
reviews: We were here almost everyday when we were in Vancouver. It is a very nice area with a lot of restaurants and shops. We loved walking around here.

title: Gastown not what I expected
reviews: Sadly I found Gastown to be a disappointment. There are some good bars and restaurants within the area, but sadly other than the steam clock and statue of Gassy Jack I didn't find much to show of its past history.

title: GREAT HISTORICAL STREET 'FEEL'. . .BUT BUY WITH CAUTION
reviews: The City has done a good job over the years with bricks and old iron and the steam clock and store fronts.  Great place for a stroll thru the past.  But just about everything you might buy is overpriced and available elsewhere in the City for dramatically less.

title: Beautiful even on a rainy night
reviews: We walked from the Pan Pacific hotel to the area.  It was a pleasant walk even with light rain falling.  We were fortunate to be at the steam clock when it announced the hour.  It is a great area with many good shops and restaurants.  If you are in town you must experience this area.

title: Great Gastown
reviews: We enjoyed Gastown with its many shops and fascinating history. Learn about ‚ÄúGassy Jack‚Äù and see his statue. Also the famous steam clock is located along Water St, the main part of Gastown.This area is an essential component of any visit to Vancouver.

title: Fun area
reviews: Lots of great shopping, cocktails, food, people watching. Easy to grab transportation. We were there on a Sat. night and it was really bustling. Had dinner and cocktails.

title: Interesting
reviews: Visited this area whilst in Vancouver, great place and interesting history. There is a steam powered clock in the centre of town that makes a whistle noise every 15 minutes and steam comes out of the pipes at the top, like a train, good tourist attraction! Many good restaurants to choose from and the harbour where the cruise ships dock. Would recommend a visit.

title: Must do!
reviews: This is a must place to see when visiting Vancouver, or even as a local. Lots of great bars and restaurants.

title: It‚Äôs a little underwhelming...
reviews: We walked round Gastown for about 10mins, taking the obligatory pictures of the steam clock and ‚ÄòGassy‚Äô Jack, but it‚Äôs a bit of a letdown generally - we drove through on our way to our hotel and we basically saw most of the sites on the way. Almost all the shops seem to be tourist traps selling the same things as the next shop. It a good diversion for a few minutes of you are up by Canada Place, but I wouldn‚Äôt go miles out of your way to visit.

title: A return after many years
reviews: My husband and I first ventured into Gas Town in the mid 70‚Äôs. So, a trip down memory lane on our 40th wedding anniversary was in store. It was sad!  The old Gas Town of days gone by is really gone forever. Now, a seedy part of Vancouver with nothing but cheap souvenir shops and overpriced galleries. Street people everywhere. We won‚Äôt bother to return.

title: Must visit when in Vancouver
reviews: Gastown was a beautiful place to walk around with historic features such as the steam clock and statues. Many interesting F&B outlets and shops there made me go back a second time.

title: Quaint
reviews: Enjoyed shopping and dinner at water street cafe. Steam clock was very interesting and unique. Went twice during our two day stay.

title: Old Vancouver meets new
reviews: This is a great area to wander around and take in the atmosphere of old Vancouver. The architecture is a step back in time when buildings were built to last. There are lots of very nice bars, coffee places, restaurants and a mixture of trendy boutiques and stores. Everyone's needs are catered for in Gastown. We went here 4 times in our 6 days in Vancouver. You can spend all day here or just a couple of hours. Check out Forbidden Vancouver, one of the best tours I've taken.

title: Other than the steam clock, there is no reason to waste your time here.
reviews: The steam powered clock is really the only attraction in this area.   Yes,  there are good restaurants here,  decide if to visit the restaurants  on their own ratings .  Other than that, this area is a sad collection of souvenir shops and homeless people begging for space change.   There are really lots of better places to visit in Vancouver.

title: Interesting but watch out for used hypodermic needles.
reviews: Quite interesting , like the steam clock but was concerned about the needles and the amount of homeless and vagrant people around.  Didn‚Äôt feel threatened though

title: Great walking tour
reviews: Spent a very enjoyable morning walking around Gastown. Lots of stores to visit and many interesting sights. Dropped by one of the bars along the way and had a drink while we watched the people walk by. Very de-stressing time.

title: Worth a stroll around
reviews: Maybe my memory is fading but I am sure this area was more interesting 30 odd years ago. Yes the steam clock is interesting but apart from that there are the usual eaterie options and tourist gift shops.If you do stray off the main streets you do come across some people less fortunate than you but I never felt intimidated.

title: Historical Vancouver
reviews: A must see when in Vancouver! Very old section of downtown - imagine the beginning of a new province - original brick roads, our famous steam powered clock, close to cruise ship docks, quaint patio restaurants , gift shops , trendy clothing shops , and much more , beautiful walking experience right next to waterfront . Enjoy our historical Vancouver !

title: Quick walk through during the day!
reviews: It's an old part of town, which some restaurants and tacky souvenir shops, along with mainstream retail.  If you're in Vancouver, take a walk through and check out the steam clock.  I personally wouldn't venture here in the evening unless I knew my route well as it borders on sketchy areas. I took a wrong turn somewhere during the day and ended up in a very bad part of town.  To be honest, Vancouver is more of a gateway to other parts of BC to visit, so in terms of sights I find Gastown to be below average, if you want to compare old parts of other cities such as Toronto, Montreal or Quebec City, Gastown doesn't even compare.  I would sooner go to Yaletown for food and drink if I had to choose between the two in Vancouver. Other than the steam clock there isn't really a reason to go here unless you have lots of time on your hands in my opinion.

title: don‚Äôt stray too far
reviews: classic tourist area with eateries, bars and shops galore... but we found the streets between Gastown and Chinatown to be unsettling.. obviously a centre for those down on their luck, and the only place in vancouver we found to be uncomfortable ... the contrast was striking

title: Quaint European style
reviews: Interesting but small area of Vancouver with a slight European influence. Unfortunately tainted by crap souvenir shops, the streets feature some boutiques and of course the steam clock which is very good.

title: Visit Gastown for the steam clock!
reviews: Besides all the touristic shops you will find in Gastown, the steam clock is worth the visit alone. You won‚Äôt find a similar one anywhere else!

title: Hip
reviews: Very hip part of Vancouver lots of bars and restaurants also lots of tacky souvenir shops, been there done that.

title: Not much to see or do....
reviews: Was dissapointed in Gastown.  It‚Äôs really only a few blocks at best, mostly tourist souvenir shops and the steam clock. If you go, don‚Äôt expect much. It‚Äôs a shame because of the history, this COULD BE a really neat place.

title: Scenic shopping and dining area
reviews: This is a beautiful little area in downtown Vancouver, full of shops and restaurants.  We are not big shoppers, but we had a good time window shopping, and actually bought a few souvenirs.  We also had lunch at a very cute pub, and of course, no trip would be complete without stopping to watch the steam clock!

title: Enjoyable Outing
reviews: A delightful little place within walking distance from Canada Place and the waterfront.  My  family and I visited twice during our stay in Vancouver.  We loved the colorful little tourist shops and their array of eye-catching goods ranging from maple syrup products, candies, chocolates and cookies all the way to T-shirts, jewelry, fridge magnets and coasters.  Compared to other countries we've visited the quality and variety of souvenirs at Gastown has been the best to date.  The best part was the affordability.  As South Africans we found these stores to be more affordable than tourist shops elsewhere.  For me, the only downside was having to dodge the many people on the walkways.

title: A couple of photogenic streets
reviews: I was expecting more than just a couple of streets. The shopfronts are nice and the trees and street furniture pretty. However, by the time I got to the end of the street I kind of thought, "That's it?" It is great that it has been restored and the businesses have moved in to create an atmosphere but as a key tourist destination, not for me I'm afraid.

title: Small district of shops and restaurants
reviews: Gastown area is about 8 city blocks square.  Easy to get to.  It has little boutique shops, as well as souvenir shops and lots of nice restaurants the offer indoor and outdoor seating.The location also has the Vancouver Convention Center, one of several seawall walks, the port of call for cruise liners.  Its a real nice place to stroll around do some shopping, have a bite to eat and walk along the waterfront.  The advertised shopping mall only has restaurants and practically no shopping, so skip the mall and enjoy the other places outdoors.

title: Tourist Trap but aren‚Äôt most of us tourists?
reviews: Ya a tourist area but you should still go.  Located downtown and easy to get too.  Loads of shops, bars and restaurants.  Some pretty good music too. Very clean tree lined streets.  All kinds of lights at night.  The steam clock is cool.

title: Restaurants, shopping, Steam Clock
reviews: The best thing about Gastown was The Steam Clock - it was cool to see. The area is full of restaurants - with both locals and tourists. It was late afternoon when we were there and I did want to get out of the area before it got any busier as I didn't know how rowdy it would get and we had a 10 year old with us. Maybe that is completely ridiculous but with the smell of pot in the air I just didn't feel comfortable. There were some neat souvenir shops and we did some shopping there.

title: Holiday
reviews: Great place for your tourist gifts, went there a few times as it was walking distance from our holiday. We Had dinner at the spaghetti factory which was lovely but very busy. The steam clock is amazing

title: A bit touristy, but fun
reviews: Lots of great food, drink, and souvenirs. Can get crowded during prime hours. It's touristy, but still fun.

title: Got to see it.
reviews: Make sure you get there on the hour. Very unique and quaint. I wasn‚Äôt impressed with downtown shopping area but this area is wonderful and great atmosphere. Highly recommend easy to find. Hopefully we will get there on way back it was that good.

title: Plenty of dinning options
reviews: Gastown have blocks and blocks of places for various dinning options. The place is pretty packed over the weekends, great place for people to hang out. Check out the steam clock for music every 15 minutes in that area.

title: Don't forget to see the clock.....
reviews: We walked from Canada Place to Gastown to see the famous Steam Clock.  It is an interesting area with a lot of stores, restaurants and cafes.  The steam clock is a very interesting landmark; we got there in time to see it operate.   So, if you visit the area, be sure to get there on the hour or half hour.

title: Favourite area of Vancouver
reviews: We really enjoyed the vibe in this neighbourhood with so many choices of yummy food and drinks. It is relaxed and has a nice comfortable feel to it. The steam clock is right here along with some brewery's. There are also some cute boutiques for shopping.

title: A little bit of history repeating
reviews: Visit the beautiful streets of Gastown for great beer, food and coffee. Only thing that was a little average were the amount of tourist stores selling rubbish. Was hoping for more independent brands and quirky shops. But, overall... gorgeous.

title: A bit too touristy and nothing that special (except the steam clock)
reviews: It is alright but there other nicer areas in the downtown. This being a bit more artsy/bohemian ( as compared to chic Yaletown). Steam-oozing grand clock in the middle of the street is a major attraction and it is quite impressive !... A 30 min stroll is all one needs to get a good feel. Most of the stores are either too tired or touristy.

title: Gastown has something for everyone!
reviews: I've been there twice now and enjoyed both visits. The interesting old buildings are in good condition and shelter a variety of restaurants to fit everyone's budget. My favorite stores are those that feature First Nation artwork. However there are stores that offer a plethora of tourist trinkets, t shirts, stereotypic Canadian style clothing, plus jewelry, and so on. So if you like to eat and like to shop, you'll like this place. As a tourist, I like to look and see new things. Personally, I like the steam clock. It's unique and fun to listen to. I've walked to this place from downtown and taken a cab. Probably don't recommend exploring the side streets in the surrounding area at night. Not the best neighborhood. But during the daytime, we walked to the Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Classical  Chinese Garden and it was a very special place.

title: Pretty street
reviews: The old buildings and street are really pretty.  Historical part of town, buildings and street well maintained.  The steam clock was neat.  Great stores to browse and good restaurants to eat in.  Very clean and an old world vibe.  They must have a good historical society.

title: Excellent?
reviews: We walked to Gastown from the Chinese Garden. Gastown is ok - nothing special really, but the surrounding area & sides streets are quite horrid. Full of homeless, drug users & urban poverty. Reminded me on Downtown San Francisco. You really do not miss much if you skip Gastown.

title: Unless we missed something, not sure what the fuss is all about
reviews: We had dinner here one evening after a stroll around this area. The steam clock is interesting but not worth making a special trip.

title: Fun shops in historic part of town
reviews: Quaint part of town where you can enjoy shopping in small boutiques.  The steam clock is a fun stop along the way too.  We didn‚Äôt spend too much time there but it is a good place for shopping and eating given many of the small restaurants along the way.

title: Nice Part of Town
reviews: Lots of shops and restaurants. Great vibe. Rich in history. Go visit the Steam Clock. Stores have pretty jewelry.

title: Make sure you do your shopping here
reviews: This is where you need to come to do all your souvenir shopping it is a lot cheaper than most places but it has also a lot more than the other shops and it is very old style and used to be the city before Vancouver come along, this is on the water and right were the sky rail runs also plenty of buses that can get you here and also you get to see the old steam clock that still works

title: Assault of the Senses
reviews: Strolling through Gastown‚Äôs vibey and crowded streets is mandatory when visiting Vancouver. From shoe stores like John Fluevog and sneaker shop Gallery 604, and the myriad of interior and fashion shops it is also a great place to people watch from one of the cafes. Don‚Äôt forget to pick up your Canadian Souvenirs here, there are many choices available and shop attendants are generally very helpful.

title: Hive of activity
reviews: Good place to walk up and down - take a look in the many shops - grab a meal or simply sit and have a drink - look out for the famous steam clock it the only one of its kind so I was told - this area is sure worth a visit

title: Fun stroll
reviews: Lively streets to stroll and take in historical sights. Huge number of pubs and coffee houses. Excellent people watching.

title: Don‚Äôt Miss the Clock
reviews: Great shopping, but the Gastown clock is a must.  Check it on the Hour.  The tunes are electrifying.  Right up the street is a great Gelato storefront.

title: historical piece
reviews: great historical piece.  a crowd magnet.  fun to watch. attraction is easily accessible and is regularly surrounded by a crowd.  seemingly well maintained.

title: Interesting section
reviews: We were told to be sure and explore Gastown while in Vancouver.  Great advice.  Since we were on the Hop On Hop Off bus, we just hopped off, explored and then caught another bus.  The steam clock on one of the corners is quite the attraction. Lots of places to eat and to souvenir shop.

title: Fascinating place
reviews: We discovered this area accidentally on our wanders through Vancouver. I love the tree lined streets and the heritage architecture. SO many places to choose from to eat and drink. DIscoveries on every corner.

title: Captivating, clean, a beauty
reviews: If you like shopping in a strong personality neighborhood of Vancouver, this is the place to go. It's also near Chinatown and the beautiful waterfront promenade.

title: Tourist attraction
reviews: This is not to be missed section of Vancouver. It has its share of tee shirt and knickknack shops interspersed with genuine unique emporiums. There are plenty of restaurants at various price points.

title: Nice buildings
reviews: Loved the architecture and the steam clock but it didnt reach the high expectations. Going on a weekend when it turned into a yuppies hangout for excessive drinking and smoking the now legal tobacco didn't work for us.  Choose your time to go unless this is your thing.

title: Quite nice low-rise district
reviews: The area is humming with activity, lots of restaurants, shops and bars. Plus there is the famous steam clock, which chimes every quarter hour, and has steam coming out of various orifices. Gassy Jack, who was one of the earliest residents, and gives the area its name, warrants a small statue.Sadly, there were large numbers of the homeless evident, though mainly at the edge of the area.Well worth a wander, and maybe a meal.

title: The most historic place in Vancouver!
reviews: With its' steam-clock, Gastown may be considered as the most historic part of the city of Vancouver.. Besides the steam-clock, it is worth visiting the many shops and restaurants as well as the nearby Chinatown. Also Vancouver Film School, Harbour Centre (Simon Fraser University) and some other schools are in this district. The only negative aspect of Gastown is that it is near Hastings Street which is home for homeless people. So if you are a tourist, be careful not to get lost and end up in Hastings Street!

title: Best place to eat
reviews: This is the best place to eat in Vancouver!Close to downtown, very charming pubs and restaurants, including those ones with patio. Go to The spagetti factory :)

title: Worth exploring!
reviews: Great little bit of town to explore! Well worth the time! Spaghetti Factory was a great stop for some food.

title: Gastown - Vancouver BC, Canada üá®üá¶
reviews: Cobblestone sidewalks, restricted car traffic makes Gastown a great place to shop and sightsee.  Right in the downtown area by the sea.  Stop at the world famous steam clock on the hour for a musical steam display.  This is what Vancouver looked like when the city first was established.  Great souveniers by local artisans.  Native artwork by our numerous native cultures.  Lots of dining establishments with great food and drinking pubs.  Many Canadian made products can be bought.  Great atmosphere especially at night under the old street lights.  Check it out for a truly Vancouver old city feel.

title: A great little place to visit
reviews: We walked to Gastown whilst visiting Vancouver. It‚Äôs very central and doesn‚Äôt take long to walk around. An interesting part of Vancouver‚Äôs history. The clock is of course the highlight. Definitely worth a visit and a coffee. From here we kept walking towards China town and between the two there is a very large area of homelessness with the usual associated issues of alcohol and drug abuse which is very visible.

title: Buzzing Place!
reviews: Got off the hop-on-hop-off bus tour to see a bit more of Gastown. Wasn't disappointed. Loads of quirky shops/bars/cafes all thronging with tourists! Good to see Gassy Jack! We went into a little cafe for a coffee and I was gobsmacked when the girl behind the counter (on asking where I was from - Glasgow, Scotland I informed her) advised me she had lived in Bridgeton (a part of Glasgow) for 2 years! She even knew the area I live in! I couldn't believe it!

title: awesome
reviews: thanks to gassy jack, gastown is lively with lots of things to see and do.  coming from new york city, it‚Äôs like the east/west villages of downtown manhattan.   üôÇ

title: Great place to enjoy the Vancouver feeling
reviews: Always a great feeling to drop by Gastown. A Vancouver trip isn't complete without passing by this historical place!

title: Unfortunately, disappointing
reviews: I heard much about this charming place, and had plans to visit more than once during our stay, but the first time proved it wasn't a place to return. Lots of homeless people approaching tourists and asking for money, dirty streets, and feeling unwelcome to take pictures in certain spots. There was one spot in a public square, where I wanted a picture, but someone implied it was 'their spot', like I had to pay or something. Souvenires were abbundant, but also overpriced.

title: Lots of homeless
reviews: We enjoyed our stay at our hostel and the bars around cambie street but gastown has alot of homeless so you may find needles and smell urine

title: Must see!
reviews: If you are in Vancouver you really should walk around this very quaint area with wonderful restaurants and pubs.

title: Very interesting area
reviews: Take the hop on hop off bus to Gastown. There is so much to see and it is amazing to see the clock ‚Äústeam‚Äù. There are many shops, restaurants and bars and hear all anout Gassy Jack to! Highly recommended.

title: It's an interesting little corner
reviews: There's some cool building and shops here, it's very touristy and kind of old looking. The only problem is that it's right next door to the worst section of the city at east hastings, lots of homeless people, drug addicts, and crazy guys in there.

title: Safe & Vintage Vibes
reviews: I don‚Äôt really see how Gastown is that dangerous like people say. We were there are night, on a nice night out, and there were some of your typical unique people, but nothing more than any other city. I would say it has less questionable people than your average city, actually. You‚Äôll be just fine, especially if you're observant. There were a lot of other people out too. Do what you normally do in a city and you‚Äôll be fine: stay alert, don‚Äôt look down at your phone, and don‚Äôt be an obvious tourist. It is a really cute area. The steam clock is beautiful and really cool to see in person. I love the vintage feel of the bricks and the street lights.

title: Good beer
reviews: Area is littered with good and fun pubs and bars most of them with good food. Great place to have a walk around and do a small beer hop. Just expect a lot of tourists.

title: Got to see Gastown, as it is a quaint old part of Vancouver, and the history of the city.
reviews: Gastown is a must area for visitors exploring Vancouver.  It is the old heart of the city, and is where the pioneers started the city.  It has a lot of older buildings, quaint shops and boutiques as well as trendy cafes and restaurants.The steam clock is a unique centrepiece for the area, and should be seen.The area is quite touristy, with quite a few gift shops and souvenir shops.  You can walk to Gastown from the CBD, and along the waterfront where the cruise terminal is.  A good way to enjoy a self guided walking tour of Vancouver, and learn a bit about its history.  There are plaques and statues along the way to read and learn.Definitely worth a visit.

title: Wonderful neighborhood of shops and restaurants
reviews: We enjoyed walking this street close to our hotel on the waterfront. We shopped and bought clothing from a couple of the local stores. The lunch was perfect. I left reviews about specific restaurants on their trip advisor site. I would recommend spending time walking here, it is in theme and enjoyable.

title: Gas town
reviews: Gastown is interesting, full of souvenir shops and eateries. Very low on public toilets though.  The clock is worth the wait but watch out for people pushing in in front of you when your trying to take the picture

title: Fun and Buzzy!
reviews: What a great little enclave in Vancouver. Quite an interesting area but a little edgy with an obvious drug problem round the corner. Stick to the main drag and you‚Äôll be rewarded with unique boutiques and many options for dining, from an almost traditional British pub to fine French dining.Don‚Äôt forget to see the gas clock and get a selfie with Gassy Jack, who gave the area it‚Äôs name!

title: Hidden gem
reviews: This is such a nice part of Vancouver, hidden gem amongst a big city. Nice to get away from the big shops and office buildings. We loved listening to the clock play its tune.

title: Busy tourist street
reviews: Worth  a short vist but essentially just one road with shops and restaurants looking for tourists to spend money. Nice lamps and a few hanging baskets of flowers brighten the place up, but don't wander too far else you end up in a rather unpleasant area of town.

title: Quaint steam clock
reviews: If you are staying downtown, Gastown is well worth the visit.  A few minutes walking distance from downtown.  The steam clock will blow its cool every hour on the hour and have a small steam-off every 1/4 hour.  If you want to take pictures try and be on the side the clock is on as tour buses conveniently stop in front of the clock when it is about to blow, thereby you see a bus full of tourists taking photos of something that you can't see.  Plenty of unique shops in this area.  Full of character.

title: Gas town visit
reviews: There is not much to do, it sounds better on paper than the actual experience. The steam powered clock was worth the visit, but take that away then souvenir shops, no cobbled pavement or road, poor and slightly run down area.  We took the hop on / hop off bus to gas town getting off at the top of the street, walking its length and getting back on at the other end.Was it worth it, no except for the steam powered clock.

title: We kept coming back
reviews: Gastown is a small neighborhood in the oldes part of Vancouver.  After seeing other parts of the city, we kept coming back to find restaurants and interesting stores.  Also in Gastown are the statue of Gassy Jack, the founder of Gastown, and a steam powered clock located on the street corner.

title: located along Water Street just East of Cnada Place
reviews: Gastown is a favorite haunt for visitors (especially those on a Port of Call).  There is no shortage of novelty and gift shops (junk souvenirs).  For a cheap meal there is the Old Spaghetti Factory, but Al Porto's is my favorite for Italian fare.  The Water Street Cafe is also good.  Be certain to stop by the steam clock located on the NW corner of Cambie Street.

title: Good tourist pedestrian destination
reviews: Lots of cute restaurants and souvenir shops line this vintage styled neighborhood. The steam clock goes off every fifteen minutes and there is never not some one getting their photo taken in front of it (often by professional photographers!) Better shopping for souvenirs here than at the airport.

title: Cool area!
reviews: This is a very cool looking area.  People are walking all around.  Great bars and restaurants!  Great for early birds!  Everything tends to shut down early by my standards which was at least by 1:30 am if not sooner.  For late night fare, other places downtown or farther would be recommended.

title: Two different experiences.
reviews: Hard to rate Gastown since it is two places: small interesting shops for tourists, and nearby streets and parks full of addicts and homeless people.  It helps to know that both exist, but hard to accept them side-by-side.

title: Tour stop
reviews: Four of us got off the hop on hop off bus tour here. Gastown reminds me of Greenwich Village. Lots of places to eat along the sidewalk and some ice cream shops too. A few pubs and cobblestone streets. Places to shop for gifts and clothing. So fun and what a delight after the glass skyscrapers of the city. I would have loved to stay longer. There is a famous local statue and a steam clock to see. Interesting old architecture add to the appeal.

title: Walk
reviews: Took a walk through Gastown  on this beautiful day. The roads were packed with people from the cruise ships wandering around to all the bars, restaurants and fine shops. A very lively area to explore. I could have stayed all day, many outdoor cafes full of happy people.

title: Interesting buildings and great for inexpensive tourist
reviews: Just walking around and having lunch or coffee in Gastown is worth the trip. If you  need souvenirs this is the place to shop. A lot of variety of Vancouver Souvenirs at reasonable to high end prices. A variety of shops to choose from for shopping. Make sure to check out the steam clock while there and wait around for it to strike on the hour, if not the hour on each quarter of the hour

title: Gastown
reviews: Best place to buy souvenirs. Picture with the steam clock has the best angle if the photographer goes across the street, you will be able to capture the historical architecture in the picture.

title: Very Commercialized. Crowded. Cheap T-Shirts
reviews: Spent a few hours walking through GasTown in Vancouver, B.C. The location is great because it is a short walk from the cruise ships. In the past GasTown was probably "the place to be". Now I find it just "cheap". Overly crowded with tourists looking for the deal of the day. T-shirts, coffee mugs and keychains. A few good looking pubs and restaurants but many more fast food and chain joints. If you need to waste a few hours it is ok, but don't expect a lot.

title: Mixed Opinion
reviews: Gastown for me ended up as a mystery: on one hand it is a charming neighborhood full of cute little bars and cafes and its historical landmarks and significance; on the other hand every other commerce is a souvenir store offering almost the same products.I don't know. Maybe I was in a bad mood that day.

title: Very interesting place!
reviews: Lots of fabulous restaurants and stores, including many souvenir shops, plus the unforgettable ‚Äústeam clock‚Äù which steams up and announces the hour - unique and worth waiting for the hour to strike! Have your camera ready!

title: Nice Area
reviews: Lovely characterful traditional historic Canadian / North American area which it is indeed a delight to stroll through - watch out for the steam clock - just follow the crowd.Just delight in the architecture of the older edifices to be found around here. Real life and history all around - and it's free to wander.

title: Original townsite of Vancouver
reviews: No visit to Vancouver would be complete without a stroll through historic Gastown. Beautiful historic architecture housing lots of interesting shops, plenty of restaurants and more hipsters in coffee shops and barber shops than you can shake a stick at!A couple of websites to help you dig deeper into whats available. gastown.org and scoutmagazine.ca (use the search feature for Gastown related material)

title: Canada tour
reviews: Visited a quaint  old section of Vancouver.  Walking tour of several restaurants. Good sampling of local food

title: An area with nice restaurants, bars and souvenir shops.
reviews: Gastown encompasses an area of 2 blocks. It's dotted with interesting, small restaurants, bars and shops. However, try not to venture out of this tourist area as the scene can dramatically change; you will encounter lots of homeless people laying on the sidewalks, selling small items, safe drug injection centre, shelters and misc social service facilities. Having said that, these sights give you a perspective of the problems encountered by a growing city.

title: Great spot with some cool restaurants and shopping - a very bohemian feel
reviews: There isn't a lot for sightseeing in Vancouver in terms of culture - more the outdoors sight seeing - but this fills an afternoon. The cobblestone bricks and the gas powered clock make for pleasant walking. Some great places to eat and go vintage shopping and with some of the less expensive bars to drink at.

title: Busy Place to Sightsee
