reviews: Easy to walk along the busy sidewalks and enjoy the many local shops, bars and restaurants. It‚Äôs an easy walk from the Sky Train.

title: Great spot with some cool restaurants and shopping - a very bohemian feel
reviews: There isn't a lot for sightseeing in Vancouver in terms of culture - more the outdoors sight seeing - but this is a must see. The cobblestone bricks and the gas powered clock make for great photo opportunities. Some great places to eat and go vintage shopping and with some of the less expensive bars to drink at.

title: Bustling place
reviews: Lots of tourists here, but for good reason!  Many shops, restaurants in this charming part of Vancouver.  A must see is the steam clock...great place to just walk around and enjoy.

title: Walk around Gastown
reviews: We spent a couple of hours walking round Gastown. We visited Steamworks brewery which was great and ate at Momo sushi which offered fantastic sushi at a great price. Lots of gift shops

title: Don‚Äôt bother
reviews: We may have gone at the wrong time (dusk/evening) but this was not a comfortable place to walk with the family. We live in cities and are used to places not being great. However we could not see the appeal for a tourist here.  Lots of other places to walk in Vancouver.

title: Lovely Neighborhood
reviews: This is a Neighborhood in Vancouver that is near Canada Place and the Convention Center. I just want to say that this is a really lovely neighborhood, with of course the steam clock but also lovely gift shops and small restaurants. It is a very beautiful place to walk through and you will see a beautiful part of Vancouver.

title: Lots of breweries
reviews: Stopped at a few breweries to try some local beers. Nice coffee shops and close to the city centre or Chinatown. A fun place to explore!

title: Walkable Neighborhood
reviews: Yes it's a little gritty, but it is filled with lovely architecture and unique shops and restaurants.  Great walkable neighborhood, next to downtown, historic.

title: An average place
reviews: Visiting gas town was on our list of "things to do" in Vancouver. Apart  from souvenir shops cafes  and shops, it did not have buzz.  The place was pretty  with hanging  pots.  But nothing spectacular

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: Love Gastown. Try to be there when the gas clock ‚Äústrikes‚Äù. 12 midday is the best performance. Amazing shopping, restaurants etc. Go further down the hill to get the best prices on tourist shops. Don‚Äôt just go into the first one you see.

title: Touristy mush mash
reviews: One day in the future or past Gastown knew what it was. Today it is a mix of tourists strolling and wondering why they are there. The mix of aging hipsters, homeless and programmers makes for an interesting mix. There are some good restaurants that are ever changing and high end furnishings and fashion but Gastown is still finding itself. Go a block too Far East or south and you are in questionable territory as the drugs and poverty of Vancouver is at hand. Is Gastown worth visiting? No.

title: Must see
reviews: Old part of Vancouver, plenty of pubs, restaurants, shops. Narrow streets, perfect for afternoon walk.

title: A lovely part of town to grab a bite to eat.
reviews: Attractive street with lots of atmosphere. Was a warm day so dining el fresco was popular. A great place to stroll around and browse in shops.

title: Atmospheric Oldtown
reviews: I loved walking down Water Street and seeing all the unique shops and eateries. From Rogers' Chocolates to Hudson Trading Company to John Fluevog Shoes, there's something for everyone to enjoy.  And The Steam Clock at the corner of Water and Cambie Streets is a very special piece of history for sight seers. Take your time perusing the shops and don't forget to get some chocolate treats at Rogers' before you leave.

title: Small places
reviews: A lovely part of Vancouver to visit, the main street has kept its old world feel, which is a nice change from the high rises in the centre of town. Plenty shops and restaurants, but can be very busy, lots of tourists, especially around an old clock that chimes out every quarter of an hour, beautiful piece that shows the workings of the clock. Worth a wee visit if you've got a spare hour.

title: Excellent place
reviews: Wether to shop, eat or just hang out Gastown is a really great place ! Be sure to try the steamworks brewery for food and drink !

title: Strolling around Gastown is a great way to enjoy a few hours.
reviews: Stop in at Rodger's Chocolate's for a treat or for special  gifts. I enjoyed  two amazing Native Arts studios; the staff in both were so helpful and take the time to share their  expertise.  I purchased a great book printed by the BC Museum from the large selection.There are really nice shops of every kind for unique items. We stoped at the Steamworks Pub to sample some of their own brews from their microbrewery.  The atmosphere was great so we decided to order the sampler and stay for appies. I definitely give it a thumbs up.

title: Great atmosphere.
reviews: This is a great area for locals as well as tourists. Interesting and varied range of shops, street activity and restaurants.

title: About as ‚Äòold town‚Äô as it gets in Canada!
reviews: Lovely area full of restaurants, shops and old world charm. The clock, operated by steam, is a crowd-pleaser and you can pick up the hop on hop off bus from two spots here (Old Spaghetti Factory and just up from the clock). Try the Flying Pig for great food and atmosphere and Local for a great pub, outdoor seating and great food.

title: Good in daylight hours
reviews: We visited here in the evening. There were lots of good bars & restaurants. The Gastown steam clock is worth a look. Avoid the nearby downtown Eastside - the edgiest place I have been to in a long time and an area full of drug addicted homeless people in large numbers.

title: Busy street
reviews: I travelled almost all of canada and this was one place where my friend took me .a lot of restaurants,boutiques etc. There is also a famous old spaguette factory were people were having great meals .Many people were clicking pictures by the steam clock and i did too. Lot of people were also click pictures of an old style built hotel which was on a three way street. Definitely a must visit place to experience so much at one place.

title: Tour
reviews: We came through this on a bus tour today and had some time to walk around will go back again tomorrow when we can spend more time shopping and enjoying the little city that we saw her today very interesting

title: INTERESTING BUT OVERATED IN MY OPINION UNLESS YOU'RE A NIGHT PHOTOGRAPHER
reviews: I loved Gastown and the Steam clock but have to say I found it a little disappointing.  Having said that, one of my favourite memories of my six months in Van was sitting on the pavement in Gastown chatting to a First nation artist working with his knife.  It was absolutely beautiful, chatting about his experience of being canadian and his artwork.  I think Gastown lends itself to these kind of experiences and if it's raining, it's a magical place to take photographs with the reflections on the water at night.

title: Interesting historic district
reviews: Large selection of restaurants and shops ranging from high end goods to tourist "tat".Well maintained to keep historic detail and must-see gas clock attracts everyone on the hour for display.One of the must see places in Vancouver

title: Enjoyable
reviews: I liked the architecture in Gastown so if you‚Äôre interested in older buildings then this is the place for you. Many large souvenir shops located here too as well as an Inuit gallery which we enjoyed. Don‚Äôt miss the steam clock which goes off every quarter hour.

title: 3 to 4
reviews: Walked through it. Ate at a large bar type restaurant at a main junction which was not the warmest. Big groups and regulars seemed to get better attention.It‚Äôs right next to the poorest part of Vancouver so there are junkies and what seem like vagrants around but they do not seem to bother tourists. Just a bit sad.It‚Äôs a strange juxtaposed position of poor and affluent. Like an up and coming area.Some good resteraunts there.Maybe better at night for adults.

title: Overated, dirty.
reviews: Walked Gastown and found the experience thoroughly depressing. Crammed with souvenir shops selling expensive rubbish obviously aimed at the Cruise Ship market and over priced cafes,  the only two uplifting moments were finding the Steam Clock and the Steanworks Brewery. The former fascinating the latter refreshing.  Too many beggars and on the Eastern periphery some really sad sights of homeless people.  Did not feel safe at this venue. An overated destination.

title: Romantic
reviews: It is a famous areas of Vancouver because of it's steam clock and beautifull restaurant which serve mealls on the street tables. Unfortunately this neighborhood is full of homeless and begars.

title: Old school charms
reviews: With its cobbled streets and classy architecture, this old town next to Vancouver downtown reminds you of being lost in some European countryI particularly love its old establishments, pubs, restaurants, brewery and the famous Steam Whistle ClockThe SteamWorks brewery and the many street shops are very invitingI would recommend this place for every visitors coming to Vancouver

title: Funky, fun, food, tiny neighborhood
reviews: Lots of bars (some will not seat families with minors), restaurants, trinket shops,  a weird ‚Äústeam powered‚Äù clock and cobblestone streets.  It‚Äôs only about 4 city blocks long so don‚Äôt blink and miss it.  We found Yale Town better for music and food.

title: A tale of two cities
reviews: Gas town is a nice part of town, with its hanging baskets, quaint light poles and has been done well for tourists and locals alike, but step out this area and it becomes dirty, thousands of cigarette buts everywhere, rubbish everywhere, homeless people sleeping in the streets, many mentally and physically challenged people. The smell of marijuana is everywhere and people smoke it openly, bc plans to legalise marijuana in October and having seen the issues the city already has I am amazed that this is being implemented, the city hall needs to at least keep the streets clean to try and raise ownership.So gas town nice, right next door, be aware

title: Wonderful District
reviews: This area was great. There were so many restaurants to try. It was very picturesque and a great place to stroll around.

title: Quite busy
reviews: Really nice place with lots of shops and dining. Not as much of the homeless population here but the traffic here was a bit busy

title: Another must see!
reviews: Gastown is a quirky area full of restaurants, cafes, souvenir shops and jewellery shops. It has a great atmosphere. The Steam Clock is definitely worth a look, as is the statue of Gassy Jack, after whom the area was named. Apparently he was a great talker and the term gassy was used to describe a very garrulous individual.

title: Charming shopping area
reviews: Take a walk through this part of town to see charming restaurants, high-end shops and get a sense of what the old time logging community was like by reading the historical signs. Was surprised by the large homeless population. People doing drugs right in the street. Some interesting architecture. No uber so plan to walk -there are very few taxis.

title: Day ended with a person od‚Äôed on the sidewalk
reviews: Sadly our day ended with someone overdosed on the sidewalk with EMT‚Äôs trying to help.  Created a very unpleasant memory.

title: Visit for the Steam Clock
reviews: I hadn‚Äôt visited the area in years until I recently brought out of town guests here. They loved it especially hearing the old clock letting off some steam every few minutes. The clock is located only about a 15 minute maximum walk from the old train station or 20 minutes walk from the Convention Centre. There are several souvenir shops but a few carry quality products. This is a good stop enroute to Chinatown.

title: A lot of the same things just in different stores.
reviews: If you love the hunt for souvenoirs, Gastown district is the place for you!   Tons of shops pretty much all carry the same things, but cool to check out especially if you have a ton of time to kill waiting for your flight.

title: Visit to Gastown
reviews: I enjoyed visiting gastown, a busy part of downtown Vancouver that has lots of restaurants coffee shops and bars and also tourist gift shops.

title: Tourist Area Shops
reviews: Pleasant area to walk and look for that special souvenirAvoid walk over two block Main & Hasting not a pleasant side of Vancouver. Homeless street people selling goods??

title: Gorgeous flowers...
reviews: Well worth a walk around, called into a little pub for a beer overlooking the gas clock.  The street is so pretty in summer, in fact all of Vancouver is gorgeous.

title: Gastown is popping!
reviews: This is a very cool area of a very cool city! Bars, boutiques, restaurants and cafes are all abound in quantity & quality. A stroll through Gastown should be scheduled during your trip to Vancouver.

title: Good shopping and atmospehere
reviews: We got off the hop on hop off bus here. It had a busy vibe. Dis lots of shopping and found a pub for for lunch . Glad we stopped here. Before that Vancouver was lacking a bit of soul.

title: Quaint old area.
reviews: This is a quaint old part of TownSome good coffee shops and a must see steam clock. Some parts of the area are somewhat rundown however.

title: Feel like wander into the Europe.
reviews: We visited there in beautiful sunny day. There are a lot of tourists and hilarious  atmosphere. There are not only Souvenir shops but also are many fashionable shops.

title: Clock is the highlight
reviews: The area is interesting to walk round but the highlight has to be the clock which performs every quarter of an hope ur and is worth going to see

title: The Gas Clock !
reviews: Nice little area, just be aware of your bearings if walking to it as theres a couple of streets filled with homeless people and drug dealers, so have your wits about you. Gastown is nice enough though.

title: Attractive and bustling
reviews: We didn't spend long here unfortunately but the old buildings, cafes and smart shops looked appealing.   What wasn't appealing were the dozens of homeless, drugged people wandering at the beginning of the area.  You can get here by using the hop on hop off bus or walking from Robson Street.

title: Overrated
reviews: Gastown was described as a trendy, funky, neighborhood, good for a night out. It is not. Overrun with tourist shops, spilling into the unpleasant drug-ridden part of town, and offering what appear to be mostly standard-issue mediocre eating establishments, it can easily be skipped.

title: Good shopping
reviews: My travel companion loves to shop and had a ball shopping in Gastown! The Steam Clock is a cool attraction! For those of us who appreciate the Stephen Spielberg movie ‚ÄúClose Encounters of the Third Time‚Äù will appreciate the tones similar to those heard in the movie. We had a great lunch of snapper at Water Street Cafe. The cheesecake at Tree Organics across the street was delicious.

title: Nice steam clock
reviews: Visited briefly here a couple of times during a 3 week visit to Vancouver.  The clock is nice and it‚Äôs worth going just to see and hear it chime.

title: Cute place
reviews: Section with cute lamps with mature trees  is nice to stroll in. Plenty of shops and restaurants. Reminded us of a Parisian street. Very accessible from the Waterfront train station. Highlight is the Steam Clock which was quite an amusement at the top of the hour. Cap the visit with a picture of Gassy Jack on Carral st. More south and east bordering Chinatown is plagued with the homeless but they don't bother you of which I was very impressed having lived in both SF and NY.

title: A little boring but ok to walk around
reviews: Vancouver grew from this historic location, Vancouver‚Äôs oldest town. There is a steam whistle clock and a commercial district with boutiques, restaurants, bars and a interesting array of things to look at. More the boutique style of shop, plenty of homewares stores and expensive art. An easy walk from pretty much anywhere in downtown Vancouver. It‚Äôs not exciting but if you‚Äôre keen to look around and grab a bite to eat, pop on down.

title: Worth a visit but not much there
reviews: Title covers it. Worth a look. Good selection of Canadian gift shops. Pubs and restaurants. Steam clock interesting but a little underwhelming.

title: Steam clock was so cool!
reviews: Try to be there on the hour to hear the steam clock chime! So cool! It rings every 15 minutes  but on the hour is the big show. My dad has fixed antique clocks for years and he so enjoyed seeing it. The whole Gastown area is really cool with great restaurants and shopping. Very cool vibe and different from the rest of Vancouver. We ate at the Spaghetti Factory and it was good.

title: Busy and dusty
reviews: Gaston is close to the cruise ship dock so inevitably,when cruise ships are docked,expect it to be packed.It's nothing out of the ordinary,but plenty of places to eat and drink,and if you want souvenirs(made in China mostly unless you check carefully) this is a place to go.You will struggle to photograph the steam clock during normal daytime hours without falling over other tourists!

title: crowds
reviews: Just a short walk from Canada place but very touristy mostly going to see the Steam Clock which is good but lots of people around which could spoil your photo. Some good eateries but be prepared for a wait as the busy.

title: A place to avoid.
reviews: Not what we expected. Full of shops selling ‚Äúmade in China‚Äù tourist junk. Some good restaurants and shops but better places to go.

title: Perhaps not when ships are in
reviews: Sigh...i don't do crowds. To much humanity in one place. Any plusses negated by bodies. Perhaps now a failure of its own success.

title: Busy Area
reviews: We visited after a heavy diner and picked up a dessert. The streets were crowded, but there was a lot of history along the streets. Had a great time .

title: Vacation 2018
reviews: Great shops.  Ate at two restaurants.   Spaghetti Factory,  and another called Local.  Food at both restaurants were excellent.  What really stood out was the service.  The waitress at Local gave my daughter a Canadian dollar coin.  Being from the U.S. we were talking about that and she reached into her change purse and handed my daughter the coin.  Super nice.  It made my daughters day.  When we got home she had thought that she lost it, but I found it in the wash machine.   She was elated.   It turned out being her favorite souvenir.  Also loved the steam powered clock. Overall neat souvenir shops, and tons of food choices.

title: Free walking tour. Blarny stone pub for music we were there on Friday night
reviews: We enjoyed Izzy‚Äôs company for over 2 hours.  She told us all the history and stories of Gassy Jack, to Blood Ally and much more. A young lady full of passion.  She took us to see the Liberty Bell. Gave us great hints for food drink etc. We enjoyed the Blarny Stone Irish restaurant on Friday night, fabulous music and vibe.

title: Historical area with good souvenir shopping
reviews: We only had a short time to visit this historical area. The shopping street was well kept with antique street lamps. There were numerous shops selling Canadian made items.

title: Abuzz with people and flowerpots
reviews: This is an inconic area of Vancouver. It is a buzz with shops and restaurants. The area has an interesting history and the steam clock and statue of Gassy Jack should not be missed. A side visit to East Hastings street is an eye opener in terms of the number of homeless and a strict contrast to the rest of Gaston, which has some very upmarket outlets and cafes.

title: location
reviews: quite a histori little area not far to walk from canada place nice little shops and restuarants to visit abd see the old area

title: Steam Clock
reviews: A great place to walk,shop, eat and drink.Gastown is an easy walk from Canada Place--only a few blocks away.Water Street is full of people, both tourists and locals. It is a shopping mecca for jade (jade jewelry, ornaments), indiginous souvenirs (totem poles, jewlery, ornaments, art work). The steam clock is the main attraction--tourists snapping photos.There are many restaurants along the way, including the Old Spaghetti Factory--seats hundreds, very busy, provides a fast and friendly service, and   an inexpensive meal  (all included: bread with garlic butter, pasta, spumoni ice cream and tea/coffee).Heads up, watch for pickpockets---there are some street people hanging around as in all big cities.

title: Go to the Clock!
reviews: Beautiful old town which a flare! There are many unique stores to visit with an abundance of dining options. What makes this stop worth while is the steam clock! Every 15 minutes or so, the steam clock performs a fun little show!

title: Shopping and eating
reviews: Lots to do in gas town. Perfect for a tourists or for killing time between meetings. Plenty of coffee shops, restaurants, and boutiques.

title: Old town
reviews: Gaston is an old part of Vancouver and is worth a visit to see the steam clock and for shopping. There are many places to eat.

title: Nice walk, cute shops.
reviews: I wouldn‚Äôt consider this as a complete highlight of Vancouver, but is definitely a place to check out if you have spare time. :) Don‚Äôt walk from china town to Gastown at night, rather get off at waterfront and walk there, much nicer.

title: Great area to stroll, people watch, shop and eat
reviews: Historic area with fair amount of crowds.  Lots of tourists and some locals. Older buildings now housing shops and restaurants. Something for everyone in the way of shopping and eats. Worth a stroll especially if time to grab a bite to eat.

title: Nice part of Vancouver
reviews: Nice and pretty green part of town. Plenty of food and bars but also quite a lot of tourists and tourist souvenir shops. Nice for a walk and a bite to eat but then it‚Äôs done and time to move on.

title: Hears to tourist traps.
reviews: It‚Äôs really pretty awesome.  And lots of stores to look/shop in.  Lost of restaurants and the Gastown clock going off is need to watch.  It‚Äôs a glorious place to walk around and eat. And shop

title: Afternoon Well Spent
reviews: Gastown was a nice way to spend several hours. There‚Äôs a lot to eat & drink, a few too many souvenir shops, and some nice galleries. The steam clock was interesting. We jumped off the Hop On Hop Off bus to explore Gastown & eat. We walked a while & jumped back on. It was a fun afternoon & more interesting than Yaletown.

title: Good shopping
reviews: Good tourist shopping in funky setting on Water street but if you stray just a little bit you get a glimpse of those who can't carry the weight of the world!

title: Great night life
reviews: This is the perfect place for after work drinks, a business dinner, or a romantic evening.  Walking distance from the CDB.  Historic.  Lovely.

title: Busy social hub
reviews: A great way to get an idea of the vibe of Vancouver. Gastown is quite touristy, but has great shopping and galleries, in addition to restaurants.

title: Can't see what the fuss is about.
reviews: This place gets a lot of hype but we must have missed it. There were some interesting shops & few eating places but not as historic as we were hoping for.

title: Old buildings/ street, steam clock and lots of restaurants / pubs
reviews: It‚Äôs a walk from most hotels downtown. For Vancouver, a baby age frontier city, Gas town is as old as it gets üòÅ Gastown is small area because Vancouver was a small settlement. Maybe track down a guided walking tour -ask at front desk of hotel . The strip is packed in the summer . Manage the expectations and enjoy an hour or so. In the wet winter it‚Äôs not busy but the cobblestones, trees, iron work and old brick buildings give it atmosphere and a nice place for a quiet lunch with many restaurant choices.

title: Good place to kill an hour
reviews: Gas town is good for a stroll to see ‚Äúold‚Äù Vancouver but it will only take you an hour or so. It‚Äôs incredibly small so unless you are eating or shopping there, it will be over in a breeze. There‚Äôs a few clothing and souvenir shops and quite a few restaurants (Spaghetti Factory is here). It‚Äôs easy to get to by city train. Just ride the Skytrain or Canada Line to Waterfront station, exit through the main entrance, turn left and walk straight. You‚Äôll see it in a few minutes.

title: The Oldest Part of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a lovely district in downtown Vancouver. You can tell it's undergone gentrification over the years. There are lots of places to eat, shops, and cobble stone streets in the area. Albeit, it's not a large area to explore, and if you go too far east you'll end up in the downtown eastside, where the city's homeless, mentally ill, and drug addicted tend to congregate. It's not scary, just overwhelming due to the concentration of poverty in this one area. So, just be sure to not go past Main Street and you'll be OK.

title: Great District
reviews: Gastown was an unexpected surprise. It's a lively district in Vancouver- lots of pubs, restaurants,  shops and people! Had a lot of fun down here and highly recommend.

title: Dodgy
reviews: This is a tourist area and I'm sure there are some nice restaurants etc but we couldn't get past the garbage strewn all over the ground, plus the homeless people and drug addicts everywhere (we walked past a treatment clinic at one stage). It's just strange that an area advertised to tourists is so dirty. We didn't feel unsafe but this definitely wasn't a great introduction to Vancouver. Love the clock, though!

title: Walkabout
reviews: We decided to walk from Vancouver Centre to Gastown (10 minutes).  A great place for the young at heart.  Friendly, buoyant and jumping for most of the night.  Gr3at restaurants and other places to eat.  It probably would be best to book most restaurants, since the place was heaving.  Great fun.

title: Quirky and Fun
reviews: Love, love, love this vibrant, quirky little corner of Vancouver. We visited at night particularly to see the nine-globe street lamps lit up, and to witness the steam clock strike at the hour. There was live music, the restaurants were in full swing and we had a great time strolling around the stone cobbled streets and wandering from shop to shop. Parking is limited though so be mindful of that. I truly recommend you spend some time here anytime you‚Äôre in Downtown Vancouver!

title: Lovely place
reviews: Really nice place with some amazing architecture and lots of personality!I could not find a museum thoughüòä I think that would be a great thingüòÑ We found a really nice restaurant called ‚ÄúLocal‚Äù which was greatüëçüèªFor my taste there was a little to many souvenir and jewelry shopsüòä

title: Well worth a visit
reviews: Gastown is different from other places in the city and has a great collection of bars and restaurants. Our favourite bar by far was the Revel Room which had great music every night ( except closed on Mondays) and the owner welcomes you like a long lost friend.

title: Did the tour guys walk8ng tour of gastown
reviews: Awesome neighbourhood quaint boutique shops beautiful architecture certainly worth a look and the history is great story

title: Old clock
reviews: Enjoy strolling thru all the shops. From the little souviner stores to the high end Native Indian store.

title: The old town but worth a visit
reviews: Vancouver without the high-rise - quaint shops ( mostly pricey) great atmosphere, great history in the architecture with a fair quantity of colourful locals. Look out for the steam clock, statue of Gassy Jack and the bar by the statue - Local - is recommended. You probably won't spend long in Gastown but it is worth the effort. As part of the Hop on Hop circuit it is good - Hop off have a look and hop back on! The main stop is by the steam clock.Hilarity1628

title: Geat experience.
reviews: Went there in morning and viewed Steam Clock. Great place to just walk and enjoy shops and atmosphere. Enjoyed it so much returned at night for dinner. Highly recommend 'The Flying Pig'So good we returned to the same restaurant 3 weeks later on our return to Vancouver.

title: As quaint as ever!
reviews: An air of excitement exists along cobblestones of Water Street. Perfect for cruise ship tourists. Take a leisurely stroll + eat at the Steamworks Brewing Company on West Cordova on your way, just east of the Waterfront Skytrain Station.

title: Well worth a visit
reviews: We spent a morning walking around Gastown admiring the old building and doing some window shopping.  It is a bustling tourist area with more than its fair share of cheap and tacky tourist souvenir shops and plenty of restaurants.  While we walked from our downtown hotel, Gastown is on the ‚Äòhop on hop off‚Äô bus route and seems to be a very popular stopping point.

title: Post Cruise Walking Visit
reviews: Real easy to walk to from the cruise terminal.  Lots of shops, very nice cloths, lots of potted flowers.  Very interesting.  The people of Vancouver dress very nice.  European or cosmopolitan I would describe.  Expensive city compared to our home in Ohio. We went to 2 different ice cream shops to buy a cone.  Passed the first one up because it was over $5 a scope, but the next place was the same price.  Good place to people watch.

title: Full to the brim with tourists and tourist shops
reviews: It's a place that tourists head to. It's fun to see the clock strike but there are many homeless living there taking advantage of passing tourists. We went there to go to a vegan restaurant that was nearby (Meet - highly recommend) but it was so crowded it wasn't pleasant. The hop on hop off bus comes through regularly and there's a lot of traffic. Rather over rated in my opinion

title: Great district
reviews: A relaxing and pleasant place to walk around. At night the street lamps and ‚Äúfairy lights‚Äù give a warmth and friendly feel to the place. Check out some great bars and restaurants too.

title: Old part of Vancouver
reviews: Was interesting to see a different or more traditional part of Vancouver. The buildings are not as high here and I enjoyed the quaint feel of walking round including the cobbled streets. The steam  clock was cool to see although be prepared to have to wait for lots of people have their picture taken next to it. Lots of places to eat around here too.

title: Lots of places to shop and eat
reviews: The area if full of restaurants and shops.  During the day is quite busy with people walking around.  Once the night falls some streets are spooky as homeless people appear from nowhere and begin to look for spots in front of the shops to spend the night.  Not used to smell weed as you walk by thus this was an unpleasant surprise.

title: So?
reviews: Old buildings now occupied by stores and restaurants. A bronze statue of an early settler who talked a lot and opened a bar.  Nothing special nothing most other cities don‚Äôt have their own version ofEnjoyable but nothing to get excited about

title: Very European
reviews: We were in the hop-on-hop-off and felt attracted by tis neighbourhood so went down to have a time there.Charming, nice restaurants, fine art gallery. . . . a very good experience

title: Don't venture off the main drag!
reviews: Gaston is in all the guide books and has some lovely places to stop, shop and eat off Water Street. However, as you wend in the direction of Carrall Street towards the East Cordova, Hastings and Pender Streets, the area becomes pretty shady and was a little intimidating even during the day. Straying off the main drag is certainly something we agreed we would want to do at night.

title: Good for a brief walk through
reviews: Interesting neighbourhood. Lovely tree-lined streets. The steam clock was cool and we heard/saw it go off on the hour.

title: Cute place for a walk, drink and a bite
reviews: We walked around on a Sunday afternoon, we didn't come there with dinner plans, but as we were walking there were many options for a place. The streets are charming and colorful. Definitely one of the places to visit in Vancouver.

title: Gastown
reviews: Gastown reminds me a lots of Middleburg Va, with tree-lined streets and lots of people milling about. I enjoyed our visit there. We ate at LOCAL, a sports bar with fantastic burgers. Gastown is Vancouver‚Äôs oldest neighborhood, growing from a single tavern founded by John ‚ÄòGassy Jack‚Äô Deighton back in 1867. It is the original settlement that became the core of the creation of Vancouver BC and is now a national historic site.

title: Nicest bit of Vancouver
reviews: Feels quite bohemian - not a big area but some great food and bars.Worth a stroll if visiting. Plenty of decent bars and eateries, great for brunch - try Catch 121

title: Good
reviews: It‚Äôs a good place where you can find many gift stores and if you wait at any o‚Äôclock hour you can see how the steam clock works

title: Wouldn't recommend for families
reviews: The steam clock was the highlight.  However there were a lot of shady characters on the sidewalks, homeless people that appeared psychotic, swearing. Doesn't seem friendly area for kids.

title: Animated
reviews: We appreciated this neighborhood. Many restaurants and shops can be found there. The cobbled streets and red bricks buildings give a special charm to this place. A must see if you're visiting the city. Don't go west of this neighborhood, the streets are filled with drug-addicts, alcoholics and homeless people.

title: Okay-ish
reviews: We took a stroll down to gastown there were some pretty good little shops and a great coffee place, but overall I just didn't get the vibe, I'm normally into all the cool hipsters places but this place didn't really do it for me. I was thinking it would be a bit like Newtown in Sydney or like the soho area in London. Overall my girlfriend and I just felt unsafe. And do yourself a favour and don't venture down one of the side streets to east Hastings st. it's like a zombie apocalypse but these zombies are all on crack

title: Quaint
reviews: A beautiful and vibey part of town with the gas clock as the feature point. Lots of cobbled streets and restaurants.

title: Cool Look, Decent food
reviews: There is not too much too see here but if you want to get some good food and do a little bit of shopping in a older style part of town it is definitely worth checking out.

title: Steam clock
reviews: Walked to this area to see the steam clock, it was lovely beautiful planters. We went back that evening for supper.

title: Nice funky place
reviews: Gastown was an interesting place and still had some of it's old charm. We made the mistake of walking through Chinatown where there was a lot of homelessness and beggars coming up to you. Approach from Canada Place for a better experience.

title: Another tourist trap
reviews: There is nothing really unique ( excluding the steam clock ) in Gastown that you cannot find in other major cities or tourist areas in Canada.There are numerous shops catering to separating tourists from there money, overpriced restaurants and crowded streets.Time is better spent in Vancouver visiting Stanley Park and taking in all the natural beauty the city has to offer

title: Fab!
reviews: This place has so much character and little things to go and see such as the steam clock! Definitely worth a visit when in Vancouver!

title: So much to see here and to experience
reviews: We went to Gastown looking for two places. We did find them after some time as it was hidden upstairs in the back of a building. There were several rowdy people outside a bar as I‚Äôm thinking a soccer game was happening. We did not experience any problems in Gastown and found the statue of Gassy Jack . We did not go to many shops in the area as we had other plans for late afternoon. We did eat at a restaurant Tacofino excellent prices and excellent food.

title: Much too overrated
reviews: Nah - we were not impressed. Tourists jamming the sidewalks, souvenirs all over and nothing special. We spent a few hours here, had a great lunch at Mom‚Äôs and then back to North Vancouver where the locals are

title: Worth an Evening Stroll Around - good food
reviews: A cool little downtown neighbourhood. Nice in the evenings, as there are lots of good places to eat and get a drink. Everyone seems to be fascinated by the Steam Clock. It isn't quite Big Ben; its about 10ft high on a street corner. I didn't notice it at first. Don't venture further east than Carrall Street, especially at night. I have never seen so many homeless people and beggars. Being from London I'm used to the odd beggar and try to give them some money or food. But between Carrall to Main St, there were literally 40 or 50 on each block, some dancing on the pavements, clearly off their faces. It was kinda intimidating. :(  Avoid those few blocks and you'll have a great evening.

title: Nice section of town
reviews: Lots of shops, a steam poered clock, and more places to shop. Not much food here and it is the oldest section of the city so be sure to visit it.

title: Fun time but could use a little clean up
reviews: I really enjoyed my time in Gastown but the streets and sidewalks had a lot of debris.  Several homeless which kept to themselves but many areas smelled like urine.  City could do a bit of clean up then it would be five stars.

title: Like the old city centers in europe!
reviews: Nice streets with older building where you can have a beer or a bite. Donut forget to watch the gas clock at noon! The only palace in Vancouver where there are no skyscrapers certanly worth to stroll around.

title: Just to see the steam clock
reviews: I had a couple of hours so walked from my hotel at English Bay to Gastown.  I passed Canada Place and enjoyed seeing the Olympic Cauldron and the digital orca first.  The steam clock was nice to watch.  There was little else to attract me.  The gift shops were expensive - we had paid much less for maple syrup in Safeways earlier (in the same maple leaf bottles).

title: Very Eclectic and Interesting Spot to Visit
reviews: We visited on a cloudy day but there was little rain, so that helped. We rode the hop on/hop off tour bus and circled by twice before getting off to see the steamclock. The area around is filled with homeless people who were smoking crack on the street. It didn't give us the easiest of feelings, so we stayed close to the central hub of people and crowds. It wasn't a bad place to visit, but if you're not hungry or looking for souvenirs, there are other things to do in the city.

title: Great Old Fashioned Feel
reviews: Quaint and fun to walk around. The evening lights on the street make you feel like you are going back in time. Lots of restaurants and people. Tours and shopping available as well.

title: Enjoyable neighborhood
reviews: Checked out Gastown a couple of times during our visit. Definitely enjoyed Steamworks the best. A couple blocks off Water St finds you in a seedier area. Lots of panhandlers roaming the streets. When we stopped for a drink or food we made sure we were not in the first row of tables next to the sidewalk as those folks would get pestered by the panhandlers. Overall it is worth a visit but don‚Äôt be surprised to see someone digging in the garbage or sleeping on the sidewalk.

title: Gastown Has Changed For the Better
reviews: As a person who lives in the Lower Mainland, I had not been to Gastown in a long time. Still lots of tourist shops and some good restaurants but now has some high end fashion shops and furniture stores. If you are looking for some unique clothing, shoes or furniture, a good place to check out. Of course you have to check out the steam clock and other tourist stuff there as well.

title: High Energy Shopping and Dning
reviews: Great restaurants and boutique shopping area. The Flying Pig has a great happy hour in a comfortable and central setting.

title: Gastown needs a facelift
reviews: Gastown is worth a visit, but I wouldn't spend a lot of time there.  The gas lamps and steam clock are charming of course, but the stores are tourist stores and the food is good but not great. Having been there years ago...I mean like 30 or so...I was disappointed because it had lost some of its charm.  But with a few good restaurants and stores it has the character to return to its glory days!

title: High-quality gift stores here
reviews: The first time I hurried through Gastown, I thought it was full of silly souvenir stores.  But if you slow down and look, there are high-quality stores in here.  And good eating places.  The steam clock is a popular spot for photos.  I think it steams every 15 minutes.  It is a 15-20 minute walk from Georgia Street.  Stop at the Seabus Station to read the WW II plaque in front, with its statue.

title: Gastown clock was so cool!
reviews: While walking around the area, we went through Gastown.  We came upon the Gastown clock and at the right time! We got to hear the steam whistle that goes off every quarter hour.  It was very cool!  The shops in Gastown were also fun to visit.  Definitely worth walking around!

title: Full of history, shops and cafes
reviews: great for leisurely stroll, shop and eat. The steam clock is a must. This area was easy to find and easy to navigate. A couple of days here exploring. Could have easily spent more time here

title: Searching for the Steam Clock
reviews: I did find the steam clock a fascination of mine steam powered clock and engines along the funky streets of trendy Gastown.  What a thrill.Very busy tourist area any day of the week, but no problems stopping or parking.

title: Always a favorite
reviews: Gas town never ceases to be a source of fun and entertainment.    Good eats.   Lots of shopping.   All the tourist shops are pretty much the same so just try a few - But the non-tourist shops are plentiful and have very coolStuff.    Some wonderful clothing stores can be found on either ‚Äúend‚Äù of the gas town strip on water street.   Not the high end shopping experience of downtown.

title: Old town fun
reviews: Find anything for everyone in your family. A great place to spend a day with your loved ones. Walking distance to Canada Place and so close to Stanley Park.

title: Popular Tourist Area
reviews: Very busy at Monument and Steam Clock nearly every time we passed nearby (Coach and Hop on Hop off Bus)Variety of Pubs in this vicinity which was great as extremely hot day on we went to Gastown so able to people watch as we had long cool drinkNear to China Town and Port where Cruise Ships dockHop on Hop off Bus covers this part of VancouverNumerous Restaurants, Souvenir Shops and Hudson Bay Outlet as well as BCMP shop to buy gifts to suit all agesSome beautiful buildings Worth the walk

title: Best vibe and good shopping.
reviews: Walked around here to see the area and the steam clock.  Somewhat crowded but not too bad.  Shops were plentiful and good prices.  Worth checking out.

title: Best
reviews: Spent an afternoon in Gastown and wandered around,  saw the magnificent steam clock there is so much to see.

title: Lively area to spend an evening.
reviews: The steam clock was fun to watch. We were there for Canada Day with lots of people. Interesting stores. Tree lined streets.

title: Hipster's paradise
reviews: Gastown is a space that has been cleaned up a little bit compared to the rest of downtown. Nice bars and night scene, better than granville street. Of course everything is pretty pricy, I bet renting a spot for business there won't be fun! $$$$$Popular spot is the Clocktower show at night!

title: Fun atmosphere and shopping
reviews: We enjoyed walking up and down the streets and had many shopping opportunities. My wife just had to see the old steam clock. We also found several souvenirs we couldn't live without.

title: Tourists-Be nice!
reviews: Keep in mind, this is a touristic area. Be kind to those who are out and about looking for something, as well as the locals of that neighborhood. This is not the place to become a snooty traveler or a demanding tourist. It is a fun part of town but touristic places get a funky reputation because of the tourists, so don't be a lame-o.

title: Mr
reviews: This place is buzzing ‚Äò cafe bars Restuarants and shopping all located in a quaint historic part of town

title: Quirky clock
reviews: We love the ever so slightly off key tone of the Westminster chime when the clock strikes the hour. It‚Äôs hard to believe it was only made in 1977 and we heard the gentleman who invented it still maintains it occasionally.  We liked browsing the gift shops  and there are lots of places to eat and drink. We also saw the bronze statue of ‚ÄòGassy Jack‚Äô. It is named after John Deighton who was born in England and he owned a saloon bar   to refresh the workers who worked at a nearby mill years ago. He was named Gassy Jack because he liked to talk a lot, Gastown has great character with its cobbled  street and is  a nice place for tourists to visit.

title: Disappointing
reviews: A very short street. A few high end shops, lots of tacky souvenir shops and some bars/restaurants.  But not a lot else, we didn‚Äôt get what the hype was about. Plus our walk back to the hotel took us past an area heavily populated by homeless people. Though we did not feel threatened, it was not a nice experience and there is no way I‚Äôd go there later at night

title: Loved the steam clock
reviews: Dined at Steam Works which was excellent. Lots of shops to appeal to many tastes. We travelled by hop on and hop off which was convenient. Great place to enjoy and leisurely stroll near the water.

title: A nice place to walk and browse!
reviews: I had never been to Gastown so decided to drive for my first visit. I wouldn't do this again as it cost $8 for two hours of parking, and there is a skytrain stop two minutes away! It is a nice place to browse, with a beautiful waterfront backdrop. The steamclock is a tourist attraction but nothing extremely special. Nice places to have a bite to eat and browse, but a lot is quite expensive or souveniers so I didn't end up finding too much. The architecture is beautiful, and the cobblestone streets give it a vibe that is hard to find elsewhere. This is a place I would recommend visiting! Though I feel that as a tourist you can get the just of it in less than a day.

title: Cool vibe
reviews: Cool places to check out just for something different. You can expect the usual overcrowding of attractions as in any tourist area. Make sure you check out the steam clock either on the hour or half hour

title: Great village feel
reviews: This is a lovely area of Vancouver, buzzing with lots of nice shops and places to eat. Lovely way to pass away an afternoon.

title: Sad visit
reviews: I was excited to go but it broke my heart to see so many homeless people in this area, I was not able to enjoy it at all :(

title: Quaint and Great Fun
reviews: Gaston is a section of Vancouver that houses many good restaurants and pubs.  Lots of history matched with a light hearted approach to dining.  Buildings are reminiscent of Europe and New Zealand.  Shop owners are committed to providing a good time.  Consider for an evening dinner outside to enjoy the crowds.

title: Nice historic district
reviews: Glad we took this in. Great walking area. Love the steam clock. Very walkable from the waterfront station.

title: Food and Beverage Waking tour
reviews: Enjoyed waiting around this area! Great food choices! Good sushi, poutine, vegan, beer and wine choices!

title: Always Fun
reviews: The place is vibrant, busy, and so much fun.  Lots of places to eat, lots of places to eat, love the people watching as well.

title: Great place to eat and drink
reviews: Great atmosphere with good restaurants and nice place to walk. Really enjoyed watching the gas clock on the street.

title: Good fun - wandering.
reviews: We gathered around 10:30 and set off to see some of the sights in Vancouver. Firstly to the (colosseum) City Library, the main Stadium, then to China town for the Saturday markets. Unfortunately we were there at 11:00 and the markets were starting at 6:00pm. As tempting as it was to wait, we decided to move on. So off to Gastown - en-route seeing some of the seedier streets - for a general wonder and windows shop.  Then off to Canada Place where we stumbled across a 3 day,  japanese comic book genre convention. Lots of characters available for photography. Pretty good  Walked along the waterfront to Stanley Park, stopping along the way for lunch and a play in the park. Then the miniature train ride, the play area, then back towards downtown. Came across a other 'street art' parade with literally hundreds of people dressed as zombies marching down the Main Street. Again, pretty interesting characters ....Dinner at a pizzeria, where the boys kept everyone entertained, then an early night for all. Tomorrow .. Seattle

title: Lots of great shops and restaurants
reviews: This is a great area to saunter around and enjoy the one of a kind shops and funky little restaurants .. It‚Äôs cobble stone and lamp light. So it‚Äôs quaint and cute .

title: Great place to wander
reviews: Fun old neighborhood to visit. We had a few hours to kill and enjoyed a stroll, some coffee, and a little history from the statues.

title: Hub of Restaurants, Bars and Pubs
reviews: The Gastown neighborhood of Vancouver, adjacent to Downtown on its northeast side, was the original downtown core that Vancouver developed from, is a popular destination for visitors due to the area‚Äôs many restaurants, bars and pubs.Besides food and drink, there are a number shops catering to tourists selling souvenirs and fashion oriented items.  The unique landmark in Gastown is the Steam Clock, located at the corner of Water and Cambie Streets, whose movement and ‚Äúchimes‚Äù are stream driven.A word of caution while exploring this relatively compact area, wandering very far east, beyond Main Street, or South, beyond Hastings Street, the neighborhood deteriorates quickly.

title: Good place to have dinner
reviews: This is about 1km from waterfront station.Plenty of bars to hangout. One most popular is called local. There is a big queue to find a place to sit outside.there is a place where homeless people hang around near local

title: Wandering
reviews: Interesting place to just wander around. Nice buildings to look at and a range of places to eat. Very nicely kept streets with lovely hanging baskets, etc

title: Famous Gastown
reviews: What do I say? It's a famous place where we should see. There are good restaurants and bars where you can see high class people enjoy. We felt safe and were pleasant to walk around and took pictures. Don't go to the China Town nearby. It's another world in a not very good sense.

title: Definite Highlight
reviews: I am more of a pub type person than fine dining so this place suited perfectly. There is a casual vibe and the weather was perfect for sitting outside. Interesting history and nice old buildings. Plenty of choices for food and drink. You must see the steam powered clock!

title: Funtimes
reviews: Interesting shops of different types. An old world feel in a modern city. Great restaurants with wonderful food and atmosphere. Thoroughly enjoyed strolling the streets.

title: Excellent involvement
reviews: I love to visit Gastown. Shopping and restaurants all over the place. Lots of fun surrounds it. Recommend to visit the gas town.

title: unique vibe
reviews: I love the energy in the area very vibrant. Gastown has lots of small shops and places to eat. Don't forget to check out the clock.

title: Historic and Hopping
reviews: This place reminded me of Boston with its historic buildings and pubs a plenty.  Very crowded and clearly THE place to be after 5 pm.  Great little shops and restaurants everywhere and the architecture is fantastic.  We were warned about panhandlers and did encounter one individual who seemed unstable but otherwise, a great evening I'll long remember

title: Quaint area of town
reviews: There is quite a bit of history in this area - highlights being the steam clock and the statue of Gassy Jack. A few spots to eat and plenty of shops -especially if you are looking for gifts to take home. A different vibe than other areas of town. A couple of nice high end galleries too for viewing First Nations art work. Need to stay on main street really- some less than savory activity going on if you take it a block or two too far off that. Fun to see the Steam Clock "chime" and the cruise ships leaving port.  Not sure I would want to be in this area at night time since we notice drug dealing and homeless population in the very early am on our first pass through.

title: Interesting site
reviews: Mixed crowd Homeless, Drug abusers & Tourists. Want beggars? People lying on the sidewalks? Druggies? The "famous" Clock? All available in Gastown.  Pretty safe when you consider all the security, private & the Police. Also some very good restaurants in this area as well as Tourist "shops"

title: Loved this area of Vancouver
reviews: My wife and I were in Vancouver for a couple days and just really fell in love with Gastown.  It is lined with shops and great restaurants and bars.  You have to see the Steam Clock and Gassie Jack statue also.  The Steam Clock sounds every 15 minutes with a full song played at the top of the hour and whistles for every hour of the day.   We also did the Gastronomic Food Tour of Gastown to begin our time in Vancouver and found it to be filled with history and great food and drink with Tracy as our guide.  Had a happy hour with small plates and a couple drinks at The Flying Pig.

title: Super cute, but be careful when you turn the corner
reviews: Gastown is a super cute area there are lots of good restaurants and bars with patio seating. There were also a lot of trendy shops. Be careful, however, when wandering around. Take a wrong turn towards China Town and you are quickly in an area where tons of people (you can‚Äôt even imagine how many people there were) are openly doing drugs and where used needles are strewn about. It‚Äôs definitely not an area I‚Äôd want to be in after dark; it was really unsettling to be there in daylight.

title: Filthy
reviews: This 'town' is full of drugs and criminals. Spent one night here and a car was burnt out on the sidewalk by morning. It's super sketch. And that annoying steam clock. Ugh.

title: Not what I expected!
reviews: So cute to walk the cobble stone streets so much to see! Its a must if your in VancouverWalking a lot of walking.

title: Fun Neighborhood
reviews: Fun neighborhood to walk about.  Lots of shops and cafes and pubs. Lots of people watching Be sure to see the steam clock.  Small enough, this neighborhood is easily explored in an afternoon.

title: Steam Clock
reviews: This area of Vancouver is unique. There are a lot of shops. The best part of this area is a steam clock. The clock goes off every quarter hour and at the hour it plays a melody. I was so impressed.

title: Vancouver's vibrant commercial center
reviews: Gastown, busy, vibrant, and exploring....Whatever you prefer Gastown has it all from excellent dining, coffee shops, travel info The Gastown steam clock, or  just the souvenir shopping, Gastown is a place for activity.

title: Eclectic Gastown in Vancouver, BC
reviews: This neighborhood is the original center of Vancouver. It presently houses a little bit of everything, from tourist shops and local restaurants to beautiful condos and offices and some glimpses of poverty. If you walk too much west you will end up in the Downtown Eastside neighborhood famed for poverty, homelessness and drug use. A unusual attraction is the steam powered clock.

title: Nice area
reviews: Very nice area in Vancouver. It is the oldest part of town. Many bars, restaurants and shopping. Have to see the steam clock on Water Street.

title: Amazing place
reviews: Gastown for me is like Italy. I love the streets, the steam clock, lots of shops especially souvenir shops. If you‚Äôre in Gastown, you can‚Äôt stop walking and touring the whole town. Never forget to stop by the steam clock and take a picture on it. It is close to Canada Place and Lookout Tower. I highly recommend this town.

title: Well worth a visit
reviews: Gas town is well worth a visit if only to see the Steam Clock which plays a short tune every 15 minutes. Plenty places to eat and drink at reasonable prices. Souvenir hunters paradise.

title: QUAINT AND FUN
reviews: You go to see the Steam clock, and wait for the quarter and half hour to hear it.  There are also lots of eateries around.

title: Good for a wander
reviews: Main attraction of the Gastown area is the steam clock. There are a few shops and restaurants around but unless you stop for a meal or a coffee I can‚Äôt see that you can spend too long here it‚Äôs not a huge area.

title: Great clock
reviews: This area has a charm of it‚Äôs own. It has a clock that works by gas which was very interesting, steam comes out of the top üòä

title: Great food choices in Gastown
reviews: After spending the day at Granville Island we headed downtown to the Gastown district.  There are many excellent restaurants to choose from.  We went to Joe Forte's for dinner.  It was excellent.

title: Pretty street area
reviews: There are lots of local shops, bars and restaurants and the street furniture is very well done ( lamp posts , flower baskets, etc.) but its really only one street to walk up and down so nice but not essential.

title: A variety of things
reviews: Gastown is an interesting place.  Lots of food choices and shops that mix old, new and a boho type feel.  Architecture was great.

title: Clock and shopping
reviews: There are two attractive most appreciated: the clock that blowout vapor and a music every 15 minutes and the small shops along the Main Street

title: Great Place to stroll
reviews: Gastown  area is a great place to stroll around with many different shops and restaurants. Many of top restaurants in Vancover are in this area.

title: Touristy area of city center .
reviews: Pleasant place to walk around the old part of Vancouver. The walk from the ferry terminal to the gas town statue is quite pleasant. The city reminds me of Sydney, Australia‚Äôs ‚Äú the rocks‚Äù district . Lots of shops, restaurants and stores selling products that cater to tourists . Good for a 1-2 hour wonder and for a quick photo stop at the hissing clock on the hour. Be forwarned that beyond the statue of gassy John or jack, that part of town is not recommended as it is full of homeless people and beggars . The smell of the place as well as the graffiti and unkempt streets are signs that you should not wander into this district . You have been warned

title: Great restaurants and bars
reviews: If you only walk through Gastown you will see lots of interesting things. If you try out a bar or two you will soak up the atmosphere with the locals. If you dine somewhere along the Main Street you will enjoy good food, good atmosphere and be part of the Gas town experience.

title: Shops and restaurants
reviews: Another rebuilt neighborhood that has many shops and restaurants, with some residential properties added in. But Gastown has the steam clock, and that is unique.

title: Top little tourist spot
reviews: Loved the quirky atmosphere of Gastown Vancouver, interesting shops and restaurants. Very pretty and clean strip.

title: Interesting place
reviews: Lots of history here.  Cobblestone streets, statue of Gassy Jack and steam driven clock.  Lots of shops from boutiques to tourists shops.

title: walking tour around gastown
reviews: I toured around Gastown 3 or 4 times at night because I was staying very close to this area of town. I saw the steam clock and ate at several local restraunts in the area. Very cool area to do sight seeing.

title: It was great to see
reviews: It was great to see The Steam Clock and the statue of Gassy Jack. There are some good eating and drinking places. There's small shops and unfortunately yet again to many Canadian Gift shops.

title: Gas town
reviews: Fun area to visit and shop in.  Lot's of history and quaint buildings.  Wear good walking shoes and keep an umbrella handy

title: A must place to visit in vancuover
reviews: Gastown  a place of lots of restaurant n the famous  steam clock , one of the highlight in vancouver...The streets are arranged with bouquet of flowers and a must try restaurant in old spaghetti factory..

title: Amazing Gastown
reviews: This is a great place to visit while in Vancouver....old part with the famous gas clock which comes to life on the hour.

title: Touristy area with lots of smaller shops
reviews: We ventured through Gastown with two kids in strollers during mid afternoon.  The streets were fairly packed with people.  There were a good variety of shops lining both sides of the streets.  The steam clock is...what you expect a steam clock to be like.  There were large crowds around it, so it was difficult to navigate around it, and definitely not special enough to try to push a stroller to the front.There were many restaurants and bars open with patios, but we did not stop in any of them.

title: The Steam Clock is spectacular
reviews: The clock is not spectacular in stature, but fun to watch gear up to whistle its tune. Plus lots of shops to satisfy all kinds of shoppers. We had a fun afternoon walking about. And we stopped for a snack and beer at Steamworks which was great. The most difficult was parking but we found a garage that was reasonable. Parking in Vancouver in general is easy but can be expensive and tricky - you can download an app to pay and it reminds you to either pay more if you‚Äôre there longer than planned but they tow pretty quickly. Not a lot of wiggle room.

title: Fun this Summer
reviews: We had a great time hoping on and off the city bus, eating, shopping, and looking at the architecture!

title: Vancouver‚Äôs Original And First Neighbourhood
reviews: It all began here in Gastown just over 150 years ago - Vancouver‚Äôs original and first neighbourhood.Today, Gastown is an eclectic part of Downtown Vancouver with its chic shops, cafes and restaurants.The Clock which ‚Äúlet‚Äôs of steam‚Äù defines Gastown and is a popular venue for tourists to visit.I have visited Gastown on each of my previous visits to Vancouver going back to 1990.A brief visit this afternoon in pretty warm weather. Thronged with tourists and ‚ÄúHop On Hop Off‚Äù trolley buses.

title: Pre Cruise Experience
reviews: Very entertaining in this area. Lots to do and the History is Great! The Steam Clock and the intersection at the statue was thrilling.

title: Typical tourist destination
reviews: We were here years ago and it seemed to be more interesting then.  Way too many souvenir stores selling the same  tourist trinkets at exactly the same price.The gas clock is interesting, a marvel of its time.There are lots of restaurants /coffee shops.We did climb up a stairway to a beautiful native art store, unfortunately I don't remember the name. But huge,unique art pieces. Very expensive and the lovely lady who explained it all to us knew we weren't buyers but treated us if we were great clients.The unnerving thing were the drug needles in the  gutters. Not one or two, watch your step. We really didn't expect this, but it's a big city, and time has changed. Unfortunately.

title: Small area downtown to walk around
reviews: We decided to drive into downtown and have a look round on a Sunday. It was fairly quiet and there was loads of parking places on meters and lots of car lots, if you are prepared to walk about 10 minutes you can pay just ¬£1 per hour on the meters. Nice old part of town to look round, interesting Steam Clock and buildings. Plenty of shops and places to eat.

title: Lovely part of Vancouver
reviews: This area of vancouver is very nice, one of the oldest I believe. We visited the steam clock, where you can see inside the mechanism that runs it. We were lucky enough to visit when the guy who maintains it was there.

title: Gastown
reviews: I was a bit disappointed with Gastown. Not sure what I expected. The steam clock is worth seeing and there are lots if tourist shops

title: Not sure what the fuss is all about
reviews: So there is a steam clock.... and lots of souvenir shops... it‚Äôs lovely.... but I am still trying to work out why it is a tourist attraction. There is nothing wrong with it...

title: did not have a lot of time
reviews: my loss    this is a small area that we hopped off     the hop on hop off bus  very cool area our loss we only  could hang around a few hours     its a great area to stop in and eat   a great area to walk around a bit    you could spend a half a day

title: Famous Neighborhood in Vancouver
reviews: Festive ambiance with many shops bars and restaurants. Many landmarks like the unique street lamps, gassy eddy statue, steam clock. Visit one of the bars in the street.

title: Buzzing
reviews: Great for brunch or dinner. Good food and vibes. Busy for lunch when cruise shops are in town, which is a lot in summer.

title: Vacation
reviews: Gastown is a quaint little place to visit. The shops were fun to walk through and the restaurants smelled delicious. We ate at The Flying Pig. Don‚Äôt forget to visit the steam clock!

title: Cool place to walk around
reviews: We enjoyed this part of Vancouver. Wide variety of shops and bars to choose from and a cool vibe.A bit congested on a Saturday but by no means unreasonable. Well worth a visit. Time well spent.

title: A vibrant area in the evening
reviews: This area is bustling with people in the evening. The old gas clock is fascinating. There are lots of good pubs and restaurants. We didn't feel unsafe.

title: Good place to wander
reviews: Spent our first evening walking around this area. Lots of bars and restaurants and of course the famous Steam clock.

title: Restaurant & Bar Centric Part of Town
reviews: Historic gentrification has made this a hot spot to eat & drink in. Close to everything in town or Uber it. Had fabulous seafood meal with wonderful white wine.

title: If you have time...
reviews: Many shops and some very nice restaurants/pubs in this area.  The shops are very tourist-focused, and the prices reflect that - so beware!  Your best deals on Canadian syrup is in the food market, and you can get better quality t-shirts, wseatwhirts, etc. in other areas.

title: Good shopping/ restaurants
reviews: There was more boutique type shopping in this area and several restaurants to choose from. Great area to spend the day or evening and see the Steam Clock!

title: Touristy
reviews: Fun old historic neighborhood. Steam clock was great. Try to hit the top of the hour for best clock show. Busy and very touristy. Some interesting shops and souvenir stores.

title: Gassy Jack and the Clock
reviews: Worth taking the time to look at the clock and statue of Gassy Jack and have a look at the shops selling a mixture and smart and tat.  The walk from our hotel on Beatty Street took us through an area with lots of itinerant people, which was a bit uncomfortable although apart from a couple of beggars none of them bothered us.

title: All about the clock
reviews: Fun activity around a steam clock!  But after the clock ,  not much else but coffee / cocktail time.  There are lots of options for refreshments.  Not a lot of time needed here,  just stay for a serenade on the hour by the neat steam clock,  that you don‚Äôt want to miss .

title: Bit of a tourist trap.
reviews: Having spent 6 nights in Vancouver, we ventures out for some lunch in Gastown. And how disappointed were we?!Tried a couple of pubs that were a bit sad. Had to try 4 restaurants before wee could eat something. 1. Menu different to the website and nothing likeds. The flying Pig2. No crab. Rodney‚Äôs oyster bar3. Not interested in serving us as they had a big party in from a cruise ship. Al Porto. 4. Steam works. Ate here. Good beer. Average food.

title: Gastown Is Old Town
reviews: There are many art galleries, restaurants and stores to shop.  The steam clock is always a great place to meet people.  Blood Alley is also a unique area.  You are also very close to China Town so do not miss that area.

title: Visiting it just once is enough.
reviews: I took a photo of it and.. that was it. There's nothing else around it. I've seen a restaurant with long lines.. still don't know what it is.

title: Charm and character
reviews: We visited Gastown in the evening and it was charming. Twinkle lights in the trees and cool architecture. The shops looked fun but were closed when we were there. I would love to visit again!

title: Worth the steam clock visit
reviews: Our waterfront hotel was just a couple of blocks from old town. Like everybody we went looking for the steam clock. Cool. But even better was the museum of indigenous native art. Do not miss it. On the way back watched a couple of photo ad shoots. Truly a wonderful urban exploration.

title: Great individual places
reviews: Lots of quirky independent shops n restaurants, no sign of prejudice, lovely place to stroll and get ride if the city worries.

title: CHARACTER FILLED
reviews: While only encompassing a relatively small section of town, the cobble stone streets, the ornate ancient warehouses, the fenced in streets all lead to an impressive yesteryear ambiance. The steam clock and statue denote the era of this locale. Bejjng on the door step of China town we found the whole area of interest. An ideal location for restaurants and night clubs. Both centres are with in walking distance of Vancouver city.

title: Lovely
reviews: Walking around down town Vancouver and it was lovely but we were very  tired after our arrival. Gastown was just different enough to pep us back up. Somehow a little special, a little old style. Steam clock was very pretty and nice to watch. (didn't appreciate the guy posing as an information guide then hitting you up for $$$$) plenty of restaurant options. Plenty of tourist stores. Just a special little area very close to the water.

title: Definitely check it out
reviews: This is a nice place to shop and eat. There are many shops and restaurants to choose from. You can shop both for souvenirs and boutique shops.

title: Grotty, smelly and touristy
reviews: After 2 days of sightseeing in gorgeous Vancouver, we thought we should go and see Gastown. How hideous!Basically Gastown consists of one strip of shops a couple of blocks long with the majority being really cheap and nasty tourist shops. Loads of pubs (that actually looked quite good) but why would you bother when Vancouver is full of pubs?But it was crack heaven. We couldn't walk a couple of metres before being accosted by someone wanting money. And the smell is horrendous - piss and crap in every doorway and laneway. Empty shops galore and I can see why. And for your own safety, DON'T stray off the main street because it is 10 times worse on any of the adjacent streets as you move away from the harbour - more crackheads, empty shops and boarded up buildings. But the thing that gets me is that everyone lines up to see the Steam Clock which was built to replicate an 1850s original was actually built in the 1970s (to fool the tourists I suspect) and the "cobbled" streets are just new pavers laid poorly enough to jump out of the road every time a car drives by.The best thing about Gastown is the gorgeous 1914 Waterfront Station which was beautifully restored inside and the John Fluevog store with its amazing interior architecture and out of this world shoes.I note that some people who visited in the same week as me have left fabulous reviews but I honestly can't imagine how anyone could enjoy what we saw today.

title: May Stroll in Gastown
reviews: When in Vancouver, one place to visit of interest is Gastown.As you stroll along the street you pass interesting buildings including well stocked gift shops for all your souvenirs of Vancouver, some great pubs where you can enjoy lunch whilstwatching the world go by and lots of cafe's.

title: Great spot for for lunchtime dining
reviews: Having discovered this charming street and its unique steam clock on our second day in Vancouver, we also found it a great spot for lunch which prompted us to go back again on another day for a further excellent choice of dining.

title: Very cool neighborhood
reviews: This neighborhood has some fun shopping and some fabulous restaurants.  It is easily walkable and is also on the hop on hop off bus route.  It should not be missed!!

title: NICE but not enough interest
reviews: good place to kill a couple of hours but certainly NOT a destination onto itself.  A few interesting stores, La Difference (a great SHOE store) a few restaurants & your done.Oh yea, the obligatory t-shirt shops.

title: Interesting to walk around for some
reviews: There was a breakfast restaurant we wanted to try in Gastown (I believe) but the line was about an hour out, so I took the family to "downtown," Gastown close to the Steam Clock.  It was quite unique and we arrived at the Clock close to the top of the hour.  Didn't wait long to see the steam and sounds of the clock.  Learn a bit of history of the clock from the fellow Gastownian.  That was very cool in itself.After the Clock, we found ourselves wondering through the beautiful streets, stores, and restaurants for a couple more hours.....   Ate at Tacofino and it was AMAZING!  known for the chicken tacos and fish tacos.  You'll have to try it. You won't be disappointed.

title: A must visit when in Vancouver
reviews: Yes, it‚Äôs a bit touristy...but if you‚Äôre in this city,  no visit would be complete without walking down Water Street. Take a picture with the steam clock and pop in some of the stores along the way. You don‚Äôt need a day to take it all in...but a couple of hours should suffice.

title: Interesting neighborhood
reviews: I visited this area twice on my free day here and was impressed by the way it had been carefully restored meeting the character of times gone by. Plenty of small shops and restaurants to visit, and the Steam Clock played a tune every fifteen minutes. It looks fairly old but only dates back around 40 years to when Gastown was restored.

title: Quirky & Fun
reviews: Gastown has everything! Great places to eat & shop & a great atmosphere. I felt safe walking around on my own. It‚Äôs easy to get around by foot & the Steam Clock is amazing!

title: Funky and fun
reviews: We go to Gastown every time we visit Vancouver. Good restaurants and variety of shops. My favorite jewelry store is Artina's which specializes in hand crafted Canadian jewelry. We navigate to Water Street Cafe for lunch, great food and fun people watching. The steam clock always draws and crowd, the best show is on the hour. It does get crowded. Some nice galleries, well worth a good browse. It is waterfront so good views. Fun place to stroll with seating available.

title: Vancouver, BC
reviews: Welcome into a true historical part of the city located in downtown Vancouver.Choose from a variety of shops, restaurants, cafes & bars.  Truly something for everyone.  Multitude of sovenier shops & gift shops. Also home to our very own Vancouver Whitecaps Soccer Club offices.  Experience the ambience of a walk through this unique & amazing part of town.  Every night at 9pm watch as the historical steam clock chimes with music.   Are you a believer? Try something new & book a walk through the "Haunted" section of town.   With something for almost every age group, plenty of paid parking available........spend an afternoon enjoying a truly amazing tour of all of it.    Enjoy !!!!

title: Not for me
reviews: Didn't really find it interesting. Overflow from East Hastings. Give me davie St anytime,far more relevant and with a lot of good restaurants, shopping and bars.

title: Don't stray from the Tourist area
reviews: Parked at Abbott St. and Hastings St in outdoor lot, 1 hr. $4.00.  Very sketchy area. Walked down Abbott St. to Cordova and passed a person surrounded with paraphernalia and garbage strewn about sitting in a door way on Abbott St.  If you look on a map this area is still considered Gastown, so have situational awareness and don't stray off the beaten path.  Gastown is an historic old area of Vancouver with interesting restaurants, pubs, gift shops and the still working steam clock.  Worth visiting, stay in the tourist area.

title: Step back in time!
reviews: Vancouver has done a fabulous job keeping Gastown in its' original atmosphere:  buildings, sidewalks, streets.  BUT the traffic through there was a bummer.  Late lunch at "Local" restaurant.  Very good food and beer.  Worth spending a couple of hours walking the neighborhood.

title: A good place to scroll, shop, eat and relax
reviews: The street is not that long... still, one can take a couple of hours to just slowly scroll and look around. It‚Äôs pretty interesting to see the crowd stand around the landmark steam clock to chime üòÇ

title: Historic part of Vancouver
reviews: Walking distance from our hotel we experienced the many tourist shops and were happy with the prices on offer.The gas clock is worth waiting to see.Best time is on the hour.Many tourists "flock to the clock ",so get a good spot.Plenty of restaurants for lunch and dinner and a short walk to the cruise ship terminal and other attractions.

title: Fun, funky historic neighborhood near the waterfront
reviews: A short walk from the heart of downtown, the shops and pubs in this neighborhood remind me of Chelsea in New York or Old Montreal. The shops close down at a civilized hour, but the nearby university housing means it remains lively after dark.

title: Good restaurants and bars
reviews: Well worth visit for tourists. Many bars and restaurants like Old Spaghetti Factory where we had a good lunch.

title: Quaint souvenir shops!
reviews: If you are looking for souvenirs, this is the place to be!! They have quite an array of souvenirs with great unique designs you wont find anywhere else!

title: Well Worth Checking Out
reviews: Gastown is a very quirky part of Vancouver, and definitely worth visiting at least once.  The gas powered clock always has a crowd, but sticking around to see it's steam song is quite amusing.  Most of the shops on the main street are tourist gift shops of varying quality and price, but there are some good catches to be found if you're willing to explore.  This part of town also hosts plenty of alternative fashion stores if you get off the main street as well.

title: A look-back in time
reviews: Quaint shopping and eating area.  The steam clock if a novelty left from the past.City should do more to clean the area up...

title: Gastown
reviews: Nice place to visit. Don‚Äôt forget the Saloon where Jack stands and the one and only steam engine clock.

title: Clock is very small
reviews: The clock is small and easy to miss.  Great selection of restaurants and pubs.  This is probably one of the cleanest areas of Vancouver.

title: Enjoyable
reviews: Enjoy strolling around this section of Vancouver. There is a lot of history here and always finding something new. Plenty of shops and eateries to go into. Nice area of Vancouver to spend an afternoon.

title: quaint
