reviews: i wish i had more time to see it  it was one of the places on our city tour . i loved the stem clock if you don't see anything else  you must see this

title: Sightseeing
reviews: Walked to Gas town after a meal. Lots of bar and restaurants close by. People gather to watch the steam clock go off. That‚Äôs about all you there is to do.

title: Too busy, unpleasant
reviews: Went there 20 years ago when it was more open. Now rather nasty. Nothing to see but the steam clock and that's not very impressive.You can spend 10 minutes here and then move on.

title: Funky part of town
reviews: When visiting Vancouver, this is definitely a spot to hit with lots of history and a wide variety of shops, bars and places to eat for all tastes. Don‚Äôt miss the Vancouver Steam Clock and the Gassy Jack Statue but there is much more to see and do and eat. This area is easily walkable and you don‚Äôt need a tour necessarily at all. We did do a food tour which took us to several very good places we probably wouldn‚Äôt have found by ourselves.

title: Fun, vibrant neighborhood
reviews: Gastown has fun shops and pubs.  Be sure to be at the steam clock at the top of the hour for a special show.  Very walkable.  We were there until 9:00 PM on a Sunday and there were plenty of people out.  Some shops were open late.

title: Old Vancouver
reviews: Many shops and restaurants.  It is a tourist area with highlights being the old steam clock and Gassy Jack. People line up to watch the old clock go off every 15 minutes. It is convenient to both Chinatown and downtown. It is a good place to eat.

title: My Town
reviews: On a cruise to the Great White North? well first stop is Gastown, Gassy Jacks town to be correct.Yes it is a tourist trap with all the trappings but it is fun to see the steam clock and visit one of the many great restaurants. We always make sure we stop in Gastown when we visit the mainland. Gastown is also on the way to visit Chinatown one of the largest in North America. Visit you will find hat you really did enjoyed it.

title: A Must stop in Vancouver
reviews: The On Off Trolly has two stops here.  A nice assortment of shops, restaurants, and history.  When in Vancouver a good place to shop, eat and people watch.

title: Walk
reviews: Gasto en is a beautiful vintage place to go and walk, but souvenirs and take pictures. A lot of nice stores with curiosities and good restaurants! 100% recommended!!

title: Enjoyable
reviews: Enjoyed walking around gas town - nice restaurants around here. The gas/ steam clock was cool to see working.

title: Tourist Location with a little History added
reviews: A must to visit when in Vancouver, the iconic Steam Clock makes for some impressive photos ( night time the best) old fashioned cobbled stone streets and late century architecture mixed with plenty of tourist shops all selling the same Made in China T shirts, jumpers and souvenirs. Walking further along the street you will find trendy little bars, restaurants and local designer shops. Along the end the is a Statute of the Famous Gassy Jack to which the area is named and opposite him you can‚Äôt miss the apartment building built right on the corner shaped like a triangle. I felt very safe here day and night walking around and if i correctly remember the shops open till late so good for a visit after a day out.

title: Steam clock
reviews: Depending on what you want a great walk along the cobblestone streets. Very busy place lots of shops and eating places and of course the steam clock try and get there on the hour .

title: Drop by if you're in the area
reviews: Gastown is conveniently located in downtown Vancouver so if you're in the area, make a trip there.The first thing you will notice is how beautifully Gastown is designed and built. You will be amazed at the architecture of the buildings.Located in Gastown are many souvenirs shops, restaurants and art galleries but the main attraction is the Steam Clock and the "Gassy" Jack statue. You won't need more than a couple hours to walk through Gastown and back.

title: Canada 2018
reviews: Great day in Gastown certainly worth a look great shopping and eateries Highly recommended Checkout the steam clock!!Garry and Jo Harris

title: Look beyond the tourists and the hipsters for Vancouver's shame
reviews: It's all very interesting and charming, as everyone says. Walk beyond it to E. Hastings St, and see the tragic truth where the gentrification ends. The drugs capital of Canada, with the heartbreaking zombie addicts lying or staggering in the streets. No threat of harm, not even much begging, just hopelessness and a sense you've entered one of the circles of Hell. Read about the historical reasons behind all this, and the inability of the city, the province and the state to work together on a solution.

title: Nice place to walk around
reviews: My wife and I needed to just walk after being on a plane for the better part of the day. Gastown was a great walk. Beautiful architecture and interesting shops and restaurants / bars. Also great for people watching. The clock is interesting to see....as we got further from the cruise ship port it got a little rough feeling but never felt unsafe.

title: Must See the Clock ...
reviews: Gastown is an eclectic place with a lot of interesting shops and restaurants.  Well worth the walk to check out the steam clock.

title: Rough at one end
reviews: Last visited many years ago.Has become a little too touristy.Gas clock remains a feature!Tourist shops, eateries, drinkeries and a smattering of other merchandise.

title: Great spot for food & drinks
reviews: Visited Gastown twice during my visit, the first time we went, we simply walked around, checked out the steam powered clock (and hear its unique chime), learnt about the area‚Äôs history and admired the buildings. We also stopped into The Old Spaghetti Factory for lunch which was a real gem, although we sat outside in the sun, inside is a classic tram artfully dividing up the restaurant, available to sit in for a little something different. The second time we visited we tried a couple of the bars and had dinner, it has a great evening atmosphere, the Local was a good spot, nice food and great drinks menu with several local beers. Sitting on a cross section of the area it‚Äôs a great spot to while away the evening with a drink.Also worth noting you can walk from here to the Vancouver Lookout or 1 Canada Place where tour buses start and is the location of FlyOver Canada.

title: Awesome Place
reviews: Beautiful historic area, Lots of shops and restaurants, parks, lots of history/building architecture , and amazing to watch people making there way to a street corner, to hear one of the only working Steam clocks, that blow a steam whistle every 15 minutes on the quarter hour, and a full tune one the hour.

title: Loved the feel and design
reviews: Gastown has a great feel and is designed like a French revival street, cobbles and old lamp lights. The steam clock is a must see, but go on the hour to hear the full set of chimes. Easy to wander and pop into the shops. Watch out if you go too far down and across, you tend to wander into a homeless shelter with quite a few people on the streets sleeping rough. Although we felt safe.

title: Pretty For a Stroll at Night!
reviews: We visited Gastown to see the Steam Clock and it seemed like a quaint and pretty area.  For the most part, the walk was great!  We found a couple of  shops to shop in and we ate at a nice restaurant.  I loved the brick streets and the lights in the trees.  We enjoyed our time walking and looking.  Yes, more homeless people scattered throughout each block.  We saw some unique shops which must only be open during the day, but, window shopping is always fun.  A few Canada souvenir shops were open that were fun to browse through. I noticed there is a lot of traffic going down the one main street.  It's a very popular area evidently as it was pretty crowded at all the eating areas.  You may need reservations at most of the restaurants.

title: Cool hip community
reviews: Hung out in Gastown which is a cool hipster community. Lots of shops and  and cool eateries. Our Favorite was ‚ÄúLocal‚Äù great food, nice outdoor patio.

title: Looking run down
reviews: Dirty and run down. I used to live on 300 block of Water St. So I get the vibe and all the DTES dynamics. But something has changed... the businesses seem fine, but if I didn‚Äôt know better, I would say there was a garbage strike on.

title: Lovely part of Vancouver
reviews: Took a shuttle to Gastown and was pleasantly surprised.  Lovely cobblestone roads and plenty of nice shops to spend an hour or so.

title: Must Visit
reviews: It can be a bit touristy and dirty, but it has a lot of character. There are lots of independent fashion shops as well as many places to grab a drink or a bite to eat.

title: A stroll around the old part of Vancouver.
reviews: As we are staying out at Dunbar, we got a trolly bus into city ( currently you must have coins or prepaid pass). Walked from Robson St. Then walked down to convention centre and main tourist information office. It was only a 15 minuets walk to the start of Gastown, with all the old buildings ( worth going into old railway station to take a few photos on your way).The steam clock is the highlight of the area, it is a magnificent piece of machinery. You need to see it, at the quarter hour but best on full hour, if you are early you can have a coffee at Starbucks which is on opposite corner.The is plenty public transport close to this area if you don‚Äôt want to walk to far.

title: Tourist Area
reviews: This is a tourist destination and the shops in the area reflect that. Here you get just about any type of souvenir that you want - from tacky pins, mugs and T-shirts to the very nice original work. There is an excellent chocolate shop (Roger's) in the area and the Jade store just down from it is well worth visiting. There are also various restaurants and bars. Make sure that you take time to see the Gastown clock - if you are there at noon, the whistle is quite fun to listen to.

title: Gastown is a fun area
reviews: Really enjoyed visiting Gastown....full of shops..bars and restaurants. This should be high on your list of must visits in Vancouver.

title: Original Vancouver townsite
reviews: Gastown is a short walk from Canada Place. As expected, souvenirs stores, tchotchke stores, restaurants, bars, and galleries lined the streets. Though the city preserved some cobblestones paths, the area is compact and walkable. Historical old Victorian building facades were undergoing renovation. Highlight landmark was a working steam clock that blew smoke every 15 minutes. Though there were 3 cruise ships in the port, the crowds weren‚Äôt too bad.

title: Such a Bohemian little place
reviews: So much history in this little area...filled with tons of restaurants and shopping...felt quaint and was full of hustle and bustle...all sorts of little historic things located along the streets that you could stop and read about the area....would go back here in a heartbeat if ever in Vancouver again...

title: Interesting neighbourhood
reviews: Never a dull moment in gastown - every time I go we find a good place to eat and are never disappointed with the atmosphere or people watching - it‚Äôs great to have so many options with outdoor seating space to encourage people to interact

title: Character and shopping.
reviews: Roamed around here for a day. Great little shops, lots of dining choices and pubs, and fun atmosphere. This area has come a long way from the old gastown. Get you picture by the steam powered clock.

title: Shops and Restaurants
reviews: Gas Town is very walkable and has touristy shops and restaurants. This time There was a lot of construction going on making it not as nice as before. There were several places that had gone out of business and fewer shops with nice merchandise. Had several touristy shops carrying t-shirts jackets and souvenirs

title: A walk thru Gastown
reviews: Love this area. Lots of culture and learning opportunities! Read up on Gastown a little bit, it has a rich culture and diverse people. It has the feel of ‚ÄúIrish  part of Vancouver‚Äù. Lots of pubs and eatery. If you‚Äôre a fan of architecture, Gastown has a lot of old buildings.

title: Very neat area with great pubs and restaurants
reviews: The area has a fun atmosphere to it with lots of souvenir shops and pubs. Everything in the area is very young and hip and definitely a great place to spend an evening out with friends.

title: Seedy/pretentious
reviews: Just come back from a lovely stay in Sechelt, visited Gastown amongst all the other popular areas within Vancouver too. Bitterly disappointed with this place, the street lamps and a handful of shops are nice but overall unfortunately the area is ruined by the vast amount of homeless people pushing trolleys of their belongings around the streets and congregating on urine covered pavements to sell and take drugs. The sights were truly horrible, the amount of people I walked past with ‚Äòtrack lines‚Äô up their arms which had become infected, people missing limbs no doubt as a result of drug abuse, shouting, swearing and walking around not fully clothed was shocking. We genuinely felt unsafe, you take one wrong turn and you‚Äôre faced with some really disturbing sights. My only advice would be, yes go and see for yourself, go in broad daylight but definitely Don‚Äôt take kids. Anyone who failed to notice this on their trip must walk around with rose tinted specs!

title: Worth a visit
reviews: Even though I say worth a visit, be very wary when walking the streets, especially as it gets later, as you have this sense of feeling unsafe.  We were warned of some of the happenings in this area, and it certainly wasn't exaggerated.

title: Very cute neighborhood !
reviews: Definitely a nice place to visit and probably to live in too ! Went there while visiting Vancouver by bike with a couple of friends, stopped at the steam clock and in a bar: the atmosphere is indescriptible! Great area!

title: Overrated
reviews: Been there, done that. Wasn't worth the trip. The parking costs are much too high. We definitely expected more.

title: Must see
reviews: Find out the history. Bring your camera. Great historical buildings and ambience. Check out the many choices for food and drink. Take one of the guided tours offered.

title: Quaint
reviews: We enjoyed the trip to Gastown with its stone-cobbled streets, shops, and of course the steam clock.

title: Shopping
reviews: Lovely old world type of shops not too commercialised nice place just to have a wonder round,and nice eating places.

title: Old town charm
reviews: Delightful shopping and art galleries! We spent an afternoon just meandering through this little part of Vancouver!

title: Stroll in the evening
reviews: Walk along the waterfront towards canada place, passing along waterfront station, the steam clock and having an ice cream cone. keep an umbrella handy.

title: Interesting place!
reviews: Some great food choices near the harbor with some interesting sights. Lots of tourist shops. The steam clock is a must see, and the hop on bus is ok.

title: A delightful mix of history and modernity
reviews: Whether you are a local resident or visiting from elsewhere, plan to spend an afternoon walking in historic Gastown. There is ongoing restoration work but nevertheless you can find plenty to see, buy, and eat! A wide diversity of restaurants ensures that there is something for every palate, and similarly the retail shops are also fun to explore ! Bring family and friends.

title: Lots of restaurans and shops
reviews: The area is very touristy, but offers lots of choices for restaurants and shopping.  The steam clock is nice, although it's a new addition.

title: A little dirty for Vancouver
reviews: We were able to visit in the morning and again on another evening. Both times surprised us with dirty streets when all of Vancouver was so clean. Recommend checking out the shops and unique restaurants along the brick streets. Entertaining to see and hear all cultures coming together. It's directly on the Hop On Hop Off route.

title: A Few Tips About Gastown
reviews: An iconic neighborhood in Vancouver and one of the first to exist from the 1860‚Äôs.    A lively place with a mixture of interesting souvenir shops, confectionaries, art boutiques and inviting restaurants.  You know you are in Gastown when you see ‚Äúcobblestone streets,‚Äù and the famous ‚ÄúSteam Clock.‚Äù  A nickname to one of the original saloon owners known as ‚ÄúGassy.‚Äù The name ‚ÄúGastown‚Äù is a favorite visiting spot for both visitors and locals alike. Most of the original buildings were destroyed in the Great Vancouver Fire of 1886. A revitalization effort was begun in the 1960‚Äôs to preserve what you see before you.  There is still plenty of panache as you walk from one corner to another.On one corner is the famous ‚ÄúSteam Clock,‚Äù one of just a few still operating in the world.  A whistle goes off every 15 minutes.  Rarely will you ever have this corner by yourself as it is a favorite tourist mecca for selfies and videos. Gastown is located just a short distance from Canada Place where the Cruise ships dock.  We also enjoyed exploring Granville Island.   A farmers market is open every day selling most everything.  We enjoyed the curry soup at Veggie Express this past visit.  Walking around Gastown and Stanley Park were major highlights on our fourth visit to Vancouver.  Also recommend finding the Marine Building and the ‚ÄúZeppelin‚Äù relief sculpture.  A free bus, too, can be had at Canada Place to the famous Capilano Suspension Bridge which is located in north Vancouver.  The ride is free, but the entrance fee to the park will be around $30.  If you found this review ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù in any way, please press ‚ÄúLIKE‚Äù to let me know.

title: Must see
reviews: A good place to sit and have a drink or to just walk through, interesting history. The steam clock is unique, not sure if there is another anywhere else.

title: Beautiful historic area to stroll around
reviews: Now a very trendy area of restaurants and tourist shops, also quite a few galleries. The hop-on hop-off bus stops here just near the unusual steam clock.

title: There‚Äôs lots to see at Gastown!
reviews: We visited Gastown a couple of times during our latest visit to Vancouver. The Steam Clock is the main attraction. There are many restaurants, eateries and souvenir shops. Nearby Canada Place is worth a visit.

title: foodie haven
reviews: Vancouve's Gastown has a myriad of restaurants and bars located easy walking distance from each other and most downtown hotels. There are at least a dozen of the top restaurants in this area. Wander too far east and things might get a little more rough and raw than you might like, though not unsafe.. Home to everything form West Coast to BBQ and cocktails to craft beer. It's a Vancouver must see.

title: unique place to see
reviews: There is an amazing clock that whistles and blows steam.  The area is very quaint with great little shops

title: Love Gastown
reviews: Lots of great restaurants and very active part of town.  Water st cafe was fabulous and great location across from the steam clock.

title: Not so great anymore
reviews: Years ago gastown had some interesting shops and some nice restaurants. The last time I was there, it's mostly restaurants and a few souvenir shops. Too much traffic and too many rough types now. People using the alley for their drugs and their bathrooms. Like many other parts of Vancouver, gastown has lost it's charm. I wish the city would clean it up.

title: Definitely visit
reviews: Very pretty part of town, lots of neat shops and restaurants. The steam clock is a fun oddity. Do a bit of research before you go so you can fully appreciate the history.

title: Wonderful!
reviews: Very nice place to visit for just about anything from food to specialty shops. So many outdoor terraces that you can enjoy the outdoors weather permitting. We discovered so many treasures in the small stores that are endless!! My wife discovered a wonderful Italian fashion store, Poppy & Rye where the clothes were absolutely amazing! Many other stores all with their unique signatures. Really a nice place to visit!Enjoy

title: Yes...yes...yes
reviews: Gastown is quaint. Another must see not a hudge area but cute. Nice shops and restaurants. You won't regret

title: Yes
reviews: Of course if you are in Vancouver you have to visit Gastown and the clock!! Totally great! The town alone is safe and with many stores to shop too, over all I like the area and definitely I would visit again.

title: Maybe, maybe not!
reviews: We were told to go to Gastown so we did and walked around. The clock was very interesting. I think if we had been on a tour and heard the history of the area, it might have been worthwhile. Otherwise, I didn‚Äôt see much of interest or that I couldn‚Äôt have seen from the car.

title: The ‚Äústeam clock‚Äú town
reviews: A very nice street to buy souvenirs, clothes and shoes! There are many bars and restaurants and of course the big steam clock!!!

title: Wonderful city and a great vibe in Gastown
reviews: A must visit part of Vancouver. Great restaurants and bars. Close to the harbour, cruise terminal and hotels.

title: Loved it
reviews: Small but charming area. Nice tourist shops. Good bars. Steamclock is nice to see and hear. Not far from China Town.

title: Amazing photos
reviews: This area, with its original clock that pumps steam across the walkway every 20 minutes, is wonderful for photographers.  Especially at night, and with the cute lights all the way down the narrow little streets, it can remind you of Paris.  Loads of eateries and restaurants, you‚Äôll be spoilt for choice.  Lots of shops for trinkets and tourist gifts.  Interesting and worth a visit.

title: Interesting ... but not that much happening
reviews: It's not that large, but does have some interesting stores, boutiques, restos, galleries.  Great for a short walking tour on a sunny day.

title: Historical Street
reviews: Gastown is a restored to the area of the eighteen hundreds. Unique shops and restaurants portray early life in the city.

title: Good for a short visit
reviews: Old town flavor, shops and restaurants. Interesting for  a short visit and have lunch or dinner. Steam clock must see . We ate at the flying pig, friendly staff and good food

title: Don't forget to see the steam clock at the hour
reviews: Conveniently located near the downtown core area, it's an interesting place to visit especially the steam clock. Be sure to be there at the hour when it whistles and blows steam. The area has nice shops and restaurants although they could stay open a bit longer on Sundays given the number of tourists in the area. Be careful not to venture too far eastwards as it is adjacent to downtown east side which is not the safest place to be at night.

title: Ate dinner at Streamworks. Great vibes & friendly staff
reviews: Gastown in Vancouver is reminiscent of Gastown in San Diego. Not quite as large nor local hotels there but a lot of restaurants & ambience. FUN!

title: Not much to it.
reviews: We walked there not really knowing what we would find. We found a few restaurants. One was a small deli ran by two older men. The deli had a great view of the bay. We also found some unique shops. Thou mostly found tourist shops, chain restaurant. The architecture was nice. We saw the steam clock ring noon and one. The noon whistle is loud and nice.The neighbourhood reminded us of the exchange district in Winnipeg. Only Winnipeg‚Äôs is much larger and filled with more unique restaurants & shops.

title: Check the time, then watch your step
reviews: Very cheesy and tourist-y but in an entertaining enough way. The architecture does have loads of character and the steam clock is worth waiting to watch on the hour where it, uh, does its steamy thing like a sort of demented cuckoo clock. Beware, a few wrong turns in the direction towards China Town and you enter an area that contained the highest number of vagrants and drug abusers I've ever seen in my life, there must have been well over fifty individuals on the one street - and we're talking literally under a two minute walk from Gastown!

title: Amazing neighborhood
reviews: Cablestones,steam clock nice shops,Excellent restaurants,Gastown has everything you need to enjoy some quality time

title: Quaint and touristy
reviews: The steamClock is nice. And there are a few unique expensive shops around and some good coffee shops. But other than that it‚Äôs not much.

title: Evening walk
reviews: Gastown is the old town area of Vancouver with a lot of unique shops and trendy restaurants. The best way to time it is right at dusk as all of the old street lamps are beginning to be lit. It‚Äôs very close proximity to Canada Place. Go to Smart Mouth coffee then walk the shops. The restaurant scene is outstanding. Hard to suggest just one, but L‚ÄôAbattoir is unreal.

title: Fun area
reviews: Fun little area with plenty of food options and souivneer shops. Just be careful what streets you walk down as it can get rough quick with a full corner of junkies and homeless. About a 10-15 min slow walk back to Canada place from here

title: Nice Stroll
reviews: Excellent area to take a night walk. Very vibrant and well lighted. Pretty close walking distance to many attractions during the day time.

title: Alot of history
reviews: Between all the shops and restaurants there is alot to see here. Many different types of food to try here and big variety of shops to buy reminders of Vancouver here.

title: Beautiful historic site
reviews: Gastown is an unique urban area, which reveals some of Vancouver early architecture. It's located between downtown and Chinatown, so one can easily visit them on the same day. On its main street - Water  St. - there are good restaurants, such as The Old Spaghetti Factory and The Flying Pig, some bars and pubs, and lots of souvenir shops. One can also find beautiful local art there. At last but not least, the famous Steam Clock is a must ser attraction.

title: love this place
reviews: This part of town is so fun. Shops are nice, lots of food, and feels safe. We loved the skinny European Hotel building and the steam clock.

title: LIVELY PLACE ON A COLD FRIDAY NIGHT
reviews: Just walking around the area and peering into the restaurants and bars on a cold Friday night was a great way to experience Vancouver‚Äôs most historic area. I bumped into people, locals mainly, who were friendly and always cheerful.  Of course we met a couple of those drug people, but they kept mostly to themselves.If you want to get in to the popular joints for live music, come early. Many of them do not take on reservations.

title: Very cool area of Vancouver
reviews: We went to this area on our last day of a week-long Spring break. A very nice area situated on Water St, but also good places on Cambie, Cordova, Abbott and Hastings. You can get breakfast, lunch and dinner in a wide variety of price ranges. And yes there are some kitschy stores, but there are also some very cool stores with original art - First Nations and otherwise. Tip: Go to this area with plenty of time to wander and just take in all this quaint, old area has to offer.I included a pic of the Gassy Jack statue whom the area is named after...Google it for a bit of the history.Enjoy.

title: Charming district !
reviews: One of the things I love about Vancouver is how clean the city is, but after a few days visiting the pristine waterfront district, it begins to feel pretty sterile and lacking in local character.  Enter the Gastown district !  Granted, certain streets in this district are pretty gritty (lots of homeless, kinda dirty and several storefronts abandoned).  But, at the center (near the famous clock) is really charming and loaded with cool restaurants and bars.  Loads of older architecture, too, which is also a pleasant change from some of the more modern areas.  Worth checking out (though I was totally happy staying in a hotel in the more sterile neighborhood :) )

title: Wonderful part of Vancouver
reviews: My wife and I spent the Easter weekend in gastown and at waterfront. It's a beautiful part of the downtown area. The clock and all the shops are amazing. A lot of good restaurants in the area as well.

title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE GASTOWN
reviews: Full of Vancouver‚Äôs historic past married with high end shops and wonderful eateries.  You can‚Äôt visit Vancouver without spending some time in Gastown.  Gassy Jack would be surprised at how successful this area has become over the years.  It only seems to get better as time goes by.

title: Nice bit of history
reviews: I just had a wander through this part of Vancouver on a rainy morning, mainly to find the steam clock, but I found myself in love with the old architecture. It put me in mind of the "Rocks" region of Sydney, Australia. Thankfully, there are some good cafes and breakfast spots nearby, so for me, this was a great place to walk off some of the calories.

title: Gastown Vancouver
reviews: We had a lovely walk in Gastown which is a very old part of Vancouver. We loved the gas powered clock and all the interesting shops.

title: Historical Vancouver
reviews: This is a very charming part of Vancouver with its lights and steaming clock. There are a lot of eateries and souvenir shops, book shops etc.

title: Rainy day walk anout
reviews: This section of town is very cute. There are lots of stores for some local üõí shopping. The clock was impressive and was steaming really good in the rain. üåß We would suggest walking around to see all it had to offer.

title: Very evocative of a former age
reviews: Gastown is a great contrast to modern Vancouver, and it is a very pleasant walk going down Water St to the Steam clock, and then onto Gassy Jack statue. Lots of photo opportunities!

title: Mountie shop
reviews: This is a great place to visit if you are into Police Souviners. They have a great range of every thing. So things are dear and some are not depends on what you want

title: Dissapointing
reviews: I have to say that I am disappinted by the size of Gastown. It is practically only one street. It looks quite nice and is a must see in Vancouver, but it is small does not have much to do and there are a lot of drug addicts around.

title: Fascinating Neighborhood
reviews: Old Vancouver, lots of old warehouse and hotel buildings, places to shop, eat and drink.  Interesting architecture.  Very near the center.

title: March may not be the best month to visit
reviews: There were street buskars and several people ‚Äúcamping‚Äù on the streets. We were asked many times for a donation.

title: Gastown
reviews: Great area for bar hoping and dining, lots of unique establishments- our favourite was the Clough Club!

title: MY VISIT JULY 2017
reviews: very nice area near the port in Vancouver B.C., lot of shops for shopping and also have good are for eatables

title: O bairro bohemio e agravel
reviews: 5 stars by nigth. Goog places to eat or to drink. Amazing atmosphere. ‚ÄúWhat time is it?‚Äù Look the vap at clock at 4:20

title: Quite nice, actually
reviews: Pubs, shops, restaurants + old houses make Gastown an interesting area to visit. Sure, lots of tourists - so what. Pubs are full, atmosphere is great - so worth a visit.

title: Just beautiful
reviews: You have to visit gastown! So many sites to see, like the steam clock, the beautiful buildings and the cobble road! Great places to eat to!! And you can see the snowy mountains to and some of the city. So overall an awesome place to visit.

title: Lovely neighborhood
reviews: Great place to walk around and shop and sightsee. Lots of hustle and bustle. Lots of shopping and restaurants

title: Charming!
reviews: Very nice place to walk around! Unlike most major cities it is not always packed. You can find very nice restaurants in this area, however parking isn't easy.

title: Amazing streets
reviews: This is an amazing part of Vancouver, we went bar hopping on a Saturday night and found great places and a beautiful scenery.

title: Great
reviews: It was a great experience while roaming through down town .It takes us to the old city and history of Vancouver.Gas blowing clocküëç

title: Might work for a gluten free diner...
reviews: We were there with other families- most options for GF included dairy and tomatoes...so quite limited for this allergic patron...but that‚Äôs how it goes sometimes. Doesn‚Äôt mean I wouldn‚Äôt love to be able to twirl around in a nice bolognese though- it looked good!

title: Interesting area of Vancouver
reviews: We walked around the Gastown district of Vancouver and thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance.  Stopped at a great pub for a beer and a glass of wine to rest a bit.  I always love the historic areas of the cities I visit and Gastown was no exception.

title: Too touristy
reviews: Mostly restaurants and gift shops. Interesting architecture and history but needs more shops forLocals

title: It‚Äôs a Gas Gas Gas!
reviews: Vancouver‚Äôs vibrant Gastown area has undergone a major facelift in the past few years, with shiny brick building facades, trendy bars and restaurants, and eclectic stores for the sassy shopper. Where else can you sit and sip your latter with stunning water and mountain views while sea planes pass overhead. The steam clock is a novel attraction too!

title: Nice for an afternoon visit!
reviews: Lots of eclectic shops and eateries. Some very high end furniture stores. Perfect when you need some extra $6,000 bar stools! Suggest download the Vancouver parking authority mobile app. Easy to use when you realize the parking pay stations are nowhere to be found!

title: Nice eateries around the area
reviews: If you've ever been to downtown Seattle, you'll notice old buildings and small businesses all around. Gastown has that same feeling. It has a lot of really good eateries to check out (Bao Down, Sardine Can, Momo Sushi to name a few) and landmark places (Steamclock, Gassy Jack statue). I would recommend coming here during a nice sunny day. If you're into nightlife, there are some clubs around here, but I'm not familiar with them .

title: Definite Place to Visit
reviews: Lovely buildings, interesting history and heaps of souvineer shops.Can get very busy with tourists.Worth a visit.

title: Fun area to roam around in
reviews: The Gastown area is a really neat area of Vancouver. Of course there is also the steam clock which everyone likes taking their picture in front of. This is a great area to discover with lots of shops and restaurants.

title: Nice area to amble around, suberb souvenir / tourist tat shops
reviews: I used the Skytrain from the airport to go downtown between flights. I enjoyed my amble around the area, had a nice pint and bite to eat at The Cambie and found a fantastic array of superb souvenir tat shops - Canada/Vancouver fridge magnets, t-shirts and postcards as you'd expect, together with the obligatory maple syrup and sweets but the array of souvenir socks was a sight to behold. :-)

title: Loved Gastown
reviews: Gastown is such a cool part of downtown Vancouver.There are lots of funky restaurants, bars & shops.The steamclock was a real novelty! It goes off every 15 minutes.I particularly loved all the fairy lights.

title: Checking out surroundings from hotel
reviews: Wow, what an interesting street, full on neat shops, people all enjoying the atmasphear.So much fun seeing such cultural diversity in people‚Äôs stores, we loved it a local or tourist must do.Take an umbrella we had rain on top of rain. But worth getting a bit damp

title: Fun but a little touristy
reviews: Area with a nice vibe with cobblestone sidewalks. Lots of cafes and tourist shops, as well as some very expensive small boutiques. Worth a walk on a nice day.

title: Feels like Europe
reviews: Gastown is such a special place and is not to be missed on a trip to Vancouver. Walking down Water St feels like you are in Europe. The restaurants, pubs, and cafes in the area are fantastic.

title: Stroll in the park
reviews: I found out about this area from a previous visit. I wanted to find the steam clock, as it's where 50 shades of Grey was filmed! There tons of gift shops, hard to find a special need.

title: Evening Stroll in Gastown
reviews: Certainly a happening place in the evening. Lots of restaurants and bars to chose from. Great shopping.  The John Fluevog store in Gastown is what took me to the area. Gastown is a must see if taking a tourist moment in Vancouver.

title: Quaint Old World Area of Vancouver
reviews: Adjacent to Vancouver Harbor and containing beautifully treed lined streets with quaint architecture the famous Gas Clock this area is a must visit.

title: Sightseeing
reviews: Nice place to wander up and down and to see Gassy Jacks statue and to learn about him . Time on coach trips is always prohibitive in finding out lots about places .

title: Place of historic interest
reviews: Well known landmark steam clock is located right beside main tourist street. Both side are historic Victorian buildings with all kinds of restaurant, trendy pub with seafood and coffee shops, souvenir shops and art galleries. You can not visit Vancouver without this amazing, plentiful,delightful tourist attraction.

title: Love the historic feel
reviews: I love the feel, I would have loved to have more time to explore. The old cobblestone road and the Victorian style buildings, it just wants to make you dress up and become apart of the feel

title: Great!
reviews: What a great place to walk around. Love the nice streets with shops and restaurants. Really recommend this area!

title: Short Visit
reviews: On a drizzly evening, we (adult daughter and I in Vancouver for a hockey game) gandered a visit to the Steam Clock and the myriad souvenir shops. If you can't find the Canadian souvenir your heart desires in Gastown, it does not exist!

title: Great walk at night
reviews: After dinner we went and walked in that great neighborhood. It has a great feel and beautiful architecture. There is a large selection of restaurants and shops.You have to stop at the steam clock and wait for it to whistle every 15 minutes. Great experience and feel

title: In Gastown is the world-famous steam clock
reviews: My wife and I walked to Gastown where we spent the afternoon. Gastown is the oldest area of Vancouver Canada and is located just east of Canada Place. Gastown is where you'll find the old town of Vancouver with its heritage brick buildings, historic character, tourist shops and fine restaurants. It was transformed from what once was a grubby rough area into a popular tourist destination with popular shops and restaurants. Gastown's main thoroughfare, Water Street, is lined with quaint shops, including great tourist souvenir ones and excellent restaurants. The steam powered clock on Water Street is a Vancouver landmark and tourist attraction. It is powered by an underground steam system that also powers some of the nearby buildings. Gastown is a must for anyone coming through to Vancouver. With all the amazing restaurants, fun night life, and beautiful architecture, there is just so much to see and do here.

title: Small but quaint
reviews: A wonderful area to relax strolling the few streets that make up Gastown, the old-Vancouver".  There are numerous restaurants and (tourist) gift shops. One of the main points of attraction is the unique (one of 2) clocks driven by steam. Be there for the hourly steam whistles, which logically are there instead of bells.There are a number of business offices in the area as well. It has been become one of the prestigious areas for apartments close to the city.

title: Old Vancouver
reviews: Located not far from Canada place, we just walked and found that the area is nice to walk around. Lots of restaurants, fashion shops and souvenir shops. With all are old buildings, we were transformed to old times of Vancouver. Gastown should be in Vancouver itinerary.

title: A Tourist's Delight
reviews: As indicated above, the neighbourhood stretches from the rail station near Granville Street on the west to near Main Street on the east, but the center core is where Water, Carrall, and Alexander Streets intersect. From here you can see Gaoler's Mews, the Hotel Europe, the Byren's Block, Maple Tree Square, and the Gassy Jack statue, all of which have separate TripAdvisor entries. Food and drink establishments abound, with three blocks of schlock shops to your west. A word of warning, 'though - don't go too far east or south of this point after dark. If you want to walk to Chinatown from here, please do it in the daylight, or at least in a large group.

title: HIghlight of my Vancouver visit
reviews: For me, this was the best part of my Vancouver trip. There were things to see, explore, and enjoy during the day and night. Lots of cute shops and restaurants. Two of my favorite nighttime spots were Guilt & Co and The Flying Pig, which has a great happy hour. The neighborhood was highly walkable and safe. Gastown should be on every Vancouver itinerary.

title: Great place
reviews: An area very close to downtown that shouldn‚Äôt be missed. The gaslight lined streets are a photographers dream. Don‚Äôt miss the old steam clock.

title: Cute little town!
reviews: Cute small town with lots of choices for dining. Romantic at night and great for walking in the day.

title: Beautiful old buildings
reviews: Relaxed atmosphere and the unusual stem clock make Gas Town an attractive place to walk around.Many original buildings are stunning.

title: Expected more !
reviews: I've read that Gastown has lots of character and was looking forward to it . Maybe we didn't have a local guide, but we just saw a row of souvenir shops and upscale cafes . The steam clock is somewhat of a landmark in Gastown but that's about it .  Be mindful that the latter stretch of Gastown looks visibly more 'dodgy' that the tourist stretch.

title: A little bit sketchy
reviews: I think Vancouver really have a problem with drug abusers and homelessness. If you take a wrong turn in gastown you in a scene from gran theft auto. We ever saw a guy injecting himself with something. There are some nice shops and bars but I‚Äôm didn‚Äôt really want to hang around for long.

title: Good afternoon walk.
reviews: Gastown is a small area with some home stores, souvenir shops, bars and restaurants. It‚Äôs a nice walk from downtown and the highlight is the clock. There isn‚Äôt a great deal there but it‚Äôs worth a visit.

title: Lots of cute cafes and shops
reviews: Great fun walking around Gastown. Check out local shops and the cafes in this area!!! There are some hidden gems.

title: An Iconic Spot of Vancouver
reviews: We visited Gastown on our new year holiday. We were looking for souvenirs, photo spot and food. Gastown has its famous steam clock   that whistles every hour. The environment is very iconic. It has a Europian Style. The souvenir store sells every kind of Canadian souvenir, but it a little bit pricey.

title: Nice part of town
reviews: A small but nice part of town with tourist shops and cafes .... we were able to easily walk from there to the waterfront and enjoyed this part of the city.

title: Interesting place
reviews: Gastown is an interesting place to visit.  When I first saw it in the 80's I thought it was great and it stayed in my mind until I returned in 2017.  I travelled there on the hop on - hop off trolley bus (which is a tour not to miss) and an amazing half a day there.  The steam clock is a sight not to miss, especially on the hour. It vents steam every 15 minutes and plays a tune at the same timed.  There are many tourist shops along the street that will fit any budget.  A bite or a full meal can be enjoyed at the Old Spaghetti Factory.  Fair enough, some may be upset by the sight of homeless people on the street but unfortunately this is now a fact of life.  If you to take the time visit, I am sure you will enjoy it.

title: Gastown
reviews: Be prepared for everything and anything.  Lots of homeless people which can be quite confronting.  Interesting experience

title: A place to wander
reviews: No so much as a place to visit, as a place to wander around.  You never know what you'll run into around the co4rniner or down a street.  Many souvenir shops to choose from, but also some high quality shops and boutiques.  Gastown is also home to the Whtecaps FC fanstore,  Plenty of coffee around, and some nice sit down restaurants.  Biggest problem may be parking during busy periods.  If you come early, its pretty chill and relaxed.

title: Where everything started..
reviews: Gastown is the place where Vancouver was founded, with Gassy Jack establishing his first building just close to a maple tree.Today the area keeps his historical value, but at the same time has become a very touristic area, with hundreds of souvenir shops one close to the other.You cannot miss the steamclock, still perfectly working.

title: A lively part of the city
reviews: Had a lovely walk through Gastown and enjoyed the lively atmosphere from the city. Restaurants and shops were busy. Great place for souvenirs, the shops had every souvenir you could want. The clock is a must to see working from the steam, wait around until it chimes.

title: Historic
reviews: Apart from the myriad of souvenir shops here selling imported garbage I enjoyed this place.  There is a lot to see like the steam clock.  worth a visit.

title: gastown at night
reviews: Gastown is really old and interesting.Lovely vibeLovely bars and restaurants Buskers and artists and tourist shops.Loved the Gas clock.

title: Overrated
reviews: We first visited Gastown during the day and dropped into the various shops. We photographed the gas clock and the statue and the flat iron building....but our overwhelming memory of Gastown,was of the stench of urine. Many beggars and homeless people.We had planned on eating here one evening but half way down the street, we changed our minds and went elsewhere. As tourists, we just didn‚Äôt feel comfortable. Vancouver has so many other nice areas to spend your time.

title: Disappointing
reviews: The area really only consists of a single main street and a fair amount of the shops are tacky souvenir shops. Some nice coffee shops and, of course, the gassy clock.

title: Just ok
reviews: If I'm honest this has become rather touristy since I last visited. Lots of cheap souvenir shops and bars, but not much else to see.

title: Gastown is a great place to stroll and visit unique shops!
reviews: Interesting Steam Clock, tasty restaurants, great bars and unique shops!  On our day to visit Gastown, it was cold and drizzley which turned to sporadic hard rain!  We darted from shop to shop, had a nice drink and snack at the Spaghetti Restaurant. Would love to prowl this neighborhood on a nice day and enjoy the shops!!

title: Walkabout eat, drink and be merry
reviews: Great to take a stroll down Gastown, unique shops, bars and restaurants.See the Steam Clock, art galleries and old Victorian buildings. Great place to stroll, eat & be merry!

title: Must visit Gas Town
reviews: Very interesting to see the old steam clock - we walked to Gas Town from our accommodation downtown and arrived right on the clock chiming 6pm. This area is vibrant - lots of eateries and places to buy gifts and souvenirs. We really enjoyed the Black Frog Bar and Eatery which we just stumbled across and were lucky to get a great window table.

title: Charming
reviews: This area has it all. Waterfront views, charming shops and history all in one. The steam clock dedicated to the citizens of Vancouver by the Gastown community was quite a novelty .

title: So beautiful at night!
reviews: It‚Äôs so nice! The lights and the roads, made me feel I was in an old Hollywood movie! I loved it but only got to drive through.

title: One of the best areas to eat
reviews: Just a short stroll from the hotels around One Canada.  Plenty of great restaurants and bars. Not much shopping best to go to Downtown for that.  The area is safe for tourists

title: Boring
reviews: Nothing to see except the steam clock (only need one minute to see it). Found the place just full of souvenir shops. Was looking for some history but maybe we weren‚Äôt given correct info to guide us (?).

title: Great part of Vancouver
reviews: Such a find in the middle of Vancouver - great to get away from all the chain stores a wander around.

title: Nice Shops
reviews: It is a area full of shops, restaurants, pubs, bars. There is one of the uniques gas clock working in the world.

title: Very cool part of the city
reviews: Loved Gastown it very quirky and a little different , some beautiful shops and restaurants. It‚Äôs full of tourist shops for those extra little gifts and it‚Äôs well priced . Well worth a visit some great pubs and there is a large bottle shop if you are looking to buy some wine to take back to your hotel.

title: Great opportunity to see the steam clock
reviews: We took the opportunity in the New Year to visit downtown when it was quiet. There were lots of unique local artist shops and quirky shops with something to interest most people. Lots of tourist shopping certainly available. Some great plates to eat. Not the ideal place to walk around on your own but certainly seem quite safe.

title: Interesting steam clock
reviews: Has an interesting stream clock that is history here. It's wonderful to see and hear the chimes go off every 15 min.Otherwise the town is safe to walk around. Has some souvenir shops to browse through

title: Needed more time to wander here!
reviews: We still have a couple of days here so I plan to go back but on first viewing this part of town is as quirky and quaint as all the guidebooks advise! If you need a local souvenir this is also a good spot to start as there are a ton of shops and many of them have quite funky items, as well as the usual shirts and caps and magnets. Some good coffee shops too.

title: Soooo classic
reviews: Classic brick roads plus the steamclock that chimes and sounds every 15 mins. A must-time if anyone wants to hit downtown Vancouver BC.

title: Historic Steam Clock is a fun thing to check off your list
reviews: We enjoyed our walk through historic Gastown‚Äôs cobbled streets, the first settlement in Vancouver. The Globe Saloon was opened in 1867 by John ‚ÄúGassy Jack‚Äù Deighton. Apparently the drinkers thought enough of ‚ÄúGassy Jack‚Äù to name a town after him.  We walked past trendy restaurants on the way to the famous Gastown Whistling Steam Clock that pumps real steam through a mechanism that plays a song every 15 minutes. The steam comes from a series of underground steam pipes that provide heat to most of downtown Vancouver but the ‚Äústeam clock‚Äù is not technically steam powered, the clockworks are actually powered by descending weights. Curious tourists like ourselves lined up to see the iconic clock puff and sing its short musical notes on the quarter hour. That done we walked back to the hotel for a good nights sleep.

title: Historical Must See!
reviews: Enjoyed walking through the historic neighborhood. Lots of great shopping, the Steam Clock and statue of Gassy Jack.  Loved it!

title: A definite must see
reviews: Gastown is a great gem in the downtown area with good eateries, restaurants, bars, pubs and shops.  One of those places where you park your car and explore for the day.  Close to the waterfront station that you can hop onto the Seabus and explore the other side of the water.  Gastown is a beautiful historic part of the city and must see.  Great for day or night.

title: Much different than I recall (in a bad way)
reviews: Had I left a review from many years ago, it might have received a 5  star review for it's eclectic vibe and fun atmosphere. Granted I was a single guy back in those days and clubs like Notorious and Richards on Richards were a single guys playground. Sadly the intervening years has seen what appears to be an explosion of homelessness that did not exist on my first visit. Additionally the streets are riddled with filth from the aforementioned people using the streets as their bathroom and drug dens. Many a junkie is trying to beg for money to score their next fix. Thus such environments are not safe for unsuspecting tourists who wouldn't expect to be harassed or accosted while walking through a sight seeing place. Sadly the aforementioned bars are gone, and bouncers at various clubs look to keep the dopers out to prevent tourists from fleeing. Poor city governance from the local politicians is likely what is responsible for this bad situation.

title: Must see
reviews: I think one of the best place for buying souvenirs in Vancouver is here.It is better that visiting done at  day and night because of wonderful scenery .Dont miss the steam clock presentations

title: Stroll
reviews: Stroll around in Gastown. It is pitoresk and nice to visit. It is crowded but in a good way. Love the vibe!

title: Fun place to walk around
reviews: In this area of Vancouver, there are many restaurants, bars and gift shops.  Fun to walk around, do some people watching, watch the steam clock chime its whistles, get a drink, eat at cute restaurants and enjoy the scenery.

title: Interesting
reviews: Good place to wander around and find a restaurant. Plenty of tourist shops. Enjoyable for a stroll. Busy at times.

title: We Love Gastown!
reviews: Maybe it‚Äôs a touristy place, I agree. But I saw lots of local folks in the bars and restaurants there. The steam clock is fun to see and people are always taking pictures of it. The poor thing took a hard hit probably New Year‚Äôs Eve, cracking the glass panel on one side. May happen all the time for all I know.Steamworks brewing is definitely worth a visit. Place is much bigger inside than one would guess. We had good food there and service very friendly. No problems at all. Check the downstairs. We also hit several shops and the local beer Mecca, The Lamplighter. Food was surprisingly good and it looks like they probably have 30 taps or more (I was too lazy to count). Gastown was a very easy walk from our hotel downtown (Four Seasons). The hop-on-hop-off bus also goes right through the heart of it. If you‚Äôre headed for Chinatown, it‚Äôs just a few minutes walk (through an admittedly sketchy no mans land). The Sun Yat-sen park / garden is well worth seeing, but wait for spring; not quite so pretty in the winter. The streets, historic brick buildings, tree lined sidewalks, proximity to the water, diverse food and drink, and overall vibe make this place very special and absolutely worth a visit.

title: Old Town - Forums Steam Clock
reviews: Gastown is different design that you will notice road and street lights. There is only one steam clock in Vancouver... The location is closed to downtown, Chinatown and Vancouver port.  Many restaurants and small souvenir shops.

title: Quaint and picturesque
reviews: Great time walking and shopping little boutique shops plus a few very tourist shops. Lots of cafes and places to stop for cocktails. Gotta checkout Gassy Jack and the steam clock. All very cool then continue on to the waterfront for some spectacular views of North Vancouver.

title: Favourite part of Vancouver
reviews: We loved this area of Vancouver and visited it everyday during our trip. It is rather small, but the brick buildings and the street lighting are beautiful. Also there are some great stores and good restaurants and caf√©s all around.

title: Great place
reviews: Excelent place for dinner, souvenir shopping and just walking around for hours looking at the shops the lights on the trees look amasing

title: It's a real "gas" in Gastown
reviews: Gastown is well worth a visit and has also been named one of the most stylish world neighbourhoods. Potter around the many cafes and souvenir/clothing stores. Enjoy the heritage of the area and take a photo of the steam clock - it's also great for nightlife!

title: One of the few remaining heritage areas of Vanxouver
reviews: A must visit on any trip to Vancouver as it‚Äôs one of the few areas in Vancouver with all the beautiful heritage buildings still standing and it includes amazing peekaboo views of the water and north shore mountains.  There are loads of interesting shops, coffee shops and good restaurants.   Visitors to Vancouver generally make a beeline for the steam clock at the foot of Abbot Street.    Gastown is easily accessible on foot from hotels in the centre of Vancouver as well as by taking the Sky Train to Waterfront Station.

title: Shopping Area
reviews: The best shops are here. Touristy ones, that is. Buy your mugs or tshirt s or fridge magnets here. Very busy when we went.Also, see the gas/steam clock along the street.

title: Food haven
reviews: Easy stroll and plenty to choose from with dining and barsLots of souvenir shops, some with interesting items that are well priced

title: Nice old town
reviews: The old city center of Vancouver is nice and cozy though it bit too touristy with many souvenir shops. However there are also loads of nice restaurants and bars. A must visit either for a drink or a bite or a souvenir to bring back home.

title: Nice area for some great Architecture, Shopping and Coffee
reviews: Love to take a stroll around Gastown. Must see spots are of course the Steam Clock and Fluevog's shoe store. Best Coffee is the one at the beginning of Gastown -  Buro Coffee. Terrific Coffee and I particularly enjoyed the Hot Chocolate, not to sweet but just right.

title: Busy. Super busy.
reviews: This was a neat side trip and worth the visit if you have not gone before. It was my first time and I really enjoyed it. It was a friday early afternoona and it was really busy. The steam clock was neat.

title: Fun and funky
reviews: Lots of tourist shops, great restaurants; our fave was the flying pig.  There were literally restaurants everywhere and a lot of options for a 3 to 6 happy hour and a 9 to close happy hour.

title: In Vancouver? Must visit Gastown
reviews: Great shopping. Budget about 2 -3 hours.  Great lunch spots (flying pig).  Go durning the day, and then return at night to see the neighborhood transform.

title: Lovely place!
reviews: We wondered down to see the infamous clock and statue and have a bite to eat.  Worth the walk.  Lots of nice shops and places to eat too.

title: Good to stroll through
reviews: Lovely area, walked through here at night and they have some lovely fairy lights in the trees. There is a steaming clock which is pretty cool to see. Lots of cool quirky shops and cafe/bars located around here.

title: Not that interesting
reviews: I would say you can skip this spot, there's more interesting places to spend your time in Vancouver. If you're really into shopping then you might find more to do in this area, but we didn't find many places worth stopping into while we were there.

title: Steam clock
reviews: Went for a early morning stroll on Christmas morning. Nice and quieter and the steam clock a bonus. Had a coffee at the adjacent Starbucks and watched the various tour groups come past for their photo op. The streetscape is worth the visit.

title: Quaint
reviews: I was wandering around when I discovered  Gastown. It had quaint architecture and the steam clock as an attraction. I liked the vibe of the place because there were plenty of tourists that visited the area.

title: Lovely old buildings, fun shopping
reviews: Gastown was on my to do-list these holidays, and we really loved it. The old buildings and the famous clock are beautiful. There are lots of expensive stores, but also plenty of affordable souvenir shops, which are really fun. Plenty of coffee shops and restaurants as well.

title: Afternoon stroll
reviews: A bit over rated based on what I have read and seen , just one gas powered clock and just restaurants and gift shops , a little disappointed

title: Great spot for all ages
reviews: We wanted to check out Gastown so drove here from our hotel. Very close and easy to get to. Lots to see and do. Old streets. Fairy lights at night. The steam clock. Views of the mountain. Easy parking. What more could you want. Some very quaint shops and your usual touristy things. Great place to just stroll around not rushing. Great for all ages

title: Nice region to walk through
reviews: Good place to wander through, with cafes and bars to warm up in, and other interesting shops to see. Was a little dirtier than expected.

title: Awesome place in downtown Toronto with Plenty of Restaurants and Bars
reviews: Very cool "old school" vibe in downtown Vancouver with plenty of restaurants and bars. Met a friend here and had a great night out.

title: Magical!
reviews: Best evenings in Vancouver. So much to do, walking in the busy streets, eat at Catch 122 or The Flying Pig, take a pic at the famous clock or buy the cutest souvenirs. We enjoyed a Christmas Event just by walking around, so pay attention to various activities in this busy area.

title: great place to wander around - great coffee shops and more
reviews: Wandered around gastown before going to canada place "tour across canada" movie - great people watching, galleries and coffee shops  and more - you have to visit gastown

title: Must see
reviews: Gas town is the best place to go if you want the Vancouver experience. Great food, drinks and shopping. And close enough to Robson street and the Water.

title: Interesting
reviews: Gastown is a very nice neighborhood. The steam clock is beautiful and very old. You will find a lot of stores, cafes, pubs and restaurantes. It‚Äôs very close to downtown

title: Quaint place to head too
reviews: Took the kids for the first time to see the clock do it's thing & they loved it playing the music. Then we walked around the tourist shops heading back into town. A lovely morning had by all.

title: Oldest part of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a gorgeous part of Vancouver- the oldest part, in fact - and is wonderful for budding photographers.Great restaurants abound and lovely boutiques.A lovely walk around cobblestone streetsExcellent.

title: Gastown
reviews: A lot going on here. This seems to be the center of Vancouver's nightlife. Lots of bars, coffee shops and restaurants here. Come at lunch to get lunch specials and less crowd. I met a lof of nice merchants and servers here. The food is really good and you can take a nice stroll down the streets after you eat.

title: WORTH A VISIT
reviews: You'll get to see the steam clock in action and learn a little about the history of this area. Apart from that, it's really on one little street with some nice shops.

title: a little disappointed
reviews: I was hoping for a quaint area with cafes and nice shops but instead it was full of souvenir shops, homeless people and over priced shops. Near Gastown if you turn into the wrong street, you wil be confronted by streets of homeless and drug induced people just milling around. This was near the Chinatown entrance which we were told had great shops but we were rattled by the groups of vagrants and decided to go back into the CBD.

title: Great place to walk around
reviews: Cool to walk around and great little shops Still a bit of street people but not great danger. The old Woolworth building area is a great site

title: See the gas clock and statue
reviews: Not much of note here other than the statue and gas clock. Its not exactly the most attractive part of vancouver. Stop by if you are passing but not really a place to make a special effort for.

title: Average
reviews: Not really sure what you are meant to do in Gastown, you see the statue, and a few tourist shops, and that‚Äôs about it, close walk from Canada place

title: Love gastown
reviews: So many different types of stores. Very eclectic. Lots of native crafts. Loved the Yule duel choir duels. Great setup and event.

title: Funky Fashion Funky Restaurants
reviews: Walking Distance form the heart of town. Gorgeous area for shopping and food. I enjoyed the ambiance of the area and managed to spend some good money at Lulu Hub.

title: Pleasant couple of hours browsing
reviews: Gastown is a terrific shopping area, especially if you‚Äôre looking for local memorabilia (aka Souveniers). Walking several blocks of interesting shops, not just souveniers and art and jewellery shops. Lots of eating options as well.

title: Best at night
reviews: We walked into Gastown at different times. Day time for photo shots of historical buildings and at night to see the steam clock in action

title: Good vibe
reviews: Hipster town of Vancouver, we spent a few hours exploring the trendy shops and had lunch at one of the pubs.Definitely a trendy part of town to explore.

title: Charming
reviews: We were actually staying on the edge of gastown and enjoyed browsing around. There‚Äôs some good restaurants and bars here, but it‚Äôs also nice to just walk around in the oldest parts of the city

title: I live in Gastown
reviews: This is a unique reclaimed part of the city offering good restaurants eg.  Jules and Water Street Cafe and many interesting places to shop.  The steam clock chiming every hour is a tourist "must".  Fun to visit and gives the city a "flavour" you would not wish to miss.  Very accessible and just 2 blocks from the cruise ship terminal.

title: The oldest part of the city by far
reviews: Start at  Waterfront station . Best to avoid Main and Hastings but don't be shy to consider Rail Town over on Alexander.

title: One of the Tourist attractions in Downtown
reviews: Just stroll around this love place with it¬¥s old houses, bars, Restaurants and many Shops. One of the Tourist attractions in Downtown

title: Great restaurants
reviews: I love this area of Vancouver  - delicious food and old town feel. Nice for a stroll on the cobblestone!

title: very interesting area to visit
reviews: Great area to visit has original steam clock and lots of eateries to choose from, easy walk from city area.

title: lovely atmosphere
reviews: Gastown is filled with nice shops, attractions like gassy jack and the steam clock, and inviting coffee shops. During my trip, the people in the area was very friendly and was happy to take some photos for me.

title: Lovely part of Vancity
reviews: Was in Vancouver for a week and this was one of my favorite place. There are restaurants, bars and souvenir shops. Great place to spend a couple of hours when you‚Äôre visiting Vancouver.

title: Place to strol and enjoy bute to eat or drink
reviews: This part of town is bustling with life in the evening.  Pubs are busy, lord o people walking around.  Great place with character for nice walk and perhaps drink or bite to eat. Plenty of places to chose from and felt safe at sll times.  This reminds me bit of NYC, lower east side or bit of Soho. Anyway, want to walk in older, more histirical part, this is the place

title: my favourite suburb in van
reviews: super rad and trendy area, spent a lot of time down here on this trip. found awesome coffee, delicious food, exciting night life and cute shops. what‚Äôs not to love?

title: Walk from downtown Vancouver
reviews: Gastown has an old world feel due to old buildings, not the best neighbourhood though, many homeless and drug addicts walking on the streets of this part,we walked to Vancouver Lookout and had amazing views of the city.

title: Nice place to spend some time
reviews: Walking the streets, browsing the stores, cafes and bars - a nice way to spend an afternoon. Recommended.

title: Cool Place to Visit
reviews: Its a nice little neighborhood to walk around, shop, enjoy a meal or coffee in.  The steam clock is a neat thing to observe and it plays music when it goes off.  Definitely worth a stroll.

title: Very charming area.
reviews: This is the old Vancouver with some amazing old architectural treasures. Some pretty amazing cast iron street lights also! There are lovely shops and boutiques, and a sprinkling of pubs and good restaurants. One should spend some time around this district. It is a treasure.

title: Interesting Area!
reviews: Took a quick stroll in around the Gastown area, it is interesting,.However I went on a rainy day, which took away from me seeing everything. Recomend to everyone to come and enjoy the interesting sites & sounds!

title: Beautiful neighborhood
reviews: Although it was a little cold and very rainy we enjoyed the Gastown area.  The main street is filled with shops and restaurants. A great place to stroll along.

title: tourist trap
reviews: Nice atmosphere but crowded in the evening but mostly souvenir shops and bars, if you can spare the time to take the ferry to Victoria that downtown area is beautiful and much more unique.

title: Enjoyed this Historic Area of Vancouver
reviews: I loved the Gastown area while I was in Vancouver recently. I must say, the neighborhoods were a bit ‚Äúsketchy‚Äù on the way to get there...but well worth it. Gastown is filled with great bars and restaurants.

title: Good history
reviews: Need to visit for knowing some history. Interesting to know some of the interesting facts about this place and the history of gas town. The gas town clock is awesome and a wonderful treat to watch.

title: Below Expectation
reviews: I spend 2hours in the Gastown wandering the streets, wasn't amazed with the place or the shops. Vancouver downtown has many better locations than this one. Doesn't give the historical or cultural sense I expected.

title: Just a fun time
reviews: There are so many restaurants in Gastown it will be difficult to choose...pubs, sidewalk seating in the summer...lots of shops...different places to just look at, enjoy and buy... affordable prices for souvenirs and food. Plan for a few hours diversion and entertainment in this area

title: Gastown
reviews: This is an interesting place for a short stroll or longer.  The myriad of shops and restaurants invite exploration.  The historical significance has been retained, architecturally, where possible.

title: Gastown
reviews: I first heard the history of this part of Vancouver when on the hop on hop off bus, then I found I could walk there from my hotel so returned and wandered some more.  Lots of interesting buildings and shops, even found a Scottish Shop there.

title: A nice quaint town in Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is located very close to the city.  One can easily spend 2 to 3 hours here taking beautiful pictures at this place.  There are many choices of restaurants in Gastown.  A great place to buy souveniers as there are lots of options and very reasonable prices compared to other places in Vancouver

title: Old town Vancouver
reviews: Good quality shops with the famous clock but not in the best area for walking in and about. We saw it during day but wouldn‚Äôt have felt comfortable as much in dark if you don‚Äôt know the city

title: a big dissapointment
reviews: really looking forward to going here but felt letdown. A bit grotty unkempt and a large gathering of homeless/beggars who were a little persistent, did not feel too safe here. The Spaghetti Factory is good for a cheap fresh lunch but needs a good clean especially the windows!

title: Scuzzy
reviews: Too many homeless, druggies to see it as anything but skid row. A waste of time. You won‚Äôt get mugged but nothing worth seeing, mostly losers and street people

title: A gas in Gastown
reviews: Gastown has a unique feel. Cobble stone streets, unique shops of many kinds, fine restaurants, numerous souvenir stores and many other attractions. The most famous and photographed is the Steam Clock. Pretty well in the centre on Water Street at Cambie the clock continuously spews Steam and on the hour every hour performs its special routine. I walked the street several times browsing in many of the shops. I had a lunch and a supper at The Spaghetti Factory, purchased chocolates at Roger's Chocolates, picked up a selection of teas at David's and bought my great nephew a Vancouver Canucks jersey in one of the souvenir stores. I also picked up the hop on hop off bus and trolley city tour on Water Street at Starbuck's coffee. A must visit for sure. Bring your camera, ie. cell phone.

title: Disappointing food and drink district
reviews: Very underwhelming. Coffee, alcohol and food options were interesting but not as numerous nor inviting as expected. Falling behind bar districts in other cities. Plenty of beggars, scammers and drug use. Worth walking through during the day for a coffee but otherwise missable.

title: Weekend in Vancouver
reviews: Visited during the afternoon. Fairly busy, but also very touristy. Some nice architecture as this where V'couver grew from

title: Quaint, trendy Gastown
reviews: Gastown is a small area in Vancouver that is filled with trendy shops, restaurants, music, bars and coffee houses.  Great to spend the day window shopping or sitting in a cafe or the evening at Guilt and Co., a hidden jem in Gastown.  Walk down a flight of stair into a cool atmosphere with an eclectic variety of music all week long.  Avoid the weekend nights though.  Quite busy and super young.

title: A little touristy ... a litlle fab.
reviews: This is one of the most touristy areas in Vancouver, so dont expect to get it to your self. But at the same time, you will find nice little cafes and local design shops, so dont miss it!

title: Good
reviews: Went down here to see steam clock this was beautiful and amazing to see it in action. Plenty of shops and places to eat

title: A Very Special Precinct
reviews: Gastown, named after Gassy Jack, whose statue is central to the area, is a tourist area and shopping precinct on the north side of Vancouver adjacent to the bay.Easy to walk around and to just relax in a special part of Vancouver, especially (but not exclusively) for tourists. We visited a couple of times, firstly as a stop on the HOHO bus and then again by catching the train to a nearby station and walking down.Apart from the shops, there are two things you must do. Visit the Steam Clock particularly on the "o'clock" to see the steam sounding the time. Reportedly this is the only operating steam clock in the world, so it is worth seeing. And the other thing is to go to The Old Spaghetti Factory and have a meal in a tram (Carriage, No 53), perched right in the middle of the restaurant..It is definiely a worthwhile place to visit.

title: Great tourist attraction
reviews: Great area to wonder through.  Many stores and is the oldest part of Vancouver thanks to Gassy Jack.  The Steam Clock seems to be a tourist attraction that is also in Gastown on the corner (sorry I forget which corner the clock is on).

title: Mixed feelings from this street
reviews: Many different shops, pubs and restaurants on this street, but there are also many weirdos, beggars and homeless people. If you turn wrong direction, it can be a bit scary.

title: Gastown is special!
reviews: We walked to Gastown from our hotel.  This area is like a hidden gem among the concrete and skyscrapers.  It is simply lovely and you will enjoy the quaint beauty of the area with all of the trees and flowers.  Must see the steam clock!  You cannot miss it as there is always a small crowd around it.  We ate at one of the known restaurants (The Flying Pig--wonderful!) and had a lovely end of the day visit there.

title: If you‚Äôre close by
reviews: I‚Äôd only recommend Gastown if you happened to be within the vicinity otherwise it might not be worth the trouble. The steam clock is nice but very small and only blowing a little steam. We happened to be a ten min walk so it wasn‚Äôt too out of our way. Lots of souvenirs stores close by this area.

title: Nice dinner outing
reviews: Part of Gastown is very sketchy.  However, the down-and-out folks very rarely bother you.  Just don't breathe in the alleys or parking lots.  Within steps are wonderful restaurants and shops.  Good atmosphere overall.

title: Like in a movie
reviews: You are back in time (though not for long because it is a tiny area). Find the "steam clock" . Enjoy the shopping there as you will find all gifts to bring back home. Good selection of everything

title: Gastown
reviews: Cobblestone St.Restaurants,bars,shops.The iconic Gastown Clock which my friend Ray built.A must see!

title: Disney in Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a steam clock (just) and a few buildings. It's getting perilously close to being overrun by drug users and the homeless if the Vancouver Police get less vigilant. I hope they don't! Its worth one, quick visit.

title: Traditional and bohemian
reviews: This neighborhood is almost just four blocks of one street but it's full of craft shop, restaurants, bars and the cheapest gift shops near downtown. Extremely high recommended "The old Spaghetti Factory" and "Steamworks brewing". Water St is the best in my opinion.

title: Great place for some decent priced food
reviews: This is a great place with an excellent vibe. It has loads of cool bars and great restaurants. Some are really pricey and others are just typical for the food they offer. Great place to meet locals if you are in need of breaking away from the traveller scene. Really good in the evenings but just be aware that flip flops are a no no in some bars after a certain time as we were refused entry.

title: Old Spaghetti Factory 3-course lunch for under $15
reviews: We stopped in for lunch on a chilly, cloudy day and were seated in a warm booth near the bar. There is a street patio for sunny days .Their lunch menu had tossed salad with choice of dressings, various pastas, ice cream plus a bread loaf and a soft drink for under $15 per person. After the salads, I had the lasagna and my hubby the spaghetti and we ended with spumoni ice cream. Not huge portions but enough for lunch. Good value and quality. Would return.

title: Step back in time.
reviews: Gastown is like stepping into the past. Great little eateries dotted around Gastown, the old clock is something to see and witness its hourly chime. We loved this area even though we were told it can be a bit rough. We did not encounter any problems at all, only lovely friendly service.

title: History
reviews: A nice summer walk through the district. Old architecture, nice restaurants, a ton of shops and boutiques and do not miss the steam clock, really interesting! A must-do in Vancouver.

title: Nice area
reviews: Stumbled upon this lovely area it was realy nice. Lots of shops and bars and the clock is stunning. Reccomend

title: Best Older Section of Vancouver
reviews: We loved the shops‚Äîespecially the ones dedicated to the art of native peoples. Also, the cafes and restaurants are very good, as well as the famous steam clock being cool! And it's a very short walk to the Vancouver Lookout, with its great views of the city!

title: HEART AND SOUL OF THE DOWNTOWN
reviews: Don't plan on hoping out of the car, taking a photo of the clock and then driving around.  Park the car and take some time to stroll, explore and enjoy.  Lots of great photo ops as well as a fun place to people watch or grab some food.  The homeless population is expanding it seems so bring some socks to donate to the needy.  Something they could actually use

title: Great walk through history
reviews: We were here in the fall, the temperature was -1 and there was a little bit of snow falling. We dressed warm and enjoyed walking the streets looking at the architecture of the old buildings and enjoying the people. There is a ton of cool stores to pop in and out of, the Steam clock is always a favourite to stop and take pictures of.
