We've been here in the summer many times but enjoyed the slower pace with not near as many people in the fall.

title: Lovely area to stroll around. Surprises abound
reviews: Stayed at Pan Pacific hotel Canada place before joining a cruise ship. Its an easy stroll down to Gastown, interesting reading the plaques on the old buildings, Some very trendy shops to browse through, Take time to be near the Gastown clock on the hour, we were taken to the Old Spagetti Factory for a meal, this is a must, value for money.

title: Lots of History & Shopping
reviews: I loved wandering the shops and looking at the architecture - very fun and a short walk to Canada Place.   I visited on a Hop On Hop Off Trolley Tour and went two days in a row.

title: nice quirky walk way
reviews: nice pedestrian area with  shops and cafe however while enjoying the walk around the perimeters  of gastown we found  ourselves faced with plenty of  homeless people .

title: Lovely
reviews: We went at night. Lots of great restaurants and shops and bars. Some history, fun for just walking (and finding decent souvenir stuff.)

title: Nice classic urban walk
reviews: Rejuvenating area with typical modern shops and stores alongside with some classic souvenir traps. Nice food along the way and cobblestone streets make it a lovely small area to pass a morning/afternoon.

title: Great fun!
reviews: Excellent walk in an interesting area! Unusual shops, history, restaurants and bars. Well worth a few hours.

title: Must visit if you are a tourist
reviews: Gastown full of shops and restaurants.But the main attraction is Gas Clock !! It‚Äôs so interesting to see how it‚Äôs working and never stops! Also making noise :)Every hour the clock making noise like a train üöÇ.Stay longer because he can be couple of minutes late but still working!!

title: Wonderful Location, Great Places to Dine
reviews: Spent a few nights visiting Gastown whilst in Vancouver.  A great location for shopping and dining.  The Steam Clock is a must see whilst in Gastown.  Would definitely recommend visiting there whilst in Vancouver

title: Nice Area to Walk, Shop and Eat
reviews: This area is the complete opposite to the steel & glass buildings of downtown town Vancouver. Lovely old buildings, cobblestone streets, great little shops and cozy restaurants. We had dinner at Al Porto on Water Street, one of the best Veal Osso Buco Entrees I‚Äôve ever had. Then there‚Äôs the Steam Clock right on Water Street chiming like it was in Westminster. A good walk from downtown but safe even after dinner. You could always grab a cab if you‚Äôre tired. Interesting shops some with unique offerings and plenty of candy & ice cream stops on your route. A fun afternoon or evening.

title: Nice area
reviews: Gas town has lots of cool stores. It's a nice part of downtown Vancouver. Better stores than the norm.

title: a nice place to visit and shop
reviews: There were several very nice stores here along with the usual tourist shops. There were many restaurants to choose from. A good place to walk around.

title: Visit at night
reviews: We went through Gastown during the day and at night, and night wins hands down.  The gorgeous glow of the street lamps gives the feel of another place in time.  Great place for a romantic stroll after dinner.  It's not a huge area, but there are plenty of quaint shops and restaurants to cater to every need.

title: Piaturesque section of town.
reviews: We enjoyed the ambiance of this section of town before we departed on a cruise.  We visited in the morning and then again in the afternoon on our return.  On our return the streets were crowded because of the number of cruise ships in port.  Allow at least 30 minutes to walk through, more time if you visit the shops.  The shops were worth looking into.  I don't shop to buy when I travel, but there were many nice things besides the soveniers.

title: Great clock! Everything else is ordinary!
reviews: Might just be me, not too sure? However I wasn't amazed by Gastown. Other than the Steam clock which is great to see (if you can get close to it in the summer due to large groups of tourists trying to get videos and pictures next to it) there isn't that much else other than coffee shops and souvenir shops.Yes there are some nice eating places, and some lovely coffee shops, but you find that in most nice towns / cities.Put it this way, other than the Steam Clock I wasn't very impressed...... but if you are sightseeing, its worth stopping by for the clock!

title: Great time visiting Gastown
reviews: Great area to visit in Vancouver. Lots of souvenir shops and plenty of places to eat/drink with nice atmosphere. The historic steam clock - well worth seeing ... but be prepared to wait a bit to get photos as it is constantly crowded. Great selection of shops from nice boutiques to quirky, interesting ones. Some of the art d√©cor style architecture in the area is fascinating. We were amazed at the number of street food vans around this area offering a large array of different foods.

title: Not what I expected
reviews: Perhaps I didn‚Äôt go far enough off the Main Street however I was disappointed in this area of Vancouver. It was filled with tourist/souvenir stores and the immediate area is still filled with derelict shop fronts, homeless and quite a few ‚Äòundesirables‚Äô I went to see the Steam Clock and was keen to go elsewhere.

title: Shop Eat and Repeat!
reviews: There was sooooo much awesome food, shopping, and souvenirs! We went a few times on our 5 day trip! Perfect

title: Pleasant bustle
reviews: Once we got there we enjoyed the atmosphere and locale. A fun place and the steam clock is an obvious draw.However getting there was an unpleasant experience..We were in Chinatown visiting the Chinese Garden and decided to walk to Gastown. Unfortunately this took us along streets full of stoned junkies/druggies and homeless beggars. The homeless junkie problem in Vancouver certainly came as a very unpleasant shock.

title: Eclectic and funky
reviews: We enjoyed the Gastown location very much. It had a terrific 'feel' to eat - not to mention fantastic, well priced eateries everywhere.

title: A great place to wander but lots of "difficult" people
reviews: Lots of souvenir shops and lots of places to eat and drink. And of course there is the steam clock - well worth seeing.However, there were many people begging and/or behaving aggressively which made me as a tourist feel uncomfortable

title: Quirky vibes
reviews: Loved the steam clock and lights at night. Goofy shops and stellar street art. The vibes varied greatly from block to block. Some areas had people shooting up heroine in the alley and others were clean and trendy. Overall a fun section of the city. We walked from downtown and then headed over to Chinatown.

title: Nice walk
reviews: Nice neighbourhood. Cute shops and caf√©s. The shops can be quite pricy. Its not very long to walk around.

title: The oldest part of Vancouver
reviews: We enjoyed walking around the area looking at all the old Victorian architecture.  We didn't buy much but the window gazing was fun; all the different fashions and goods offered.  There are lots of bars and restaurants serving any kind of food you could desire.

title: Gastown is worth seeing!
reviews: If you are new to Vancouver or just visiting Gastown is a delightful place. It is the original old Vancouver, the budding are old and reflect the era. The stores are excellent for souvenirs or authentic aboriginal art. It's a pretty and easy walk with lots of restaurants and pubs to choose from. There is a clock run by steam and goes off every 15 minutes, with versions of the Westminster chimes.

title: Excellent way to spend an afternoon
reviews: A great area to wander in and out of souvenir shops and eateries. Love the lamp posts and Steam Clock. Stopped at the brewery which has a great view of the harbour.

title: Interesting Place
reviews: Took a walk thru Gastown, very interesting must see place, filled with shops and resturants along with interesting history stop. Enjoyed seeing the steam come out of the clock too. We got off at this stop when on the On and Off Bus tour.

title: Fun area
reviews: We enjoyed being in this area, great restaurants. Just a neat vibe about it. The people are friendly.

title: Best spot to visit in Vancouver!!
reviews: Gastown is a great spot to explore.  Amazing coffee shops, restaurants and shopping.  A must to visit.

title: Charming
reviews: Beautiful neighborhood!very charming place. At night, the lights is quite sublime! Great restaurants! It's a place which worth it to visit!

title: Brought friends to this very quaint and walkable area
reviews: Looking for Vancouver souvenirs? This is the street where you can find every one imaginable.  Bestto be outside by the steam clock at noon though so you can hear it play the full tune.

title: A most interesting place.
reviews: We walked from our hotel downto Gastown. The old buildings were most impressive. Pleanty of places to eat and drink. The highlight for us was seeing the old Steam Clock. By accident but fortunately we arrived just before midday and sat watched and listened to the steam whistles blowing the midday tune whilst having a coffee.

title: Arty and fashionable area in Van City.
reviews: Lots of craft shops independent labels and excellent places to eat and drink. Nice coffee houses. Well worth a visit when in the city.

title: Great place old Vancouver market
reviews: A little bit of Europe. Cobble stone streets and stores. Lot's of restaurants to choose from. It would be nice if they closed the streets off.but a fantastic place all the same.

title: Touristy
reviews: Some nice shops/restaurants and bars and some of the architecture has been preserved very well. But more down and outs than I had expected in a tourist area and when we reached the end of the "nice" part and turned to go towards Chinatown, we found ourselves in an area where almost everyone appeared to be homeless/spaced out/ selling drugs. Bit scary.

title: Buzzy atmosphere
reviews: Loved wandering around in Gastown. Other reviewers have mentioned the dangers of walking from here to Chinatown and i repeat the warnings. We did in fact see an individual injecting himself in a street between the two. We were on a car tour at the time so completely safe.But dont let this stop you enjoying this great part of town. You must not miss the steam clock of course.

title: Pretty, Historical...But...
reviews: Gastown is good for shopping, historical architecture, and is hip in an urban kind of way.  Just thought I‚Äôd let my fellow travelers know that this is wear the Vancouver street people hang out - and it‚Äôs probably not as safe as other areas.

title: Picturesque neighborhood; be wary if you walk from here to Chinatown
reviews: On a sunny day, this is a nice neighborhood to walk around, with the cobblestone sidewalks, quaint stores and abundant restaurants -- and of course the famous Steam Clock (make sure to wait for any quarter-hour to hear the steam-chimes). From here, you can walk to Chinatown -- but better take West Pender/East Pender over, and NOT West Hastings/East Hastings (especially around the intersection with Columbia), as this is a really seedy part of town, full of homeless people (which you'll see everywhere else in Vancouver as well, just not nearly as many as here), prostitutes, and junkies that will shoot up right on the street (and you'll see syringes with needles lying around here and there)...

title: Lively neighborhood.
reviews: Cant miss it if in Vancouver.  There is a steam clock that is not really a big deal but the neighborhood is fun and full of good restaurants.

title: Great history and restaurants
reviews: Lovely to wander here after dark looking at the various sites (including the steam clock) and then stop for a bite to eat.

title: Gastown
reviews: We enjoyed is area of Vancouver so much that we mad a return trip the next day and took 4 of our friends there. Fun to walk and look in the shops, the steam clock and had lunch at a great pub it is a fun area.

title: must go and see steam clock
reviews: the shopping is amazing and the clock is a must see when it chimes on the quarter hours it plays different on the hour when it goes off.

title: Interesting area
reviews: We walked to this area from Sheraton a Wall. Lots of interesting historical sights and shops . Went back in the evening for a group meal and it was a very lively area at night.

title: Work in Gastown
reviews: Gastown is very busy during the cruise ship season. There is a creperie trailer on water street that serves what I believe are the best savory and desert crepes in town. The only issue is that she is not always at the corner.Tourists need to be careful of the vehicles on water street as the cars may hit them because a tourist is not paying attention. The steam clock seems to be the biggest attraction. There are a lot of restaurants, gift shops and stores along water street.

title: Great at night!!!
reviews: Gastown is the tourist area of vancouver i would say...lots to see...shopping areas...and lots of history

title: Worth a visit
reviews: Gas town is a central area in Vancouver, famous for its shops bars and restaurants. People also visit to see the steam clock and Gassy Jack‚Äôs statue. We went a few times during our 3 days in Vancouver and enjoyed the food, drink and atmosphere. Our only negative was that after dark there are too many ‚Äúhomeless‚Äù people on the streets which I.S very sad but also a little intimidating, especially if you are from out of town and not used to it.

title: The SoHo of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is oldest neighborhood of Vancouver. Lively and vibrant, the hip area is always flocked with tourists and young locals. Although the taste of history is somehow distant, this lovely place deserves a stroll.

title: Old Town Experience
reviews: Love Gastown. A definite stop especially the night life. So many restaurants and bars in a few blocks, that it was difficult to decide which to patronize. Definitely, crowded on weekends.

title: Definitely worth a wander
reviews: The highlight of Gastown is the Steam Clock. It's probably unique and is at the heart of this small historic area. There are lots of restaurants and tourist shops to wander around, but the old buildings are good to look at and as it's quite central, Gastown isn't far from anywhere.

title: On the trolley tour
reviews: Very interesting place with a history and easy walking distance from Downtown.    See the steam clock on the hour and fill in the time between in one of the many shops, bars and restaurants

title: Just walk around
reviews: Just walk around and look at all the people. Great shopping for that  souvenir you don't  need but want anyway.  Some great coffee places here and you are spoilt for food choices.

title: Showing friends from Germany around the city.
reviews: Gastown is always attractive for tourists and even locals. There are good restaurants, caf√®s and boutiques. The energy is inviting and the Steam clock unique. Cobblestone streets and arquitecture that is inviting and attractive. There is so much to enjoy and walking along the stretch is a beautiful experience.

title: Cosy neighbourhood
reviews: Has atmosphere, lively, though with many tourists. Nice steam clock, must see. Every hour it plays a tune

title: A must see!!
reviews: This is definitely the heart of Old Vancouver and it was intersting to trace the history of the city through the various monuments there.  The highlight though has to be the Steam Clock which is fascinating to watch and plays great tunes every 15 minutes.  There are also many great tourist shops around the area

title: The original part of Vancouver
reviews: A guy called Gassy jack built the town with the help of the locals when he arrived with his wife and a barrel of whisky. It is named Gastown after him as he talked a lot!. The town was made of wood and once burnt to the ground before being re-built. The steam clock is in Gastown

title: Interesting tourist spot
reviews: Lots and lots of interesting souvenir shops.  Great place to buy a lot of things to bring home.  Liked seeing the steam clock too!

title: A quaint historic enclave in a modern city
reviews: We joined a 2-hour walking tour of the city including Gastown which is designated a National Historic Site.  It is predominated by heritage buildings under preservation with a touch of contemporary mixed-use structures. In the middle, there is a gas steam clock powered by a steam engine and chimes every 15 minutes.  A worthy visit by foot to learn about the history of Vancouver.

title: Nice shops
reviews: Gas town is nice with small boutique shops and restaurants. Street lined with trees and lamp lights. Looks pretty. I wouldn‚Äôt wander  too far from here into china town in the evening. Gangs of homeless people can be intimidating. Don‚Äôt miss gastown it‚Äôs a lovely area.

title: The most touristy area of Vancouver
reviews: A must go for the first time visit. Don't miss other interesting place similar to Gas town for shopping and eating. The local usually goes to Main Street uptown and 4th avenue Kitsilano. You can see the real Vancouver people there.

title: Hopping Gastown
reviews: This area of Vancouver is quaint yet hopping with tourists and locals alike. Great restaurants and shops! Great location. We walked from our hotel. Well lit and the Steam Clock was a huge hit with young and old.

title: The Steam Clock!
reviews: Anyone visiting Vancouver must visit Gastown and the steam clock!  Gastown is a great place to walk around, have dinner at one of the restaurants and enjoy the waterfront.  Lots of old buildings to see, it is the original settlement that became Vancouver and a national historic site.  If you visit Vancover be sure to go to Gastown.

title: Gas town was a blast!
reviews: So many restaurants and bars to choose from it was hard to decide, very cool with lots of patio seating in summer months.

title: Old Vancouver
reviews: The area is quaint, filled with lots of shop (not all are touristy), and very walkable. Driving through there is very slow. Definitely walk.

title: Great spot
reviews: Enjoy the atmosphere and walk around the area to soak up the vibe.  Some wonderful eateries, bars and street art

title: Now trendy
reviews: Locals don't really frequent Gastown, it's the tourists. That said with the Film and art schools now resident in the neighbourhood, there are more locals at the Happy Hours, more pubs and restaurants. Do walk through the area and wait for the steam clock on the hour. Area is still dirty and full of street people begging, so it's part of the area. Totally safe though.

title: Interesting area of 'Old Vancouver'
reviews: A walk through Gastown is probably on the itinerary for most visitors to Vancouver. Interesting collection of the older buildings in the city and lots of trendy shops. The steam clock on a street corner seems to be the biggest 'must see' attraction.

title: Great Place for a Wander
reviews: We tend to come here more when we have visitors from another country. It is quaint with older buildings and cobbled streets and the steam powered clock. There are many good coffee shops and restaurants within it bounds, but the shops tend to run more to souvenir shops, great if you are a tourist.

title: Busy,busy
reviews: You have to definitely visit gastown if you are in Vancouver as this is on the main tourist routes. Lots of gift shops plenty of places to eat and up the far end a brewery to boot.Make sure you go the old C.P railway terminus that has fantastic old pictures up near the ceiling all the way round,a fine building

title: Touristy
reviews: Very much a tourist area, teeming with activity. If I were in my 20‚Äôs, I‚Äôd have loved it. As it was, I concentrated on the few unique shops that were well worth the visit

title: Little Europe
reviews: Gastown in Vancouver is where the Steam clock is. It's a beautiful little street that reminds me of Europe. The roads and buildings, especially at night time with the lights, are beautiful.

title: What A Gas!
reviews: Very atmospheric with shops, bars, cafes, restaurants and tourist shops. Worth a visit. You have to have your photo taken at 'Gassy' Jacks statue and the Steam Clock is certainly worth a photo!

title: Lovely ambience
reviews: Went there and got caught in the rain but nevertheless still pleasant.  Cobblestone streets, old and new shops, loads of bars and restaurants and the mandatory souvenir shops of course.There is a steam clock which is very popular for photos and chimes on the hour.  Well worth a visit though and would like to revisit on a dry day to take more of it in.  There is a cenotaph to remember the fallen which is located in a quiet corner.We went for the Inuit museum but sadly this did not live up to expectations as it was more of an art gallery with expensive paintings and sculptures by people the tourists have never heard of.guided tours are available at a cost from the local tourist office and would be worth doing if only to get the history of the place as well as the places for photos.

title: Good for a wander
reviews: Gastown is architecturally charming, being the 'old town' of Vancouver. The steam clock is an interesting attraction, inviting large crowds to gather every half hour. Definitely worth a look - a bit of a novelty and interesting to read the history. Lots of souvenir stores as well as other shopping here. Don't miss Delice - close to the cruise terminal end. Maple syrup products - well worth a look and a tasting. We lunched at The Lamplighter - a great old pub on the corner not far from the steam clock. Fantastic staff - waitress was super friendly, efficient and cheerful. Helped with a selection of a local beer which was spot on. It was a big football weekend and it was very busy with supporters. We shared a plate of nachos - too much for one person but very filling. Lucky enough to find a table outside and enjoyed the sun. Top spot!

title: Bit Too Touristy - No Heart
reviews: Not for me, but for many others. I found it a little too touristy - a box to be ticked on the tour route. Some interesting shops but quite expensive. Couple of good eating places. Contrast with homeless people living rough in square.

title: Fun walk after plane ride
reviews: After checking into our hotel, we went to the Outlook and then walked through Gastown. Fun Restaurants, bars and souvenir shoes. The steam clock is awesome.  Had a nice brew at Black Frog and watched the clock. Nice stroll

title: Restaurants Galore
reviews: We walked through but there are only lots of restaurants and a Steam Clock plus places to shop for tourist items.

title: Gas clock interesting but not much else
reviews: The gas clock was an interesting concept, although it was not easy to see it through the tourists while we were there. The rest of Gastown seemed a bit overrated to us. Nothing special.

title: Heritage Buildings, Whistling Steam Clock
reviews: In Vancouver, as one proceeds from Coal harbour to downtown, one reaches  the Gastown named after ‚ÄòGassy‚Äô Jack,  the seaman turned barkeeper. The area has historic Victorian buildings, cobbled roads, eateries and a whistling steam clock that remind of by gone days when former Granville was shaping up as Gastown. The evolution of Gastown from an warehousing hub to a wholesale Center and a center of the city‚Äôs drinking life deserves attention from tourists as well as city historians.

title: Visit daytime
reviews: Some great historical buildings in this area of Vancouver. Lots of cafes and bars along with lots of tourist shops.Make sure you see the gas clockBe careful at night time, there are a lot of homeless people and drug addicts that frequent some of the side streets. We didn't feel safe

title: must see !
reviews: The steam clock at Gastown is a must see for every tourist. It is amazing to see a clock work on steam and with such perfection ! And all along there are small shops for you to pick souvenirs from.

title: Super historic area...
reviews: This is a beautifully renovated, historic neighborhood with quaint shops, good restaurants and wonderful architecture. It is always thrilling to see an historic district celebrated the way this one is and it is close to the waterfront, several hotels and is,  oh,  so walkable.

title: Interesting
reviews: Our adventure in Gastown was great while enjoying each shop, having lunch on a patio and site seeing along the way.

title: Awesome area to explore
reviews: We loved meandering around Gastown.  We were in Vancouver for 6 days and ended up in Gastown several times.  It has a fun vibe and there a lot of great shops.  Although, on our first night in town we were trying to get back to our room and we were just on the brink of Gastown and it was around 9:30pm and just getting dark...we didn't know our way around and there were a lot of homeless people out and I was alone with my kids.  the kids were feeling a little unsettled.  It was pretty real.

title: Loved it
reviews: Had a very happy time eating outside in the sunshine, ambling along the street, visiting the retails shops, looking at the steam clock ....... oh, just everything, we went back 3 times.

title: Nice revitalization
reviews: The city have worked hard to revitalise this once seedy part of town. It's worth a look if you have time but it is just more (tourist) shops & restaurants with a few statues thrown in.  The gas clock is probably the most unique thing in gastown.

title: Great vibe!
reviews: Gastown is a very touristy area but a must see when in Vancouver.  See the iconic Steam Clock and the statue of Gassy Jack.  Wander down the cobble streets and enjoy a nice lunch or drink in one of the many restaurants or bars. There is a great vibe in Gastown and definitely worth a visit.

title: One of the best places to explore
reviews: There are so many lovely small shops in this area- uniquethe street is so pretty especially in the early evening as the lights all come on. Some great restaurants in this area- cant go wrong.

title: Wander through gas town.
reviews: Came here about 10 years ago and remember it being better. The buildings are quite old but the shops are poor and full of expensive touristy stuff with a few drunks and homeless people about. The spaghetti factory is still nice as is the brewery on the corner. Otherwise not worth the trip really. There‚Äôs a gas clock that looks nice but isn‚Äôt really old at all.

title: Interesting historical street
reviews: This is a great area to visit with a variety of interesting shops and restaurants. The Steam Clock is a great attraction and worth waiting for it to strike the hour.

title: Great place to sightsee, shop, eat, drink or just walk around
reviews: We stumbled upon this area accidentally.  Boy, am I glad we did!  I loved the Steam Clock, there were a number of awesome shops to peruse through.  We went back the next day after my BIL and SIL arrived in Vancouver.  It was a very convenient area to walk to from both the Pan Pacific and the Fairmont Waterfront.

title: Choices !!
reviews: So many cool little spots in this area .. vibrant community and plenty of high quality beer choices.

title: Lovely
reviews: Lovely to visit at night time some excellent bars and restaurants. Beautiful lights. Not so charming in the day.

title: Old town
reviews: If you've got tired of the modern world try Gastown, It's like stepping back a good few years. As the rest of Canada the people are so friendly. Especially the leather boot store (sadly I can't remember It's name). Awesome people, beautiful place. It is for tourists though so it will be busy. Don't miss the steam clock.

title: Good for shopping and eating.
reviews: This area is great for shopping and eating, pretty clean and no hassle.  Lots of choice for food and loads of souvenir shops plus plenty of arts and craft establishments.  You must see the steam clock.

title: Holiday
reviews: Although a drizzly day it was still a most enjoyable walk through Gastown. Lunch at the Old Spaghetti Factory shouldn't be missed. Look for the famous steam clock whistling every half hour.

title: Excellent shopping
reviews: Great place to do some shopping or have something to eat great spot make sure your take the time to watch the steam clock

title: Great area to visit
reviews: Gas town is a tourist area in Vancouver with numerous restaurants and tourist type shops. The old steam clock is also in the area.

title: Tour
reviews: Great place to shop, eat & sightseeYou can walk all over there and take a bus back to your hotel.some tours offer you last stop drop off in gastown and it is a great idea

title: Fun to explore
reviews: There are many nice shops and restaurants in Gastown. I liked the cobblestone paths too. It's very walkable. Make sure to check out the Steam Clock here too.

title: Checkout the steam clock
reviews: Great food and drinks and looks amazing at night. The steam clock is a must see..so cool, it gets busy so check it out early

title: Old world charm with lots of Pubs Stores and Restaurants
reviews: Lots of native arts and silver jewelry. Quaint buildings and architecture with modern shops and eateries.  Cobblestone roadway and a great Steam Clock.

title: A great tourist place
reviews: There are many tourist shops with Canadian gifts on sale.  Gassy Jack statue to see outside the biggest boot shop and the steam clock which strikes the quarter hours and, just like Big Ben, strikes the hours playing Westminster chimes.  At the same time steam is blown out of the top of the clock while one can investigate the workings in the glass cabinet. It's a great feat of engineering.

title: Nice shops
reviews: If you enjoy shopping for presents to take home this is a good area.  Also very nice restaurants and places to sample the local Craft Ales.  Busy at the weekends!

title: Lazy Saturday afternoon
reviews: Had a lazy wander around gastown with my partner. Nice mix of tourist shops and genuine local speciality shops. Two amazing shoe/boot shops. Best selection of steam punk style handmade boots. Pity (or may have been a good thing) that we had run out of money. This was our last full day. Good way to spend a couple of lazy hours

title: Good for evening stroll and beer
reviews: Although this is the main tourist spot for evening it wasn't that busy.Very good large pavement area for walking and plenty of bars tourist shops and restaurants and eatries here.Got a bit noisy at around 10.pm so although the streets were not that busy the drinking holes were.

title: History needs to be told...
reviews: We browsed a little just because we were in the area, but unless someone explains its history, it's hard to appreciate.

title: Good Colonial Buildings
reviews: This part of Vancouver is worth a walk with many restaurants (with outdoor seating) and shopping. Some interesting features to compete with the gas clock

title: Nice!
reviews: Besides the steaming clock, this is a really nice neighborhood. Many shops and restaurants. Perfect for a walk!

title: Nicely restored
reviews: This neighbourhood is nicely restored. A good place tomwander around. Lots of shops, cafes and restaurants. Althogh there are a lot of tourists the atmosphere is nice.

title: Lots of tourist shops
reviews: Oldest part of Vancourver. Many tourist shops and restaurants. Need to take something home. this is the place to go.

title: A nice diversion
reviews: A vibrant neighborhood, though I'm not sure anybody really lives here. Some good restaurants and pubs, plenty of shopping (especially women's and souvenirs) and of course, the fantastic steam clock.

title: Forget about downtown ;)
reviews: The old buildings give charme to the lovely streets of Gastown. The lanterns and first of all the steam clock are worth some looks above your head. Walking through the streets, having coffee or ice cream is as good as visiting at night having some drinks.

title: Awesome quirky place
reviews: A really awesome place to visit, with quirky one of a kind places which you just must visit! Steam clock is here but I recommend wandering down some of the streets too while you are here and it‚Äôs only a 2min walk from Waterfront station so easily accessible

title: Interesting
reviews: Right next to China Town, it's an interesting neighborhood, full of character and local colour.Although it's busy you can walk around feeling secure and safe.So many different cultures in this area it's fascinating!

title: Olde Worlde
reviews: There are some nice restaurants and it has an historic feel but it is a very compact area. Don't go past the statue or head south. We were going to go to Chinatown but encountered a lot of people clearly out of their minds on drugs and syringes on the pavement. I felt unsafe.

title: Gastown Vancouver
reviews: I really liked this part of Vancouver, lots of things to see. It's the old part of the city. Must see the Gassy Jack monument & the steam clock. Lots of restaurants and cafes, and views of the waterfront. Great place to board a float plane and see the islands. Lots of hotels to choose from.

title: Lovely
reviews: Firstly did not find interesting but as we walked around was so interesting, old building with new buildings , years ago what a street was planned , funny shops as well

title: A Stroll Up Down and Around Water Street
reviews: I decided to show my friend the Steam Clock, we parked and walked up and down Water Street!  It was there, but not as clean as I remembered it back in the nineteen eighties.  The tree lined street, was what I enjoyed, along with the steam clock.  I remembered it shoots off every fifteen minutes.  As usual  it still on time.  It was a nice truck up one side and down the other.  It is nice too visiT!

title: Worth a Stroll
reviews: Every tour guide asks, "Have you been to Gastown?" It's part of the early history of Vancouver, and the most prominent character of that period was John 'Gassy Jack' Deighton. His statue stands prominently in a square in that part of the city. There are many relics from that time, such as gas lights, and also the famous steam clock. The area has atmosphere, and a Victorian feel. Probably not somewhere that most people would stay in for long, but should be part of a tour of the city.

title: Great place to shop, dine and see the Steam Clock
reviews: Gastown is a great little area of downtown Vancouver where you can shop, find gifts, dine and the best part was watching and listening to the Steam Clock on the hour!

title: Cute busy town
reviews: Quaint area! Lots of shops and restaurants. Loved the history of Gastown! Doesn't take long to walk through this beautiful area! Close to cruise ships!

title: It's Nice Considering What It Could Be
reviews: The old stories of Gas Town being a dump are truly no more.  This is now a trendy neighbourhood where you can spent 10 dollars on a cup of coffee. It's a strange mix however considering no more than a few blocks over is Hastings Street, where you can see the truly downtrodden of Vancouver.  Occasionally you'll see some cross over, but for the most part this neighbourhood has cleaned up and become totally trendy.

title: Good for a Stroll, but Watch Where You Go
reviews: Enjoyed the stroll through the older buildings, but a word of warning. After you get down to Gassy Jack's statue, turn around and come back the way you came. I had read about the area next to Gastown that isn't particularly safe. I thought we would go across the street below "Gassy" and come up the next street. I would not recommend doing that. Just turn around at Gassy and head back the way you came.

title: Like stepping back in time - vibrant area of the city
reviews: WE drove through on the bus when we arrived in Vancouver so we made a point of going back on foot and so glad that we did.  Loved seeing the gas clock and hearing of the history of this place.

title: Nice to wander around
reviews: Nice area and lots to do, look at & wander. Plenty of shops, bars & restaurants. Take usual care of possessions etc as busy area and no doubt pick pockets etc.  Steam clock on the edge of gastown is pretty

title: Extremely contradictory
reviews: Gastown is an extremely contradictory area. On the other hand it's a very beautiful old district with lovely houses, restaurants and lots of gift shops, but on the other hand it's part of Eastside Downtown, which is the area of the less fortunate. Because the so-called four blocks of hell are right next to the tourist streets, there are a lot of addicts, mental patients, prostitutes etc. also in the tourist area of Gastown. Some people might find it disturbing. For me it was just a shock to see them in the city that is supposed to be one of the best when it comes to quality of life. Overall street homelessness is a very visible phenomenon in downtown Vancouver. As a single female traveller I accidentally ended up in the four blocks of hell in the daylight. I wasn't threatened in any way, but it was an eye-opening experience, which made me think how lucky I was.

title: Worth a visit
reviews: Lovely old town type of feeling. Easy to find and great shops for pottering around. Lots of places to eat and drink

title: Great Variety
reviews: Very cool little spot in Vancouver not to be missed. Check out the funky bars and the Steamworks Clock that chims everyday! From here it is well worth the trip to East Hastings to see another side of the downtown area of Vancouver.

title: Gastown visit
reviews: Gastown was an interesting part of Vancouver with some tourist attractions (steam clock, statue) & many shops & restaurants.  We didn't eat at any of the restaurants but some looked good.  We didn't cover the whole area but it seemed to sell too many tourist type items.

title: Nice area
reviews: This a good location with shops /eating etc in a nice area . Some parts of Vacouver can be very sleazy with beggars and are best avoided but Gastown is safe ,day or night

title: Nice victorian town
reviews: A small town, with a lot of victorian looking shops and restaurants, quite an expensive area as its so touristy but I would recommend seeing the steam clock, thats pretty cool

title: Great place for food
reviews: We had a walking food tour through here but is worth going on your own. Heaps of great food places and a quirky little district with a great history

title: Gentrified and Welcoming
reviews: We haven‚Äôt visited Vancouver for almost two years and could not have been more surprised to see Gastown‚Äôs growth and gentrification.  In this short time span, the area has pushed further to the east.  Instead of previously remembered vacant buildings we strolled past an enjoyable variety of both local and tourist-focused venues ranging from interesting shops to wonderful little cafes.  More important, these changes engendered a greater sense of safety whereby allowing us a larger area to experience and enjoy the city.

title: Gastown Revisited
reviews: My husband and I have visited Vancouver a few times and haven't been in Gastown for probably 14 years, and It was interesting to see this area of Vancouver again!We took some time to enjoy. appetizers and drinks at happy hour.  Before going to dinner. I was surprised at how many people were panhandling there. It was the 40 year anniversary of the steam clock, so there was quite a crowd at it!

title: Canada Road Trip.
reviews: It was one of the recommended places to visit whilst in Vancouver. It was a bit underwhelming, a bit run down and dingy. The Steam Clock being possibly the only thing worth seeing. Chinatown was even worse with all the homeless and addicts etc. Felt unsafe down there, so did not hang around.

title: Bustling with tourists
reviews: Busy area as all tourists visit here. The steam clock is great. Be there on the hour to see clock in actionLots of touristy shops, bars and restaurants. Easy to walk aroundSpoilt by the number of homeless people all asking for money

title: Busy shopping street
reviews: Yes, the area was cute with an old-world vibe. It was also elbow to elbow with tourists going from shop to shop. Some cute boutiques, some bigger outfits. and a good selection of restaurants and bars. I'd take a look, but there really isn't much to do except buy things.

title: Place to vist
reviews: Very interesting place to see with lots of gift shops and places to eat, good to just walk around and get the feel . Gas clock is to see

title: Step back in time
reviews: Cobblestone streets. Meet Gassy in the square. Beautiful architecture. Great way to spend the afternoon. Streets are lined with Restaurants. Enjoy a coffee on a deck.

title: Funky, fun part of Vancouver
reviews: This part of Vancouver has a lot of fun shops, cute restaurants with interesting food.  The Gaston clock was nifty.  We even saw a movie being made.  We were allowed to get up close to the shoot.  Other visitors to this part of Vancouver may see movies being made because, evidently, it is the Hollywood of the North!

title: Worth the wait
reviews: Nice to walk around this area.Jam cafe is a must for breakfast but expect long queues but it is well worth it.The only negative about this area is large number of homeless people. They caused us no trouble but I found it terribly sad.

title: Beautiful street, expensive boutiques
reviews: This is a beautiful street with a nice history. The gas clock is interesting, there are plenty of beautiful bars and boutiques. The prices are usually high.

title: Lots of gift shops
reviews: Went to Gastown to look at the clock - unsure what we expected but felt bit disappointed once got there - almost walked past it. However, it was still intriguing. There were many gift /souvenir shops - it was quite busy - we were there end of August so don't know what it would be like in the height of the Summer . Interesting place.

title: Winteresting area
reviews: We really enjoyed our visit here and took photo of the steam clock.  Great shops and eateries.  Had delicious pulled pork sandwich in the Steam Brewery pub and my husband raved about the beer.

title: Nice part to stroll
reviews: Nice place to stroll. The street is lined with many restaurants, bars, cafes and ice-cream shops. Most of the places look pretty decent and nice.The steam clock is also the highlight for this neighborhood.

title: Nice builds but.....
reviews: This is our second trip here and yes Gas town is famous and has lots of lovely old buildings and the steam clock. But I feel it's just to full of tacky tourist shops that ate well over priced. Hills is a fab shop and a must as it has a great selection of 1st nation art. Walk past all the tourist parts and you come across some lovely coffee shops and a great vibe. With some lovely shops, I like Gastown put I have been to nicer places in Vancouver.

title: Magnificent old part of Vancouver; loads of history, atmosphere and great shops and restaurants
reviews: Worth a visit through Gastown to see the old steam clock - quaint part of history.  Unique shopping and pubs

title: Two days in Vancouver
reviews: Very busy place, old world charm. Lots of souvenir shops, and you must see the steam clock, which chimes every 15 mins. The cruise ships dock there.

title: Historic Vancouver
reviews: This is the oldest part of Vancouver and where the city started Very busy tourist area with lots of places to eat

title: Very quaint area
reviews: Gastown is a lovely part of Vancouver. It is easy to get to and you will enjoy just walking around snd taking in the sites. Many photo opportunities.

title: Go and have a look
reviews: Only had a day here wish I had longer the steam clock is a must, as Normal there is plenty to see ,to much to fit in a few hours but I tried,if I wasn't on a tour I could have spent more time here.

title: Charming
reviews: Packed with tourists, but worth the visit for the cobblestone charm.  Also there are some awesome restaurants in the area, and it's a heaven for beer aficionados.

title: History is still Alive
reviews: Gastown is living history of Vancouver.  Streets are filled with souvenir shops, excellent restaurants, fine jewelry shops, folk art craftsmen and many drinking establishments.  Take your time go into many shops and look for hidden treasures to take home.

title: Be careful with young children.
reviews: Gas town is a very 'interesting' place to potter!  There are lots of fab buildings, restaurants and shops but sadly this isn't all it has to offer.  After a visit with 3 children (12,9,8) we were at times, overwhelmed with the number of drug users and vagrant people in this area.  I would have liked to spend more time here but felt very uncomfortable with my children seen people drugged in the street.  (Gas town - East Hastings)

title: Nice place to stroll around
reviews: Nice neighbourhood to walk around. Some of the shops are quite expensive here though. The clock operates off the same gas as the pub up the road.

title: The older part of town
reviews: A very interesting part of Vancouver with many good restaurants particularly Jules which offers French cuisine. The main attraction is the steam clock but there are numerous other things to do with a selection of good shops on offer. Well worth a visit.

title: Good food
reviews: Interesting neighbourhood, well worth visiting with great restaurants and bars. Good shops in this area. However I wouldn't feel safe alone here at night.

title: Vibrant and Lively
reviews: Gastown is in the city core. One of the oldest neighbourhoods as well. It has tons of great restaurants, bars, gift shops and designer things including furniture. Lovely architecture and cobbled streets. Most of the restaurants have interesting layouts due the the building age. Lots of homeless and some pretending to be. Definitely as urban as one can find anywhere.

title: Gastown is full of shops, bars, restaurants and coffee shops.
reviews: Nice to stroll through the area - plenty to see and do (Steam Clock, Gassy Jack etc) though be careful when you walk into Chinatown from Gastown as there are a few strange streets with lots of beggars, drunks/druggies and homelessness

title: Homeless do not add to the experience
reviews: Gastown has the potential to be a step back into a great time in Vancouver. Our favorite breakfast and coffee shop is there, Nelson the Seagull and still well worth going there. But the homeless congregate in Gastown which makes visiting a sad and smelly experience. Makes me wonder how the cruise ship crowd is encouraged to visit.

title: Nice spot but mainly for tourists
reviews: Nice part of town, but lots of souvenir shops and tourists, the steam clock is good to see in operation, but unless you're after souvenirs not much else.

title: Plenty to see and do
reviews: Walked through this downtown area of Vancouver from the piers,plenty of life and shops restaurants and generally buzzing area

title: Afternoon stroll
reviews: Gastown is a great area with restaurants and shopping.  It does not have the typical shops like on Robson St, which is refreshing and fun.  Check out the Steam Clock while in the area and walk down Water St.

title: A very interesting place
reviews: Walk the streets that early pioneers did: experience Vancouver culture and tourism. Good restaurants and a fabulous steam clock.

title: Historic and interesting area
reviews: Cobblestone streets, boutique shops, restaurants and the famous steam clock make for an enjoyable place to walk. There is lots to see and many choices for places to have a drink or grab a bite to eat. The steam clock gathers a crowd of photo takers when it is close to the chiming time. Only sad part of the walk is the number of street people and people begging.

title: Tourist trap
reviews: Not very charming. Mostly stores and restaurants, but no real "historical" sights. Unless you want to just shop and eat tab overpriced stores and restaurants , I would avoid Gastown.  Also, lots of panhandling and undesirables.

title: A tourist Mecca for Souvenirs
reviews: The beginnings of what is modern day Vancouver, Gastown is a Mecca for tourists.  It would seem that every other shop is a souvenir shop.  The primary draw other then seeing where Vancouver began is the "Steam Clock" an ornate clock designed to attract tourists.

title: An afternoon with my Sister
reviews: We had lunch on a patio. Excellent restaurant. Walked forever in this area. Hit up the souvenir shops. Bought lots of gifts. Had supper at Steamworks.

title: Worth for visiting
reviews: Gastown has some very old buildings and the same is nice for artistic photos. Gas clock is a special place to be there and the town got its name because of this Gas clock.

title: Worth a visit
reviews: This place has some interesting history. Highlight is the steam clock  which is well worth a look. The clock gets crowded so be patient when wanting a photo. Lots of souvenir shops as well.

title: Interesting place
reviews: An interesting place to spend a couple of hours, its a historic part of the town with a really good feeling to it. Check out the bar just behind gassy jacks statue!

title: Busy place
reviews: The Gastown area was busy due to Ships/Cruises port just up the road. We went there a couple of time during the day and during the evening. Some great restaurants, went for lunch and dinner. The shops are great as well. As well the steam clock is there a must see if in Vancouver.

title: Gas town steam clock
reviews: Loved looking round Gas Town steam clock was something different check it out if you are in the vicinity

title: Gastown Vancouver BC
reviews: Loved this quaint area of downtown Vancouver. Was told by a native to check out the area for good brews and also great food. Especially like the Sardine Can and also the local craft beer that was offered in may of the restaurants in the area. Area has old world charm, and the steam clock is worth going to see.  Make sure you are there on the hour so you can see the clock in action.

title: Must see
reviews: Cool place to visit .. full of activity, shops and restaurants suitable for a day time or evening stroll followed by dinner! One of the vancouver must sees!!

title: Fun place to stroll, eat and shop
reviews: Close to the heart of downtown and Canada Place.  Everything from coffee shops to fine dining, tee shirt shops to high end art galleries, in a compact area.

title: Bustling area
reviews: Loads of restaurants and shops, very busy area. The main highlight is the 'steam' powered clock, when it strikes the 'hour' steam emits from a funnel.

title: Interesting history
reviews: Took in by hop on - hop off bus tour so driver told us what to expect. Interesting to walk around particularly fascinated by the steam clock.

title: Vibrant area
reviews: Couple of streets full of shops, bars, restaurants and tourists! Try the bar in the Train station and don't miss the steam Clock! Look closely for some lovely art galleries with First Nation artists among the trinket shops.

title: A must visit place when in Vancouver
reviews: A short walk from the waterfront and main hotels. A great evening out with many restaurants, pubs. A good vibe in the area as many tourists /visitors enjoy the atmosphere. Of course there is the gas powered clock which a must see/ must photo landmark

title: A little,bit of everything
reviews: Lots of,restaurants and bars at all ends of the spectrum.  Shops and stores offering everything from affordable to higher end.The steam clock is a must see.  As is the statue of the founder.This is an historical place as well.  Late in the evening you may run into the less fortunate looking for,a handout.  Most are harmless but some get aggressive.  Keep your purse close and don't acknowledge them, just keep walking and you'll be fine.

title: Cool vibe
reviews: We enjoyed this neighborhood and came several times within our weeks visit. Loved soft peaks and chill Winston. A definite must when in vancouver!

title: If you have not seen any other old towns ..
reviews: ... this can become your favorite place. Unfortunately, if you had a chance to visit some of America's or European downtown (like Seattle, San Francisco, Rome, Amsterdam, Berlin) this will be just an average old location in some city. There are few things to see like old steam clock that wakes ups everyone on few streets or blocks away (including very 'friendly' people on the East Hastings); few stores with souvenirs that are very cheaply and bulk made (like coffee mugs, hats, fridge magnets) and owned by one person (yes, you can get the same coffee mag cheaper in one another store few meters away), some old buildings that can be used as a good background for photography, few very expensive stores, one parkade, few restaurants that can feed you quickly and cheaply but that's about it; some number of bars with outdoor patio you can enjoy during non-pouring-bad-rainy days... Yes, streets are older and fairly good maintained for their age but that's about it. Make yourself a favor, walk the Gastown once up and down on opposite side of the street, get a quick coffee and catch a hop-on bus to get to English Bay, or Kits beach, go to the Capilano suspension bridge or take a short (or long) walk close to the ocean and enjoy it. I would strongly recommend visiting Richmond's Steveston area if you have few hours to spend.Far better way of spending valuable tourist time than buying souvenirs in Gastown overpriced shops and wait for a seat in any Gastown restaurant during 2 hrs lunch breaks. Yes, someone would say that Gastown is unique.. It is but it is also a place to which you are not coming back for a reason. You might stumble up on it again... Once you see it you can check it off from your Vancouver to-do list.

title: Quaint town
reviews: Gas Town is a quaint town with lots of cafes,shops & bars. There's is a steam clock in the Main Street which is worth a look. There's are lots of hanging baskets in the streets with lovely flowers which gives a pretty feel about the place.

title: Wonderful place with bars abd restaurants
reviews: Gastown is a wonderful place to visit daytime and evenings. It has a lot of buzz and many restaurants with outdoor sitting to enjoy the worold go by. Accessible by bus and 300 metres from Canada Place.

title: A different face to Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is the place to go if you want to eat and drink away from the Condo/highrise centre. East to get to on foot (and safe as well) the area boasts a steam clock and other touristy type stuff. It is very bohemian in parts and there were remnants of Old Vancouver before the property prices made it a Condo developers dream. Lots of bars and restaurants, as well as souvenir and specialty shops, means it is busy in the day as well as the evening

title: Steaming, if you've got the time
reviews: Visited the famous Gas Town last week.  Definately worth s quick stroll if you are close to the waterfront.  Some useful tourist shops and a few restaurants and eateries but becoming a bit up market with some designer furniture stores now taking up space.  The steam clock is definately worth a photo.  Iconic and fun.

title: Great walk full of shops & cuteness everywhere
reviews: Went there on a day excursion with family and the whole area is full of shops, restaurants, and beautifully red brick streets full of flowers.  It was lots of fun, just exploring and visiting the steam clock and people watching.  When I visit again - I will definitely visit Gastown again.

title: Great area!
reviews: Definitely should experience this part of town. Lots to do and restaurants to check out! Really lively and fun environment.

title: Great restaurants and shops
reviews: Our hotel was not far from Gastown so we ate dinner there each evening.   We enjoyed trying different restaurants and all were good.   Be prepared to be approached by panhandlers.   We were approached 3 times in our first 30 minutes in Gastown.

title: Lots of Nightime Atmosphere
reviews: Checkout the Gastown Area of Vancouver in the evening and enjoy a variety of street front restaurants, happy hour drinks, street food and the atmosphere of a vibrant inner city lifestyle. Dont forget to look at the steam operated clock.

title: Pretty streets
reviews: Mainly consisting of a couple of streets and tons of restaurants, Gastown is still very pretty with its cobblestone streets and older buildings. A little more poorly frequented than before apparently, so be aware of this!

title: Something a little different. Cobblestone beauty and charm, not to mention Great food restaurants. And shopping!
reviews: A charming olde worlde change of pace to busy downtown Vancouver.  The old gas clock.  So Incredible!!!  You must wait to hear, and see, the gas funnelling from the quarter and on the hour chimes from this gas powered clock. Still in full working order.  amazing!!  And some of the Freshest and most Delicious food restaurants dotted along the cobblestone streets.  Smart Mouth Cafe well worth a visit.  Avant garde shops also inviting a look in.  Take the hop on hop off West Coast Sightseeing bus and get off at Gastown.  Like we did.  A glimpse into the past you'll love.

title: Downmarket Fulham
reviews: Older part of town. Street bit gloomy because of many trees which we shouldn't complain about.  Very smart shops in one side and souvenir places on the other.  Lots of people asking for handouts.  Reminded a bit New York Soho , or downmarket Fulham.  Saying that, it's interesting to get away from bright shiny new Vancouver.

title: Fun stroll
reviews: We had fun visiting the old steam click and many shops along one of Vancouver's oldest streets.  Parking isn't great but there are some large parkades nearby.

title: The character of the city
reviews: This is the oldest part of the city, the buildings have character, if your visiting be sure to go there. Some of the shops are touristy, but there are some nice boutiques and artist wares available here, great restaurants and bars.

title: Very quaint and the heart of Vancouver.
reviews: Gas Town is very quaint with a good number of decent and unique shops.  Has a few travellers-tat shops too, but randomly even those are reasonably high quality!  Loved the Steam Clock and loved the spot where a bunch of guys came up with the name "Vancouver".

title: Interesting Part of Town
reviews: Gas Town is just a short walk from Canada Place and is filled with interesting shops and restaurants.  Great little walk and they offer guided walking tours in the evening.

title: Great night atmosphere
reviews: Walked here from our hotel for an evening meal.  Lots to choose from with a good atmosphere around the area.

title: Cool is Gasetown!
reviews: We enjoyed our time in Gasetown at the end of August. Very nice terrasses and cool places to sit and have a drink.Nice terrasse on the roof of this particular cute building.

title: Nice but Not a Must-Visit
reviews: We found Gastown a charming area of the city, but not particularly unique (apart from the famous steam-clock perhaps). It appears to be pretty heavily touted by all the tourism literature however. We only had a couple days in the city, and in hindsight would have spent our time elsewhere in Vancouver.

title: Walk around to see it all
reviews: We had a great dinner here Al Porto Restaurant.  Nice shops with a variety of items to buy, not just 'touristy' stuff.

title: Interesting.
reviews: Another interesting and beautiful part of Vancouver. Many stores and restaurants to choose from. Has a nice old world charm vibe to it. Loved the steam clock.

title: Best part of Downtown
reviews: We have loved this part of downtown the most. It is the most charming part and has a special atmosphere. Try to have a cup of coffee or a drink to the happy hour (3-5 p.m.) there.

title: Amazing old part of the city of Vancouver.
reviews: The original settlement that became Vancouver. It has a charming mixture of Victorian buildings, brick streets, restaurants, bars, shops, a statue of Gassy Jack, Gastown's namesake, and a wonderful steam clock that whistles every 15 minutes. This is a must-see for anyone visiting Vancouver.

title: Funky
reviews: Nice shops, cafes and an easy walk. Check out Canada Place and Vancouver tower as well. Plenty of souvenir shops and a few pubs as well.

title: Great Area to Walk Around in the Evening
reviews: Gastown looks magical all lit up in the evening light. There are tons of shops, restaurants and sights to see. Listen for the steam clock going off at each quarter of the hour. Get a drink at one of the many bars or restaurants. Or just amble around the cobblestone street and enjoy yourself!

title: Fun
reviews: If you are into eating and drinking there is lots of choice to be found.    When in doubt try them all.

title: Great vibe!
reviews: Such a cool part of Vancouver. I instantly got a very positive vibe when I was in gas town. It's full of trendy bars and restaurants right by the water. There always seems to be an ever present buzz during both the day and night! Well recommended.

title: Very pretty.
reviews: This area is very nice. Lined with trees that, if you visit the Vancouver lookout tower and look down on it, looks very strange as the only bit of greenery around.. The main street is full of every sort of restaurant you can wish for. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Summer Vacation
reviews: This place has a nice vibe. Check out the taco place that locals enjoy called Gringo. Have yummy food!

title: amazing area
reviews: beautiful location in downtown and nice atmosphere :)you love this area and stores. steam clock is amazing tourist attraction and it's goof for children who loves science.

title: Lots of restaurants, nice walking street
reviews: Just be careful not to go further to the streets with drugged people... we went the wrong way and it is not a pretty scene. But we liked Gastown, had dinner there, and loved the walk.

title: Interesting
reviews: The oldest part of Vancouver downtown this is a must visit. Situated 10 minutes walk from Canada place wharf the are plenty of old style bars and restaurants.Novelty and gift shops about and make sure you see the steam clock that goes off every 15 minutes... take you camera.

title: What An Awesome Place To Walk Around
reviews: Wonderful shops and galleries as well as some fabulous restaurants and of course the famous steam clock. Gastown is such a beautiful place and shouldn't be missed.

title: Lots of attractions
reviews: Lively Gastown is known for its whistling Steam Clock and mix of souvenir shops, indie art galleries and decor stores in Victorian buildings. A trendy food and drink scene includes chic cocktail lounges and restaurants serving everything from gourmet sandwiches to local seafood. Great place to walk around.

title: Spend an evening here for sure
reviews: One of the evenings, we went to a nice little neighborhood called Gastown to roam around and for dinner. As you can see from the pictures above, it's like and old-city type area with brick roads and old-style street lights. The street lights immediately reminded me of the Gaslamp District in San Diego. I assume it's true here, but I definitely read about it for Gaslamp, but these street light domes were each once lit with gas lamps. Now of course they're just light bulbs. I assume it's a similar deal here. There are a ton of restaurants, bars, shops, and so forth. Fun area to walk around and see - oh and don't miss the steam powered grandfather clock. That was something unique. We ended up having dinner in one of the restaurants with outdoor seating called Chill Winston. Pricey, but good experience. More in the Restaurant section on that. We also ate some ice cream, from a place which I think was called swirl. Kids loved that. I'd recommend visiting Gastown if you're in Vancouver.

title: Great place to visit and to relax with friends
reviews: We went there with kids mid afternoon and it's nice to wonder around.  Adults stayed around and made an evening of it starting off in Chill Winstons for drinks and then a few more quaint bars.  Ended up in TUC which had a great atmosphere and great food.  Well worth a visit at both places and other bars that you will find if you are walking around.  All within a nice walking distance for a nice evening out.  Feel safe as well.

title: Went for the postcard... got so much more.
reviews: had heard mixed reviews about this part of town but it was the consistent recomendation for guarentee postcards and souveniors so we went. Cool place.  Its a colorful mix of old and new.  Victorina architecture and cobblestone streets met with trendy watering holes, innovative sandwich shops and inde art galleries.  Tons of stuff too see.  Its great for an afternoon stroll.  The clock is neat to see too.

title: Still an amazing place.
reviews: Be sure to see the steam clock. Stroll the streets and check out some of the best eateries in this wonderful city.

title: Quaint section of city
reviews: Nice area to go for a walk ,do some shopping and have a meal, Very picturesque and pleasant with a steam clock and other bits and pieces to draw your interest. Great location yo spend half a day or if pressed jump on and off the  hoppa bus .

title: So much to see and do
reviews: When Vancouver you must take some time and visit Gastown. As a travel agent I always arrange a visit to this destination. Whether it is to shop, eat or simply explore, Gastown is a must! @cruiseplannersjbr

title: nice street, but a bit boring
reviews: quite crowded, the gas clock is a big attraction, many Restaurants and Shops, but nothing you must see. Nice trees, shadow therefore.

title: Fine selection of shops, cafes and restaurants
reviews: This historical part of downtown Vancouver is well worth a morning's stroll.  Some fabulous coffee shops, lots of interest boutiques and many excellent restaurants. The steam clock has been in existence for almost 150 yrs and is a great draw with tourists and locals.

title: The good and the bad
reviews: Parts of Gastown are very funky and well worth the visit. The reality is that it is very small and busy when we were there. Not much to do other than eat and drink.The bad is that there is a really bad side to Gastown near Chinatown and I would not want to be there late at night. Lots of homeless people and druggies shooting up in the street which we found so surprising to see in Canada.

title: A great area for food, bars, and shops
reviews: It seems that all roads lead to Gastown. I did two walking tours of the area.  Also, I returned for eating, drinking, and shopping.

title: Gastown Trip
reviews: Interesting blend of old and new.  The Gassy Jack statue, the Steam Clock and I found a bar,  "The Irish Heather" with a picture of an old shop with my home town.  Great place to walk round and restaurants and shops were good.

title: Great buildings, but...
reviews: This is supposed to be the new, trendy area of Vancouver. There are some very attractive restored buildings but the area is overrun with tourists, particularly from the massive cruise ships which dock nearby. There are a lot of restaurants which are not cheap, and shops selling "made in China" Canadian souvenirs. The steam clock is worth seeing.

title: Lovely atmosphere
reviews: A quaint local area. The steam clock is worth seeing (on the hour when you get the full sounds).There are lots of cafes and pubs in this strip, and some retail therapy but most of that is souvenir shops.

title: Very nice for walking
reviews: This is one of the Vancouver oldest neighborhoods and certainly you can see the difference as you transition into the area. The buildings are Victorian and the area has a lot of character including one of my favorites the steam clock at the corner of Cambie and Water

title: Don't miss the STEAM CLOCK!
reviews: Go off the Hop On Hop Off here and what a fun place to visit. There are all sorts of shops, restaurants, and bars. I happened to be there just a few minutes before the Steam Clock struck 4 PM. You must try to see this. It plays a tune with the steam bursts on the hour. Everyone was gathered around taking pictures.

title: Shop, Lunch, Stroll...
reviews: Easy to spent time here. We had a beer and watched people as we relaxed during a long walk about. YES! You can shop till you drop here too. Some exclusive shoe and boot shops sit along the route.

title: A very pretty town and shopping area
reviews: While waiting for our cruise to start we visited Gastown to shop and see the steam clock in action Very worthwhile and an easy walk from the Fairmont Hotel by the wharf.

title: Great area of Vancouver
reviews: Beautiful old architecture, and a great vibe from the people and eateries in this area makes it a must see in Vancouver.There are some great places to eat, and lots of tourists to chat with.  The locals are super friendly, and can point out some great spots to head after you've finished with Gastown.A unique and charming area to visit.

title: Gastown stay
reviews: Stayed in the area for 3 nights. It‚Äôs an up and coming around but butts up to a not so decent area that houses a bunch of transients.

title: Full of character
reviews: See the steam clock, visit the actual spot where the pioneers settled on naming the city Vancouver ( by the statue of Jack Gas) visit the shops , have lunch or coffee and pick up a souvenir or two to take home.

title: Stroll, Browse and Dine
reviews: I spent a wonderful afternoon strolling, browsing and shopping in Gastown. Seeing the only steam powered clock in the world (their claim) was quite interesting particularly when the full hour came around and the chimes started. There were numerous shops to browse or buy. All in all, you could spend several hours there. Although I did not eat there, I did see several restaurants and people dining in them.

title: Old City Charm
reviews: Gastown is worth strolling around to view the of buildings, shops and restaurants.  They are very popular so get there early or stand in line.  Great way to meet new people.

title: Entertaining and good eats
reviews: Gastown Saturday night was lively and unique. We pub crawled through a few venues and ended up enjoying dinner at the Blarney Stone. The general atmosphere of old world charm on the cobblestone streets coupled with the live entertainment made our night in Gastown one of the best trips to Vancouver yet.

title: Old Building and some good restuarants
reviews: We ate at the Bauhaus for dinner.  Many shops and touristy type things to do.  It is the old part of Vancouver.  When I was younger we enjoyed going there for dinner and shopping.

title: A Nice Stroll
reviews: We spent some time walking Gas Town. A very nice place to spend some time but it was hard to keep our teenagers interested. A lot of shops and souvenir stores and an amazing steam clock.

title: A Must See in Vancouver
reviews: I have lived in Vancouver all my life and visited Gastown today after many years.  Over the years it has definitely transformed for the better.  So many interesting shops, restaurants and bars.  Really worth a visit whether your a visitor or a local.

title: A major disappointment
reviews: Since my last visit ten years ago this area has been taken over by millennial's and is now full of trendy,  very vibrant and expensive restaurants and bars. Many of the places that I remember are gone. There used to be a number of wonderful galleries carrying First Nations Art and I could only find one remaining. The steam clock is fun, but if you are over 30 I think you'll find very little here.

title: Getting better
reviews: Gas town keeps getting better every year. Lots of good restaurants now in the area. The shops are getting more up scale and interesting, not just touristy places. Cleaner as well then past visits.

title: Trendy, hip place
reviews: Many small street side restaurants. Lots of character in this area which is very trendy. Easy walking.

title: Gastown is amazing!
reviews: Gastown is full of beautiful flowers, eclectic architecture, and  amazing food, all in a safe and welcoming environment!

title: restaurants and a great clock
reviews: Be sure to hear the old clock that goes off each hour.llots of good restaurants in this area.lots of bars and young people.......fun casual area

title: Evening stroll to dinner
reviews: After 6 pm there is free parking but be sure to still get a ticket. Some stores are open late. Take a look at the steam clock on the corner.

title: Really nice walk around a quaint area
reviews: Spent an afternoon/evening wandering around here. Really enjoyed the architecture and the ambience of this nice area. Several interesting things to stop and see and loads of spots to stop for a meal or drink. Worth a few hours of your time during a visit to Vancouver.

title: Can a street violate a "Best before" label.
reviews: Since I'm getting to be older than some cosmic constellations, I remember well when Gastown was fresh and lively and new in it's oldness. But it's expiry date came and went years ago.What is the appeal of this sad stretch of patched and worn Home Dept before Home Depot cheap bricks and plastic tourist trinket shops and phoney made everywhere except Canada junk markets?I remember it back in the 70's when it had life. The Spaghetti Factory was THE place to go for grub and the crackheads pissing on the lamposts were far into the future, like 1995. Make a wrong turn off Water street and meet an ugly truth of Vancouver, the zombie apocalypse stretch of East Hastings skid row. I travel through Gastown about twice a week at around 7 AM. That's about the time most of the zombies have vacated most of Gastown and retreated back a block or two, leaving others to clean up the garbage of dumped cans in the search of bottles and to pick up the used hypo-needles that litter every dark corner.Avoid this place.

title: INteresting architecture, shops, and CLOCK!!!
reviews: We took a walking tour of Gastown, led by a member of the Vancouver Architectural Association, and we learned a great deal about Vancouver's history and buildings.  Surely the main delight is the steam clock sounding out every quarter-hour, but the surrounding shops and restaurants are also quite pleasant.

title: A Historic, interesting downtown area!!
reviews: Gastown is named after the person who built the first "Tavern" in 1867!  Today it mirrors many aspects of Vancouver-- with "HIP" bars and restaurants, "startup businesses", offices for a broad set of professionals as well as homeless folk!!  It has been recognised as a "National Historic Place" and it even has a quirky steam generated clock!  Its well worthy of a visit!!!

title: Quaint must see visit
reviews: Gastown is filled with boutiques and great restaurants. This is a quaint must visit town. Bought a beautiful cashmere scarf at Kit Lace and had a wonderful dinner at the Flying Pig. Could have spent hours more there if not for the timeline of our cruise.

title: Nice neighbourhood to visit
reviews: When you are there make sure to visit the statue and steam clock which are the highlights of this neighbourhood. Very tranquil and historic, full of restaurants and bars where young people socialise. One of the must sights in Vancouver

title: Beautiful, historical area!
reviews: We ate dinner down here and did some shopping.  We loved the Steam Clock on the corner. My disappointment was with no historical tours....no historical building offering tours.  That is weird to me.  But glad we went.

title: Nice place to browse and shop
reviews: We enjoyed the shopping and various restaurants in the area.  Also close to the Look Out.  Lots to see in a small area.

title: we saw the clock
reviews: gastown has a very eclectic atmosphere with gift shops , foodie places and people watching . went there a few times just to soak up the atmosphere

title: Busy place with an amazing steam clock
reviews: This place is busy as there are lots of eateries, gift shops and the famous steam clock. Nice gentle walks around the street.

title: Shops with oldie times store fronts
reviews: Stroll the mile of Gas Town checking out the shops. Listen for the whistle of the steam engine clock tower. Take a picture with Gassy Jack's statue. Stop for lunch. Then you're done.

title: Fun energized area!!
reviews: Loads of trendy stores for shopping .So many fun restaurants to choose from. (Not chains restaurants) a lot of young people , trendy vibe on the street, stays open late too.

title: Great tourtist attraction but....
reviews: Must see tourist attraction ideal for gifts and souveniers. But, sadly there are a lot of homeless people sleeping on the streets with begging bowls knowing tourists were aplenty. Unfortunately, some with mental issues you really felt sorry for.

title: Gastown
reviews: Great walk  & good for a meal (don't miss the Steam Clock) Stay in the main tourist area are there are a lot of homeless person (stoners) living in the back streets

title: Quaint eateries, upscale shops and coffee
reviews: Loved the story of this area and the statue of 'gassy'. Lots of shops and restaurants. Loved this area.

title: Pretty
reviews: Pretty streets with colourful flowers hanging from the gorgeous streetlights, the buildings made for some nice photos but the main street with the classic clock is overrun with souvenir shops and tourists... I found it quite overrated...

title: Nice to see worth going to
reviews: We enjoyed walking around Gas Town, several shops and restaurants. Quite bussely. The gas clock was good to see.

title: Enjoyable part of Vancouver
reviews: We went to Gastown to see the steamclock, but there is more to Gastown. The old part of Vancouver has plenty nice shops, coffeshops and restaurant so a stroll through Water street is very pleasant.

title: Gas Clock was amazing!
reviews: I strolled through Gastown and came across the Gas Clock!  I had never heard of it (surprised) and was amazed by it!  I saw it at night, then the next day.  I preferred the view in the day as opposed to night.

title: Funky, Historic, Fun
reviews: Gastown takes you a step back in time.  What used to be the commercial and rundown part of town has been resurrected by shops and restaurants.  It is fun to stroll there.

title: Hobnobbing with the Bourgeois
reviews: City brochures should feature Gastown under the headline, "Come See Gentrification at Work!" The block-to-block juxtaposition of clean, high-quality, trendy establishments alongside the skiddest of Skid Rows full of drinking holes, hourly motels and cheap calorie dispensaries (these places barely qualify as "eateries") will ensure that only the most jaded and/or willfully ignorant fail to contemplate the cost-benefit ratio of gentrification. High quality services, upscale apartments and top-flight restaurants mean better jobs, safer streets and a high standard of living, but at what cost? And for whom? I haven't been to a city where the tony and the downtrodden exist in such numbers and in such close proximity as to be mentally jarring. I walked from Water St., to Carrall St. and then down Powell St. over to Main to catch a bus. (This was around sunset and I grew up in a very rough part of a city, so I was OK, but I would not recommend this for families or anybody who doesn't know how to handle themselves.) It was like walking from one city into a completely different one, from the First World into a developing country. How do we make sure that folks who are barely hanging on get lifted up as the rents rise and the job opportunities improve? How can I make choices that do not exclude those who need help and resources most of all? It's something that a visit here should make everybody think about.
