title: Keep to the path
reviews: Okay so no reflection on the establishments in Gastown & the steam clock is impressive...but do take care how far you walk down...we innocently carried on walking and before you knew it we were right bang in the middle of a less desirable area...quite intimidating when you're with young children...a lot of drug dependent people...rough sleepers and drunks...again every city has it's problems but here they seem to be more prevalent...like I said just be careful how far you walk and what time you go out...

title: Great start to our downtown visit
reviews: Came just in time to watch the clock at the full hour. Very cool, enjoyed an but of shopping as well, just have to watch to not get into the sketchy parts of the neighbourhood.

title: Great Vancouver Neighborhood
reviews: We loved hanging out in Gastown. Lots of great shops, plenty of restaurants to choose from, and neat architecture.  Very clean. Easy to get around. This is a great place to spend a day.

title: Interesting place
reviews: Lovely old place, buildings kept original. Has a steam clock, which you must see on the hour. Nice place to eat, and not far from downtown

title: Birthplace of Vancouver
reviews: It's the historic heart of Vancouver, where Gassy Jack built his saloon and started it all. It's a lot of fun, with an edge. Bars, restaurants, and souvenir shops, as well as higher end stores, are plentiful. But, be aware, the seedier side is plentiful although, safe. It's a good places to spend some time when you are in Vancouver.

title: Great morning spent browsing
reviews: We had a few hours to kill before our cruise, so we walked through Gastown, checking out the shops and admiring the overflowing flower baskets that grace every lamp post. It was a quaint area, but I wish it was open to pedestrians only. It is a busy road, so be careful walking.

title: Great vibe
reviews: Really nice street with a good vibe to walk down. Some great shops as well. The regular souvenir type places but also some high end fashion and a few quirky places like the shop selling all sorts of English food and drink. Well worth taking an hour for a stroll.

title: Hip, eclectic and alive!
reviews: An easy walk from many downtown hotels. Very popular with tourists and the locals. Great eateries and interesting architecture.Don't miss this hot spot when you are visiting Vancouver. Great place for a jumping off point before or after a cruise. About $35 CD flat rate by taxi from airport. No Uber here yet, but maybe someday.

title: Did we miss something?
reviews: We were excited to have a mooch around Gastown having read so much about it. We were visiting during the day and were expecting a buzzy atmosphere with lots of independent shops and cafes. Perhaps we missed something or came on a bad day but we didn't experience anything like this. What we did see were a lot of souvenir shops and some pretty rough-looking side streets. We saw the steam clock which is cool - and some of the old architecture was a breath of fresh air after the endless glass-fronted high rises everywhere else in Downtown... but that was about it. We were with our teenage Son so weren't there for the nightlife - and perhaps it comes alive at night a bit more, but for a day visit, it was a bit of a disappointment.

title: A lot of souvenir shops
reviews: I went with a friend and we went to all the souvenir shops.  Be aware when you see shops with big sale discounts.  Always good to shop around.  We got excited to see the first shop we went into with sales and discovered the the following shops had better prices.  The best attraction was the Steam Clock.  It makes music every half hour.  Well worth seeing.  As usual it was busy with crowds but that is expected in the summertime.

title: Great part of downtown!
reviews: We spent an afternoon walking around the area. They've got history,  art shops, boutiques and the requisite souvenir shops.  Best of all there are many great places to eat.

title: Lots of souvenirs
reviews: My wife and I visited Gastown as a stop on our hop-on-hop-off bus tour of Vancouver.  It is worth the visit even if to check out the souvenir shops, which are in abundance.  There are also lots of restaurants, which we did not visit, so not comments there.One highlight is the steam clock in the main street.  It is about the size of a grand-father clock and, yes, it is actually steam driven.

title: fun stroll
reviews: This was a fun area to walk through but obviously very touristy but I was able to get some great pics of the streets and statues but every other store was a $5 souvenir shop.  I was a nice area to get a stroll in though even though it was raining.

title: Not worth the trip
reviews: Except for numerous restaurants the shops are ok for tourists, a couple nice crystal shops, lots of people living on the street. Not as exciting as I remembered

title: Fun neighborhood
reviews: Gastown is a cute neighborhood with lots of restaurants, coffee shops and stores. The architecture is interesting.

title: Steam Clock
reviews: Great, busy part of the city, we walked from Canada Place.  We went to see the steam clock and it was very cool.

title: Historic charm.....
reviews: This is Vancouver's oldest neighbourhood and is full of history, charm and culture. It grew from a tavern which was founded by John "Gassy Jack" Deighton in 1867.Now it has something for everyone from architecture, restaurants, art galleries, and amazing shopping....!!!There's lots to see and do and walking tours are available of the area if you want to explore further and find out more about the place. We were only on a very brief visit enroute from the Okanagan region before we flew back to Ireland so didn't get chance to avail of them but will definitely do so when we return next year.A "must see" is the famous Steam Clock on Water Street.....it plays a tune and releases steam every 15 minutes...make sure you look out for the beautiful buildings and vintage lampposts too.There's even a statue to commemorate old "Gassy Jack"....!!!A stunning place..... We're looking forward to returning next year.

title: Historic walk
reviews: Heard lots about Gastown and how it got its name, only really one main road but worth visiting. Steam clock interesting, and plays every 15 mins. Plenty of shops which are not too expensive

title: Gastown- A must see
reviews: The oldest part of Vancouver with the beautiful old steam clock that plays a tune every fifteen minutes. There are plenty of nice restaurants and bars to have a beer or lunch at. It does get busy down there so try and get there early to avoid the crowds.

title: Worth a short visit
reviews: If in downtown vancouver i think its worth seeing this place. Whilst it isnt unforgivable if you dont, it certainly adds variety to the city landscape. A few nice restaurants and cafes along with the typical souvinir shops. And of course take a photo of the steam powered clock and join EVERY other tourist haha.I think 2-3hours is all you need at this place. Late afternoon is nice which allows you to dine in or attack the brewery.

title: Historic and tourist!?
reviews: Lots of tourist opportunities because it is close to the cruise port. You do need to go see the gas powered clock.

title: Fun shopping / tourist area
reviews: This a fun, bustling touristy area with lots of enjoyable stores including some first-rate native artwork.

title: Great
reviews: A great place to visit. Al fresco dining, cool boutiques, souvenirs to fill your bags. A reasonable priced area downtown Vancouver

title: Let down
reviews: Full of Japanese tourists and gift ships. Over crowded. If your going to get mugged it will be here. No visible police presence either and just around the corner to the real parts of the city where the officials would rather you did not go.

title: Most beautifull place of Vancouver city
reviews: For good restaurants and nice bars go to gastown. Also the steamclock can be Found here. Good for a very nice evening!

title: Gastown - steam clock
reviews: We visited Gastown in Vancouver and my favourite thing was the steam clock you can find there. It plays a tune every 15 minutes. But beware not to stand to close otherwise you will get wet.

title: Great for People Watching
reviews: Great area near downtown and the Convention Center with a lot of restaurants and interesting shops.You get a flavor of old Vancouver in the shadow of the glittering condos and office buildings of downtown.

title: Just a bunch of shops
reviews: Rates in the top20 of Vancouver attractions, but really, a shopping area? It has a few redeeming features like the nearby waterfront and a steam clock, but overall a little below par for a major city

title: Driving and walking
reviews: Old rejuvenated area, lots of restaurants , shops and tourists. Good place to walk around and feel the mood of the city.

title: Must Do
reviews: Gas town beautiful place, the steam clock is amazing must see and hear it, shopping is great much to see

title: Fun and busy
reviews: Lots of people, shops, restaurants, street artists. Good vibe and excellent Indigenous Galleries. Steam Clock not as expected (harder to pump with steam than I thought!) but interesting nonetheless.

title: History but too many vagrants
reviews: This was recommended and parts were full of history.  However there was a strong smell of urine in parts and there were many vagrants and drug addicts wandering around.  Did not feel comfortable.

title: Disappointing shopping experience
reviews: While there were some lovely buildings & galleries, most shops are tacky souvenir shops with all the same stuff - not even locally made. The steam clock was very interesting.

title: Lively and Different
reviews: Vancouver has so many places to explore, and this neighbourhood is great. See the steam clock in action, visit the great variety of shops, check out the street artists and their stalls- a super place to spend a couple of hours.

title: Historic section of Vancouver, touristy
reviews: Fun historic section of Vancouver, original site of city, with several iconic landmarks. Lots of easy walkable shopping, tourist type stuff as well as quaint shops, and places of all sorts to eat. Easy to spend a few hours there if you like shopping. Two stops on the hop on hop off tour in this neighborhood.

title: Sometimes very busy
reviews: Sometimes it gets very busy in this location ! But there is always something fun to do . And places to see and attractions to visit ! The famous steam clock is one of my faves :) love it for sure ! Can be a challenge to find parking etc if you're driving . But it's definitely worth a gander !

title: A moment in history.
reviews: Well worth the effort. Great for families and couples. A very beautiful part of Vancouver. The steam clock is a wonder to behold. Wait at least 15 min so you hear it "chime".

title: Best little neighborhood in Vancouver
reviews: Great place to stroll, shop and eat in Vancouver. However, be careful on the side roads as there are so many drug addicts and homeless people. The city has provided shelters and cheap accommodation to these people in the neighborhood and they blend in. While there are great restaurants and eateries on the main street, the sidewalks still smell urine. The city has no plans to power wash these sidewalks and be careful where to walk and what to step. A must see thing is the steam clock every hour at the intersection of Water and Cambie streets.

title: Do go and see the steam clock
reviews: Nice to walk around here with plenty of shops and a good atmosphere. The steam clock is interesting to look at and listen to.

title: The Founding Place of Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver, it all begins from here - Gas Town! It is a historic landmark of the City. The steam clock attracts most visitors to get here. A Must Do for travelers to this City.

title: must see place
reviews: You have to see gastown if you are staying in Vancouver. Beautiful district with a lot of street photography to be done and historic sites to be seen.

title: Too touristy
reviews: Except for the really cool steam clock, not a lot to see. A lot of souvenir stores, but not the most attractive part of town.

title: Nice area to walk, eat or shopping
reviews: Great area to go for a stroll, several restaurants, stores and other places to see. Steam Clock is in this area as well.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Gastown has a lot of shops and restaurants. Gastown streets and sites are a must see area of Vancouver.

title: Nice hipster type neighborhood
reviews: Gastown is a hipster style neighborhood so if this is what you like then you will feel right at home

title: Fun to walk around
reviews: I thought Gastown had a lot of charm! There's plenty of pubs and restaurants to choose from and quite a few souvenir shops too. The steamclock is quaint and just adds that much more character to the neighbourhood.

title: Lovely but careful where you wander
reviews: A great couple of streets in Vancouver- a nice wander and place to shop. However as some other people have commented, although people have recommended going at night - I wouldn't. Unfortunately there are a lot of homeless people, a food distribution place, within a street of the main area. I wouldn't feel safe here at night and be careful where you wander- stick to Water and Powell street.

title: Walking Tour
reviews: The highlight here is the steam clock. Be sure to visit on the top of the hour to really enjoy the show. (15) mins. The shops are common tourist style gifts. Lots of restaurants and pubs. Be aware they Vancouver is a metropolitan city and has the homeless and criminal element that goes with such a large city. No real danger, but be alert.

title: If you have the time Gastown is fun!
reviews: We did a lot of walking in Vancouver. Gastown was fun and full of small shops. If you have the time it is worth seeing.

title: Interesting
reviews: Being a native British Columbian, I've been to gastown many times.It was a rundown area for a long time but is being resurrected continually.It still has its moments but look for tours(foodie tours for example)that will walk you around and explain the interesting history of the whole place.

title: So quaint, beautiful architecture, beautiful flowers and trees!
reviews: We loved walking around Gastown admiring all the older buildings. Great places to eat too!  So quaint but yet feels very metropolitan.

title: Great stay in Gastown
reviews: You cannot stay in Vancouver without visiting Gastown. Nicely reconstructed, great shops and sufficient choices of good restaurants and bars.

title: Explore
reviews: Explore this little section of Vancouver. It's quaint and eclectic with lots of specialty shops and great eateries. No lack of choice for all types. And with this time of the year the evenings are balmy and it stays light out till almost 9pm. A wonderful atmosphere and we felt very safe. The steam clock is a tourist favourite and I must admit the rolling brings a smile to my face.

title: Fun Neighborhood
reviews: Lots of tourist shops as well as a fun brewery. Worth a visit!  We really enjoyed seeing people from all over the world!

title: Nice but less impressive than advertised
reviews: As this is a must see being in Vancouver we made a walk along the marina and Vancouver place towards gas town. Apart from some nice shops, mainly souvenir shops, tourists and hardly a chance for a nice foto - too many people around. Have expected more, specifically the steam clock was no more than "been there, done that". Other parts of the city are more exciting.

title: Homeless problem
reviews: Seriously alarming and unexpected.  Many examples of squalor.  Whole sidewalk of homeless, insane and destitute- didn't feel in danger , just really sad

title: Fun
reviews: You can walk easily and people are friendly and helpful.  Lots to see - even "people watching" was fun.

title: What's so good?
reviews: Maybe because I've travelled around but cannot understand why so many people rate this place- loads of better places to go if you like this sort of thing and with no begging

title: Tourist Area
reviews: Gastown is the main tourist area of Vancouver and the spot to go if you're looking for any sort of souvenir.  That said, it does offer some eclectic restaurants and shops.

title: Stay aways from Hastings St
reviews: Aug 1When we inquired about Gastown with the hotel front desk, we were told to not go down Hastings St and stay on Water St.  The scene of 2-3 blocks of Hastings by car can be scary.  There are literally hundreds of homeless men loitering about.  I have no idea what they are doing.It was only 10:00 am so none of the shops and restos were open for business.  The large statue of Gassy Jack got my curiosity.  He didn't live very long, but I suppose he lived a full life.It would be another 30 min before the Flying Pig resto would open.  We left Gastown.  It is probably very lively at night, but it is sleepy during the morning.

title: Nice old buildings but make sure you avoid Hastings street
reviews: We read the description of Gastown and went over to visit. We entered Gastown via Hastings Street and were appalled by the huge number of junkies/homeless people here. Not a pretty sight and certainly not the street with the trendy shops/restaurants. Although we didn't feel threatened we certainly didn't felt at ease. So if you want to visit Gastown be sure to miss Hastings Street and look carefully which streets are good to visit (Water Str and part of Cordova Str)

title: Loads of character
reviews: Great area to visit.  Loads of character.  Plenty of shops and places to eat and drink. Not to be missed when in Vancouver.

title: Must visit
reviews: Gastown named after Gassy Jack, pebble rock neighborhood that features many many restaurants and local art and clothing stores

title: Great place to walk around
reviews: There are plenty of options for places to eat or drink it can get a little touristy but a great place to visit

title: Eclectic European Atmosphere
reviews: We walked to Gastown and encountered a fun neighborhood of cute shops and eateries. Parking was limited on the street. It's definitely more suitable for foot traffic.

title: A visit with charm.
reviews: My wife and I visited gas town via the hop on hop off bus.Dropping you off in the centre of the main street.Up the street, Steam Clock down the street, Gassy Jack's statue "decision,We did both" (call us adventurous), the clock and statue are not to far to walk for anyone, and in between there are more than enough shops, bars and coffee out lets to satisfy everyone.The place has, dare I say " all that a tourist could ask for". it's cool.Spend a few hours on a visit.

title: SCARED FOR MY LIFE
reviews: Our morning stroll through the city turned into a sprint when coming across Gastown. Scared for our lives walking through junkies, used syringes on ground. The place is filthy.. Our tour director warned us not to go after dark no one in their right mind should ever go there. Travellers beware.

title: Gastown at Night
reviews: We visited Gastown by day then by night.  This area has a lot of old heritage buildings which are kept well by the way.  Old street lamp posts.  Is quite a long street.  Full of restaurants and shops.  Lots of souvenier shops here we found these to be the best in all Vancouver.    We revisited Gastown on a Friday night and the town came alive.  People everywhere dining shopping strolling.  A great vibe for sure. The old Steam Clock lets off steam every hour is quite cute to see. Be sure to check the Old Spaghetti Factory for dining its good value for money and a big menu full of variety.

title: Lively and hip
reviews: Gastown is a fun, lively and hip part of Vancouver BC. There are shops, galleries, and plenty of restaurants to entertain tourists and locals alike. Chocolate, coffee, clothes, and contemporary Inuit art. Check out the new Innuit clothing shop and the art galleries.

title: Vibrant historical area
reviews: It is a short walk along the Main Street with plenty to see, including quality shops.  We visited the football shop and they were generous and allowed us into the offices to see memorabiliaGas town has an interesting history and an unusual steam clock which is well worth seeing.

title: Nice shops, dirty street
reviews: Don't see the charm or understand the hype around this area. Lot of nice, unique shops and restaurants, but walking on the street is somewhat unpleasant. Recognizing that there are a good number of homeless people, more should be invested in maintenance and cleaning. Also very close to downtown Eastside, so be cautious of where you venture if you're exploring on foot. We inadvertently ended up in a very difficult area with our two teens. Good for them to see the flip side of Vancouver, but we felt a bit unsafe.

title: a great place
reviews: Lots of restaurants, bars, and a cute gas clock attractions. Every hour the gas clock has a little "performance", which is very cute

title: Interesting in more ways than one.
reviews: For Me there were many interesting buildings in this area. The steam clock is here. Gassy Jack's statue. Chinatown is nearby. As well as Vancouver Police Museum, a ghost tour and many great shops, restaurants and bars. There are also a lot of homeless and addicted people who apparently feed on change? I did notice some "Beware of pick-pocket" signs in the area. But I didn't have, nor did I noticed that personally.

title: Gastown, another spirit in Vancouver
reviews: I love Gastown for its spirit, street art and good food adresses : Nelson the Seagull, Revolver, Meat & bread, ..

title: Very touristy but the clock is magnificent
reviews: Pop down to Gastown on the bus to see the magnificent steam powered clock. Fans of steampunk will be particularly enthralled.

title: Not Too Bad
reviews: Walked through Gastown with a couple of friends. Probably would have rated it higher but it was the last thing we did on a very busy day and we were all extremely tired. It is an interesting area and has lots of dining choices. Should at least give it a try if you're in Vancouver for a few days

title: Eclectic part of town is not to be missed
reviews: Very fun and historic part of town that is not to be missed.  Great places to eat as well!  Walk around at night to feel the vibe

title: Not something interesting
reviews: The district is average. Its good for a stroll, maybe to have a coffee but nothing more! One interesting sight is an old steaming clock and a few buildings.

title: Seedy
reviews: historic area with a few interesting shops and a steam clockThqts the best bit. Loads of cheap tourist shops selling tacky Canadian crap made in ChinaVagrants.and homeless beggars abound and the sidewalk is covered in dog ends and trash coupled with dog and human waste to give a arma not found in most countries but that disgusting stale urine encountered in the odd multi story car parkCould do with a serious hosing down bu the city fire brigade

title: Old-town design and class
reviews: Cobblestone streets, funky buildings, shady trees, tons of restaurant options...Gastown is a little blast, and should be made part of every wandering experience in Vancouver. Don't miss the steam whistle clock in the heart of the district...it goes off on the hour with that familiar grandfather clock tune.

title: "Good for souvenir shopping"
reviews: A friend & I took the Seabus (overcrowded & overpriced ripoff) from Downtown Vancouver  to the Gastown area.  Unfortunately (due to overpriced parking fees) we only had 3 hours there so it went by too quickly.  We did see the historic Steam Clock and could see the busy area had lots of potential for walking, shopping and eating but we barely had time to go to 3 souvenir shops, take some quick photos, & see the Clock. I must warn visitors of the souvenir shops. Don't be fooled by big signs of "30 % off" like at the  C & K World Handbags  on Water St.  The saleslady was "too friendly" and made you think you were getting the best deal-& there were plenty of great souvenirs to choose from-but if you go check out the prices at other stores, they are lower than the jacked up then "discounted" ones there..  Also, in Suraj Fashion & Gifts on Water St., the salesman actually asked me to hand over my credit card-NO ONE ELSE DID THAT-(I could kick myself for not refusing at the time, was just surprised) and he was the one who handled it, looked at it, put it in his mobile credit card reader, answered "yes" when it asks if the total is correct, which I assume by law is only supposed to be done by the card owner, and didn't even thank me for the purchase.. I was quite concerned later that  there'd be a fraudulent charge on my card due to this suspicious behavior (so far ok).  I would recommend skipping this shop since there are better options.  The best souvenir shop was Smileys on Water St. since the owners (?) were so very nice (Japanese, I believe since they accepted Yen too as payment). They also accepted payment in U.S. $ and actually figured out the correct  amount, unlike Suraj's shop & others which technically accept the $, but don't give you the actual value (since the $ was worth more). There was a good selection of souvenirs & shops here-as long as you avoid or are aware of the ones I warned of-and much better prices here than at tourist areas.

title: Great streetscape
reviews: The icing on the cake , best place to be in Vancouver downtown, great architecture/ restaurants/pubs/coffeeshops . Its a great place for any occasion really.  Solo , couple or with friends

title: Fun area
reviews: This was one of our stops on our hop on and hop on tour of Vancouver.   We stopped and walked around looked like a lot of small restaurants and shops.  Close to our hotel so we just walked back leisurely "window shopping".

title: Must go
reviews: It is the most beautiful area of vancouvers, full of life, people walking in the street, a lot of pretty restaurants, coffees, bars and stores

title: An old looking street with nice cafe s and gift shops
reviews: It worth to spend an hour or so to go visit this part of the city. It's a street that gives an old style yet clean, colourful feeling. It is full of cafes and gift shops, and of course a steam clock which is always surrounded by tourists.

title: Quirky place.
reviews: Gastown in Vancouver is a great place to visit. It's the oldest part of Vancouver and has some great architecture, restaurants and shops. A must see is the steam clock which sounds of every quarter.

title: Historic Gastown
reviews: I visited Gastown about 25 years ago and was taken by the historic feel of the place and one could feel it's potential for restoration. Well, much of the restoration has taken place but the store fronts are primarily tourist shops. If you look hard enough, you will find interesting, one of a kind home decor and clothing stores. It's still very charming to walk the historic streets but I suggest you find a time when a cruise ship isn't in port. The crowds can detract from the experience.

title: For a look
reviews: Cute little area with lots of shops cafes and a few pubs not hard to find the steam clock was worth a look

title: Unique Stores and Restaurants
reviews: We took the "Hop Off Hop On" bus to this area. There are 2 convenient stops in the centre of Gastown. There is also a Sky Train stop here too. My one caution is don't venture down side streets as it gets very scary quickly (sketchy characters) . The main strip has great shops and many historical buildings. Well worth a visit.

title: Clock the least of the attractions in Gastown
reviews: The iconic steam clock is fun, but the shopping and food will keep you coming back.Eat or snack in cutting edge restaurants with unique menus and matching cocktails. Sit in a sidewalk cafe and talk to locals or people from around the world. Shop for everything from tourist kitsch to unique jade and jewelry. Browse clothes or high-end home decor.Only blocks from the small but exquisite Chinese Gardens.Gastown is one of my favorite places in the Pacific NW.

title: Lovely area
reviews: There is a lot of extreme poverty right in the area and that was troubling to see. It makes you appreciate what you have and hopefully will inspire people to volunteer to help the less fortunate. Having said that, gas town is a really fun and cool area with tons of shopping and eateries. It's a nice area so walk around and pop into some of the businesses. Plus there is a gas clock that goes off every 30 minutes. Lots of instagram photo ops there!

title: Erm
reviews: I have to admit i don't really get gastown..in fact i could easily describe it as seedy. The delicate aroma of piss and dope doesnt help matters. Not my favourite part of vancouver at all.

title: Interesting part of the city
reviews: This part of the city is very nice and has some interesting buildings, including the famous steam clock.  You have to be aware there are some dodgy people around so be careful of thieves. homeless and mentally ill people on the streets, who can be a bit threatening to all around some steal from the shops when the staff are not looking.

title: GREAT SOUVENIR SHOPPING
reviews: I probably enjoyed this area of Vancouver the best, probably because it was the cleanest. Great stores for gifts and each store was pretty competitive  in their pricing. Great restuarant choices and outdoor dining.

title: Gastown is a must visit neighborhood in Vancouver.
reviews: Best in summertime however there are great restaurants and pubs  and shops in this area. In summer there are almost always street artists for entertaining and outdoor cafes to sip good brewed coffee and eat a sumptuous snack or two...or stroll eating an ice cream cone.Pubs and clubs as well. Close to downtown and business district. Get your icture with gassy Jack! Lots of fun.

title: Great place to visit.
reviews: Shopping is great and some nice souviners. Nice places to eat at some of the shop owners are pushey but other wise quite good.

title: Nice street
reviews: This street gives a good old time feel. Has a rustic cobblestone street with shopping and lots of places to eat.

title: Great place to visit
reviews: Great place to visit and walk around when you have a few hours to kill.  Lots of shops and restaurants.  Visit the Steam Clock.  Also great for people watching.

title: Plan for crowds in summer
reviews: Gastown is a pleasant enough walk filled with shops selling Vancouver souvoniers and high end local artists studios. The steam clock was a main attraction. There were ample parking garages.

title: Fascinating little patch
reviews: Great place to wander for an hour or two.  Interesting little restaurants and shops in interesting old buildings.  Baskets of flowers hanging along the street when I was there.  Very colourful and a great place to get photos of "old" Vancouver.

title: Charming neighbourhood
reviews: Enjoyed exploring here, although not that big of an area. Loved the older buildings, gas lamps and the steam clock. Worth taking a stroll and maybe grabbing a coffee.

title: Not much to see here
reviews: Not much to see here. Typical tourist strip selling touristy type things and restaurants that Seem to be just decent at best.

title: Fun Place
reviews: Gastown is a neat place to visit during a trip to Vancouver!  Rich history and great little shops and restaurants!

title: Pretty trendy... lots of homeless people and druggies
reviews: I was hoping gas town would be a lot cooler than it was.I probably talked up the steam clock a little too much, my kids were not that impressed when we got there.  There are cool cafes and pubs and we had dinner at a nice Italian joint opposite the steam clock.We went for a walk after dinner (say about 7pm), and there are a lot of homeless people and drug users about.  It provided for some good conversation with the kids and overall it is raised good issues to talk about with our kids.  Some of the scenes were a bit distressing (vomiting on the street).Either way, would go back again when everyone one is a bit older

title: Fabulous exciting street
reviews: This is an amazing area, with plenty of great shops, but we loved all the pubs... old style, modern...great food choices. Its really worth a look.

title: Definitely worth a walk and look around
reviews: Gastown is a lovely area to walk around whilst in the city of Vancouver.  It is very pretty and has lovely shops to look at and buy from, and some great places to eat from or to grab a coffee from, good people watching too.  I liked the fact it was pretty shady too, which added to the attractiveness of the area but also helped it feel a little cooler too while walking around.  Definitely worth going here when visiting Vancouver.

title: Interesting place with interesting people
reviews: Debated on whether to visit as some reviews focus on the homeless which are there.  Decided to go and glad we did.  It has lots of interesting restaurants and shops.  Yes, there are homeless people as in any city but they are outnumbered by tourists 100 to 1.

title: Nice neighborhood
reviews: Home of the first steam clock. Spouts a whistle every 15 minutes. Nice and mellow neighborhood to get away from the more hectic  down town area.

title: Night life
reviews: This place is popping ! People everywhere and great clubs . I absolutely loved the steam clock and went back several times just to see it go off !

title: Lovely
reviews: Great place to stroll, shop and eat. We loved The Water Street Caf√©, had a fabulous dinner there.A fair few souvenir shops, it's the quaint "old town" part of Vancouver, well worth a visit.

title: Worth a trip but basically a shopping area
reviews: The title says it all really. Good to see. The steam clock is fun. Not a chilled place though. Try the Black Frog by the clock. A small haven.

title: Hip and charming
reviews: Lots of great walking streets with great bars and restaurants. The boundaries can be a little tricky with all the homeless people around, so just pay attention to where you're planning to go.

title: Vancouver history
reviews: This area has some quaint buildings and a clock that is run by steam power. Great photo stop and don't forget to take a picture of the plaque so you remember how it works.

title: Fun to walk around
reviews: We had a great time walking around Gastown.  Lots of fun shops and restaurants.  It was not too crowded on a Sunday afternoon.

title: Great area
reviews: Arrived in preparation for cruise to Alaska, will spend 4 days before getting on boat.  Have been here before and enjoyed area, many good restaurants and if inclined novelty shops.  Well worth 1 or 2 days in area.

title: Really nice area to visit at night.
reviews: Lots of reasuarants to choose from, be sure to make a reservation. The steam clock is a must see, every 15 minutes

title: Ok but not what I expected it to be
reviews: We walked around Gastown the first day we were in Vancouver.  There are several stores and places to eat.  The steam clock was cool.  There were several people sleeping on the sidewalks and others asking for money.  Either the homeless rate is high in this area or it is a good place to ask for money or both.

title: Good vibe
reviews: Great to stroll through here at night.  Lovely hanging baskets and multibulb lights add to the ambience as does the good natured crowd.  Would strongly advise booking dinner as many establishments book out early.

title: Gastown Walking Tour
reviews: Nice place to walk through and visit shops. Lots of nice restaurants with outside seating. Steam Clock viewing was nice; operates on the hour.

title: Quaint European district
reviews: We spent an afternoon there. Fun to walk around the area and take time to sit out for a drink and meal or desserts in the open air sidewalk restaurants. One nice surprise - we visited several furniture stores in the area and they have wonderful showroom displays. It's such a refreshing change from all the souvenir shops and we enjoyed that visit thoroughly.

title: Full of history
reviews: Saw as part of our tour. Full of history and the clock was amazing. We sadly didn't get off our tour bus as we were up against time but if given the opportunity I certainly would.

title: Celebrating retirment
reviews: Loved Gastown. Lots of restaurants, plenty of tourist. Lots of benches to take a rest. make sure to see the statue of Gassy Jack.

title: Gastown is a fun 'happening' place
reviews: We spent our first evening in Gastown - got to see the steam clock on the quarter hour AND the hour!  We enjoyed having happy hour at Rogue and walked around and had dinner somewhere - later.

title: Older neighbourhood
reviews: Gastown has a sense of history with older buildings and quirky, more individual shops. It is a nice area just to potter around in.

title: Food and shopping
reviews: Ate in Gastown 3 different evenings and didn't have one bad food experience.  The wines and the food were excellent at every place we ate.

title: Ghastly Gastown
reviews: The architecture is marvelous,  the streets no so much-roads are rough and pot holed, lots of homeless wandering around, lots of drug activity. We did not stay long as it appeared to be an area that needs attention from authorities.

title: Fun!
reviews: We took the Hop On Hop Off and decided to get off & walk around Gastown.  Full of lovely restaurants, boutiques and bars - lots to see.  Very touristy but fun.

title: FUN
reviews: Just chockfull of unique shops and unique people, we could have spent a whole day exploring all over this little spot.

title: Interesting but very confronting
reviews: I accidentally strayed onto a street filled with homeless people, street walkers and drug addicts. It's very confronting. The streets reek of urine. Vancouver needs to clean its act up in this area as the restaurants and shops are great but it feels a little unsafe and the stench is really bad. It's such a shame as it is a beautiful city.

title: Nice area
reviews: Spent half a day walking up the street, a few v nice coffee shops & gift shops.Lots of history associated with the area.Clean.

title: Love Gastown, Very Charming Area
reviews: There just wasn't enough time to visit every part of this amazing city. However, my husband and I did manage to make it down to Gastown for a few hours. The streets are lined with beautifully charming buildings and lamp posts. It's wonderful to simply walk and browse the shops. If I had it to do over again, I would have tried one of the many restaurants, maybe dined outside where the lights twinkled in the trees. I wouldn't recommend this area for families or late at night. I believe the shops begin closing right around dark. I did feel safe in the area, however, I don't think there would have been much to do later, other than eat or drink. Unusual sight seeing opportunity in the area; the steam powered clock. Go see it!

title: A must see but needs to be cleaned up
reviews: We visited Vancouver some 10 years ago and Gastown had always been one of our most vivid memories. On our new trip to Vancouver, we sure came back to Gastown to relive the emotions of the steam clock and the nice restaurants, shops and amenities of the area. Those are still there, as the night life, the good food and the fancy shops. However we were a little shocked in seeing people buying and using drugs (I mean it : literally doing drugs) on the corners, in the alleys - like that, as if it was just normal. Not just one : many. Too many. No moral question here - I am just saying that when you're walking with your kids it's not nice to see people shooting in their arms and throwing used syringes on the street. Sorry guys, the place is beautiful but you need to fix that problem.

title: Lovely old portion of Vancouver
reviews: The traveler can enjoy a stroll through the older portion of Vancouver, with ample opportunities for a good meal, or a chance to browse in some upscale shops.

title: Beautiful architecture and people watching
reviews: Gps sent us to Cordova street and I was disappointed as it felt a bit downtown sketch, but we quickly learned Gastown sights are shops are more so on Water Street one block north. The brick lined streets and layout was gorgeous. There are tons of outdoor seating areas at restaurants which is great for enjoying the nice weather and fun people watching. People were going crazy over the steam clock, but my favorite part were the fun restaurants and shops. Sidewalks are intricately designed with bricks so I'd suggest not wearing heels. Lots of spots to shop, grab and bite and a beer, and snag your souvenirs and trinkets, then come back later for the nightlife. Quick walk from the waterfront station on the Canada line.10/10 would recommend

title: Touristy, but still a joy to visit.
reviews: Old Gastown in Vancouver, although a bit overrun by the typical souvenir and tourist shirt establishments still maintains much of its appeal by preservation of the character of the architecture and ambiance.  Old buildings are generally well preserved and not transformed in outrageous ways and there is a genuine buzz about the area.  It's full of life and you feel very comfortable walking through Gastown.  It was most pleasant on a warm July evening; even on a weekday, the place is very active and alive.  Stay close to the waterfront as it gets a bit seedy away from the water.

title: Touristy but Fun
reviews: Gastown and the adjacent China Town are blatantly touristy, but nonetheless upbeat and entertaining areas to visit with interesting architecture and shops, historic signage and an abundance of restaurants and watering holes.

title: Cute and trendy
reviews: Very cute ambiance, lots of shopping, trendy bars/restaurants. Perfect place to just walk around and grab a drink before/after dinner

title: Lots of "Stuff"
reviews: Unless you are a tourist who has to come home with a teeshirt or stuffed moose toy, the joy of gastown is the walk, in great summer temperatures, with thousands of other people, through an historic part of town. That is a compliment, not a complaint.

title: Touristic
reviews: Not really authentic anymore, although really good renovated. It lost its charm however. Many cafes and restaurants to choose from.

title: Gastown at Night
reviews: Recently a Friend and I went thru Gastown on a Monday Night and it was alive with activity! There were lots of People out enjoying the warm Summer Evening - the Restaurants seemed popular as they were full - there was a Crowd standing around the Steam Clock waiting for it to go off - tons of great Shops - totally worth another Visit! Some of the most unique Buildings I've ever seen! It is a Lovely place and a real Treasure!

title: Very "neat" place to visit
reviews: We were in a group of 12 and accessed it by our hop on hop off bus.   There are many unique restaurants and shops.  It makes it feel like you have transcended back in time to the Charles Dickens era somewhat.  There is a steam driven clock that is really unique and amazing.  Great place to visit if in Vancouver.

title: A pleasant place to while away an afternoon
reviews: So this place is well and truly on the tourist map - so you'll be enjoying it with everyone else!We were there on a Sunday, so some of the shops were closed but those we did pooch into were pleasant/quirky and there were some nice pubs and bars around.....plus of course the steam clock!

title: A walk back in time
reviews: Nice street and old pubs with good craft beer. Steam clock was unique. Streetscape with the hanging plants amice touch.

title: A different experience
reviews: Nice shops, nice restaurants. Be aware of Hastings Street, this is where you. An find all the drug addicts and homeless people, for us this was very sad to see.

title: Interesting old town area
reviews: Interesting place to walk around to see how send to be in old Vancouver. The steam clock in an unusual item - and probably unique.  The area is worth  an hour or so of your time.

title: Hipster Hangout
reviews: Nice place to hang out on a restaurant patio and have a meal, and great for people watching. Walk through and sit in a strong stench of weed the entire time, this is where hipsters and trendy millennials hang out, not the right place for an older or more mature crowd. We went into this area to go to the Vancouver Whitecaps team store, and gave the area a chance, but didn't want to stay and hang out.

title: Place is a tad too touristy
reviews: Read great reviews about gastown but was a little disappointed when I went there. The place is touristy with loads of souvenir shops but I have to say, the range of goods in those shops are mind boggling. There are also many restaurants and cafes there so may be a good place for you to check out if you like people watching or food. Guess you should still make a trip here if you have the time. The Gastown Steam Clock is interesting, go check it out.

title: Amazing Area
reviews: I love the Gastown area. It has amazing coffee shops, Revolver is a must! It's really easy to get to on the SkyTrain and there's great stores and restaurants.

title: Fun place to shop and eat
reviews: Our hotel was near Gastown so we spent a lot of time in the district shopping and eating. Very attractive and well kept.

title: Great Place!
reviews: We stayed note far from here.  It was fun to walk through in the early morning when there were fewer tourists and get coffee, then return later in the day and the place was full of energy and merriment.

title: Very touristy
reviews: On our first day in Vancouver we strolled down to the waterfront and then onto Gastown. It's a quaint and historical area but there are lots and lots of souvenir shops as well as eateries so once you have been into a couple there is not much else happening.

title: My favorite Vancouver neighborhood.
reviews: Visited this area several times and each time found something new. Being originally from the NYC area, the best comparison I have is to the West Village. Lots of unique shops, pubs and restaurants. Don't miss the steam clock perform on the hour.

title: Just a tourist shopping centre
reviews: Two blocks of souvenir shops, a few bistros and a few galleries.  Pleasant but not something that i would go back to.

title: Too Many Souvenir Shops
reviews: There were way too many repetitive souvenir shops.  Quite a few eateries.  I would have liked more interesting boutiques

title: Fun
reviews: A great place to walk around, get drinks, food, shop and people watch.   Visiting Vancouver stop by Gastown.

title: Quaint
reviews: The places is nice, romantic, full of little stores and places to eat. A great places to walk around, have cofee or a beer. It has some nice souvenir stores.

title: Social visit
reviews: Visited Gastown on the hop on hop off buses and decided to visit one evening.Not disappointed on return and had a walk around and decided to eat at an Irish bar which was very Iively and well frequented.Food and drink was very good and served by short skirted very friendly waitresses.This restaurant was one of many in Gastown but all of them were very busy and it was well worth a visit

title: Great Visit
reviews: We attended the Forbidden Tour of Gastown and loved it.  We returned the next day to shop and loved the little shops, food and sweet treats. The only negative is the amount of beggars (street people) and druggies hanging around.  The beggars can get quite aggressive at times and follow you into stores and restaurants.  We did not like that part of the visit.  Otherwise it was enjoyable.

title: The beating heart of Vancouver
reviews: This is the place where the first whisky bar was opened, forming the basis of Vancouver. It's still lively, full of restaurants, bars and shops. It also houses the famous steam clock. A must visit if you come to Vancouver.

title: Enjoy the action
reviews: People watching, shopping, the steam clock, and fabulous restaurants are the reason to enjoy this easy-going area. No pretense, just good experiences.

title: shopping & food
reviews: I didn't eat in Gastown, but the shopping was good. The closer you get to the cruise terminal, the more kitschy souvenir shops there are, but down towards the clock & Maple Square there are specialty shops.

title: Sad sight
reviews: Gastown is now a very confused part of this city. One street may hold some smart boutique or fine dining venue and the adjoining street filled up with the down and outs of this very wealthy city. Even local newspapers are saying there is a major problem with a lack of social housing leaving many to fend for themselves living on the street. Stay in the busy areas.

title: Too many Crazy Homeless People
reviews: There are a few cute stores in between mostly touristy tacky ones. However there are way too many crazy homeless people and mobs of Chinese Tourists. You are better off visiting other areas of Vancouver.

title: Wow
reviews: Full of people, art galleries, gawkers (like us).  Just a nice, interesting mostly shaded walk right near the Canada Centre.  Lots of restaurants, too.  Very much worth the stroll.

title: Amazing choices
reviews: Great area to eat or shop for something special, wlaking distance to everthing or use the hop on hop off trolley tours.

title: Steam Clock and Water Street Cafe
reviews: Had a great time strolling around Gastown and dining at the Water Street Cafe.  The famous Steam Clock is right across the street and goes off every 15 minutes.

title: great part of town
reviews: Full of lovely restaurants, boutiques and bars - lots to see..... downside: full of tourists. Reminded me a bit if SoHo in NYC.

title: Good for Pub Crawling
reviews: Very touristy! Mostly small eateries and a few souvenir shops. Lots and lots of people. Watched the steam clock go off and ate at a great pub, the Black Fog. Good for dinner and pub crawling.

title: Historically beautiful
reviews: Get off sky train and stroll a few blocks to Gastown. Beautiful old architecture with active social shopping and restaurants full of life and locals as well as tourists

title: A quaint place worth a visit
reviews: We were a group of ten staying at a downtown hotel. Gastown was a nice 20 minute walk. One could savour the old culture and pick up some interesting souvenirs. Of course the steam clock is a must see. Great places to eat close by on the sea front. A good way to spend a few hours.

title: Loved Gastown
reviews: Gastown is such a cool part of downtown Vancouver.There are lots of funky restaurants, bars & shops.The steamclock was a real novelty! It goes off every 15 minutes.I particularly loved all the fairy lights.

title: Cafe culture in Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Hundreds of place to eat and drink, catering for all tastes. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are all available with an atmosphere that just hits the perfect note.

title: Neat, tourist spot
reviews: This is definitely a tourist spot, but still neat to walk around. The steam clock is gorgeous and fun to watch at the took it the hour. As with any major city in the tourist spots, be aware if your surroundings. It is not far from Hastings street where the homeless tend to congregate.

title: Gastown walk and sample
reviews: Wonderful mix of old/new and slightly bizarre. Good for evening stroll with sampler or drink crawl. Or just people watch. Start at Gassy Jack and loop around.

title: Nice place to walk around
reviews: We loved this area of Vancouver, nice shops and restaurants.  Stop to see the steam clock!  We were there in late afternoon and there was plenty to see and do.

title: Very intriguing
reviews: Lots to see and do. Many quaint shops and restaurants. Only steam clock around. Great must see area.

title: Eclectic Visit
reviews: During out 3 day stay we had dinner in this part of town twice. It's edgy for those that are not use to large cities. Cute shops and homeless people sometimes difficult to visit. Expect some panhandling. Otherwise our dinners were nice.

title: Fun place
reviews: It has a lot of shops and many restaurants, it's a beautiful place to walk and it has a steam clock that sounds every hour.

title: Nice walkabout
reviews: The steam clock and the whole old charm atmosphere, with lots of shops, pubs, and restaurants. Not far from the harbor or downtown area. Great way to enjoy and afternoon and finish with a nice dinner at one of the many restaurants per your taste.

title: Loved this Neighborhood
reviews: Our family of 5 spent an evening in Gastown. A must see neighborhood, history, culture, architecture, fun restaurants, and street artists. Make a reservation to eat or expect a wait. You can take a self guided walking tour, book a guided tour, or easily wander about on your own. Area is not too big but packed with much to see.

title: Historically Significant Tourist Spot
reviews: Great historical area on stone covered street with shops, restaurants, and beautiful Victorian architecture.  Some  of the area has been remodeled but most are the original buildings.  You can walk to Canada Place from here.

title: Interesting area. Pretty and funky.
reviews: To be honest, I'm not sure what I really expected out of gas town based on other reviews. But I really did enjoy it. It is an eclectic mix of different stores, restaurants, and people. We walked around checking out the sights and had dinner. The steam clock is pretty cool, but only interesting for about 5 minutes. Be advised though that Gastown is an area that has a significant homeless population right near it. The homeless don't appear to be very aggressive (I've seen much worse) but there are a lot of them. It's not "bad" but was unexpected. We walked to Gastown from Chinatown and the streets in between are kind of dicey. I would not venture through there at night. And we were warned away by locals from both locations after dark. Glad I went but probably won't be back without a good reason or activity.

title: Charming spot for lunch
reviews: We asked a cab driver to take us to an interesting place for lunch that was not overrun by tourists...he hit the nail on the head, as Gastown was an interesting place for shopping and we had a great lunch at an out door cafe.

title: Interesting
reviews: Loved the steam clock on the foot path. Some great buskers. Some interesting shops to walk into. A great afternoon stroll.

title: An evening out with friends
reviews: Such an exciting little area it's got such a buzz about it lots of restaurants & pubs such a lot going on the tourist shops were open for last minute trinket gifts.

title: Fun walking through Gastown
reviews: Use to be a lot more shops by locals and more cute boutiques. Still some, but not as many.  Fun walking area.

title: Truly Vancouver: historical Trendy and Unique
reviews: Gastown founded as a seamy stopping place for newcomers to Vancouver in the early 1800's has an interesting history:stop and read the plaques and check out the free on line tour by Vancouver's Architectural Society.  Awesome little shops of all kinds from tourist kitsch, to artist galleries, haberdashery, vintage clothes, books ..lots of browsing bliss.  Stop at any of the restaurants and bistros.  I love Nuba Restaurant and the Gyoza Bar is great, so is Urban Brioche, Cochilla, Jules Casual French Bistro, Bread and Meat...there are so many great choices, I haven't been disappointed yet. You can walk around and soak up the atmosphere or spend money on some incredible original art, so it's a place that fits all budgets.  It's right beside the Waterfront station, so you can go there easily from any where in Vancouver and you can spend one hour or a whole day.  I preference going for 10am until 2pm and that still gives me time to head off to bike ride around Stanley park, or head to the theatre or comedy clubs a quick transit ride away.

title: Interesting spot in interesting city
reviews: We had a very brief stay in the Gastown area of Vancouver , but it was interesting and a good place to spend much more time

title: A village inside the city
reviews: Gastown is like the individual neighborhoods in Boston or Washington DC (for us east coasters).  I love the architecture and the vibe of the place.  There are restaurants everyone and if you are into people watching, plenty of outdoor seating.

title: authentic
reviews: the area, made up of small shops and eatery's had an old world authentic feel, slightly dirty and run down but in a good way, if you know what I mean....always extremely busy, with once again, many homeless people gathering there.It is not a pedestrian area, so beware of the cars, many showing off classics, a great thing for me as a car nut but many driving too fast for a street full of people...

title: History
reviews: Loved this spot, great place to eat or just sit and watch. History of the steam clock to the advent of Gastown. Very enjoyable. Can be busy on the weekends.

title: Great Section of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown a must visit on a stay in Vancouver - Please make it a point to see the  steam clock that is a must for photos

title: Not as Good as Last Time
reviews: went there 10 years ago and it was excellent, this time it was still o/k but very samey on the food side and very busy.

title: Pleasant place for a stroll!
reviews: Be sure to visit the Steam Clock, ideally on the hour, but otherwise at a 15 minute interval.Nice character on Water Street.

title: Great atmosphere in Gastown
reviews: We enjoyed the great atmosphere in Gastown, streets are clean, and there are lots of nice cafes and restaurants, shops and boutiques, you can stroll around as long as you can.

title: Quaintness abounds.
reviews: We enjoy the eclectic choice of shopping and places to eat as well as the many photo opportunities.  It was the best part of our trip for the first timers we brought with us.

title: Great place for evenings in Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a great place to go for an evening stroll and has some great restaurants. Make sure you visit the Steam Clock - great to see and hear when it strikes the half hour / hour/ quarter. We were  lucky enough to see a film in the making too as Gastown was being used for a film set. Apparently it is used quite a bit for this. Plenty of souvenir shops too for last minute gifts.

title: Tourist Trap But Amazing
reviews: Some of the most overpriced stores in the world are in Gastown but its still a great place to come and hang out and see the hawkers the big steam clock and just chill but bring ur wallet. Lol. Xx

title: Fun to walk around
reviews: Great place to walk around, people watch at a cafe and check out the historical part of Vancouver. Definitely one of the must see places when visiting.

title: Small and Quaint!!
reviews: This small part of Vancouver, which borders Railtown and Chinatown, retains its buildings from a much earlier era, giving it a very quaint feel and look. In fact, it doesn't quite feel like it's part of the rest of downtown Vancouver. There are a lot of fashionable bars, restaurants and shops in this area. And of course, it has its famous steamclock,which was much smaller than had imagined it would be.  If you have enough time, try to make a point of spending some time here.

title: Fun place to visit.
reviews: We walked to Gastown this afternoon. This section of town reminded me of a town in the late 1800s. The street were brick and storefronts were old looking. There were many unique stores and restaurants. The only reason for 4 stars instead if 5 is that 2 beggars asked us for money in the first five minutes we were there.

title: Shopping, Bars and Restaurants
reviews: If you like to browse in shops, eat or drink beer, this is a must.  It's a clean, safe place to explore.  It's a historical part of town and was within walking distance from our hotel, so we decided to check it out.  You can also get there via the Hop on, Hop off trolley.  Certainly worth your time to visit.

title: Dinner in Gastown
reviews: Artsy and hip area, very inviting.  It does have some big tourist shops if you want to get Canada branded stuff, but it also has local specialties.  Avoid the perimeter later at night because there are a lot of homeless people and may not be safe.

title: Spend your time and money elsewhere
reviews: Spent 2 hours on Gastown visit - I wish that time was spent elsewhere... The streets were filthy, full of people who looked homeless and/or on drugs. It was hard to park, we ended up paying for parking on the 8th floor of a parking garage - to find out later that the elevator did not work (without any warning or explanation). Vancouver and it's surroundings has so many treasures that you cannot find anywhere else... We were amazed by Sea to Sky highway, Stawamus Chief, Shannon Falls, Seawall, Lynn Canyon Park - and I am sure we did not get a chance to see 10% of it in the 3 days we had. Do not waste your time on Gastown, especially if you live far from Vancouver and your visit is short.Take advantage of what's best in Vancouver - it's outdoor paradise. Yes, it is an enjoyable experience to visit a place that has old buildings, cobblestones, vintage lampposts, etc. - but chances are there is a town somewhere much closer to you where all these things exist and are cared for much better than in Gastown.

title: Free tour
reviews: The guide was good, Erik. He did a good job. Some of the stories were not very exciting.  Recurring tales of European destruction and murder  Enslaving groups for own benefit then oppressing them.  Yada yada yada.

title: Old city
reviews: Gastown comes under old city, it has good and famous restaurants. Loved Mexican food at Taco restaurant. nice to hangout and walk around..

title: Nice area for bars and restaurants
reviews: Walked through gas town for dinner Sunday evening and there are lots of restaurants and bars but unfortunately many of them closed around 7-9pm

title: Vibrant and Souvenir Stop
reviews: Steps from the Convention Center and the Waterfront Station (Sea Bus, LRT, Train).  It is Vancouver's oldest settlement area.  Cobblestone streets with signature street lamps (you'll recognize in movies shot here).  Very touristy with lots of souvenir shops.  Good restaurants, galleries and coffee shops as well.  A must see if you're in Vancouver.  There are several parkades (parking garages) as well as metered street parking if you're driving.

title: So pretty
reviews: So pretty, all the flowers, the neat shops and restaurants. The clock was neat to see. A great place to sit outside and have a lunch.

title: Dirty "grunge" area full of souvenir shops
reviews: I can't believe this place is truly recommended by any reputable tourist books.  It is is full of junky shops selling maple syrup and Canadian leaf boxer shorts to tourists. Plus, it attracts loitering grunge types smoking marijuana. So gross. We couldn't wait to get out of there.

title: Great spot
reviews: If you're in Vancouver, you have to visit the oldest part of the town, great shops, great coffee houses and great restaurants. Something for all the family. Make sure you see the steam clock too! Very pretty.

title: Nice to walk around
reviews: This is a quaint area with mostly gift shops, restaurants, coffee shops and galleries.  The street lights are old fashioned gas lamps and there is a unique very narrow building in the heart of gastown near the statue of the founder of Gastown. There are some unique shops mixed in with Canadian souvenir shops. It's a very walkable area.

title: Old town vancouver
reviews: We had a great time walking around Gastown. It was fun to see this area even though streets were crowded with cruise ship passengers.. It has a vibrant, fun and welcoming atmosphere.We loved seeing the steam clock! the shopping is great. there are the usual tourist souvenir stores but there are many really beautiful and unusual stores as well. We didn't eat there but there are lots of great looking restaurants!!

title: Loved the steam clock üòä
reviews: A lovely area - probably not so nice later at night but a great place to go for a drink of a meal - the steam clock is an obvious tourist draw and worth a look best on the hour when it chimes fully

title: Great window shopping
reviews: We had a lovely morning exploring Gastown, lots of high end shopping along side the usual tourist traps!  Lovely old buildings, history and character! Loads of places for a meal or a drink. We did see the steam clock but unfortunately it was obscured by barriers in preparation for a cycling event starting that evening! It was a lovely place to see some of the older parts Iv Vancouver.

title: Lots to see and Do
reviews: This area is very popular for tourists as it is just a stone throw away from the cruise ship terminals.  Food services, shopping and cafe's abound.  You can even get a haircut or buy cool glasses.

title: Best Marigold Hotel Scarborough
reviews: Again a very popular place for people watching. There is a good story behind this place. You have to read the story on the statue to understand it. A very busy spot.

title: Good for walking
reviews: Really nice historical buildings and a huge selection of food. There is also great art scattered throughout, so it is a fun place to just walk through.

title: Gas Town! Gas Clock!
reviews: The day we walked to Gas Town the Gas Clock was being repaired! Lots of questions Answered! The streets were lovely, lots of spots to stop, history was wonderful! Every section of Vancouver is unique! A must!

title: great place to visit
reviews: Went to visit gastown , had great streets lined with trees and a steam clock which we saw go off every 1/2 hour .

title: Mixed bag
reviews: Some great stores but marred by seedy bars and uncharacteristically littered and dirty conditions. Don't miss the Filson and Kit&Ace stores.

title: Nice place to wander
reviews: Busy spot full of tourists. Also lots of homeless people on a few streets. Steam clock was interesting. Looked to be some nice restaurants

title: My Visit to Gastown
reviews: Gastown is a must place to see when you are visiting Vancouver.  It is in the heart of downtown Vancouver.  It is accessible by public transportation. If you are driving on your own there are parking available, as well as nearby. Lots of things to do in Gastown. There are restaurants, souvenir shops, little shops of different kind of things to buy. The renown steam clock that sound every half an hour on the hour. And if you are there with a cruise line it is near the cruise line terminal and also the sea bus terminal which you can take to go to North Vancouver without taking the bus or car to cross thru Lion gate bridge to get there. Gastown road is made of brick and it is a place where people like to visit when they are in downtown Vancouver.

title: Great for a Friday night out
reviews: We went down to gas town on a Friday night for dinner and it was a blast. There was tons of people wandering around from families to couples and business people. Even late into the night it stayed busy and was an awesome environment.

title: Amazing
reviews: The town itself is great and has many small shops and areas to eat. Beware though, as there are many areas surrounding the town with sketchy people.

title: Too many degenerates.
reviews: It smelled of urine and pot. There is a reason that Dior doesn't bottle that fragrance. Totally overrated. Even the old reliability of a tidy Starbucks was an afterthought: the bathroom was FILTHY!!! Avoid this tourist trap if possible.

title: THe old town
reviews: This is great to wLk through with loads of gift shops and cafes. I loved the steam clock on the pavement which you can see the inside wheels and pistons.

title: Perfect place to visit
reviews: Loaded with multiple shops and a variety of restaurants, this historic section of Vancouver has been transformed into a must-see attraction in Vancouver.

title: Gastown experience
reviews: So exciting to walk around Gastown, so much to see and do. The clock was a good photo opportunity and every 15 minutes it let off steam, putting a smile on our faces.

title: Interesting history spoiled by the number of homeless people.
reviews: A really nice historical area with a steam driven clock which sounds off the quarter, half and full hours with steam whistles, really neat. The area also has loads of shops, cafes and restaurants for you to browse and eat in, the only issue is the numerous homeless people who frequent the area, particularly at night and whilst not normally threatening does not make for a nice atmosphere.We were also astonished when taking a taxi to the train station early in the morning on the day of our departure of the large amount of homeless and the trash in China town, not an area to visit. On investigation it appears that Vancouver has a rapidly rising homeless population problem!

title: Quaint and varied shopping district.
reviews: I came across Gastown whilst I was exploring Vancouver. It is a good mix of tourist shops, restaurants and other specialty shops. No department stores here.

title: Loved this place
reviews: Loved Gastown, so much atmosphere and history there.  Loved the steam clock!   Lots of shops to wander round and restaurants to eat at.  We ate at the Old Spaghetti Factory which was really nice.

title: Old Vancouver
reviews: Great pl,ace for shopping - also great for finding a place to eat - nice pubs with great selection of food - look out for the Fried Chicken, waffles and Bourbon Maple Syrup - ODD but delicous!

title: Historic part of Vancouver
reviews: Especially Water Street is nice for a stroll, nice boutiques, cafes and restaurants. Absolutely worth a visit.

title: Felt like a time traveled to Oliver Twist world
reviews: Gastown has a unique, old world feel to it. The architecture and buildings give a very old europe town feel. The shade of choice here seems to be darker colors. Aside from the steam clock, Gastown has many eateries. However, the whole ambiance of the area is spoilt by many vagrants asking for spare change and actually getting in your face to ask.Did not enjoy walking the streets there as I felt unsafe and hurried back to the more modern areas. Do go if in a group, and if you are there just for the clock, get there, take your pictures and go back to the other parts of town.

title: Little Gem
reviews: Old part of town with a quaint feel. Well worth a visit. Lots of souvenir shops but also some also great bars and restaurants.

title: Has a lot of charm!
reviews: It is a nice area of town to browse and have a drink and let  time pass by. We were there for few hours and we spent the afternoon shopping, eating, and watching people... From there you can walk to many other areas close by.

title: Quaint section of Vancouver
reviews: Trendy shops and restaurants. Small section of the city, worth at least a walk through. The gas clock is a must see while there. Just look for the crowd on the Main Street. Do price different gift shops as price vary for the same item.

title: Cool area, great food but a still a little dodgy
reviews: If you are a tourist in Vancouver, Gastown is definitely an area to take a look around. It's one of the only places in Vancouver that has cobblestone streets and the buildings have a lot of character. There are many cool cafes, bars and restaurants in the area to visit, including Chill Winston and the Diamond Bar. I would however keep in mind that this area still has a fair few junkies and quite a high homeless population. We didn't encounter any trouble with anyone in the area though. Great photos opportunities in this area!

title: Funky Neighborhoid
reviews: Think West Village meets Soho.  Don't miss the famous Steam Clock which is really not powered by Steam but emits a plume when it dings.

title: Disappointing
reviews: What was once a historic and artsy spot adjacent to Canada Place now seems kind of seedy and rundown. We were constantly being hassled by vagrants soliciting "spare change" making us feeling very uncomfortable and, somewhat unsafe, especially after dark.

title: A neat place to stroll
reviews: Lot's of shops and good restaurants.  This is a place to walk around and window shop and get a bite to eat.  Historic buildings and cool atmosphere

title: Must see, great tourist place and fun
reviews: Ya just got to go to Gas Town, the old steam clock that is not really that old nor powered by steam but hey makes a great selfie pic. Lots of shops, restaurants and bars and close to the LRT and Sea Bus

title: Great shopping and Restaurants
reviews: Great area to stroll with many different shops from souveniers to high quality merchandise. We did not eat there but there were many restaurants available. Certainly worth a visit and only a 10 minute walk from Fairmount and Pan Pacific Hotels

title: Good atmosphere but nothing to see
reviews: Well, there is nothing special about this place for sure. But then again, who expects history or old towns in tis area of the world. it s a nice walk around area, but done t leave the main roads, you might end up thinking Canada is the poorest place on earth...

title: Very pretty even with the tourists
reviews: A lovely atmoshere and very pretty houses.We ate at the reasonably priced Spagetti Factory. Good food and a surprisingly low cost particularly as the lunch menu had so much extra included.

title: I don't see the hype
reviews: Came here as apparently this is a 'must-do' in Vancouver. I would say it really isn't. Ok there were a few nice bars and restaurants, but nothing you can't get downtown. Also the area is seriously shady as it's next to Downtown Eastside and it's easy to veer off to the few blocks inhabited by junkies.

title: Obviously directed at tourists
reviews: Walked down the Main Street where the Gas clock is. Summertime, and quite a few tourists around and many were from 3 cruise ships in port so it was a little busy but not that congested that you couldn't see anything. One was called the Nieuw Amsterdam which had 11 floor of passenger berthings (3000 passengers and staff).Absolutely massiveCasually walked down the street so many souvenir shops that sell t-shirts, cups, heaps of key rings etc all cheap junky Chinese souvenirs.The tree lined streets with the old lighting and baskets of beautiful flowers line the entire street and the old historic buildings is just beautiful.If you're hungry there are so many restaurants, that it makes choosing one difficult.The guy in the photo is burning wood with a thick chunk of glass to design pictures that can be hung on walls. He was selling them for around $30. He also 'burned' the top of boxes with designs which would have to be varnished, not sure how much they were.Overall a pleasant experience.

title: Go to Revolver for good coffee
reviews: Nice place to wander around. I did a walking tour of the area and chinatown that was fun and informative I am a Melbourne girl so very happy to find Revolver ( with an Aussie barista!)

title: James Smith
reviews: Very quirky part of Vancouver loved it plenty going on and lots of shops, restaurants and bars all reasonably priced too

title: Try West End instead!
reviews: Maybe this was overhyped by the guides, or maybe our standards are set by the area in which we actually live, but we found Gastown pretty disappointing.  Water Street was nice enough with trees, well preserved older buildings, lots of tourist restaurants apparently aimed at cruise line passengers and very high end furniture stores, but there was nothing particularly quirky or edgy about the place.  Other streets in Gastown were less popular but no more edgy (though more homeless), mainly because there was less to visit or shop at.  Frankly, we were far more impressed by the residential streets in the West End around Barclay Street where the streetscapes were delightful with large mature trees and beautifully renovated Victorian houses (in amongst some less nice apartment buildings).

title: Wandering
reviews: While visiting the Vancouver area I took some time to wander in the Gastown area. The streets are lined with shops from souvenirs, fine art, designer clothes, coffee shops and eateries that can occupy you for hours. Take a stop and the steam clock and you are only a quick walk away from the water. Was very busy with tourists and  local addicts from the community, which if you are not used to can be  bit of a culture shock but I assure you very safe.

title: Real Vibe
reviews: Gas town moves from bohemian student, to tourist souvenirs, to street life with an edge remarkably fast. It's the place to go for souvenirs, very good eating, and a couple of places with great Craft ale.

title: Restored old area of downtown Vancouver
reviews: This is one of the main tourist areas in Vancouver.  There are many old restored buildings.  There are historical plaques on many of the building which explain what the building originally housed.  There are a number of shops and restaurants and is definitely worth a stop when sightseeing in Vancouver.  Be sure to see the steam clock.

title: Shopping and the steamclock
reviews: If you need to get your shopping jones on, you can find it here. Not a sterile mall, a real live city with stores. Got to get a picture at the Steamclock.

title: This is where Vancouver started
reviews: Gastown has some nice restaurants.  Shops are mainly catered towards the tourists.  If you have some free time, it won't hurt to explore the area.

title: Great taste of Vancouver (especially the alleyways)
reviews: Great duing the day with plenty of places to eat, drink and shop. There's a couple of excellent local galleries.Don't go hear at night though, massive homeless population in this area.

title: Very cool area
reviews: Plenty to do for everyone. Super chill, cool vibe...basically, there's no way you should miss this side of town if you're in Vancouver. So many restaurants and bars to choose from. Hip area. Try Guilt & Co. or Peckinpah fried chicken.

title: Vancouver-June-2017
reviews: We walked thru Vancouver and thus made out Way to the GASTOWN. The High Light of this Area to me was the STEAM CLOCK that RINGS on the HOUR. Since I love OLD Clocks it was a Must See for me. Hope you Like it Too!

title: Enjoy the walk and the diversity
reviews: Although my latest visit, in this case a walk-through, was in July 2017, I have visited Gastown a number of times since 2010.  Has it changed over the 10 years? Yes because one of my favourite venues - the underground history of Gastown theatrical production - has closed and no, because many of the same shops (some of them commercialized tourist traps) are still there.  The Steam Clock is still a major attention grabber, as well as the cobblestone and the variety of restaurants and pubs.  For me, the real joy of Gastown, is not so much the destination, but the journey.  I usually walk from various points on Main Street, carrying through to Chinatown, past some seedier areas, where by the way, I have never been bothered by panhandlers or otherwise, and then turning on to one of the back streets leading to Gastown.  Every block of the walk is like theatre; scenes and actors change every few steps.  Never a dull walk.   Once you arrive in Gastown, enjoy the diversity of shops.  Sit on the benches and watch as tour groups and individuals take in the mix of original, refurbished and new buildings.  A walk through Gastown is also an excellent way to get to Canada Place and Coal Harbour to watch the cruise ships, sailboats and seaplanes.  And, as long as you  have the money, you can eat (and drink) your way through the day.  I have rated Gastown and the environs a very good.
