Very good because of its diversity and charm and its proximity to other areas of the city.  First-time visitors especially will fall in love.  I did not rate it as excellent because of the number of tourist trap type souvenir shops, which detract from the more authentic local and native art and crafts vendors. I would not describe it as a hidden gem either, because it is well advertized and quite easy to find, by foot and by transit.  Parking will be extremely difficult to find and I would not advise it.

title: Homeless people and DIRTY
reviews: While there may be a steam clock and some trendy restaurants...this place is riddled with homeless people and would be quite scary after dark. The streets are grossly dirty. Just down the street a few blocks is a park that is essentially a "tent city" for the homeless. I was quite shocked this is considered a tourist destination in the city of Vancouver.

title: Easy stroll to enjoy the "Old Vancouver"
reviews: A few blocks from Chinatown and Canada Place close to the waterfront, stroll along the cobbled-stone streets of Gastown which is probably the oldest part of Vancouver. It reminds me of the alleyways of Europe. The "place to be" if you're looking for restaurants and bars, outdoor cafes and dessert bars.  Don't miss the "steam clock" that plays music and let off steam every hour on the hour.

title: did i even go through gastown?
reviews: I think me and my family missed the whole "gastown" area even though we were at the steamclock...not sure what gastown is considered to be?

title: Interesting
reviews: Fun but a little touristy. Interesting characters to watch as you visit the little shops down the streets.

title: Liked this area a lot. More old style Vancouver with a slightly more authentic feel.
reviews: Glad we found this area because the downtown area of Vancouver has almost a clinical, modern, young city feel to it. Needed this area to knock the edges off. Used several bars and restaurants in the area which were good and enjoyed a walk around. Definitely go to this area if in Vancouver. Plenty of car parking on Water St, great pubs in the area.

title: Must Visit
reviews: Lots of fun spots. Great restaurants and bars. Too many souvnir shops! Fun way to spend and afternoon.

title: Charming Area
reviews: This is a primarily a pedestrian area filed with nice shopping spots. The gas clock was fascinating to see nothing to go out of your way for but if in the area, stop and take a photo.

title: OK but nothing too special that we saw
reviews: Gastown is supposed to be a "must see" for Vancouver.  Although it's not bad, we didn't find much to it.  I was disappointed in the amount and quality of the shopping as well as the restaurants.  The  Steam Clock is famous and worth a couple of photos.  The best part for me were the origlamme street lights, the flower baskets that hang from them, and the color of the buildings.  If you're like us, you can allow 1 hour to walk around and take it in, and then it's enough.

title: Beautiful and older view of Vancouver!
reviews: The area with the streets covered with brick pavement and beautiful big flower pots on top of street lights which looks a bit like some European cities. There are a lot of small local shops in the street. An old steam clock is one of the landmark of the Gastown!

title: Gastown was a great surprice!
reviews: I happened to drive past it by change, I parked the car and decided to go for a walk! I was struck by how nice the old buildings were, as well as the greenery of this part of down town Vancouver! There are also a lot of nice restaurants in the area. The main attraction is the steam clock, particularly around hours and half hours then the clock announce the time with a loud steam blow for example five o'clock is five steam blows! The statue of the fonder of Gastown is also very impressive, don't miss the boots shop to the left of the statue! This is a nice area of Vancouver!

title: Lovely place
reviews: Popped here on Canada Day. Was extremely busy. Lots of nice eateries. Pretty place. Probably wouldn't want to spend a lot of time here but definitely worth a visit

title: WOW - Love it
reviews: Thoroughly loved this area, - Great restaurants , shopping and bars - To see the clock is an experience and the statue of Gassy Jack gives you a glimpse into the past events in the area - Very nostalgic feeling in the area . LOVED it  - will be back . To see the old buildings restored is fantastic  - a truly amazing place

title: Old Vancouver
reviews: Older buildings with more character (I like older things) and more like a city.  Make a quick stop a the steam clock.

title: Charming neighborhood
reviews: Great neighborhood in Downtown. There are a lot of great restaurants and pubs (some of them may be a little pricy). There you can find the steam clock that is one of the city's attractions. Also there are a lot of local stores where you can find beautiful souvenirs.

title: Gassy Jack
reviews: So named because he talked a lot the founder of Gastown has a statue erected in his honour.And the steam whistle clock is also worth seeing.This is a very touristy place but well worth a visit

title: Steam clock
reviews: Interesting place with rich history. Characteristic feature of Gastown is the clock that runs by steam and chimes at certain time, particularly at the hour. Our friend took us there and we managed to catch the clock when it chimed. There are shops around too. Possible to get to Chinatown from here too.

title: Fun neighborhood
reviews: Gastown is a fun neighborhood. It's quaint and has lots of restaurants and shopping. It's definitely worth a visit while in Vancouver.

title: Nice place and good restaurants
reviews: We enjoyed our visit to Gastown! Lots to see and lots of choices for restaurants. There is something for everyone. Parking is a tad bit of an issue, however; I would recommend to find the easy parking lots to park.

title: Gastown
reviews: We wandered around Gastown which consisted of little boutique shops, souvenir shops, bistros e tc. We saw the steam clock and listened to it's chime and strike the hour. There were lots of shops to look at and the buildings were interesting architecturally. Public transport was plentiful.

title: Quaint place to wander
reviews: We had a nice walk down to Gastown from our hotel. It's a place for people watching and wandering. There are loads of restaurants and bars but we found a lovely Indian restaurant.

title: It worth once
reviews: This was my second time and lost a lot of attractiveness First time was okThink since one is downtown must see this clock and neighborhood Just once

title: Nice area
reviews: This is a nice area to visit not the same old stores but a nice collection of shops and restaurants.  Don't miss the glass shop Ethereal Art nearby

title: Fun, Tourist Part of Town
reviews: Our Hop On/Hop Off bus stopped here so we hopped off to explore some of the shops and have lunch.  The shops and boutiques are really cute with different types of items (not large chains).  The main street was well populated and safe.  The tour had gone by an area right before this that was really sketchy so we made sure to stay on the main street.  Gastown was fun to explore for shopping and dining.

title: Busy but interesting
reviews: It was very busy in the Gastown area when we were here (although it was the start of the Canada Day weekend and apparently also Ryan Reynolds was a few blocks away shooting a movie, so not sure how much of the crowd was due to those factors), but we enjoyed the historical buildings and the shops/restaurants.  We saw the steam clock and had some good gelato. Worth exploring.

title: Good stay
reviews: We had our stay in this neighbourhood. Very quaint. A lot of places to eat dinner and to drink a coffee.

title: Not to be missed
reviews: For food, drinks or souvenirs- Gastown is a must as you view VancouverSome fabulous places to eat and bustling with locals and tourists alike

title: Good place for more food!
reviews: Besides the bit of history and steam clock, it is another area of Vancouver full of restaurants and shops. If you visit allow for about 3 hours. Look for the maple honey bar around there. The curios and souveniers are cheaper in Gastown than in most other places. Best way to get there is via a hop on bus.

title: Could be very busy
reviews: We ran into those who came out from the cruise ships just docked,  and it was just overwhelming amount of tourists everywhere, and was hard to walk..Lots of charming restaurants, and souvenir shops are there. We would like to go back to try one of the restaurants there.

title: Small for walk but big story in town
reviews: The root of the history of Vancouver, practically, we got very good restaurants and happy shopping in Gastown, don't miss the steam clock to see the fabulous mechanical details of the clock.

title: Don't Miss the Steam Clock!
reviews: Several blocks of the older section of Vancouver.  Some good restaurants, history, statues, and the steam clock, with pipes instead of chimes.  It plays the Westminster chimes every 15 minutes and people gather.

title: Important part of Vancouver BC history
reviews: Gastown was an interesting quick visit.  The most iconic thing is the steam-operated clock.  Everything else is either a place to eat or shop.  Not our favorite stop in Vancouver

title: not worth the long walk
reviews: except from a lot of Asian tourists looking at the clock and many homeless people (only place in whole Vancouver were I saw them bothering other people) there is not really anything to see here - no nice atmosphere, no fun shops, no nice restaurants

title: Old town area with food and seedy neighbors
reviews: Interesting old buildings adjacent to a seedy neighborhood with colorful (drugged street people) characters wandering around.  Not sure that I would linger after dark unless a large group with some burly friends.

title: Old Part of Downturn Vancouver
reviews: This is the older part of Vancouver. Has lots of eateries, shops and also the steam clock. Not to be missed.

title: Great for shopping and eating
reviews: We really enjoyed the Gastown experience, great shops and great for pubs and eateries. Highly recommended for a day or two.

title: Love the Gastown area
reviews: Go visit "Gassy" the statue and learn about the historic Gastown area.  Tourist shops, splendid bars and restaurants plus history.  Great place for the start of your visit to Vancouver.

title: Interesting tourist trap
reviews: Gastown is a great area to visit to see a little patch of Vancouver's history. It does get really busy and has lots of souvenir shopping. But there's other attractions, stylish shops and interesting places to eat. Wait for the steam clock to mark the hour.

title: An interesting place
reviews: Gastown is a most interesting part of Vancouver with its shops, its steam clock and it has an atmosphere all its own.  It is quite unlike other parts of the city

title: Unique Shopping and Dining
reviews: If you're in the market for Prada and traditional dining, don't come here.  However if you enjoy a more creative take on fashion and cuisine, do come here.  It is by far our favorite place to see 'what's new'.  Yes, it's urban and you may be exposed to a street person or two, but that comes with the territory.

title: Go see the steam clock!
reviews: Gas Town is a quaint little area of Vancouver with a long history and a number of small shops worth seeing. Upstairs in one local crafts shop you can see and meet an Indian carving the woodwork, it's very special.

title: Cobblestone streets - nostalgic feel!
reviews: Gastown is a must see when visiting Vancouver. The ambience of cobble-stone streets and the old Steam Clock, along with many wonderful boutiques to visit. Great eateries and a laid back relaxed feel. Close to Chinatown as well.

title: Interesting history & shops
reviews: We drove past this as part of the Hop On Hop Off tour and later walked back. The history is amusing. The area is named after a man who talked a lot. There are some delightful shops including one where we watched a man paint a totem pole. That's not something one sees in the US Midwest.

title: Back in Time
reviews: Really enjoyed walking through the cobble streets of Gastown. Great shops, restaurants, and bars. Visited during the day and found it safe and full of people walking in the streets. Parked in a parking garage on Cordova without any problems. Loved it!

title: Full of character
reviews: Only a short walk from the centre, Gastown is a district with alot of character. From the lamp posts to the steam clock, it has lots to see but between Chinatown and Gastown it is really run down and not a tourist area.

title: Lots to choose from!
reviews: Lots of restaurants and shops if you like to shop or just need a few souvenirs.  Can get crowded but only a short walk from waterfront hotels.  Check out the steam clock while you are there.

title: Great atmosphere and nightspot.
reviews: We kept coming back to Gastown as had a fantastic atmosphere and good range of pubs, restaurants and nightlife. Can be a bit seedy in the day, but comes alive at night.

title: Great walkabout area
reviews: Wonderfully funky downtown area near the waterfront that is older part of the city.  Neat restaurants and streets that make the area feel like it is more european than north american.  Lots of choices here to explore and to visit.

title: Interesting buidlings
reviews: Gastown is refurbished older area of Vancouver and well worth a wander round.  Its not far from the main shopping areas of downtown area.  The steam clock is interesting.  There are some interesting buildings and the streets are pretty and tree lined.  Be aware that there are lots of street sleepers in this area really highlighting the vast difference between the 'haves' and the 'have nots' in this city.

title: KEEP YOURSELF IN THE MAIN STREET and avoid surroundings at all
reviews: The main street has beautiful buildings, but DO NOT WALK in the surrounding streets!!!!  It is full with junkies.... the worst thing we have ever seen in Vancouver.  It is a complete shame for a touristic area...We went with our kids and walked to the Chinese Garden, but regret to do so....we were shocked about what we saw...!!!  Awful and shameful...

title: Really cool historic district
reviews: This is a super cute historic district. Lots of cute shops and restaurants. Definitely fun to walk through and enjoy!

title: an historical site downtown Vancouver
reviews: this is a very historical and famous site downtown Vancouver.  a must see for all tourists.  be sure to put this on your 'to do list' when visiting.

title: Fun and Funky
reviews: Really great shopping, ice cream and coffee shops.  The kids had fun at the steam clock and we shopped till we dropped.

title: Steamy nine 'o clock!
reviews: Gastown has a great atmosphere, nice shops and feels optimistic. The clock is so wonderful, of course you haev to take some time to wait for the fun moment. But once it happened you feel happy and cheerful!

title: Eclectic! and fun!
reviews: That's it - eclectic and fun.  Just walk around, stop in a pub or two, wander the vintage vinyl record store, and maybe enjoy a "smoke" break.  Gastown is a neighborhood to just have fun in.

title: Not as interesting as they say.
reviews: Gastown supposed to be a very interesting, unique place, the more affluent part of Vancouver. There are lots of shops, eating places and everything else. We found the place very similar to any other larg(ish) city's downtown area, yes, there were shops and eating places, but nothing special. Actually, it was a bit boring. It is next to the poverty stricken Chinatown and where the two areas meet, there are quite a lot of homeless, drug adicts and other unfortunate people. We even met a screaming lunatic who ran up and down the street, yelling obscenities.

title: Wonderful vibe
reviews: Gastown runs for a couple of city blocks and is full of life and vibrancy. There are a number of popular eateries here and souvenir stores and the whole area has a good vibe to it. It has that good mix of tourist experience and locals. The building facades have maintained their heritage feel.

title: Gastown
reviews: Great shopping for souvenirs and eats. Watch the steam clock on the hour - in walking distance from cruise ship ports.

title: Meal and a walk
reviews: Waited for the clock to go off at 9pm.  Enjoyed, different.  Good shopping and meals.  We were only on a night tour so not there for a long time and it was late.  Lots of people.

title: Eh
reviews: We found Gastown to not live up to the hype. The clock was interesting but nothing spectacular. The flowers wet lovely but all in all we could have skipped this stop and not felt cheated.

title: A fun place to visit
reviews: Being the oldest part of settlement in Vancouver there is plenty of history and quirky things to see. However be prepared for crowds especially busloads of Japanese and Chinese tourists making it impossible to take photos without them looking as though you had visited Tokyo or Shanghai. Loved the souvenir shops there with so much to choose from to prove back home it really was Vancouver you had been to.

title: Not as expected.
reviews: Visited the Gastown area for an afternoon food tour. It was surprisingly dirty, smelly and full of homeless people asking for food. Not a place to go with small children. A lot of car and bike traffic too. Could easily skip this area on a visit.

title: Lively place with cafes, restaurants
reviews: We were there for our cruise to Alaska next day. Our hotel told us to go there. It is a very happening place with restaurants, cafes, shops, art gallery. We found a mini grocery store and was able to buy water, wine to take them to the ship. Would like to go back to explore more.

title: Nice part of town
reviews: Walked through the busy streets on a lovely day, quaint area and of course the steam clock is superb, spent several hours browsing, including cafe and a lazy lunch.The trees along the side of the streets are lovely too and a good selection of shops, bars and eating places.Just be aware the main 'homeless' part of town is close by and asking for money happened several times.

title: Quaint
reviews: You have to visit if only to listen and watch the steam clock chime. Very touristy but still worth your time.  Get your souvenirs while you're at Gastown, there are a number of shops with a variety of products from which to choose.

title: Nice place to visit and have a bite
reviews: Nice area to walk around with plenty of good restaurants and interesting stores. Good vibe, but gets busy. Recommended visit for a few hours.

title: Lots of fun
reviews: Walking up and down the streets of Gas Town is exciting.  Very touristy with douzens of shops, resto's and art to see.

title: Everyone wants to see the steam clock.
reviews: We always take visitors to see the steam clock or Gassy Jack statue from which Gas town got its name. There are plenty of eateries around and shopping nearby.  Need interesting souvenirs to bring home? You will find plenty there and for a good price. We also like to stroll along the street there as locals for an interesting walk.

title: Neat place
reviews: What a great, neat place to have lunch. The area was loaded with shops, pubs and taverns and was just an all around fun place to walk around.

title: Fun
reviews: Do the tourist thing and get your photo taken standing under the clock. Good shops, bars and restaurants.

title: Tourist central!
reviews: A fun and interesting place to visit when in Vancouver and somewhere you will end up if going as a tourist.Lots of shops and places to dine

title: Cool neighbourhood
reviews: Nice old buildings, good restaurants and views. Only a short walk from the Waterfront, but don't be in a hurry as this place is best experienced slow and steady with stops for interesting sights and food.

title: Nice clock worth seeing. Too many bums
reviews: Vancouver - best place to live in the world? Pure propaganda, i have never seen so many homeless people and drug takers other. What makes it worse is that they are all quite agressive and constantly bothering you. It made us cancel an evening out as although they left us alone when ignored it just was not pleasant.The clock itself is worth seeing and is a little bizarre but cute. It is neat the Waterfront station so my tip would be to go and see the clock and then leave.

title: A great wanderlust neighbourhood
reviews: If you're looking to rack up a handful of steps, and maybe stop in for a bite or a pint, then Gastown is a wonderful spot to get your fill. Although the streets can be congested, the beautiful brick patterns, lush flower pots, and boutique style shops give it the charm I was seeking for our afternoon stroll.

title: Old town
reviews: Beautiful old part of town with some great restaurants and shops. Don't miss the steam clock. However be aware some streets are a little dodgy with many homeless.

title: Nice Old Town Feel
reviews: Site of the Steam Clock, Gassy jack and lots of gift shops. Great old town feel to it with nice coffee places. Also a good place to get not he hop on hop off bus.Get tot he clock on the hour, its worth it.

title: Beautiful part of town!
reviews: This is a beautiful part of the city in a very fine neighborhood. There are shops, restaurants, small hotels and interesting attractions.  It is a nice way to spend the afternoon or evening walking around and taking in the sights.

title: It's like the hood
reviews: It's more street like in gas town , more homeless , dark street then down town . I like gas town it's shows the real Vancouver I feel . My friends also found a weed dispensary .

title: This place is a must do!
reviews: The tourist hot spot. Filled with souvenir shops, yummy restaurants, gourmet food and a very famous gas clock, that sings a tune on the hour. Don't miss this place..

title: Loved my visit to Gastown! Highly recommend!
reviews: Gastown was beautiful and a must-see part of Vancouver. The gas lamps are super cool and so is the steam clock! I went to the Old Spaghetti Factory for dinner which was good value and tasty. Plenty of souvenir shops along here and nice views of the mountains and the water. Lots of places to eat and the buildings still have that historic architecture. Will definitely return!

title: History
reviews: A walk through Gas Town is a walk in Vancouver's past, and most enjoyable. Standing and listening to the 'CLOCK' on the sidewalk is also a must. Restaurants are plenty, so do enjoy a lunch.

title: Wonderful flare & character, nice eateries and shops
reviews: This is an adorable place to stroll, and to eat. There is an old steam clock that everyone stops to watch. We ate right across the street from it, and were amazed at the fascination of this old clock!  It's very compact in Gas Town and it's very romantic. Lovely spot to get a bus, take a stroll, shop, eat, get coffee, or just wander about. It's not too long so you could walk up and back in about an hour if you don't stop much.

title: Ok but nothing special
reviews: If you need some tourist tat then this is the area to go. There are so many souvenir shops it is easy to miss some of the nice cafes and restaurants in the area. It gets very busy in the afternoons, be warned.

title: Touristy
reviews: Came to this part of town on the recommendation of a friend, and because a TA top ice cream shop is here. We were disappointed all around. This neighborhood was central, then fell into seedy disrepair, then the merchants united with the city to clean it up and beautify it. Now it's overrated restaurants and schlocky tourist trinket shops. The best thing is the steam clock which is charming and fun. We did go from here to the nearby Lookout which was fabulous.

title: Gassy Jack.
reviews: We had a blast in Gastown! Plenty to see and photo ops with the Gassy Jack statue as well as the gas powered clock that plays the Westminister bells. It seemed the souvineer shopping was slightly cheaper in this part of town.

title: A must when in Vancouver
reviews: We spent several nights here during our most recent trip to Vancouver, had fabulous meals at a Wildabeest, Catch122 and 6 Acres... great was to pass any afternoon or a night!

title: An extension of the Alaska cruise ship tourist traps
reviews: Unless you have time constraints avoid Gastown. It is only there to catch the tourists coming off the cruise ships and the nearby hotels. Not the real Vancouver, expensive and locals don't go there.If you want to see places that are more interesting and close by, try Chinatown and Granville Island. Both are an easy bus or cab ride. You can walk to both and you can take a water taxi from the southern foot of Howe Street to access Granville Island.Other interesting shopping areas close by include, West 4th Avenue in Kitsilano (not far from Granville Island) and Main Street. Main street has it all, Micro breweries, restaurants where the locals eat, lots of small independent shops and services.Bus service from Downtown is easy.Avoid Gastown like the plague. They are only out to take your money selling over  priced trinkets, and items tourists think are uniquely Canadian. You can buy Maple Syrup in any supermarket for half the price.

title: See the clock
reviews: Take a walk down to Gaston and find the clock its wonderful goes of every 45 minutes and on the hour it will sing to you with steam

title: Old, yet so new
reviews: Visiting here each and every time you‚Äôre in Vancouver would be a given, as each time you‚Äôll discover more and more fascinating discoveries. This old part of Vancouver has a designated board of directors looking after every aspect of the township. It is well worth the hour to walk down Water Street to see the cultures of the past, the shops and the all the caf√©s/restaurants offered daily for all to enjoy.

title: wow, what changes in Gas Town
reviews: Gastown has been on a rapid progression of change.  Great restaurants and coffee...shopping is weak but they are trying.  People who visit Vancouver really enjoy going to Gastown so take your friends down.It also feels much more safe in Gastown

title: Touristy but Nice!
reviews: We were in Vancouver for a few days before our cruise through the Inside Passage to Alaska. Gastown represents a view of Old Vancouver. It is okay for a stroll and a few photo opportunities. We had a really good lunch at the Water Street Cafe, which I can highly recommend. It is also opposite the steam clock, so you can enjoy lunch and see the clock go off.

title: City history
reviews: A great place to visit with a lot of Vancouver history. Good shopping and eateries. Just feeling the cultures is worth the visit.

title: Cool vibe
reviews: Loved this part of the city. Lots of cool bars and restaurants and the streets are great to walk around on. Cool place to go

title: A historic part of Vancouer
reviews: Lovely part of downtown to wander through. Lovely shops, not just a tourist haunt.  Must see the steam clock, which chimes every 15 mins.

title: One street rather than a district
reviews: We stopped off in Gastown as part of the hop on hop off bus tour.  It is quite pleasant although it is essentially one street. The gas clock is fun, and "chimes" every fifteen minutes.

title: Lovely Shops
reviews: Very crowded and busy when the cruise ships are in. Otherwise it is a nice walk, with little gift shops and restaurants. Also you will pass the old steam clock.

title: Know more about Gastown!
reviews: As a local Hongcouver citizen, my uncle took my nephews to the Gastown for a history class and I was glad that I could join. Lol Waited until Steam Clock ringed, my uncle started to be a storyteller...... (Let's skip this part where you can google it!) Worth knowing it before the visit though. Apart from the history, it's also a good place to enjoy the night view. The difference colors of the lights made the buildings so splendid! You can imagine how cool it would be if you come to visit during Christmas. Amazing!

title: Great souvenir shops
reviews: If you're vacationing in Vancouver, Gastown is the place to stop for any souvenir shopping. Tons of places to go and also plenty of restaurants.

title: More than just the steam clock
reviews: There is plenty to see and do in gastown. At night the area comes to life with bars and restaurants. A variety of shops are also available for those with money burning a hole in their pocket. There's more to see than the steam clock, but nevertheless, visit when it's about to "chime". You will be impressed.

title: Busy tourist hub, but a delightful place to visit
reviews: The main attraction is the Steam Clock, but the area itself is lovely despite the high percentage of tourist shops (souvenirs etc.) .

title: Touristy
reviews: Walked over to Gastown and walked around.  Lots of pubs and shops.  Kind-of touristy, but enjoyed the walk and people watching.

title: Looking for Dinner
reviews: Found this place while looking for dinner. Lots of options, nice shops and a charming streetscape.It is a good place to go for a meal and do some sightseeing.

title: Nice steam clock
reviews: a very busy area with the steam clock being the main attraction its a beautiful novel clock nothing much else going on there

title: went here for a meal
reviews: was very disappointed in the area overall and found both restaurants and bars very expensive.example 3 small glasses of cider 36 can. dollars

title: Gastown
reviews: We decided to take a look at Gastown as it was a short walk from Canada Place whilst we were down that way. It is an eclectic part of the city which is very tourist oriented. Most shops are directed at tourists selling the usual fair of t shirts caps and other stuff. We inadvertently walked too far through Gastown and ended up in skid row where unfortunately there is a large population of homeless and drug affected. It was confronting for my kids and they were immediately on edge. We were lucky to hail a taxi and left. Gastown is probably not a must do but if your down that way it has a certain vibe almost New Orleans style.

title: Gassy Jack lives on
reviews: Gastown is Vancouver‚Äôs oldest neighborhood. The city started here with a single tavern founded by John ‚ÄòGassy Jack‚Äô Deighton in 1867. Apparently he was called gassy because he talked a lot not because he blew hot air from the other end. The former British sailor, river pilot and saloon keeper arrived with barrels of whiskey which made him a popular guy locally. There is a statue of him standing on a whiskey barrel in Maple Tree Square at Alexander and Powell Streets near the location of his first bar in Gastown.The area along Water Street with cobblestones and vintage lamp posts has had its ups and downs but today is lined with renovated old stone and brick buildings housing multiple souvenir shops, hi-end clothing boutiques, Inuit art outlets, galleries, restaurants and, of course, bars. There are walking tours for architecture and history buffs. A four-faced Steam Clock toots off the quarter hours and blows out a puff of steam on the hour at Cambie and Water Streets. It is usually surrounded by tourists so difficult to get a clean photo unless you arrive in the very early morning or buy a postcard. If you are in Vancouver it is worth a walk through Gastown.

title: Dodgy area
reviews: We stopped here as part of our hop on hop off bus tour. We nearly didn't get off of the bus as it didn't look like a great area. The part around the clock has some shops and nice looking restaurants. Lots of beggars and addicts so probably not a great place to take kids, we didn't feel very safe there so only spent about 30 minutes.

title: A neat piece of Vancouver that you must visit
reviews: I would highly recommend visiting the gastown district when you get into Vancouver. Only planned a night going here on a weekend but always found ourselves coming back. Whether it's for the steamclock, amazing eateries or just doing some of the bar scene, it's a great time.

title: Quaint shopping
reviews: One of the good places to shop in Vancouver . It's a cobblestone quaint street with the famous steam clock.Eat in flying pig . It's name seems like the restaurant has many meat dishes. On the contrary , most of its dishes are seafood . We had the seafood pasta and the lunch of the day which was blackened cot with shrimp risotto. Also ordered the cauliflower au gratin. All excellent !Shop for souvenirs : maple biscuits , maple syrup , Canada Tshirts ...Check out the it's local clothing brands like (1) kit and ace which has simple cut clothes in excellent bamboo silk fabric and (2) oak+fort which has simple stylish clothes.

title: Forget Chinatown- go to Gastown
reviews: Great atmosphere- many great shops, bars and restaurants, interesting upscale shops, great architecture. Next time we will stay in this area, close to CanadaPlace and bike/walking paths.

title: I liked it
reviews: The street was quiet pretty, especially at night when light up with fairy lights. The steam clock is a must see on the hour, beautiful!

title: Dirty
reviews: Uninteresting and full of tourist shops. Lots of beggars and generally unappealing. Don't waste your time

title: Just a nice walking part of town
reviews: Lots of shops to stroll in and out of. Lots of restaurants to choose from. A bit touristy for me. The cruise ships sick nearby.Worth a walk about.

title: Ho hum
reviews: Clearly this is now a tourist area.  Plenty of shops and restaurants but everything was designed for tourists.  A couple of interesting art shops but the quality of merchandise was variable and the true art pieces were overpriced and duplicated so one couldn't say they purchased a unique piece of art.

title: Lovely area of Vancouver.
reviews: Great shopping and restaurants.  It reminded me of Paris.  Don't miss the steam clock, it's awesome.  Take the Hop On, Hop Off tour bus, it goes through there.  Stop there, you won't be sorry.

title: See the Only Gas Operated Clock
reviews: This section of Vancouver has many restaurants and shops and is a grreat walking area.  There is a gas operated clock that blows steam every 15 minutes.  Very unique.

title: I love Gastown
reviews: Was lucky to work in Gastown for many years. So many good breakfast/lunch options around and lots of cute boutique stores, etc. Also has a good atmosphere at night for people of all ages. Gastown has a special charm.

title: Liars to see
reviews: Gastown is great, the historical part of Downtown Vancouver. Plenty of places to eat and drink and lots of things to see, make sure you check out the steam clock. The only thing be prepared to be confronted by the many homeless that live and beg in this touristy area of Vancouver. There is lots to see and experience and make sure you visit this area as it has special vibe about it.

title: Lovely part of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown has some nice shops and a few pretty streets. Quite busy, but a nice area for a wander. One of my favourite gift shops was in Gastown, plus the official store for Vancouver Whitecaps.

title: Beggars and mental health patients
reviews: Too many weird people yelling and begging in Gastown. We didn't feel safe.  Should be called weird town.  Vancouver city should clean this up if they want tourists to feel comfortable in this area.

title: Great walk/views
reviews: Pre-cruise morning explore. Many gift shops for trinkets. Steam clock was fascinating. Many bus tours start from this area.

title: You cannot leave Vancouver without a visit here !
reviews: Walk down to Gas Town to see the steam clock if nothing else.  It will play you a 'steamy' tune on the hour and looks like it just might take off !!!  Gas Town is full of interesting shops (more than just the normal tourist stuff) and good restaurants. A definite must for the Vancouver visitor

title: a must do
reviews: walk slowly along the gas town main street. enjoy the boho atmosphere. There many eaterys, all types.

title: Be careful
reviews: This is a very quaint part of town, the busy streets offer lots of good shopping and sightseeing. There are loads of restaurants, historical interests and bars to keep everyone entertained for a few hours, BUT, be careful as it seems to be the area where the local addicts hang out, we had not problems with them as there was a good police presence but I get the impression that it would not be safe at night.

title: Shops
reviews: Stopped by went shopping and found an Italian shoe store, fabulous leather shoes and boots that we purchased

title: Great area, lots of homeless people.
reviews: A special area in downtown Vancouver with lots of bars and restaurants and a distinct feel from the rest of the city. Very nice to spend some time having dinner, a drink or shop.The only downside is the the great amount of homeless people asking for money. Tip: l'Abattoir is a very nice albeit not cheap, restaurant (see other review)

title: Fascinating area - great stores, restaurants, people watching
reviews: This is a a fascinating area. There are great stores, art galleries, restaurants and people watching.  You get a flavor quite different here than from the huge downtown hotels. Strongly recommended.

title: Nice place
reviews: Nice place to see but close to ghetto.A must see is the steam clock and it is a nice experience.Many local souvenir shops.

title: A good walk down the older part of the City.
reviews: Gastown is in the older part of town and very busy with tourists.  We dropped into several local eateries and weren't disappointed in any of them.  The gas clock is worth seeing.

title: Great area
reviews: a lot of bars and shops on Water st good meals and plenty of craft beers to pick from, everywhere we stopped and ate everyone was very friendly

title: A lovely part of Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a really picturesque part of Vancouver. The architecture is very attractive and unique to this part of Vancouver. It's a great location if you are interested in photography to get some good shots. There are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants in the area - enough to keep me busy for a few hours. The steam clock is worth checking out as it is one of the few steam clocks in the world.

title: Nothing there
reviews: We visited Gastown after a recommendation from a friend but we really couldn't see what all the hype was about! Nothing there except cheap tourist souvenir shops.

title: Nice
reviews: Nice old buidings. The steam clock is a great piece  of engineering. The statue  of the guy who started steam town was good with the accompanying  info. Again plenty of eateries.

title: A fun place
reviews: An interesting neighborhood with lots of shops and restaurants. Be sure to see the unique steam clock and the statue of Gassy Jack, the founder of the area.

title: Lovely part of Vancouver
reviews: In a city full of charms, Gastown is possibly the most attractive quarter. Walk the streets and don't miss the Steam Clock.

title: Neat place to have diner.
reviews: The Gastown area is a must see while in Vancouver. You need to see the steam click and the cool vibe of the area while in town.

title: Vibrant
reviews: Very busy area with places to eat and loads of shops,within walking distance of the market and you must see the steam clock

title: Definitely worth a visit
reviews: There was a time when Gastown was just about the only place with shops open on Sundays. We went there often then. But not that much now of course. Still, if you are tourist, arriving by cruise ship, Gastown amounts to a pleasant nearby visit. It has some of the older buildings one will find in Vancouver. As far as attractions are concerned, there are a number of restaurants, all sorts of shops selling Canadian kitsch, and a few more upscale stores. There is even a Lululemon design outlet. One store receiving special mention from us is Olaf & Wu‚Äîa mixture of Swedish and Japanese goods. It is one of the few places with linen dish cloths! For tourists there is the Steam Clock. Worth a visit.

title: Old town vancouver
reviews: Take a delightful stroll down Water street, past old industrial buildings, now converted to shops, enjoy an eclectic mix of cultures, cuisine and collectables. Stop at the old steam clock and imagine the Vancouver of yesteryear. Many places to eat and drink, wander and wonder, rummage and reminisce.

title: Walk
reviews: Awesome place to stroll on weekends and try different types of foods. From street food to high end dinning.

title: Nice walk
reviews: Nice place to discover great little local stores and restaurants! Some areas can be shaddy so be vigilant!

title: Stroll when got into town
reviews: Lots to see and do!  Fun souvenir stores! Lots of pubs and fun people to watch.  We had gorgeous weather!   Really fun to see...

title: Trendy spot for a quick bite and beverage
reviews: A short walk from Canada Place is Gastown. A revitalized area off downtown, it is filled with bars, eateries and small shops. Worth a visit, even if just to see the steam clock.

title: Interesting Area
reviews: Plenty of different places catering for clothing attire, shoes, souvernirs, restaurants and a brewery. The steam clock is interesting when chiming the time. The Hop On Hop Off buses stop at different locations in the main street. Stay in the main street area as some of the other nearby streets can be a bit seedy.

title: Ghost tour, great gentrification of old buildings, great vibe in the evenings, but be prepared for the street people!
reviews: Really enjoyed an evening in Gastown. I loved seeing so many older buildings utilized in ways that keeps them fresh, vibrant and relevant. The area is awash with boutiques, restaurants, bars, art galleries, and miscellaneous gems for the intrepid traveler.The streets felt very safe, even on a very busy long weekend evening, but that said, I was in a small group taking part in a Gastown Ghost tour for a good part of my time there, and then with a friend, so was not on my own for any time. I will caution though, be prepared for street people to come up and approach you. That happened to us a number of times. That would not stop me from venturing there again, but it is something to keep in mind.Overall, I enjoyed my evening there.

title: really great atmosphere
reviews: this area has retained some of its frontier atmosphere.it is always busy but the shops and bars were great. some interesting things to see, a good place to just wander around especially in the evening. don't miss the gas clock, be ready on the hour with your video!!

title: A Fun place with history
reviews: We got off the Hop on Hop off bus at Gastown and loved the Gastown Clock which also always had many tourists surrounding it. We also read the plaque about Gassy Jack.It was a fun place to wander around. The Old Spaghetti Factory was worth a visit or have lunch at. There is an old tram that you can sit in and have a meal. There were many historical examples within this building and it was well worth a visit.

title: interesting shops
reviews: Lots of different shops around the old town and it was nice to see different buildings and facades rather than the usual types of shops. The steam clock is... well a steam clock, but none of the faces were saying the right time when we visited, but what does that matter - it's an attraction so worth going to see.

title: Gastown
reviews: Fun place to just wander around and have a meal, try the Old  Spaghetti  Factory.Lots of souvenir shops and some crazy shoe stores selling unbelievable boots.Watch the stream clock go off.

title: Worth a visit
reviews: The Gastown clock is a landmark.  Steam driven, it plays a tune on the hour.  There are many interesting shops in the area as well as restaurants.  Well worth spending a few hours walking around.

title: A must see
reviews: We spent a great morning exploring Gastown and soaking up the atmosphere, followed by a lovely lunch in the Lamplighter Vancouvers oldest pub, don't miss it.

title: The only place I have ever seen a steam clock!
reviews: This is such a memorable and distinctive area of vancouver, the street lights and lamposts the 'cobbles' on the road make this so different. The clock is like a grandfather clock, it kept excellent time and it had steam coming out of the top! This steam was more kettle than engine, but it was still a joy to see. I would have liked to have spent longer here, but even 10 minutes was worth it.

title: lots of shops and cafes
reviews: visited twice over 3 weeks, lots of souvenir shops and cafes. loved the steam clock. a must visit site

title: Clean up
reviews: We stayed at a hotel in gas town and did some shopping there. This would be a lot better if they dealt with homeless and cleaned the street of trash and urine smells. I know they are just coming out of winter but hose down the streets. It's cool to watch the steam clock and some of the shops and restaurants are pretty cool.

title: Plenty to do and see here
reviews: No trip to Vancouver is complete without a stroll around Gastown and a meal or couple of pints in one of the quaint bars. Great original architecture from Vancouver's early days. It is a touristy area so be prepared for some hustling and of course tourist prices but having said that, they are not outrageous. You'll find loads of options for eateries and a variety of shops to source souvenirs and interesting art work.

title: Walk, Enjoy & Discover
reviews: Amazing neighborhood where you can easily hang out with friends and eat some snacks or proper food! Everything is pretty clean, however really busy in rush hours

title: Home of Steam clock
reviews: Gastown , very busy place,  full of pubs,caf√©s restaurants.Found a  great souvenir shop with reasonable prices. Had lunch in the  Steamworks brewery,  great ipa beers, lovely  lunch, good service. Loved the steam clock,  get there on the  hour to hear it chime, very unusual,  worth seeing

title: A taste of old Vancouver
reviews: Great place to wander around for a few hours.  Plenty of unique shops, souvenir shops and great places to eat and drink. The buildings are beautiful and the lamps and tree lined streets are very pretty.  The old steam clock is a must to see and the tourists wait for it to chime every fifteen minutes and watch the steam come out of the top. Well worth a visit!!

title: Eye opener
reviews: Gastown has a lot of interesting places, shops, restaurants and bars. But also a lot of homeless people! People are sleeping on every possible spot, making messy spots and making it stink. (Urine!)During the time we visited the area, at daylight, we did not experience any trouble at all. But you will face a lot of drugaddicts.

title: Cool Area
reviews: Full of cool eateries, classic architecture and interesting people. Only 10 minute walk from Canada Place. Check out the gas clock on the hour for its chime. Walk around and soak up the atmosphere. Perhaps then take the ride up Vancouver Tower or go to the adjacent China Town.

title: Don't go!
reviews: The area of Gastown, especially towards Chinatown is clearly a ''no-go'' area as we found out on our walk thru town. We were shocked to see so many drug addicts, poor people and other strange characters around that my wife got scared and we quickly left the area. Forget the historic buildings, mostly dilapidated houses and dirty streets.

title: Interesting with some unique shops but typical tourist area
reviews: Worth the visit and a walk around, some of the architecture is nice and while there are some unique shops it is more of a standard tourist area. Would be great especially if headed to one of the many  restaurants in the area, but not sure I would make a special trip just to see the area.

title: a must Visit
reviews: The Steam clock was the highlight. This was the site for the Canada Pacific freight trains as well. Contemporary designer boutiques were there.

title: Gassy Jack was here
reviews: This is an awesome neighborhood with a lot of history. It is also home to some nice boutique shops, great food and plenty of watering holes.

title: A quaint but shabby area
reviews: A strange mix of nice and not so nice. Historically not such a good area, that has been improved. But still a bit shabby. The steam clock is a must see and the mural on the wall at the bottom of the town, if you can find it is absolutely amazing. There ateylots of deep messages painted into it, so well worth spending dome time having a look. A variety of shops and restaurants, some really good, some not so good.

title: Good vibe
reviews: Cool hip clean place. Great customer service in their shops. Most of all the steam clock!! So retro.. Love it!!

title: A stay in Gastown
reviews: Gastown is a great location to most of the sites in Vancouver. It has a lot of charm and character. You will see a lot of homeless people but don't let that deter you from staying in this wonderful neighborhood. They are harmless and usually won't approach you. We enjoyed several of the restaurants that have outdoor patios and loved the Diamond at night for cocktails.

title: Historical
reviews: Fun shop, lots of history and fun cafes.  Be careful walking off the main street as the neighborhood is iffy and there are pan handlers.  Best way to visit is the Hop on Hop Off Bus.

title: visit to the Gasworks Brewery
reviews: we all had lunch at the Gasworks Brewery which was a great place for a few beers and lunch then of to visit Gaston shops.

title: A quirky place
reviews: Top attractions of this neighborhood is the clock and the haunted Old Spaghetti Restaurant. Took us less than an hour to visit both attractions and got back to our car.

title: Shops and Restaurants
reviews: This is a great spot to go for a wander and stop for lunch or dinner. There are some neat shops and good restaurants. All set in an historic setting.

title: Eclectic
reviews: A fairly typical ex maritime area that has been revived with restaurants and retail in original buildings. Humms at night with signs of poverty and drugs.

title: Great food great shops
reviews: We Decided to Get off at Waterford station and walk down to this district. I am very glad we made the hike it's not very far and it was very pleasant and clean.  Very safe area to take your family. Great food and The souvenir shops were reasonably priced  I don't suggest going any further towards Chinatown, we did that and boy was that a mistake. Very unsafe tons of drug dealers and people on the street corners drunk and high

title: Fun and quirky
reviews: Accessed from the Hop On Hop Off bus. Lots of photo ops including steam clock. Restaurants and shops to poke around in. Good prices.

title: Cool neighborhood for shopping or a bite to eat
reviews: Nice, interesting older part of town with a funky atmosphere and lots of independent shops and restaurants.  Cobblestoned streets add a nice touch.  The steam clock is a bit of a tourist mecca.  I roamed around a bit and went in and out of interesting shops.  Good choice for a snack, a bite to eat or just a beer.  Good place to visit and within walking distance of downtown and waterfront.

title: Touristy
reviews: Still a bit edgy with lots of tourists, homeless and some drugs.  Good restaurants and tourist shopping but does not live up to hype.

title: Funky area
reviews: This is an older section of town that now has lots of restaurants. Is supposedly very popular with "foodies." There are a lot of homeless people and drug addicts even among the more upscale restaurants. It's a very diverse mix of people.

title: Fun place with unusual products and great food
reviews: Every city should have an area like this.  It is so great to see vibrant retail stores that have unique products.  There are some interesting places off the main road.  If you want outdoor seating for lunch on a nice day plan to eat early.  We ate at the Flying Pig.  As busy as they were the server felt like a friend and the food was great!While you are there it is a short walk to China Town!

title: Nice place
reviews: The most attractive city area, the sky train station waterfront is very close to the area and there several pubs, restaurants and stores. The steam clock rings every 15 minutes

title: Taking a walk
reviews: A nice day to take a walk where in the Gastown area is the place you could find the heritage building as well the most unique stores and boutique, an old style of the city area, antique shops and all  different types of dining area to satisfy your taste. Its just closed to waterfront skytrain station.

title: Old Vancouver, reinvented
reviews: This is the oldest and original section of the city within EZ walking distance of the cruise terminal at Canada Place and downtown.  Lots of places to shop (especially tourists) and many great pubs, restaurants and more.  Worth seeing.

title: Early dinner in Gastown
reviews: Ate at MoMo's Japanese.  Good food and authentic.  Rainy day for our first day in Vancouver but seemed normal in spite of being South Texans.  Kind of a nice break from hot and dry San Antonio.  As the evening progressed the relatively quiet streets and restaurants suddenly became buzzing with activity.  Nice choices in shops and restaurants.  Worth the visit.

title: Great place to visit
reviews: This beautiful street has an French feel with the street lamps and gorgeous shops.there is s fantastic Jade shop in Gas town.Great cafes,coffee shops ,just walking distance from Canada place.The Hop On Hop Off bus will stop in Gas town.

title: Borderline scruffy.
reviews: An older part of Vancouver which is interesting but not scenically beautiful. Some decent looking restaurants and independent type shops. Best described as "up and coming" maybe. Avisit is worth the short walk.

title: Nice area for drinks/eating out
reviews: Quite a smart area with nice restaurants and bars.Quite a variety of different restaurants.I would go with my hubby, family or friends.

title: Walk through Gastown
reviews: Walked through Gastown a couple of times during our stay in Vancouver. Lots of lovely little eating places (the Flying Pig and Meat and Bread were both delicious) and lots of tourist shops and arty places to pop in and out of. The Gastown steam clock chimes every 15 minutes, to the tune of Taps of you were a Girl Guide.

title: Beth
reviews: Was delighted with the steam clock.  Well worth a visit! It blows off a steam whistle every quarter hour.

title: Atmospheric
reviews: Really atmospheric area of Vancouver, particularly at night when it's wonderfully lit up. It reminds me of Gas Light Quarter of San Diego. But this is better.

title: Tourist area some nice stores
reviews: Souvenirs stores nice restaurants spaghetti factory etc few couple bars skid road homeless people very close by there China town at end safe but be aware skid road area close to waterfront sky train from yvr or metro town line buses near by waterfront is nice other direction basically downtown just closer to water down a small hill Sears tour restaurant near by SFU university fairly nice night or day fairly safe maybe weird at night time depend s on you walking distance from Center city 15-20 min

title: Saw it from the Hop on hop off bus .
reviews: We visited it later so we had time to see the steam clock and visit some of the souvenir shops We also went there at night . I wouldnt want to be by myself as  alot of street people hassling for money . The lighting through the trees was nice

title: Fun place to visit!
reviews: We enjoyed the shops with native art and the coffee shops in the morning when we visited. It was cool to see steam clock sound off.

title: Old Vancouver
reviews: Older buildings, cobbles, steam clock, Gassy Jack - very quaint and bohemian.  Wonderful coffee in the roastery.

title: safe? seems quite fine to me
reviews: friends have told me to be careful in this neighborhood, but i found little to worry me. i loved the restaurants and proximity to the waterfront district.

title: Good atmosphere in the evenings
reviews: Gas town is a lively area in the evenings. Book a restaurant or wander and take a chance. Lots to see and lots of choice. Look out for statues and unusual steam clock and Olympic gift statues.

title: Seedy part of town.
reviews: Shopping destination in a fairly seedy pert of town.  Mainly of tourist traps and noteable for the intriguing steam clock.  The main street itself is pleasant enough, but shares a location with the local homeless hostal.

title: Gastronomic Gastown Tour...exact name of tour
reviews: This specific tour of Gastown was incredible.  The tour guide was so friendly and informative.  There were tastings and historical information along the way.  The group of 12 was like a party.  Each location we sat with someone new and heard of their travels and hometowns.  The food was soooooo delicious.  It was a 2 hour walking tour that met up in front of "Gassy Jack".  Would love to do it again.  Our guide was Traci.  Wonderful.

title: Great part of town
reviews: We went for dinner twice in Gastown and went back during the da to check out the shops as well. It's quite a nice part of Vancouver, young and buzzing. Well worth a visit

title: Steam clock whistle magic!
reviews: Yes, we became those tourists who gather at the clock every 15 minutes, waiting for it to do its steam magic. It was worth being almost knocked over twice by those tourists who refused to put down their phones and consider others' views.

title: Very Uneven: some nice some crummy
reviews: We visited Vancouver in May on a beautiful weekend and walked through Gastown on the way to dinner at Tuc. Some spots are great with pubs, shops and restaurants. But in between the nice spots there are some awful examples of urban and personal decay. Beggars, drunks, people sprawled on the sidewalk, people sleeping in doorways, urinating in public, and even a prostitute waiting on the corner. There is urban, there is gritty, and there is seedy. So it is OK for adults but the seediness I can do without.

title: So, so...
reviews: Gastown is more or less where Vancouver was founded and has become a somewhat trendy/millennial neighborhood of shops and restaurants. The steam clock is interesting, but once it's steamed, it's just a clock. there are some quality stores (such as Hill's Native Arts) and tacky souvenir shops as well. The edges of the neighborhood can be a bit dodgy. Okay for an hour or so...

title: City Overview
reviews: Took the hop on hop off bus. A great deal as you get to see the entire city and can then decide what to revisit.

title: Highs and lows
reviews: Gastown is a lot more than the Steam clock and tourist shops, although these seem to be the main focus for many.A bit of exploring lead to great cafes and bars, quirky shops and architecture with plenty of stories to tell. I couldn't find a self-guided walk on TripAdvisor, but it was easy to patch one together from various reviews.

title: Good to walk through and selection of bars
reviews: We ate there one night and walked through one morning. Interesting area of the city. We were approached in the morning walk by a couple of people I would have said were drug addicts but I didn't feel unsafe.

title: Fun tourist place!
reviews: Your typical tourist part of a big town.  Lots of great stores and restaurants.  Fair share of homeless people and panhandling.   Kind of interesting that there didn't seem to be a presence of police.  Definitely check it out but watch your wallet and purses (and it wasn't the homeless or panhandlers you had to worry about).  Loved the music playing on the street!

title: Quaint little area!
reviews: The cobbles and the streets give you the impression of being in an old European town! The clock with the steam coming out is a must be clicked at spot. Walk around and one should be able to cover up the whole gas town area in an hour or so. Take a left as soon as you head out of the waterfront sky train station and you should be there in about 5-10 mins or so.

title: Great shops
reviews: Easy walk from our hotel and interesting places to shop for First Nations authentic art and jewelry.

title: A must
reviews: This is one of the prettiest areas of town, and this is where it all originated. The buildings and ambience is very traditional and old, filled with small boutiques and restaurants. This is where Vancouver started and is immaculately kept and hopefully will stay this way for a very long time.

title: Gastown clock worth a trip
reviews: This is an area of Vancouver with souvenir shops, boutiques and restaurants. The area is rustic and quaint. It is easy to walk around the area. The highlight is the steam clock that whistles the hour.

title: Old Town
reviews: This is a great place to wander the streets.  The buildings are old but have fun things to do and shop in.  There are many  good restaurants all along the area. Be sure to see and hear the steam clock!

title: Wonderful area to ramble along...
reviews: Gastown is a menagerie of restaurants, bars and shops. Wander at night at your own pace, and don't miss the Steam Clock at the top or bottom of the hour. It's a five minute show worth seeing.

title: First timer
reviews: We walked through the area at night. It was very lovely. The steam clock looks cool. Doesn't last long for all that wait. The restaurants are quaint. Met some lovely ladies. The atmosphere was great. The service of the server was garbage.  If you hate job ...quit. Don't make other people unpleasant or have a bad experience.

title: Unique
reviews: Gastown was a unique and quirky area. I think we were there too early in the morning to take advantage of all there is to offer.

title: MUST SEE!!!
reviews: Always enjoy our time here...down side is that parking is almost impossible to find!  Great shops and LOVE the steam clock!

title: Small and historical
reviews: Vancouver is quickly becoming a city of boring glass sky scrapers, but fortunately they've preserved part of their historic core within Gastown. The brick streets, sidewalk cafes, and odd statues (gassy jack) and steam clock add to the quirkiness. Unfortunately the area is relatively small and there are more tourist shops selling stuff made in China rather than mom/pop local shops.

title: Old Vancouver but Can Be a Little Seedy
reviews: Gastown is the old area of Vancouver and definitely has that vibe. There are plenty of restaurants and bars with live music. Some neat art shops. And, yes, some kitschy souvenir shops. I was little disappointed that there was a little seedy edge to the neighborhood. It was the only area in Vancouver (obviously I didn't go too far) where I felt I needed to really keep my head on a swivel. If you visit San Francisco, it had that feel of Market Street after dark. On the tourist map but should probably have an asterisk. It's definitely worth a visit. But, after dark, pay attention.

title: Fun tourist area to explore
reviews: Great shopping and food in a tourist-centric area. Can capture some cool photos because of the old architecture. It's a must-see if you're a tourist here, or looking for typical souvenir shops.

title: Cute shops and lots of places to eat
reviews: If you are staying in Vancouver it's definitely worth a few hours to wander Gastown.  There are lots of cute shops, touristy ones too, art boutiques, coffee shops and places to eat.  The architecture is also worth the time, some really cool buildings as well as the famous clock and the statues.  My husband and I spent about 4 hours down here including a meal and saw everything.

title: Historic area
reviews: Gastown is a quaint cobblestone street area about 4 square blocks, fun to walk around and explore/shop/dine. A ten minute walk from Yaletown. As per other reviews there is a homeless presence but no more than in any big city if you stay within the immediate area and don't wander east.We encountered no aggressive or problematic folks. We had lunch at the Lamplighter, excellent beer choices and a delicious brisket dip sandwich. There are lots of local artisan shops, mixed in with some tourist trinket places.The area wasn't crowded, but it was off season. Cruise ships do deboard here, so it probably gets a little crazy in the summer.

title: Very Historic Area
reviews: There is a lot to do in Gas Town. Food, shopping, and people watching. I highly recommend taking a walking tour to really appreciate it all. Forbidden Vancouver is the one we took and it took our experience of the area to the next level. Its very walkable and accessible from transit. I wouldn't recommend driving though. Its very condensed and parking is harder to find.

title: Nice tourist spot in Vancouver
reviews: For years we've been going down to a restaurant in Gastown but rarely have we explored the area. Great way to spend an afternoon.

title: Old style
reviews: It was interesting seeing all the businesses in old style buildings. The steam clock did not go off while we were there, but was still fascinating.

title: Great atmosphere
reviews: So close to the waterfront and so close to Canada Place that you shouldn't miss it.  There is the steam powered clock and a couple of flat-iron buildings - a great atmosphere here and you don't even have to spend any money.  Keep walking to Chinatown if you like.

title: Nice area
reviews: Steam clock was interesting. It whistles every quarter hour. I've never seen anything like it before.

title: Quirky heritage neighbourhood
reviews: Being a local to Vancouver I love gas town for its heritage buildings cobblestones sidewalks and of course the steam clock. It does get a little crowded in the spring summer months with all the tourists coming in so definitely avoid it on weekends. Great little eateries around as well I highly recommend l'abbatoir, bauhaus, and the pourhouse for upscale eats and for a quick bite to definitely go to taco Fino, gringos or chill Winston

title: A bit overrated.
reviews: I spent several hours adventuring around Gastown on my first night in Vancouver. Although there are some gems, like the steam clock I found the streets to be mostly packed with souvenir shops selling cheap Made in China gifts. I further disappointed by the lack of restaurants in this area. The pub scene is good though and I sampled an excellent IPA at Steam Town. If you're looking for something more interesting than the same old tourist experience then I recommend visiting Granville Island and checking out the market there. I enjoyed it a lot more than Gastown.

title: A very eccentric mix
reviews: Gastown is a very eccentric mix of things. The cobblestone roads, the steam clock, and eateries are all very lovely and have a great vibe about them. But one wrong turn and you'll know you are in a downtown district of a very large city. I highly suggest sticking to the main roads while touring around Gastown. I always felt safe here, but some things can catch you off guard - depending on where you are from. Definitely worth the visit! Great souvenir shops as well.

title: Gas town
reviews: This is an ok place to walk around. Beware of theft .  We lost our rain coats inside the car while parking on the street.  Apparently they broke into the car with high skill way.

title: Somewhat of a Disappointment
reviews: I had heard so much about Gastown and saw that it was on all of the tours and must-do lists when traveling to Vancouver, so I was quite surprised and disappointed with the lack of restaurants and shopping.  There are both, but not what I would expect in a tourist area.Most disturbing was the amount of homeless people, people doing drugs on the street, and the street beggars, though polite, coming right up and asking for handouts.  I understand that this is part of living in any city, but I found it distasteful.   In general, I do not understand the attraction to Gastown.

title: Great Area for Drinks or Dinner
reviews: This area is on the edge of where Vancouver gets sketchy.  However, the few blocks of Gastown have some terrific spots for drinks or dinner, lots of touristy shops with the usual types of offerings and a steam clock that is pretty neat to check out.  What's there doesn't take long to wander through and is a good spot to hit later in the afternoon for a few hours before dinner.

title: ok to walk through, but not an attraction
reviews: Nothing special. Ok to walk through and look at some buildings, but generally on the run down and beggar hot-spot side.

title: Classic, older side, of a beautiful city
reviews: Historic part of the city. Older architecture, steam clock with exposed fascinating workings & chimes, bars & restaurants (including the Black Frog), and the inevitable retail therapy. Like the rest of this beautiful city the term 'traffic congestion' does not appear to be in the dictionary. Besides, this is a place where the drivers respect pedestrians. Ultra safe.Worth a visit. Enjoy a leisurely stroll around.The Strudwicks

title: Overnight stay
reviews: Fun area with lots of choices for eating, drinking and shopping. Enjoyed a great dinner with drinks at a local brewer.

title: Great place to hang out
reviews: Gas town is really, really cool. Great shops and restaurants all over. You can walk along the cobblestone streets and enjoy great pubs that serve great beer and pub food. Plus great shops and restaurants. Walking distance from downtown

title: make sure to visit
reviews: was a fun place to shop and walk around.  Make sure to visit the steam clock tower and listen to the chimes.  Cool and interesting to see.

title: Nice to Walk around
reviews: We spent an hour or so walking around in this area looking in stores and just being a tourist. I found it quite interesting and also lots of restaurants to choose from when you get hungary

title: Gastown Outing
reviews: G√°stown has a variety of restaurants and bars to visit. The environment is lively but not overwhelming with people like some bigger cities. It's also a nice place for a walk during the day.

title: A hsppening place
reviews: Gastown has a unique flavor all of its own.  There is lots of food and shopping.Just strolling the streets is fun.  Make sure you take a photo op at the gas powered clock.Street parking is limited but there are several parking garages which solve this problem.

title: Dont't miss the steam clock
reviews: Gastown features a heritage stem clock that emits a blast of staem at regular time intervals. It is an area where you have boutiques, specail indigenous stores like Hall's that make you see the history of BC indigenous people. Restaurants are many and include the iconic Old Spaghetti factory. You can also pick up your hop on trolley tickets tosee more of the city.

title: An Area Full Of Character
reviews: In a modern City, the Gastown area stands out, having been the original part that grew up close to the Waterfront and achieving it's name from Jack Deighton "Gassy Jack" a seaman from Yorkshire who arrived in 1867 and set up the first Bar. Quite rightly, there is a statue of the famous man set at one of the junctions. Today, the area consists of an eclectic mix of artisan shops and cafes of all shapes and sizes. A great place to stroll and observe with plenty of accessable seating.

title: Historic district with lots of shops and restaurants
reviews: Located in the shadow of the iconic Sky View building the part of Vancouver maintaines much of its historic past. Lovely shops and restaurants provide. distractions. Can be busy if the liners are birthed at the nearby dock.

title: Great streets to walk
reviews: This is fun to walk down and see all the area. Look in the shops and the Restaraunt. A lot of fun to sit and have a drink and watch people. As you go away from downtown there are more homeless along the street.

title: Great place to visit, lots of restaurants
reviews: Most interesting area of Gastown.  Lots of restaurants to choose from and music venues. Colourful local characters.  Definitely worth visiting day and night.

title: Great shopping area.
reviews: Many unique local stores, a good place to dig for special items. At the intersection of the steam clock always the busiest place.

title: Kind of odd...
reviews: Gastown is the is a bit of a dilemma.  It has some cool little shops standing right next yo abandoned warehouses teeming with the homeless.  Not a place to go at night but worth a daylight trip.

title: Shopping with a capital S
reviews: Really unique boutiques, great style and a must in my opinion. I got amazing shoes, unique clothing and a purse - all designed or produced in Vancouver. Really great. Good eats too

title: Must see
reviews: Ok, I gave it a 3 star and said it was a must see.  Kind of contradictory, right?  The clock was cool for the two minutes (or less) it went off and there are some cool art galleries but overall it was kind of boring.  It was more a touristy thing than I like.  There were lots of bars but then again there are lots of bar everywhere so you don't need to go to these,  but..it isn't hard to get to so go check it out and make up your own mind.

title: Quirky area with lots to do!
reviews: Another must see spot in Vancouver especially if you enjoy taking a walk and exploring downtown. Myself and my boyfriend really enjoyed it here!

title: A part of Vancouver history
reviews: Vancouver was born in Gastown, from its historical streets to its steem clock and industrial remanescentes all around you. The local gift shops at charming to the revitalization of that neighbourhood.

title: Interesting
reviews: We loved walking through Gastown, and feeling the nostalgia of days gone by.  Our favorite was the "steaming" clock on the street.

title: Great area for food & shopping
reviews: Great food & shopping ( and people watching).   Foodie paradise. Warning - avoid Hasting Street (homeless people, drug area, just overall scary and unsafe).  Go see the gas clock. Enjoy - close to the cruise port area if you are here on a cruise.

title: Charming area with a touch of tacky
reviews: Gastown is a charming area of Vancouver. It's obviously a tourist atea and has more than its share of tacky souvenir shops. There are many eateries and other shops.We walked here from West Hastings street on a couple of occassions. We took a different route one day and found ourselves in an area full of homeless people. So be aware.

title: Old town Vancouver
reviews: Lots of interesting architecture to look at here.  Also, coffee shops, bars, restaurants and big souvenir shops - classy ones!  One reason to visit here is the Gastown Clock which plays tunes on the hour and every quarter.

title: Good until you turn towards China town
reviews: Gastown is the oldest part of Vancouver downtown and you have great places to eat and souvenir shops there. You should definitely plan it in when you visit. But beware-we followed the advice of the tourist information centre and wanted to walk towards china town. We ended up in the 'druggy' area where they dealt openly with drugs, were high and generally we felt unsafe. So when you reach the end of Gastown, TURN AROUND!

title: Interesting Area - Aim for Midday
reviews: Gastown is a vibrant and interesting area within to stroll within Downtown Vancouver. With plenty of places to stop and admire, different cafe's and bistro's for something to eat and drink it is a go to place if you are feeling hungry and not sure what you fancy.Home to the Gassy Jack statue and the Steam clock there are a few things to see if in the area.I would recommend going around midday onwards, having visited at around 8am it was particularly quiet and not a lot open.

title: Lots of life
reviews: Probably not a destination point but had a little more interest than the CBD itself - lots of life, cafes and shops (obviously aimed at the tourists). Some of the restaurants actually seemed more interesting than where I had eaten by the water only a few hundred metres before.

title: Best part of vancouver
reviews: Gastown may be small, but it is magical. Has several shops, restaurants and coffee shops. It very romantic and a really pretty place to visit.

title: Interesting to walk around
reviews: Beautiful old part of Vancouver Watch for a few homeless people & beggars but they aren't pushyA lot of restaurants and the steam clock is coolThe old cobbled stone streets & heritage buildings make it look like a movie set

title: See the steam clock
reviews: Good shopping, eating, and sightseeing! Steak clock....spaghetti factory...all kinds of aboriginal arts displays. Be there!

title: Very Touristy...
reviews: We've been through Gastown a few times. It really is just tourist shops. coffee shops and restaurants. If you haven't been there then you should go for a walk. Always interesting.

title: Stroll, eat, drink, watch people
reviews: Gastown is a great place to hang out for an evening.  Great restaurants, the Steam Clock, some shopping, all on historic streets.

title: Nostalgic Evening Walk and Local shops
reviews: My friend and I decided to have a walk at Gastown that late rainy cold afternoon. What is more convenient than to hop on the Skytrain and get right to your destination as soon as you get off the station? Gastown can be nostalgic depends on the weather and time of day and that afternoon brought me back to the years I spent walking on a weekend in Florida, downtown Buenos Aires, Argentina. They had similar souvenir shops, same concept for tourists and locals alike, local shops where you can find unique pieces of clothing, shoes and artwork. My friend and I spent admiring Canadian artwork, photo frames at a small museum, trying on unique shoes at Fluevog and shopped at Latest Scoop. And just like most people, we waited and watched for the Steam Clock to whistle and steam and took pictures and videos, twice! For the half hour and the full hour... We even heard a group of young men after dinner screaming and running to witness this highlight of the place. You've never been to Gastown if you haven't witnessed this important event that happens every half hour! Gastown is one of my favourite places to visit whenever I get the chance to go downtown Vancouver. In the summer, you can go the other side towards the Canada Place and that's going to be on my Summer review this year.

title: Tourist trap
reviews: Overpriced area for tourists, if you like souvenirs, this is the place to go.  We wanted to visit the antique shops, only 1 was open and there was hardly anything in the store, would not waste my time going there.

title: Fun place to saunter around
reviews: Gas town is filled with shop, restaurants, some street entertainment, and a steam clock that goes off every hour.  It's cobblestone like walkways makes it a nice little spot to visit and walk around

title: Good area to walk, shop and have a beer
reviews: Strolled here prior to the sea wall.  Nice cigar shop-cigar emporium, lovely jewelry at the Jade store, and plentiful beer at the Lamplighter.

title: Great history
reviews: I have been going to gas town since the 70's, it has history and just a fun place to wander around, the steam clock is a must, as well as the old spaghetti factory

title: Very nice small part of Vancouver
reviews: This little part of Vancouver is absolutely a must visit. Very nice small shops and cafes and good restaurants.

title: Touristy
reviews: Touristy but nice walking and browsing the shops. Various resturants with many cuisines. Steam clock was interesting but of 1970s vintage and not actually run with steam

title: Very Artsy, Tourist friendly part of Vancouver
reviews: Great place to come check out in what I consider Downtown or Oldtown Pasadena.
