I think I would recommend coming more at night since it would be more picture friendly with the old buildings and the gas lit lanterns. There are also a lot of bars and restaurants to check out. We went in the afternoon so we checked out all the tourist stores, the art stores and live performances that were happening.

title: Cruise
reviews: What an interesting place. Don't miss out on this spot the steam clock is worth it if nothing else. Lots of suvenier shops a little bit of something for everyone.

title: Great vibe in a revitalized part of Vancouver
reviews: Love the vibe and variety in this part of revitalized Vancouver.  Some great shops and amazing restaurants away from busy Robson.  Worth the walk to check it out.

title: Enjoy it during the day
reviews: Nice walking trip during the day . Plenty of stores and restaurants  but be aware of your surroundings and what streets you go down. drug people in back alleys and abandoned store fronts. Security and citt workers are present

title: Great place to stroll
reviews: Went for a walk down to gas town prior to flying home. Wasn't disappointed, clean and well looked after locality. Great paths to walk along the river.

title: Nice area. Plenty to do
reviews: A short walk from my hotel, I went to gas town to walk around and stumble into something to eat.   Tons of options.  Lots of shops. Plenty of comfortable pubs/public-houses.  Wish I had more time to explore, it was a very comfortable place to wander around. VERY SAFE.

title: Didn't quite get it
reviews: Maybe I should have done some research before visiting because I didn't quite understand it, it looked like an interesting area but on walking through it was just one souvenir shop after another. The only area in Vancouver I didn't feel safe, lots of people approaching for money which is okay but some were a little too in your face for my comfort level. Did find a nice pub for dinner in a more open end of this area.

title: Fun place with a real steam clock!
reviews: Good mix of touristy and hipster with loads of old and new shops and cafes mixed together.  Go see the steam clock and the indecent shops selling hats, boots jewellery and other Canadian goods.

title: Gastown old Vancouver
reviews: This is the old part of Vancouver.  There are many old buildings.  It is a bit of a tourist trap with many businesses aimed at the tourist trade. The streets are  cobbled and can be  a bit slick when wet.  This area is part of the down town east side which is the poorest postal code in Canada.  One  may  see people with challenges - addictions and mental illness.

title: Special
reviews: Beatiful and warm place in the city. For to walk, seat at coffee shops, to buy souvenirs. The oldest neigthborn of Vancouver. Nice.

title: Original Townsite ‚Äî good restaurants and boutique shopping
reviews: Gastown is the original Vancouver Townsite, marked by the statue of Gassy Jack (Gassy Jack Deighton), the first to open a saloon. Gastown has come a long way from the comfort station where loggers and seamen came in from work to find comfort. Once the Canadian Pacific Railway terminated in Gastown, warehouse sprang up and more service were established. Today, Gastown is an ever change district of contemporary interior furnishing and hip fashion, restaurants, nightclubs, professional offices, creative spaces and a variety of commercial spaces catering to tourism.

title: Like this little hamlet the best
reviews: Of all the neighborhoods of Vancouver I liked this one the best. That is, at least, in the downtown. It's lovely little walk with shops, bars, and restaurants to peruse. If you are strolling it late at night, head back to the west end before you go south. Cutting south from the east end can get a little dicey after midnight. The gentrification of Vancouver is slowly moving East, but the panhandlers still have a strong stake in the east. But like all Canadians they are very nice about it, albeit highly unstable. I read a piece about the history of Vancouver which says the city has always had a large homeless population because it is the only city in Canada where you can starve to death before you freeze to death.

title: Historical place
reviews: This is where you will learn more about the history of vancouver- thank goodness for my notes and guide book or else I'd miss out on some interesting information.It was pouring and cold but all is good.

title: interisting
reviews: Went for a walk through Gastown, old buildings and old history, interesting replica steam clock with steam whistle.

title: Shopping anyone
reviews: Found this slightly underwhelming as it is just shopping really and a few metal sculptures.  It's saving grace is it is close to China town

title: It's a busy town
reviews: We just drove through it because it is the town where Vancouver started. But other than that it's just a town with lots of locals walking the streets lots of little shops and very very busy.

title: Gas town had super restaurants and nice shops
reviews: Gas town was a few blocks of super great restaurants that you cannot tell from the outside how great they are. Tacofino was one such restaurant.  Ask for recommendations from the locals.  Very diverse area , anyone can fit right in. Vancouver is experiencing a huge herion/drug problem and young people can be seen in this area in bad condition.  I didn't feel afraid, but it was very sad to see. No police in sight , drugs are kinda tolerated a little too much. Shops are fun and there are some touristy shops mixed in with novelty shops.

title: Increasingly touristy
reviews: I've visited Gastown several times over the past 15 years or so.  My sense is that it's become more of a destination for large groups of tourists.  There are still a few restaurants/bars and art galleries, but there are a much higher share of gift shops with a large variety of products.  So, Gastown offers a nice place for a walk, but it wouldn't be at the top of my list for a short visit to Vancouver.

title: Charming but touristy-y
reviews: Gastown is the older part of Vancouver, with cobblestone streets, historic buildings & enough stores to see to all your souvenir needs (Shop around!) Even if you're not buying, there's lots of Native art shops to poke around in & the general atmosphere is charming. There's also lots of pubs & restaurants, so you can take a break.Being close to the water, you can watch the ships &, of course, being Vancouver, there's always a beautiful mountain vista.

title: Interesting Place
reviews: Older part of Vancouver lots and lots of shops with so many interesting things for everyone . Streets are beautiful loved seeing the steam clock. Go for a walk down there you'll enjoy it

title: Amazing history
reviews: Was an amazing place to visit. Great food, amazing history and friendly people. The shops were all amazing and unique.

title: Lots of stuff to do here.
reviews: I could not find the steam clock so I was a little disappointed with my own navigation skills. Stop through and get a nice beer flight.

title: Not so much
reviews: Sb.Told me was a great place but the truth is,  I desagree, I thought some pubs seems to be good but others was crowded by teens!  And the streets were a little darkness and empty. So I came back to granville st., I thought better place.

title: Walk around
reviews: Beautiful buildings, great food and shopping. Easy to walk around and centrally located. Great way to spend part of the day.

title: Short Street of Shops
reviews: Was rather disappointed when we realised how small the area was. Lots of touristy shops..stray a street and the homeless street people & junkies were everywhere.  We were told when its cold this coast offers them a nicer environment.  Tye city lacked loved...trash all around and really untidy vacant lots were a real sad sight. We walked from gas town to Chinatown and it just got worse...Shame.Its a pretty city but someone needs to fight to bring it back

title: Loved the atmospere
reviews: Spend an afternoon walking around here. Some great restaurants, pubs, stores and art galleries. Loved the general feeling.

title: A Walk Around Gas town
reviews: I love to walk and enjoy old buildings and gas town is a great spot to walk around and window shop and look at people .I first visited it some 40 years ago when i lived in Vancouver and bought a great set of 6 bent wood chairs that has now become a great set of 4 but considering there now about a 140 years old and i paid about $30.00 each for them good bargain i all so bought about 1000 used bricks from the same area from a building that was being demolished that now are brick panels on the front of my home in Edmonds WA

title: Fun place to visit and shops galore.
reviews: Neat area for wonderful shops, eateries and brews.  Fun for all ages to experience.  Found several international shops, great fashion and jewelry stores.

title: An Historic Place not to be missed
reviews: Max was our tour guide from " Taste Vancouver Food Tours ". He was so much of knowledgeable with the history and background of this place. His relationship and arrangement with the restaurants, pubs, bakeries was exceptional as we get to see the brewery, try out the drinks and food etc. Although it was raining during the tour which started at 1345 hrs from the Waterfront Station, it didn't dampen our spirits. It was an enjoyable 3 hour walking tour. I would recommend for those interested to know more of this frontier town.

title: One clock, lots of shops and homeless people.
reviews: Sure there is a nice steam clock, makes noises every 15 minutes.Some great art shops if you have money to spend.Lots of tat shops if you have less money to spend.Homeless people seeking cash for "coffee" so don't be surprised to be approached by them.A very strong smell of urine and Ganja on the streets if you like that kind of thing.

title: A Fun Place to be at!
reviews: We were visitors at Vancouver and my sister who was a resident took us here and we were happy that she did. It was a very happy place to be at with the steam clock as the main attraction. There are lots of souvenir shops to engage the tourists while waiting for the whistling chime. Definitely a must visit place while at Vancouver!

title: History of Vancouver
reviews: Wonderful walk to read and learn of the history of Vancouver.  "Gaston" named after "Gassy Jack" just east of downtown.  Nice statue of "Gassy Jack" is there and I won't give a spoiler alert.  Visit and read the history.  And then walk a few more blocks to Chinatown.  One of the best walks I've had (and a great 2nd hand book shop to boot...Mcleod's)

title: Could be better
reviews: This part of downtown could benefit on an upgrade from the city government. From the waterfront station it was alright until you reach Powell and Main Sts. Beggars all around, not a sight a tourist would want to see. Did not feel safe especially with kids in tow.

title: Some nice restaurants but we felt unsafe walking here
reviews: Although we had a nice evening out, it was somewhat spoiled by being approached by homeless people for money.   Whilst not unsympathetic, some were on drugs and we felt very uncomfortable and intimidated.   We made a conscious decision to avoid the area the next night.

title: Well worth the visit and the walk
reviews: Travelled along the shore front and ended up in Gastown. Beautiful shops, restaurants and pubs. Was a great way to the end the day with very courteous and friendly staff, good food and an excellent atmosphere.

title: Fun part of town
reviews: Enjoyed this part of town immensely. Some interesting architecture from historical to modern. Enjoyed walking the area window shopping and watching the local people. Dined in a couple pubs the food and crowds in this area were fantastic.

title: Very dirty
reviews: We had read so much about Gaston we decided to take a walk through the area, only to find homeless people by the bunch, all over hoarding whatever they could making the area look dirty because they keep messing up garbage. Cheap ugly shops all over, a nice pub here and there but were completely disappointed.

title: A look at the history in a slightly seedy area.
reviews: We tend to stop by here when we have tourists with us. It is a quirky mix of upscale shops and history in a slightly seedy area of town. If you don't mind mixing with a few homeless people, it's the best place in town for a wide range of the standard souvenirs, coffee shops. I would recommend daylight visits unless you like mixing with the young people who may be a little drunk. Every hour the steam clock puts on a unique show.

title: Some great shops and restaurants, but lots of homeless people too.
reviews: It's easy to walk down a wrong street here and see people buying meth in dark corners.  I found myself staying very close to my husband and hanging tight to my purse. But there are also really great shops and some really good restaurants so my review is mixed.

title: nice area but small
reviews: You probably can't spend the whole day here but it is nice to see and walk around when you are in the city

title: Great vibe
reviews: Lots of funky cafes and restaurants and great shopping. Didn't buy much but enjoyed wandering through the streets.

title: Nice area with character
reviews: Nice area away from skyscrapers, quirky bars and restaurants.Great coffee shops. Very walkable and safe.

title: Quiant with an edge
reviews: Lots of interesting shops,fun resturants,the atmosphere was amazing  can not be specific the area is a must walk thru..look at everything............

title: Consider skipping the minors
reviews: Just like in my review of Vancouver, the Gastown district is a nice little quaint area of town with a few shops and many many pubs and restaurants.  Like much of Vancouver, Gastown is certainly best enjoyed without the minors as none of the pubs will permit them inside and only a few of the restaurants.  It is a bit of a hassle to search, particularly on a weekend.  Calling ahead and making reservations and to make sure minors are allowed would make for a much better Gastown visit.  I also recommend visiting the art shop that carves totem poles and masks, just don't let little hands touch - very expensive!

title: Al Porto Restaurant in Gastown
reviews: This Italian restaurant was one of the best I have been to in Vancouver. The ambiance was lovely on a cold rainy Vancouver night and the waiter was so helpful. The wine list was extensive and the food was fantastic

title: Glorious Gastown!
reviews: Love this area! Quirky, retro and clearly massively changed in recent times, it has lots of interesting places to check out and anywhere that has several vegan restaurants and a dedicated vegan pudding hatch is a win with me:)

title: Nice ambiance
reviews: We visited this area 3 times, it's whatever you want.Edgy youngster place, causal dining, bar with music andup market cuisine.Plenty of character, go

title: Historic
reviews: This is definitely the more historic area of Vancouver that we saw. The buildings are vastly different from the rest of Vancouver and it has a bit of a hipster vibe. But don't let that put you off! It's a cool area with lots of shops and worth a visit!

title: Bleak
reviews: This is the historic centre of Vancouver; a single lane, cobbled road with the usual assortment of touristy souvenir shops and boutiques.  In a rather untidy part of town (watch for beggars and   the homeless) although only three blocks from Canada Place. Not a good impression for the thousands of overseas visitors who flock here during the cruise-ship season (April - Sep). Not recommended

title: Another side to modern Vancouver
reviews: We loved wandering around the Gastown area of Vancouver.  It is the oldest part and interesting as you comb the streets.  There are a few pubs and eateries amongst the historic buildings and there seemed to be quite a few souvenir shops, giving us the impression that tourists flock to this particular area.  I would recommend to wander down to this area during the day to take in the historic side of Vancouver and learn more about the early days of this city.

title: Weird experience part I
reviews: Gastown itself was definitely worth the walk through. OK, it felt rather high-end and touristy, but the charm of the old city was definitely there. My kids, ages 10 and 12, were not so impressed, but I think my wife and I could have spent a lot longer here nosing around. The clock was pretty cool. It was a rainy day and the streets and shops were not crowded. We did not have any problem with solitications or observations of drug use ourselves, but this was at about 2pm. Lots of restaurants, lots of shops, and a very funky and laid-back atmosphere in my opinion. It got weird when we walked from Gastown to Chinatown. Within half a block of the main Gastown alleys, things degraded rapidly, and we stumbled upon a large collection of people who were clearly serious drug users. I am not sure if we wandered through a needle-exchange zone or what, but there were about 100 people from all walks of life concentrated on a small street corner and it was clear that these folks did not feel well. No violence, no threats, just a feeling of uneasiness. Caught this family of four (with 2 young kids) off guard. Would have appreciated some sort of "warning" I guess. Spent the next two hours explaining to my kids what we had just wandered through.

title: Great food
reviews: gas town has changed a lot in years! used to be scary, not anymore! maybe late at night with all the homeless people. Major should do something about it!

title: Gastown Clock
reviews: If you have a chance to visit Gastown while in Vancouver, please do. It has great shopping and the Gastown clock is something to see when it goes off. It has all the bells and whistles and the story is very moving. So do yourself a favour and visit wonderful Gastown.

title: Fantastic atmosphere
reviews: still retains old gas topwn feel and many of old buyildings and charactyer retained.Go and see the gas whistle go off every 15 minutes.Plenty of good restaurants and shops and our favorite place ionj Vancouver.

title: Some parts not so good
reviews: the street where the steam clock is situated was OK but other than that not really much to offer. There seemed to be a lot of homeless people about asking for money and the smell of weed was everywhere. Drug use was apparent across the whole city

title: Lovely Area
reviews: Very tourist filled area with great restaurants and bars around. The Steam Clock attracts a lot of people so it can get very busy in Gastown at any time. There's lots of shops, bars, restaurants which all look very nice. Gastown has a good community kind of feel to it, you can go from the busy down town area with large skyscrappers surrounding, making us all feel like ants, but Gastown provides some nice refuge and makes you feel a lot further away from downtown than it actually is. Lovely area.

title: Tourists in our own City
reviews: We walked to Gastown from our hotel, an enjoyable afternoon. Was great to see again after so many years. Lots of eateries and a little gem -  el Gringo....great margarita

title: A little bit for everyone.
reviews: A mix of Kitsch, tourist shops with the usual items, restaurants and interesting people.  Unfortunately it was raining, then raining harder when we were there so didn't get achance to fully enjoy Gastown, it has been years since I was there and it has changed quite a bit.  It is worth going to visit, there is the unique Steam Clock, run from the steam pipes below this area; which are used to heat most of the area.  We then enjoyed lunch at the Lamplighter Public House

title: A nice area to walk
reviews: Gastown is not huge so walking it is pretty easy. There are lots of touristy shops, as well as nice restaurants and pubs to choose from. Views of the mountains and the ports are spectacular.

title: What a Gas!
reviews: Love this part of town.  There are some very nice boutiques and then some regular souvenir shops.  There is red brick road and it can be an afternoon thing to do.  Lots of great coffee shops and restaurants.  Art galleries are in this area and some really cool concept stores - art on shoes a new place across from Starbucks.  Rain or shine this part of town is great.

title: Nice neighborhood with some sketchy alleys
reviews: I've been to Gastown a few times and it's definitely a must see.  Happy hour during the week is busy and there's quite a few bars with live music, tv's (but not quite sports bars), and 1-2 really good cocktail bars (the rest are alright but nothing to write home about). The neighborhood itself is cute, there's just a few dark alleys and spots where I wouldn't want to be too late at night. Lots of homeless, addicts and general crazy people walking around but I'm sure that adds to the charm.

title: Great little shopping and restaurant street in Vancouver
reviews: Recently spent several hours in Gastown. Travelled there and back on the hop on hop off trolly and spent several hours including lunch in the main street of Gastown.    Abounds with restaurants and cheaper eating places as well as countless souvenir and trinket shops. Found some items at bargain basement prices compared to in the city itself.Would rate as a must do for anyone spending a couple of days exploring Vancouver.

title: Fun place to visit
reviews: Gas town is a fun place to visit, from the old buildings that make you feel you were in Vancouver 100 years ago, to the Steam Clock and neat restaurants. Just don't go too far along or things go down rapidly with plenty of homeless people and it turns sketchy fast.

title: It worths each block you walk.
reviews: This area will lead you in a trip to the past, probably to the beginning of the beautiful Vancouver, where the traders used to come to sleep, eat and drink. The buildings and constructions are well maintained and it is culturally vibrant. During night time the lights make this area more pretty, and the pubs give an atmosphere of happiness. I love Gastown. Do not miss the steam clock, it is amazing.

title: Historic Vancouver
reviews: This is a nice spot to visit for its historical architecture. It also has a number of nice shops and restaurants. The Steam Clock is so unusual, and one of the signature things to see in Vancouver.

title: Rough
reviews: Gastown has some nice stores and an old brick style aesthetic; unfortunately the homeless problem can be shocking. We've been several times and have been asked for money (which is an everyday occurrence in Vancouver anyway), saw blood pouring out of a addict's arm and saw another man injecting drugs between his figures. If you want to visit, go in the day and stay on the main streets.

title: Historical downtown with a great vibe!
reviews: The historic area of downtown Vancouver is a great place to explore on foot, lots of historical local sights, restaurants, and coffee houses. There is a great vibe about the area and one of the 'must see' parts of the city.

title: Calm place next to downtown
reviews: Gastown offers a big variety of calm and cozy caf√©s as well as small stores and souvenir shops inviting everyone to come in and relax. If you visit Vancouver, you definitively have to go there and see the steam clock in Water Street as well.

title: Walk back into time
reviews: A wonderful heritage area of the city. A variety of different architectural building styles. Good variety of shops  close to sky train and Canada Place. Cobble stone streets and gas lamps abound. A lot of history here.

title: Clock and shopping
reviews: Nice place to visit for sightseers.  Lots of souvenir shopping options.  Recommend for first time visitors.

title: Great restaurants!
reviews: Both in Gastown and in Yaletown there are loads of restaurants to choose from.  Great shops and good people watching

title: Interesting up and coming area
reviews: Lots of artisan chocolate shops coffee roasters clothes shops bars and restaurants very interesting and easy to walk around

title: Old part of downtown Vancouver
reviews: Oldest part of downtown old buildings tastefully restored steam clock was the highlight for me.Unfortunately after dark the area is best avoided due to the street people and drug use.

title: Gas town
reviews: Went down to gas town to have a look and there were some really nice shops and restaurants down there. Two attractions down there to see as well. Found it getting a little on the rough, turning into a not nice neighbourhood with a lot of rough sleepers down there. Didn't feel unsafe but felt a little uneasy at that end. Went back to the busier end and it was much better. Would go back there and have dinner at a restaurant in the that area as it seemed really good.

title: Great Historical Part of Town!
reviews: We walked all around town and ended up in Gastown. We explored Black Frog since they offered an affordable meal in a local pub. I wish I could have seen the city during the day but this was still a lot of fun and a lot of history!

title: Nice for a stroll
reviews: We were on our way to Granville island but decided to have a stroll through Gastown before ordering a car.I think if you have a couple hrs to kill and like looking in tourist giftshops its good. We saw the famous steam clock and took photos and wandered in and out of various stores-very nice wood carving one but I forget the Name!! Stop for a coffee and Watch the world stroll by, very relaxing not taxing at all just an easy walk with lots to look at

title: Lots of interesting things to see.
reviews: Had a great time on a walking tour with 9 food and beverage stops. Loved all the cobblestones, beautiful restaurants and historic sites.

title: Cute shops
reviews: Odd area. High end shops but lots of homeless people. Beautiful old buildings. Street parking is tricky but there's a parking lot where you can pay for the day on Water Street.

title: Mainly for tourists
reviews: Gastown is a unique part of the city.  It has some historical buildings that have been upgraded and renovated in the western section.  It has rundown buildings and many poor people living in the eastern section, near Main St.  The western part has become home to film schools, university and art students, souvenir shops for the cruise ship passengers, and eclectic one-of-a-kind shops.  The eastern part has become gentrified amidst the population of poor and street people who are being pushed out.  Still, there are many services for the poor and homeless, so they are not going to be leaving anytime soon.  Gastown is steeped in history of the port and gold rush.  Enjoy the heritage architecture, try out an ethnic or unique restaurant and appreciate that the area is home to many kinds of residents.

title: old Vancouver
reviews: Wander the streets in this area and see old vancouver. Funky shops and good places to eat. Take a tour if you want more or pick up some information and visit galleries, gift shops, native jewelery art and more. You may want to wait by the old clock for when it strikes the hour and learn the history of Gassy Jack.

title: Great!
reviews: My favourite place in VC!! You will find many souvenirs store, great restaurants and an ancient arquitecture.

title: Best Downtown Neighborhood in the City
reviews: I have lived in Vancouver all my life and Gastown is my favorite neighborhood in the downtown core and one of the best in the entire city. It offers great boutique shopping, coffee galore, the best cluster of restaurants and bars. In the day, Gastown is a great place to grab coffee (Buro, Revolver, Timbertrain, Starbucks....JUST KIDDING) and walk through all the shops. Stay clear of the tourist shops, if you want any of those goods like maple syrup they can be purchased much cheaper elsewhere. This is the best boutique shopping in the city. Be sure to check out the steam clock, it makes for a great photo. At night Gastown is an awesome place to have a high quality meal with the best cluster of restaurants in the city (the Flying Pig, L'Abbatoir, the Alibi room, Water St. Cafe). Follow up this dinner with a drink at a many great bars including Portside, the Metropole, the Camie and the Alexander. All these places are a different vibe, but something can be found for everyone from a backpacker bar to a high end cocktails.

title: Avoid this area
reviews: We have been to Vancouver many times over the last 40 years and it is a beautiful, crowded city.  The city has changed so much-not all for the good.  We were wondering around Gastown and stumbled on an area of incredible sadness.  Blocks of homeless, strung out people stumbling, walking and living on the street. Avoid the Hasting St. Area.The areas away from downtown are still lovely.

title: Ok Downtown Area
reviews: Gastown is nice, especially at night with all the lamps and the steam clock.  Shopping is decent, like most downtown areas.  I would not plan on eating in Gastown unless you have reservations as the restaurants fill up pretty fast especially on the weekends.  It's worth a drive by or a  quick walk through but parking is scarce or expensive.

title: Gastown is our favorite!
reviews: We spent five days in Vancouver and visited Gastown often. We found the shops, pubs and restaurants charming and welcoming. Love the atmosphere!

title: okay
reviews: We walked around Gaston in the evening.  It was okay, but there are other attractions in the city that are more worthwhile.

title: Fun shopping day
reviews: The Gastown area of downtown Vancouver is extremely convenient. It is an easy walk from the major hotels and features Waterfront shopping, plenty of restaurants, upscale boutiques, and quirky finds. We love the antique shops and a couple of them were straight out of Harry Potter, with oddities and peculiar notions that had an eerie, magical quality to them. Seriously, I thought maybe I could get my wand for Hogwarts at Salmagundi West. I'll admit I was a little creeped out. But it was a fun adventure,  nonetheless.

title: Good Food, Weird Vibe
reviews: The area has some nice places to eat, similar to Yaletown, but as other reviews have said there is a huge homeless population that overspills from a few blocks east. We walked from Chinatown and it took us directly through some of the worst streets. The people aren't pushy and we never felt threatened just a weird vibe when you're spending $100+ on a meal and you can see people outside who can't afford to eat, an eye opener for sure. Hopefully the city can resolve this someday.

title: Feeling cultural
reviews: Gas town feels like a really small Grenache Village. Small breweries, amazing restaurants and a local vibe. You have to see the oldest steam clock in Canada.

title: Fun but a real Tourist area
reviews: It's a nice stroll but most of the shops are set up for tourists as it is close to the cruise ship terminal. Still I take visitors here but may be it's because the Steamworks Brewpub is close by :-)

title: Was ok
reviews: Expensive dining and stores. The Steamclock is here and that is AWESOME. There is also the Gassy Jack statue that's cool to see.

title: Great place to go at night!
reviews: Beautiful streets with lights at night! Lots of restaurants to go to eat and have dinner. Good variety of places to visit.

title: Do not miss this!
reviews: So many great shops and restaurants, really beautiful at night. Great cafes too although many with a queue to get in so remember to pack your umbrella!

title: Gastown
reviews: Gastown is a tourist magnate and is also a bit of a tourist trap. Maybe a bit too many expensive artisan type shops for my liking. It is a place with bars, restaurants and shops. Very walk-able and definitely worth exploring.

title: One of my favourite parts of Vancouver
reviews: I love going for strolls in Gastown. Lots of history, character and charm, not to mention the great restaurants!

title: The BEST
reviews: Amazing restaurants, shops, street artists, buskers. this is also a great place to watch people - grab an outdoor table - order wine or a great coffee and enjoy

title: Amazing
reviews: Gas town is an amazing little town lots to see and nice places to eat,be wary of the beggars around you!

title: Fun place to hang out at night
reviews: This is a fun area to be in at night. Lots of small bars and restaurants that have style and are very unique.

title: Great place to stroll üö∂üèº
reviews: We love Gastown. The food, the shops, the walking and my childhood memories of the big steam clock. It was extra beautiful on a quiet wintry night surrounded by the gorgeous lights.

title: Great neighborhood with restaurants and shops
reviews: We just strolled through Gastown with no real agenda. We enjoyed window shopping and just found a restaurant to eat at. We also picked up some ice cream along the way. Just a really charming part of the city!

title: Fun neighborhood
reviews: Interesting bars, restaurants and shopping.  It's a nice place to just walk through even if you're not exactly looking for something specific.  Duck in a cafe, grab some drinks, or browse the shopping.  It's a fun, cute place to check out.

title: Unique
reviews: Gas town is like being in a small town where there were no high tech overcrowded cities like present day.  There are cobble streets and the old spaghetti factory is a great place to eat.

title: Quaint old part of town
reviews: This is the old and quaint part of town and lined with restaurants and shops in historic buildings. Lots of nice places to eat, shop for souvenirs etc. which we did. There is an old gas clock thats fun to watch and video as it strikes the hour. If you get a chance its worth spending an evening in Gastown.

title: Meh.
reviews: Quick walk to gas town.Well I decided to walk around on the hotel they told me to watch out there.There's a lot of homeless people and beggars you can ignore them as you walk around.A few tourist shops here and there.In the end nothing fancy to see here.

title: Being a tourist in your own town
reviews: My friend had not been to Gastown in quite some time so we went to check out what was new. We had a great time the tourist stores were great, coffee shops were delicious, and lots to choose from if you wanted a pint or cocktail .

title: Nice
reviews: It was nice to walk on the street in Gastown. The views are great. Towards the end of the street we saw a lot of homeless people-which was sad.

title: Super cool
reviews: The area is very trendy and has lots to see.. there are lots of homeless and lots of cheesy tourist shops, but the food is great!

title: Everything you imagine and more!
reviews: Gastown has an old feel to it with all different kinds of restaurants and boutiques. Gastown is the perfect place to walk around and see the steam tower and then grab a beer or lunch with friends

title: Unique shops and eateries
reviews: We spent yesterday afternoon enjoying the sights and sounds of Gastown.  The old buildings remind me of Beacon Hill in Boston, as do the cobblestone streets.  It's hard to believe this little gem of a neighbourhood is in the middle of one of the largest and most modern cities in Canada - Vancouver!We found many unique shops, offering local designer furnitures, shoes and other home decor accessories, as well as clothing stores.  Nice to shop sometimes in unique boutiques, rather than chain stores. There are also many eateries, of different cuisines, to satisfy your hunger.  If you have an afternoon to spare, come down for a visit, and enjoy some shopping and dining in a unique Vancouver neighbourhood.

title: Gastown - historic but not very interesting
reviews: Well this is the first settled area (by Europeans) and the start of Vancouver, but it is of limited entertainment value. See the steam clock, Gassy Jack whistle and see his statue; look in the overpriced souvenir shops and try to ignore the pan-handlers. This area borders on the sleazy, but slowly changing East Vancouver so be careful and don't head too far east, although if veering a little south, you will find the old China Town, which I find more Entertaining. All this is walking distance from most Vancouver downtown hotels.

title: Walk, shop and restaurants
reviews: A walk in Gastown is a must while visiting Vancouver. Many nice shops, coffee places, restaurants and bars. It is not pedestrian only but it feels like it.

title: Awesome shopping strip
reviews: What a great stroll for shopping. All sorts of quirky shops. Make sure you have comfy shoes. Great cafes and restaurants.

title: Nothing is quite as enjoyable as taking a day off to wander the streets of Vancouverss oldest neighbourhood..
reviews: Some far thinking city planner prevented the forest of skyscrapers Vancouver has become from treading all over the original gas lit streets of Vancouver's oldest neighborhood. It is a pizza slice wedge of history fronted by charming stores and resteraunts and even though it has a heavy tourist flavor being right beside the cruise ship dock it still attracts the locals as well as the visitor. Right next door is the citys colorful Chinatown with its apathocarie, strange smells and delicious food. Among the best resteraunt in the area is an unpretentious little cafe named The Only Fish Shop. Lawyers and  homeless alike rub shoulders here to savor the delicious clam chowder served with healthy slices of crusty fresh sourdough bread. The cobbled streets are the original ones and such addresses as Blood Alley tell a tale of the early pre refrigeration custom of slaughtering aminals as close to the point of sale as possible. Chinatown features the famed Dr Sun Yat San traditional garden enclosed behind a traditional wall. Allow lots of time. If you wear on the historical aspect the vibrant down town and some of the worlds most exclusive retailers are only a few blocks away.

title: A Neighbourhood with Style and Historical Grace
reviews: I visit Gastown whenever I am in town. The finest drinking establishments and creative eateries can be found here. Artisans abound.  neighbourhood of energy and true West coast attitude.

title: A wonderful way to spend the afternoon
reviews: Wander, explore lively restaurants, character buildings, wide variety of food. Pubs, shopping, very entertaining and enjoyable walk, find a coffee or dessert spot, people watch, enjoy the view

title: Shops, restaurants in an historic area!
reviews: We had so much fun browsing this area.  The cool shops, restaurants, bars were so trendy.  The famous Steam Clock was something I had looked forward to seeing.  It did not disappoint!

title: Must see place
reviews: Bar hopping, restaurants or shopping, this place is for you. I highly recommend to navigate the whole city center on foot ( we've done it all week long).

title: Pleasant walk thru the city
reviews: We had a great time walking thru this area of the city, there a a lot of local shops with quirky items other unique furniture stores and many places to eat and have a drink.

title: Good place
reviews: The place is good  for have a casual walk, I know that the place is historically good, but not too many places to look forward, but they have good coffee shops and restaurants

title: Getting better for locals, always good for tourists to shop
reviews: Good place for tourists to do souvenir shopping especially if you are first timer to Canada/Vancouver and reasonable priced stuff. Better to go daytime as you may feel bit uncomfortable as area is very close to our red district (you will see some homeless people asking for change etc but they are harmless and nothing to worry about).Getting better for locals too. Many little nice restaurants here or near Gastown. As for sightseeing not much too see aside from steam clock, rests are all shops (gifts or unique stuff) and restaurants, some offices/local business. Not so entertaining for small children.

title: Only if staying nearby
reviews: It's an attractive area of the city, with some good restaurants and souvenir stores. Most of the shopping is boutique and quite expensive however. I'd probably only recommend it if you are staying in the area or are in Vancouver for an extended stay.

title: They need to do something with the homeless
reviews: This was my third time to Gastown. Every time the homeless issue gets worse and worse. On this trip at 10 am a naked homeless man was beating up another man in the middle of the street. This went on for about 10 minutes, before the naked man ran off. 2 minutes later the police show up, but the fight was over. I can understand the homeless issue is a challenge, but something need to be done. With so many other places to eat& shop in Vancouver, I don't think I will be visiting Gastown anytime soon.

title: Interesting area.
reviews: Good shops with interesting ethnic art and artefacts.....not cheap mind.  Very near the water and stunning skyline with Rockies as a backdrop.

title: Interesting area of vancouvef
reviews: Quirky area of Vancouver with nice eateries and independent shops. Interesting architecture. Worth a wander through.

title: Perfect for a rainy day
reviews: Gaston is so beautiful in the rain and offers so many quaint restaurants. I'd go to Six Acres for wine and dinner, then head to guilt and co for a burlesque show or live band.

title: Where the action happens !
reviews: Good restaurants, bars , and shops. While this is a MUST go destination if you are visiting Vancouver, Gastown is also regular  destination for locals looking for a good party scene. There are few bad streets you want to avoid though later at night.

title: Cute little spot with good shopping
reviews: Nice part of Vancouver. Enjoyed wandering around, taking in the sights, the lovely shops and the nice vibe.

title: Eh, I'd give it a miss
reviews: As I mentioned in my Granville Island review, I used to live here.  I've not seen it as a tourist and a local.  As a local, there are some nice restaurants to check out but as a walking visit, I'd really just suggest you give it a miss.  There are only a few blocks of shops and they hit the polar ends of tourist paraphrenalia (which is why I went there) and high end design/furniture shops.... and oddly enough the spaghetti factory chain restaurant.  For those unfamiliar with Vancouver, Gastown is a dodgy part of town.  I would highly recommend you not go there at night unless you are with a local.  I would give anyone that even looks remotely dodgey a swerve without feeling 'bad' about it.  The real estate industry has been trying for YEARS to gentrify it and infuriatingly enough, priced in its VERY LONG potiential which was and is ridiculous.  I lived there for along time and it's been 4-5 years since I've been back to Gastown specifically, and it really hasn't changed.  IT's still got a gritty after taste that isn't a must see for tourists.  Just sayin.

title: Charming
reviews: The streets are almost European inspired. A tourist zone with lots of souvenir shops, old brink buildings, and cafes lining the streets. Just a wander through for an hour gives you a lot to see

title: Romantic
reviews: Loved walking the area. Loved the clock, and so many little stores. We enjoyed a wonderful Italian meal, and sat outside. Very clean and charming. Smaller area than I had imagined, and very windy (told it always is windy). Stores close early, and are closed on Sunday.

title: Chinese New Year Parade
reviews: Always have to go through Gastown when we go to Vancouver ....Great shops ...nice old buildings ...good pubs and food and just an all around place to visit !!!

title: Lovely town!
reviews: We visited Vancouver in December during winter. Its not so convenient to walk outside but gastown has a lot to see. Good place to shop for souvenirs. Don't miss the steam clock!

title: Personality Plus!!
reviews: This neighbourhood has so much character and charm. We just love walking through and exploring. Every time we go there we discover some new cool restaurant, store or cafe, i love the cobblestone roads...it adds to the charm.

title: Lively Area of Vancouver Even in January
reviews: We enjoyed walking around in Gastown and window shopping.  We also stopped into a couple of Public Houses and had some great food and drink.  Don't miss seeing the steam clock sing on every hour!

title: Very historic
reviews: Gastown is a great area to walk around & shop for tourist gifts, eat & admire the old town heritage of Vancouver. It has many great bars & restaurants.

title: A area where you can find everything
reviews: Gastown is a great area for walking, shopping, drinking coffee, bars and restaurants. Very close to everything in Vancouver it is a must to stop there. It is in a walking 5 mins distance to the Canada place convention center, train station,etc...You can find a few cool things like the vaper clock, some cool arts galleries and souvenir stores.

title: Impressive!
reviews: A walk in Gastown! All i can say it that place have something magical, a perfect mix of old and new. I was fascinated by the steam clock, felt like in a Harry Potter movie! üôÇPlenty of restaurants to choose, great variety of different nationalities cuisine, or just for a walk. Being there after holidays, the Christmas decor was amazing making it more fun! Traveling or local, you won't be disappointed! I wasn't!

title: Nice place for a stroll
reviews: We walked down to the gastown area and found it to be a beautiful historic place for a stroll. There were several restaurants and bars that looked like nice places to stop for a bit! The steam clock is pretty... along with all the beautiful hanging baskets overflowing with colorful flowers!

title: Quick Vancouver getaway!
reviews: We spent an evening walking around Gastown.  We stumbled upon it as we didnt realize it was as close to our hotel as it was.  The steam clock was neat and definitely worth taking a look.  There is a great variety of food and shops to have a look in.

title: Great during the day
reviews: Lots of restaurants and great places to discover. Avoid the hobos and you will be just fine. They can be rather aggressive no matter what the hour.

title: STEER CLEAR
reviews: We heard this was a good place to go - honestly, it was horrible. I witnessed people doing drugs in the middle of store doorways and several homeless curled up along the streets. The stores were all crappy quality and dollar store feel souvenirs. We went and saw the steamclock, it was fine - but not worth the visit. Would never tell someone to go here.

title: A great variety of shops and restaurants
reviews: A great variety of shops and restaurants. Easy access with public transport. Good coffee shops and good service

title: One of our favourite memories of Vancouver.
reviews: We utilised our Hop On Hop Off Bus tickets to stop and explore this quant and exciting part of Vancouver.  We loved the cobble stone streets and the lamp lights.  At Christmas time it was especially pretty with a smattering of snow on the streets.  We loved exploring the many souvenier shops before sampling a beer and a wine at two of the various quant pubs on offer.  We enjoyed a lovely meal and beverages at a gorgeous pub on a corner with a front row view to Gassy Jack.

title: Small enclave of historical era
reviews: The older architecture and location were interesting but this is essentially a place filled with tourist shops.  Probably worth a quick visit

title: Cute place especiallly after dark
reviews: Trendy place.  Lots of good palces to eat, gift shops, and lights that make any picture a good one to save.

title: Interesting but boring
reviews: Walked thur Gastown on a clear cold day, and really the best thing to remember was the steaming clock.  Very historical place, but really not much to see.  Should have eaten there, I am sure there must be some good restaurants there.

title: Great Vancouver history tour
reviews: One of the places you have to visit when in Vancouver. The cobblestone roads show the history. Great restaurants and shops to browse while having a stroll.However, be mindful of personal belongings since there are many pan handlers. It's overall safe but have to make sure since Vancouver has become a large city

title: You have to see the clock!
reviews: Not far from Canada Place is the Gastown clock. It actually runs on steam and the clock itself tells you when it was made and by whom. Very interesting

title: Cobble street historic district
reviews: This is one main street (Water St.) with about 2-3 cross-streets that have lots of historic charm. Many one-of-a-kind boutique stores -  clothing, shoe, designer furniture & eateries. Lots of tourist goods here. Brick streets, the very famous Steam Clock, street artists - especially native carvers. Some great pubs, interesting historic architecture. Unfortunately, there's almost nothing open until at least 10am -11am. I hate seeing cruise ship passengers wandering wasting their time until store openings. I really wish cruise ship staff would INFORM VISITORS of Gastown retail hours.(If your off a ship earlier AM & want to make the best use of your time,HEAD WEST for a spectacular walk along Vancouver's waterfront. There are a few breakfast and coffee place along the way. Head east back into Gastown around 10am. The side streets are well worth a look - Abbott St. Carrall St. - you can do a loop and check out some places on Cordova St. as well. Bloody Alley is cool - mostly because of the name - not a whole lot there. Definitely DO NOT go much more than a block east past Carrall St. It becomes a rougher neighbourhood. Not dangerous, so much as rundown. Visitors should all be cautious in Gastown re pick-pockets. Do not leave purses unattended on backs of chairs, etc. Not that much for kids or teens in Gastown. People LOVE the Steam Clock. It sounds with steam-driven whistles on the hour and I think, on the half hour in the summer. Best to check ahead.

title: Old town Van!
reviews: Loved wandering down to Gastown for a little light shopping, lunch and local culture.  Plenty of hip and eclectic places along with your standard tourist fare.

title: Beautiful, no shopping
reviews: Beautiful and gorgeous. Shopping is horrible here. There are way too many souvenir stores. Worth a visit here

title: Lots of shops and restaurants
reviews: An easy walk with a multitude of art galleries, shops and restaurants. Some are pubs some or BBQ there is Italian and sandwich places too.

title: So it's a cobbled street .......
reviews: Having read numerous previous reviews before I went, I found it a bit disappointing.  Several reviewers had enthused that it's just like Europe - seemingly because the "main street" is cobbled.  Well, yes it is, but Europe is more than just cobbled streets.  Europe usually also offers narrow passageways, lots of hanging baskets/window boxes filled with flowers and outdoor cafe.  Gastown has none of these - unless it's completely different in the summer than it is in January.  It has a high percentage of tourist/souvenir shops, so if that's what you're looking for, then this is the place to come.  Other reviews said Hudson House Trading Company is the best place for souvenirs, and although it's probably the largest, I didn't think it was necessarily the best.  There's another souvenir shop on the same side of the street as Hudson House, but further away from the Steam Clock.  Think it was called Smileys.  They had the same souvenirs but at better prices.  The most famous part of Gastown is of course the Steam Clock, which is on a corner just past Hudson House.  The steam is continuous but the clock only chimes on the hour.  There are the usual jewellery stores and art galleries, as well as a gazillion different cafes and bars.  Other reviews have mentioned that the area borders a bad section of the town and is becoming overrun with homeless, but I didn't really see that.  I was on my own, I felt perfectly safe and nobody bothered me.

title: My favourite spot in the city!
reviews: Everything about this neighbourhood is lovely. The restaurants, shops and cafes are almost all privately owned. Beautiful historical architecture. There is a feeling of a small European town in the heart of a big city.

title: A downtown should see!
reviews: A few easy walking blocks from all downtown hotels (downhill to the harbour, three blocks back uphill), two blocks level walking from the "Vancouver Cruise Ship Terminal" and a short taxi ride from Ballantyne terminal (check your cruise ship port-of-call) or easy downtown bus/skytrain transit from all of town.Although a "bit touristy" not so much so, Vancouver locals also visit shops, restaurants and stroll Gastown for an afternoon or evening. Great photo ops!  A vestige of the early days of Vancouver, it has evolved into a bit trendy spot to visit.Restaurants abound from casual to upscale. Shopping for local gifts and souvenirs  from Canadiana through genuine collectible First-nations art are all available within three blocks of pleasant walking.Don't forget the Hudson's Bay Company store, founded 1670, the oldest Department Store in North America. Just three blocks uphill from Gastown. Typical Department Store operation nowadays, but a few great "old world" tri-colour ribbon Hudson Bay Blankets, etc.All in all a good few hours and/or evening in Gastown is a great, short introduction to Vancouver. Great visit for Couples, Families and Solo visitors to town.

title: Fun tourist trap
reviews: Its fun, but pretty dirty. Steam clock is fun to watch. Overpriced tourist shops, and overpriced native shops. Fun for kids.

title: Gastown Visit
reviews: We visited Gastown on a food toy. We have been there before, but were reminded how must history, fun shopping and delicious food there is.

title: Nice shops
reviews: Great place to walk round. Nice shops. Very touristy so can get very busy. Visit the gastown steam clock.

title: A fun place to spend a few hours!
reviews: Gastown is named after Gassy, Jack Deighton, named  "Gassy" because he talked so much.  He built the first saloon in Vancouver.  It is now a mix of tourist shops, eclectic clothing and shoe store, coffee shops, funky restaurants, pubs and craft breweries and old brick buildings.  The steam clock is a must see!  It looks really old but was actually built in 1977.  It plays a little tune on each hour and blows steam out of the top.  It's fun to watch!There are so many little shops and restaurants located in a short stretch that you could spend a lot of time browsing.  It does border the Downtown Eastside, a neighbourhood know for its drug problems, so stay on the Main Street where all the shops are.A fun thing to do is take the Gastown food walking tour...find it on the internet and book it.  An informative guide will take you on a tour of Gastown, telling you stories of its history, and you stop at about nine locations for small bites and drinks.  A really great way to learn about the area and get lots of yummy food!

title: Steaming great place
reviews: We had only a short stay in Vancouver. We spent our last afternoon in Gastown. It is littered with pleasant eateries, we dined in a Peruvian cafe. The high spot of the visit was the amazing Gastown steam clock!

title: Too much Gas, no substance
reviews: Gastown, which is principally a few cobbled streets spruced up for tourists may be good for foodies but on a winter's day holds very little of interest, there are more tramps than tourists and lots of rubbish everywhere, the old-fashioned streetlamps which give it a suitable Edwardian glow were turned off and the famous steam clock did not move one inch despite producing sufficient steam, neither did it whistle, the view of Gastown from the Lookout is more enjoyable than the real thing

title: Good neighborhood for food
reviews: Cute little neighborhood for many good restaurants. Just be careful that if you walk out of the area into a shadier section of town. Lots of homeless people.  Think the section between gastown and Chinatown.

title: Feels Like Europe
reviews: Maybe it's the cobbled stone street that made me feel like I was in Europe but I know that when I saw this area from a hop on hop off bus, I had to come back. It has that old feel about it. It's a not a very big area but it's a nice place to walk even on a cold rainy day. There are a lot of souvenir shops, some cafes and restaurants. And don't miss the Steam Clock and Gassy Jack!

title: Interesting
reviews: This is an area of Vancouver that tourists will find very interesting when walking around.  The buildings and gasworks date back to early days of Vancouver a very interesting area to explore.

title: Heritage district,
reviews: We had a great day wandering thru this precinct. Lots of interesting shops to look thru, with a fabulous boot shop that we spent a couple of hours in.

title: The place where it all started
reviews: Popular place for tourists. They are trying to change that to make it more for locals also, with pubs and restaurants. Nice area for souvenirs and go for a stroll

title: Great Restaurants, Shopping and Don't Miss the Steam Clock!
reviews: Four of us were visiting Vancouver for the weekend and stayed within walking distance of Gastown.  A vibrant part of the city!  Terrific eateries and local shops.  Comes alive at night!  Highly recommend!

title: Nice to see but not the highlight of our trip
reviews: Lovely older part of the city, friendly restaurant staff but it did feel a bit like a film set. Had a wander round Gastown the first few days we arrived in Vancouver but did not bother when we returned to Vancouver at the end of our 6 week tour.

title: Architecture and shopping
reviews: If you like architecture you'll love Gastown. The steam clock is nice too. Plenty of clothes and souvenir stores for the shoppers. Nice range of restaurants too but pre-book as they are very busy in this area.

title: Fun Vancouver Neighborhood
reviews: We visited Gastown on a foodie tour and a city tour.  I highly recommend visiting the area if you're in Vancouver.  The area is filled with great restaurants and local small businesses.  There is a great native shop and art gallery to get original prints or hand carved gifts.  Also, be sure to visit the steam clock, an icon in the area and a unique mechanism that plays music as well as tells time.  It's a fun and safe area to visit to get a different Vancouver vibe.

title: Good day spent
reviews: We went to Gastown as part of our day in Downtown Vancouver. I found I quite similar to the Exchange District in Winnipeg, Manitoba. There were many shops offering all sorts of services, as well as an abundance of coffee shops and restaurants. Walking was easy and the area easy to navigate.

title: Great for a night out
reviews: Full of loads of interesting pubs and resturants and shops all with character and charm a must if going to vancouver

title: Great for local shopping and souvenirs
reviews: There are lots of great stores in Gastown, from boutiques to souvenir stores. It is always nice to visit Gastown and it is especially lovely when lit up during the evening.

title: Enjoyed the stroll
reviews: Lovely place to stroll around. Didn't see everything but enjoyed what I did see. Beautiful buildings and lots of individual boutiques. A couple samey tourist shops.

title: Nice but not impressive
reviews: Nice olace but not impressive.  One of Vancouver places to be visited . To see the steam clock whoch find steam get out of it . Old mechanism.  Some thing you see.

title: Touring Vancouver
reviews: A great touristy strip to see the City.Safe area, lots of kitchy stores selling Vancouver Memorabilia (tshirts etc) - if you need that kind of thing.  Priced for tourists!  Don't jump at the first thing you see.  -  Area is good for a walk around and bite to eat.

title: Angles of old-style Van
reviews: A lot of people go to Gastown only for the Steam Clock and then they are disappointed because they expected it was bigger and more impressive. I suggest that if you have a couple of hours walk all Water Street, from Maple Tree Square to Waterfront Station: you'll discover some nice art galleries and shops and you'll really feel between the past and the present Van. Enjoy!

title: A little of everything within walking distance
reviews: We wandered around the cute shops and cafes looking at the holiday decorations. We went early so it was not very busy. Brought some souvenirs and Christmas items and they were reasonably priced.

title: Avoid "East East" Hastings
reviews: True, you can find some trendy cafes and shops in this little area, but be forewarned that East Hastings turns into skid row quite quickly. We were there on Boxing Day and headed east from Waterfront Station. We thought we'd walk through Gastown to Chinatown, but we suddenly found ourselves in an area of terrible blight and misery. Almost every doorway was occupied by homeless people huddled under wet cardboard and plastic bags. The sidewalks were covered with garbage and litter, and graffiti scrawled on the walls identified one source of the devastation: "Fentanyl eases the pain of gentrification," along with names of friends lost to addiction. Posters in several windows warned of the extremely high rate of overdose in the area. Though it was 1:00 in the afternoon and the streets were busy, a man injected himself not two feet from me on the sidewalk. Nobody hassled us, and we did not feel threatened, but it was quite a shock to see such suffering. After talking to several locals and reading up on the problem (The Globe and Mail featured the issue three days in a row while we were in town), it's clear that the city/province is taking opioid addiction and the resulting overdose crisis seriously. It's a relatively recent phenomenon, and the government is mobilizing to help those addicted. We just happened to wander cluelessly into "opioid ground zero" of all of North America, it seems. So this may not seem like a conventional review--parts of Gastown are probably what the guidebooks and other reviewers describe. However, I would suggest avoiding the Hastings route if you would rather not witness the sad scenes we observed. Or at least be prepared for what you might see just a couple of blocks from the Steam Clock.

title: Very nice area
reviews: Loved the cobble stones, the art galleries, the steam clock, and the cafes. Also the general decor, the street lamps and overall ambiance. It's a regular shopping area too. Very nice!

title: Tourist destination
reviews: Quite a small area near downtown. Got very busy during holiday season. Too many tourists for my opinion.

title: A fun place to explore while downtown
reviews: Not far from the Waterfront Skytrain Station and a enjoyable stroll. Places to eat and shop along the way and stop to see the Steam Clock go off. A large variety of shops to choose from for souvenirs with reasonable to higher prices.

title: great historical area
reviews: Gastown was a great hystof vaancover. Quaint  shops and great service. Wonderful experiance for first time visitor's

title: Interesting, dynamic, touristic
reviews: Gastown is a very dynamic and vibrant place. There are loads of things to see, try and do. We enjoyed discovering the stores, arts, diy-products and the whole atmosphere inspite of the fact that it is very crowded and packed with tourists. Nonetheless we were able to enjoy it for a different view of the city.

title: Cool historic area...
reviews: Great to walk around... if you havent been here take a stroll. Each time I go to Vancouver, I discover more interesting places, even if I've gone to same area before.

title: Water St. is a must in Vancouver
reviews: The street maintains its classic flavor of old Vancouver great ambience and atmosphere the stores look great and you really enjoy walking the 4 blocks it is, great restaurant optionsAnd the steam clock is a great thing to see, unfortunately in our visit it was not working properly it seem the mechanism was stuck but I supposed it was an unfortunate event during our visit, but it is great to walk in This area

title: Beautiful but a bit dirty
reviews: Gastown looks a bit like a European town, it is filled with shops and restaurants. The only downside is that the ground is a bit dirty.

title: Lunch
reviews: Easy walk from downtown hotel to Gastown for lunch. There are many cafes and restaurants to choose from. The town offers shopping experiences from clothing and accessories to art.

title: Ok
reviews: This area has some good souvenir stores, a few restaurants, nothing over exciting. Parking is expensive, there are a lot of pedestrians if you are driving and the bus system is not convenient

title: Quirky
reviews: This is a lovely quirky area of Vancouver that we really enjoyed walking around. Some lovely boutique style shops and some interesting historical bits of info. Check out the Steam Clock!

title: Nice ambiance, restaurants & shopping
reviews: Gastown feels quaint. I have enjoyed visiting this area with friends & as a couple.  There are quite a few different restaurants to choose from, nice (often expensive) shopping, and cute touristy sights.

title: Commercial but fun and safe
reviews: Mostly commercial area and appealing to tourists. Safe and clean and filled with quaint eateries. There are also some very nice boutiques in between tourist trinkets.

title: Great street
reviews: Our visit to Gastown was great. We strolled along the street stopping to look at a number of stores, yes most were souvenir type but they were always interesting. Then the obligatory photo with the clock.

title: Beautiful street full of cool bars restaurants, shops and atmosphere
reviews: Throiguhly enjoyed our times in gastown with the wonderful atmosphere, fantastic shops, albeit touristy, they had great stuff, the bars, cafes and restaurants were also great. Must see and do when in Vancouver

title: Great for souvenirs and that's about all.
reviews: I visited Gastown with my family based on reading others reviews. If I am honest it is great if you after souvenirs to be taking home. There is a number of different stores which have a range of souvenirs. I found that most of the stores sold the same types of things. There is also some nice and trendy looking restaurants which would nice for a late lunch. The steam clock was a bit of a let down. Perhaps don't have too higher expectations. It is a lot smaller in size than I expected. Every 15 hours it makes a whistle noise and releases steam. There were a few tourists posing for photos next to it.

title: Winter must
reviews: Great ambience, lights and Xmas decor were excellent. Lots of family friendly restaurants available but very busy at this time of the year. Plan ahead.

title: Gastown is a consistent Vancouver neighbourhood which seems to be improving
reviews: When I first drove into Vancouver in my early 20's and saw Gastown with the brick facades, cobblestone streets, and twinkly lights in the trees I though it was the coolest looking place ever. It's remained consistent over the years with a combination of stalwart businesses and revolving new ones over time. While some say the area is being 'gentrified' I personally find it improving. Worth checking out for a Vancouver visit. Don't be turned off by the tacky tourist shops...there's a lot of other great stuff there.

title: Walk about town
reviews: If you love wondering about , looking at old architecture , shopping for local creations and eating some of Vancouvers best food available Gastown is a must do. Take the Hop on Hop off bus loop and make this stop your hop off. You'll need an hour for exploring. Put your name down for lunch at the Spaghetti Factory for an amazing food stop as well.

title: Steam Clock
reviews: This a quaint part of Vancouver and I loved it.With cobblestone streetsAnd the beautiful street lamps Lots of nice tourists shopsA very nice First Nation storeA cowboy boot storeVery nice restaurants And of course one of the main attractions is the Steam Clock - I think it's the only one left in the world ??make sure you stay around to hear it chime off a tune at 1/4 past the hour & 1/2 past and of course on he hour.. it's so nice

title: Beautiful place
reviews: Highly recommended!! Great local shops and Restaurants!! Great views and just a few blocks from downtown.

title: Great area of Vancouver
reviews: A excellent and must see local area of the city of Vancouver. You must check out the Steam Clock which plays music every 15 minutes....great!

title: Something for Everyone
reviews: Gastown was amazing with something for everyone. Took wife and daughter back three times during a one week stay in Vancouver. Even bought myself a great pair of cowboy boots. The gas clock is great and everyone was so friendly.

title: Historical and Architecturally Stunning
reviews: Well, I guess if you come to Vancouver and haven't been to Gastown, you haven't really been to Vancouver then. This is one of our historical tourist place where you must visit. I like the feelings of the whole street just back in time and just feel amazing being in the middle of it. The crowd will make you think you are in a really important part of the town it will make everything worthwhile. The dining places on this street all have modern structure to boost it's historical feel. I like being in the middle of the street, it's one of the place that says "Vancouver".

title: Shopping & Eating
reviews: Gastown is a nice little excursion for tourists --- great boutique shopping, a wide variety of restaurants, ranging in price and cuisine, good people watching, an easy walk from the train/transit, very central.  Also a lot of good history --- check out some walking tours if you are into that type of thing. Some historical sites within, as well, like the Steam Clock and the park.

title: Shopping, lights excellent places
reviews: On GAstown you can find excelelnt restaurants, shopping, attractions and the most interesting route in the buillding city

title: Nothing speciL
reviews: It's a nice place but not the best place where I would say it's amazing place to spend with family..

title: Cheryl
reviews: Best place to "just be" Experience, view, fun and more! We walked everywhere and the food was great! People in Van are friendly, fearless, and fun!

title: E xciting, vibrant town
reviews: From the variety of restaurants to the variety of shopping great place to walk and absorb all of the hometown culture. Fun for all ages

title: Gastown, Vancouver
reviews: Gastown itself is picturesque, quaint - with great architecture, shops, antiques and fun restaurants.  Unfortunately, as is true of many North American cities, there are a lot of people who seem to be using drugs, have mental health issues and are seeking money from pedestrians.  I was approached more than once.  One should go prepared to ward off people who are "hustling" .

title: A bit hit and miss
reviews: We found the much-touted Gastown to be a bit uneven: some nice places, some predictable tourist shops.  If you have time to spare, consider a stroll through the area but keep your expectations modest.

title: A bit touristy but a fun walkabout
reviews: Gastown is an easy walk around. A lot of tourist-oriented businesses near the cruise terminals -- and that's a good thing for some folks.  The rest of the neighborhood has interesting architecture, the steam clock (which I didn't expect but it's worth seeingit's just there on a corner), and the further one walks from the cruise terminal the more local character you get to see. Worth the short walk if you're there on a cruise stop.

title: Great historic part of town
reviews: Hiking around historic Gastown rewards you with interesting shops, great spots for lunch or supper,(Porto), and a good slice of turn of the century Vancouver. Fine way to spend a few hours.

title: Good for a walk
reviews: Good to walk down once during your trip. The restaurants are bit pricey but theres the "flying pig" thats very popular. The Steam Clock in Gastown is pretty cool to see. (One of those things you "have" to see but not much to it)  but walking down the streets alone was an enjoyable experience.

title: Nice place to walk and dine
reviews: I suggest going here at dusk to see the lampposts at night. There are a number of good places to eat in this area such as the Water St Cafe and the Flying Pig.  Souvenir shops are plentiful in the area, but there are some hidden gems.

title: Historic Architecture, Interesting Shops
reviews: My wife and I strolled through Gastown yesterday, and enjoyed the window shopping. We went into a few stores, admiring the often quirky charm of the often offbeat merchandise.Even in the cold and rain, the trip was fun, and we look forward to visiting again.

title: Something to do
reviews: Gastown never disappoints! The down part is there is very limited parking! And you cannot park longer than a couple hours, you cannot renew your parking. But good variety of stores and restaurants.

title: Not bad
reviews: Walking around later at night with my husband I wasn't worried but this would be uncomfortable alone or just with a group of girls.  Shops closed by 8:00 pm

title: Beautiful
reviews: Each time I'm in Vancouver a have to take a walk to Gastown. There is a special atmosphere there. It's calm and lively at the same time. I would recommend reading about the history of Gastown because it holds many interesting facts. Have fun üòä

title: Pretty at night..
reviews: We visited at nighttime. Very pretty with the lights twinkling. The best thing by far was the steam clock, very cool... We were there for 1800 and got a great video of the steam clock doing its thing. Brought a few souvenirs but didn't eat here.

title: Stepping back in time
reviews: Gastown is an old part of Vancouver and is very scenic, especially the steam clock which must be the most photographed structure in Vancouver. It offers quirky shops and wonderful restaurants and is a must see if visiting the city.

title: Old face of vancouver
reviews: Gastown is one of the best in Vancouver ..   it's the old face of Vancouver, when you go there you will think that you are at another city, another culture, absolutely you will be in love with this place ..

title: Old Town, Urban Problems
reviews: A beautiful old part of Vancouver with nice trendy restaurants. Lovely cobblestone streets and a steam clock that gives a burst of steam on the 1/2 hour. Very cool.It's a very nice area and a great city walk. Warning though, one turn and you can quickly find yourself in an area with a high concentration of addicts and homeless folks. Vancouver has a pretty serious drug problem now and it the epicentre seems to be on East Hastings. We encountered a number of folks who were struggling but they did not trouble anyone. I'd recommend using common sense, particularly if exploring at night.

title: Nice area with lots of shops
reviews: Although this is close to a shady area, Gastown itself is great. Lots of galleries and quirky shops and restaurants. Cool cobbled streets and gas clock.

title: Great place to eat and shop
reviews: I loved GStown because it was a shopping hAven , cute and charming to hang around and look at. I had the best haircut of my life in the Acela salon here and the prices are very affordable

title: Shoppers Paradise
reviews: So much to see and do day or night.  Fantastic shopping, dining or just hanging out.  A bustling place with something for everyone.  We had a yummy lunch at small unassuming sandwich shop where eveything was made fresh.  Easy access by bus but could take some time getting around by car.

title: Interesting part of Vancouver
reviews: I am attracted by the older architecture, the old steam clock and the food offerings around here. It is quite old and intriguing. However, it is small. We just did a quick walk through. The Crab Park is just at the junction of Main St and Alexander St. Good views of the Canadian Place from here- but not a particularly nice part of town to go to. Better parts of Vancouver to go

title: Wet time
reviews: Gastown section of DT Vancouver is really nice place to stroll around even in a wet and soaking day....just beautiful.

title: Varied selection of shops & restaurants
reviews: Charming olde world area of Vancouver including the world's only steam operated clock, nice bar/brewery called 'Steam Works'

title: Pulls the Tourists In
reviews: Vancouver started in this neighborhood with the opening of John "Gassy Jack" Deighton's salon in 1867. The National Historic Site sprawls for a few blocks on the northeast end of Downtown, featuring restaurants, bars, coffee shops, tacky souvenirs, fine creations by indigenous people, boutiques and the list goes on. Skidrow with its homeless and drug dealers begins on its eastern edge, but I have noticed only a few homeless spilling over into the neighborhood itself.As a history buff, I like the well-maintained old brick buildings with information plaques about their past. Brick-paver sidewalks, antique-looking lampposts and cobblestone streets enhance the earlier-era ambiance. Maple Tree Square, mostly a busy intersection, is where Deighton built that salon and a statue of him stands there. His "Gassy Jack" nickname came from his penchant for talking a lot rather than a digestive problem. The square also holds historic Hotel Europe, now affordable housing for those with low incomes.This flatiron-type structure was the first reinforced-concrete building to go up in Vancouver. The popular steam clock at the corner of Cambie and Water streets, however, is not an authentic vintage timepiece. Instead, it was constructed and installed in 1977, commissioned by local Gastown businesses. It whistles on the quarter hour, generated by steam, but the clockworks themselves are operated by electric motors.Parking in Gastown can be expensive and I dislike driving its busy streets. Depending on location, I recommend walking here or taking public transportation. For example, SkyTrain's Waterfront station is extremely close.

title: Great fun
reviews: A must do area for anyone looking for a place to eat and drink with a trendy feel to it. Great shops for the person looking for touristy items as well as more artsy items. The steam clock is also here

title: Changes After 25 Years!
reviews: First time back after 25 years, when we came here on many weekends. Gastown streets are showing it's age due to "wear & tear"! We travelled the streets during the day time, did not see that much outside of few souvenir stores that did not have many patrons. Not a bad place for a daytime stroll to take in the sites!

title: A Pretty Good Location
reviews: We stayed for a week in Gastown and loved the convenience of it, great shopping and a never ending supply of eateries.  The white elephant in the room however, is that it butts up against the East End and the homeless and drug issue is real and those people flow into the whole of Gastown.  Now, let me be clear, you don't feel threatened by these folks but the situation is uncomfortable and just simply impossible to get away from.

title: My favorite place in Vancouver!
reviews: If you only have a few days in Vancouver, you must go to Gastown.  Relax and have a cocktail at Chill Winston as the street lights come on.  Walk down Water Street and visit the numerous shops along the way and definitely have a look at the steaming clock.

title: Shopping and dining extravaganza
reviews: A must see in Vancouver.  The street are beautifully lit with lights.  There are local store with local merchandise.  Fine dinning and local bars are clustered through the street.  It is a safe place to stroll around.

title: My review probably not so hot
