reviews: It was a very cute little neighborhood, we strolled around late in evening, looking at shops. And had dinner at one of the restaurants. Plenty of coffee houses, restaurants and bars to choose from.

title: Shopping and dining
reviews: Didn't think the area was anything more special than you'd find in any big city.  There are eateries and places to shop.  We stopped in a couple places to look at the menu and both were eclectic  Worth a stroll through if you're in the area.  Not somewhere you'd seek out specifically.

title: Gastown - Steam Clock
reviews: A must is to see and hear the Steam Clock.  Plenty of shops, restaurants and bars.  Not a very large area but plenty to see and enjoy.

title: Fun place to wander
reviews: If you like poking around in small gift shops and art shops, Gastown is a great place to visit. There were some touristy places, but most had beautiful First Nation art for any budget.

title: A bit run-down
reviews: While on a walk to the Sun Yat Sen garden (recommended), we went through Gastown -- this is not one the better parts of Vancouver, and we could have easily given it a miss.

title: A good trendy place for a stroll on a sunny day
reviews: Gastown , although heavily touristed, is a great place for a leisurely stroll, particularly if it is sunny...lots of shops selling the usual Chinese made tourist rubbish, but some beautiful designer show shops thrown in the mix. heaps of little places to eat, with food a little different from the usual carb heavy typical Canadian offerings.  If you walk on out of Gastown you may find yourself in areas with a lot of homeless people and drug users....not a problem, being Canada even these people all seemed friendly and non-threatening. If you want some amazing hand made shoes this is the area to find them.

title: Lots of fun.
reviews: The area has lots of fun shops and restaurants. I don't think there are lots of bargains but prices seem fair.

title: Traditional
reviews: It s a nice place with old time places, lots of shop with souvenirs, and the famous steam clock. The last one you should probably see it ....

title: Great restaurants and place to walk around - watch out for crackheads
reviews: Gastown is a great place to walk around, pop into shops and try out restaurants.   It's close to the train station and many bus lines service this neighborhood.  We walked from Gastown to Stanley Park - a long hike but mostly near the water.  Watch out for crackheads!  If you stray off of the main drag, it gets pretty dodgy.  I was told that the crackheads are mostly harmless, but I don't quite believe it.  It gets dodgier the further south and east you go.  Your spider sense will be in full alarm by the time you get to Hastings and Carrall.

title: Good Eats.
reviews: Mostly fancy pubs and restaurants. The brick buildings and architecture are cool to look at but not a whole lot to do either than getting a meal or some drinks

title: Vancouver history
reviews: Be sure to take a stroll down here to witness historical Vancouver. Plenty of brownstone and art deco buildings of interest. Some roads retain their cobbled surfaces in keeping with the character and don't miss the steam powered clock and railway terminus building. Artisan shops and galleries specialising in First Nation Art sit alongside tourist shops selling gifts and souvenirs. A good selection of restaurants, bistros and bars too.

title: quaint and buzz buzz
reviews: walking from Chinatown to gastown is a little worrying with many interesting characters who are homeless. however there're lots of shops selling local products and signature goods of Canada. You can find the same goods and products in every shop. The steam clock is interesting and unique and for the fact that it is still working is cool.

title: First Visit
reviews: We hadn't been to Gastown before so we made sure to explore it during this visit to Vancouver.  It is an amazing part of the city.  We enjoyed the unique architecture and cobblestone as well as all the interesting shops.  We found a place to eat easily as there are many options.

title: Close to Canada Place
reviews: More quaint than the glass fronts elsewhere in Vancouver. Lots of shops and eateries. The Steam Clock is worth a look.

title: Eclectic area with restaurants, galleries, and shopping
reviews: Easily walkable from downtown Vancouver, an eclectic part of town filled with restaurants, art galleries, and other shops.  Nice ambiance at night with lots of people out walking around, and the main block strung up with lights that cross crossed the street.  Visit the steam clock that sounds every half-hour.  We had a very nice dinner at the Flying Pig.

title: Unique
reviews: We were on a hop on hop off bus tour it was fun, we got off at Gastown and spent 3 hours walking around checking out the shops and restaurants. I loved standing in anticipation waiting for the steam clock to play. They have some unique shops very reasonable prices. Unique part of Vancouver for all to visit, shop and eat. There are many restaurants to choose from.

title: Great place, just beware where you wander
reviews: The historic part of town this area is a must see. The gas clock is amazing. We intended walking towards Chinatown from here and as you do, you just wander around in the general direction of your destination. We unwittingly turned a corner to be confronted by a change we never expected. An awful smell of urine, and general uncleanliness, litter all around,there were druggies drunks and homeless people laying around. We actually witnessed an addict heating up his heroin over a flame, pulling it up into a syringe. An other was shooting up. I'm not naive I know every city has its problems, but I was shocked to find it so close to popular tourist areas. In fairness we didn't feel threatened by anyone, but made our way back to the safety of Gastown.

title: a must visit
reviews: An historic area. Very nice with lots of places to eat and shop plus two terrific art galleries - one a Pacific Northwest gallery and the other Inuit.

title: Beautiful place to visit
reviews: Take the family and walk down the streets and by all your souvenirs. The street is lined with beautiful hanging plants and lined with trees to keep you out of the sun. The street looks like a scene out of the movies. The colors of the buildings are nice and the streets are clean.

title: Short walk from the Seabus
reviews: We didn't have long to spend, but wandered over from the Seabus and checked out a few gift shops and saw the famous Steam Clock- very cool! We were a little too early for lunch so didn't get to try out any of the restaurants.

title: Good food and history
reviews: We took a food tour of Gastown one Friday afternoon/evening.  It is a busy area with many locals and tourists, but not overwhelmingly so.  It has the usual touristy shops, but also a lot of unique stores, restaurants, and historical buildings.

title: Awesome place to browse
reviews: Nice stores & restaurants.  Loved this place!  It's within walking distance of the hotel Georgia and the Four Seasons.  Many restaurants to pick from.

title: lots of good restaurants and bars-lively buzz
reviews: the area around the steam clock is very nice and centrally located with lots of good restaurants and bars etc

title: Quaint but be careful of the surrounding areas
reviews: Nice area for a wander with some good bars but turned the corner and walked into a run down area on the edge of Chinatown. Lots of homeless (sadly) and felt quite unsafe.

title: Most reasonably priced resturants,
reviews: Seems a bit rough and ready, but generally ok. Some beggars, but not aggressive. Was told there are many with mental disabilities who end up as drug addicts. Didn't personally notice anything that bad.

title: Interesting revitalized neighborhood with history!
reviews: Did a walking tour (Tour Guys) that included Gastown and really enjoyed learning about the area, how recent it had changed... saved from being bulldozed by some forward-thinking people. The city planners also made sure there were places to live for any persons being displaced from their affordable housing. Seems like the transformation was done properly!

title: Nice Stroll Without A Lot To Do
reviews: Nice area for a walk among a lot of mostly kitschy shops and bar/restaurant ops.  Didn't live up to our expectations in that regard.

title: Interesting unique area steeped in history
reviews: Gastown is a small area in downtown Vancouver offering high quality souvenirs, stunning native american art and some good food outlets.  The steam clock in the centre is an obvious feature drawing crowds for each quarter strike and the statue of Gassy Jack , the founder of the area, stands proud near the entrance. Well worth a visit to this waterfront area and allow plenty of time to explore.

title: Much tidied up over the past 40 years!
reviews: Much more touristy than when I visited years ago - but good to see the steam powered clock and it is possible to find reasonably priced eating places ( such as the Black Frog ) still as well as more high end ones. Shops are a mixture of interesting and typical tourist stuff. Great cheesecake from the shop near the clock.

title: Lots of great shops and places to explore - but do be careful
reviews: Gastown is the "old town" section of Vancouver - packed with restaurants, bars, and shops. It's thriving and lively at all hours - don't miss the antique shops, clothing stores, and hipster restaurants.  There are some blocks where homeless people gather at night, and they're worth avoiding.

title: Ok bit disappointed
reviews: Was ok and worth a visit, but if it was not for the clock you would not really know you were in the area, lots of places to eat and not far from other places

title: Food, drinks, shopping
reviews: I loved the town clock which emitted steam from the top. Be sure to have your picture taken in front of Gassy Jack.

title: Major Tourist Attraction - containing Vancouver's historic roots
reviews: Centrally located take a stroll along Gastown's gaslamp & flowerbasket lined cobblestone streets, and witness the restoration of  Vancouver's oldest neighbourhood.  Home to a variety of fine restaurants and pubs, outdoor cafes, artists, and boutique stores,  in restored historical buildings. You will also find several historical features:  the statue of Gassy Jack who distilled and sold alcohol to weary sailors and lumbermen, and the world famous working Steamclock which whistles every 15 minutes.  The area becomes more vibrant with the evening's nightlife.

title: Vancouver Must Sees
reviews: What a unique and historic part of Vancouver. The variety of unique stores and restaurants demonstrate the diversity of the area. The main thoroughfares present a very pretty small town feel. A quick walk gets you to the Canada Place Pier and opens the door to the next adventure.

title: Lovely unique town!
reviews: Lots of interesting shops and architecture.  Lovely to just walk down the street but be careful of some dodgy areas which can be unsafe.

title: Cosmopolitan area
reviews: This is a must for visitors to Vancouver. The diverse choice in shopping is amazing. There are lovely little coffee/cake shops as well as restaurants, again, high end and standard. A great experience!

title: Gastown is very colorful
reviews: a very fun and historic part of Vancouver's past, from timbering onwards.  This area has been well preserved and likely "enhanced".  See the sculpture of whiskey-entreprenuer Gassy Jack for whom the district was named.  Strolling through on your own will be pleasant but taking a Tour Guys tour will give you more information (and it's free).

title: A must see!
reviews: So much fun and so much to see. There are so many great pubs and restaurants to check out and try, we had a hard time choosing.

title: Gastown
reviews: Great place to get around, lots to see best on sunny days to sit and watch the world go byeThis is the second time we have been there and again enjoyed it Restaurant OK in this area

title: Enjoyable part of City
reviews: The gas clock is interesting and always have tourists there,especially on the hour. Lots of shops selling usual tourist fare, some selling better quality items.

title: Dinner in Gastown
reviews: There are many surprises here that merit exploration as in walking around the streets .There is history, jazz Cafes where the performers climb over the open windows into the street to entertain the passers by. There is good food in tucked away little cafes and just a good  "vibe"

title: Area is a bit run down around the edges.
reviews: Approach this area from the seafront as we tried to get there from the downtown side and there were large bunches of people hanging around which made us nervous so we retraced our steps and left the area.

title: Cool places
reviews: This is a great place to take in a meal or drink and watch the world pass by.  Take in The Lamplighter pub, so friendly (don't let the decor put you off), or some of the other great food and drink places.There is hustle and bustle but great to stroll along.

title: Historic and unique
reviews: Wonderful area of town. Cobble streets. Nice unique shops. Don't miss the steam clock on the hour or quarter hour. Many good restaurants in the area. We ate at Steamworks and has an amazing Chowder and the biggest pretzel of ever seen.

title: Worth a visit.
reviews: Lovely shops and cafes to wander around. Don't forget to visit the steam clock.Lovely part of the city that feel more like the country with lots of trees and a lovely atmosphere.

title: Historical and trendy
reviews: Before I moved to Vancouver I knew all about Gastown... My mom used to live here and my dad when they were younger,,, and they told me all about it. There still is this rustic charm to the area.. the steam clock.. the brick buildings... the cobblestone road... I like to every now and then go hang out at one of the bars or restaurants  with friends... there is outside seating at many places great people watching.. and it is a must see for any tourist. Great new shops popping up all the time.. and it will always be this special place in Vancouver that holds alot of history.

title: Very Cool! A must see!
reviews: Be sure to hit Gas town!Lots to see and doThe Sky train has various streets to get you to your exact destination

title: Nice walk!
reviews: It was a beautiful day & the walk through Gastown was interesting.  Many shops and awesome restaurants.  See the Steam Clock, grab a bite to eat, coffee & a cocktail.  Great way to spend an afternoon.

title: Don't rush to go
reviews: We went as it was on a list of things to do and if we hadn't we might have thought we had missed something. It's nothing special. An older part of town but full of souvenir shops and coach loads of tourists. We maybe missed something but wouldn't make this a priority visit.

title: Quirky, quaint and quintessentially Vancouver.
reviews: This is an enjoyable little district within easy walking distance of downtown Vancouver and only 10 minutes form Canada Place.  Quite a few different shops for you to browse through and a number of eating options for a snack or dinner.  The area has some historic interest and architecture topped off with the famous steam clock.  We had a nice time strolling through and stopping for a very nice lunch.  It's definitely a bit of a tourist zone but not overly so, not so garish IMO.  Its worth a look and better than Granville Island.

title: Cool Place to Visit!
reviews: Stopped here for a short visit prior to boarding the Royal Caribbean for a 'inside passage' cruise. A very cool part of town where there is plenty of neat historical things to see, the highlight of which is the Steam Grandfather Clock (apparently the only functioning one in the world) in the center of town.  I heard of it and thought that perhaps it would be a bit overrated, however, to actually see it and its gears in action is a technological sight to behold. Make sure to see it around the top of the hour to hear it play a tune. Overall, neat place to visit for a couple hours and do a little shopping if you have some time to kill.

title: Go to see the Steam Clock, stay for the unique shops and fun pubs.
reviews: One of the top attractions to visit in downtown is the famous Steam Clock in Gastown.  Every time we walked past it there was at least a few people there taking pictures.  I enjoyed the unique shops that featured Canadian products and First Nation art and jewelry.  We stopped in for a late lunch at a small pub during happy hour.  They had 1/2 price appetizers that were perfect for an affordable lunch.  Sitting at one of the outside tables was the perfect place for "people watching" while we waited for our food.

title: Stroll & lunch
reviews: We had been on the hop on hop off bus & decided to have lunch at Chill Winston then walk around.It is great to see so many restaurants.Unfortunately there are a lot of homeless in this area asking for money & cigarettes, just don't make eye contact .Good experience with lots of history

title: Unusual
reviews: This is just off Chinatown with its interesting open market type shops selling oriental produce and spices.   The street,has interesting street lighting and a famous large clock with steam pouting from the top of it.  Most unusual.

title: Quite touristy, as you'd expect
reviews: The architecture here is great, and there are a couple of nice bars. The history is interesting, but for the most part it's taken over by tourist shops which is a real shame. Worth a visit but be prepared for tourist tat!

title: Dinner in Gastown
reviews: Great part of town lots of great bars and restaurants, friendly lively crowd . Plenty of choices and most well priced . Worth taking a walk around spend a bit of time looking aeound

title: Want a drink in the original drinking corner of BC?
reviews: Then this is the locale for you!  Gassy Jack set up split logs on this very site to dispense high proof alcohol to weary loggers and ship's mates and made several fortunes doing so.  Yes, you can get every kind of cocktail and spirit and local beers even now, but the fun loving crowds just enjoy themselves, and you will too.  Look for a small shop selling Ammolite jewelry and other artifacts of this somewhat rare fossil.  Good restaurants but even better "pubs" where you can't go wrong if you are looking for a big variety of liquid refreshment.

title: Great shopping
reviews: Awesome to walk, eat or shop. You must stop to see the steam clock. The only in the world. I would go back anytime. 20 min walk from BC place.

title: Commercial but some redeeming features
reviews: Nice to see a small sample of old Vancouver. Several cheap souvenir shops, derelicts and pan-handlers. Hanging flower baskets are gorgeous and Steam Clock is worth seeing.

title: Surprised
reviews: Had not been to Vancouver in over 25 years so wanted to go back to Gas Town.  It is not near has clean as it was years ago.  Still nice restaurants, etc.  Was surprised at how many homeless people were in the area.

title: Historic and interesting
reviews: Enjoyed exploring Gastown and the history of it all. Just wandering around and taking it all in is a thrill.

title: Interesting neighbourhood to walk, browse & eat in.
reviews: This area of Vancouver offers unique shops, lovely little restaurants, interesting nooks & crannies, the famous Steam Clock as well as souvenir shops and Galleries.It is close to the Cruise docks and transit.I like to try the little restaurants, and there are many, great for lunch or dinner.  The Woodwards Centre offers entertainment, as well as a grocery store, drug store, coffee shop and other retailers.Great place to window shop and browse.

title: Up and coming (trendy) area, but stay away from sketchy places
reviews: We walked into Gastown through some not great areas (found an alley Deadpool was filmed in!)  but we did not feel we were in danger, it was just a bit gritty, and I'm glad we kept going. There is a trendy, more upscale area by the water with great shops, restaurants and bars.  Along with way we ate at an amazing taco place, drank craft beer in a nice pub, and watched a sword fighting class (!) in a place that sells swords.  It was a fun day of exploring another part of Vancouver.

title: Interesting area to see if you don't mind being accosted by panhandlers
reviews: Nice historic area but expect to be asked for change every few hundred yards.  The city would do well to implement and enforce a no panhandling bylaw.

title: A beautiful part of the City
reviews: Old town charm with a variety of specialty shops, pubs and eateries.  Flower baskets line the streets. There is something for everybody here.  If you come by the Hop On, Hop Off bus, there are two stops...the second at the steam clock.

title: Fun location
reviews: Charming district with great atmosphere and cool history. Lotsa of good value bars and restaurants and specialty souvenir shopping

title: Delightful Victorian buildings
reviews: The heart of the old town behind the railway station - where it all began.  The highlight is the steam clock - be sure to see that in operation.  Browse the stores -  it's so much more friendly an environment than any modern city.  If you're going to Port Townsend, you'll see similar architecture.

title: Lots to choose from
reviews: A shopping centre that is designed for those on a holiday. Lots of restaurants and gift shops. A nice vibe exists on the whole. You need to a bit careful, you can suddenly exit the town and find yourself in an area that is very much less comfortable.

title: Great atmosphere
reviews: We enjoyed all the individual shops and lively atmosphere.  Plenty of places to eat and drink and a quirkiness to the area which made it stand out in a good way.

title: Poor experience !
reviews: This was recommended by the Visitors Centre Assistant for an early morning walk as it is the oldest part of Vancouver. It was pervaded with addicts and young people who needed help. The dramatic and spectacular harbour will not disguise that this great City has a problem ! Be extremely careful if you visit this area during the day.

title: Took the tour
reviews: Gastown is the original part of the city.  Quite a bit of good history about the area.  Lots of restaurants and action at night.

title: Gas Town Steam Clock
reviews: Awesome place in general, lots to do and see around the area. History is everywhere in this town!  The steam clock is one of few in the world, it whistles every half hour and is pretty cool to see on your travels, a must see if you like these kinds of things

title: Just ok
reviews: I think this area is just ok. The buildings are interesting, but the shops seemed very touristy. Some good eating choices.

title: The steam clock is a fun diversion from a day of sightseeing.
reviews: Although parking was a challenge, a trip to the area was worthwhile.  We went on a Thursday night and crowds were manageable.

title: Cool town
reviews: The gastown area is very cool and nice. You can tell once you enter the town/street and when you leave the town/street. It is old style but it doesn't seem old. It is a very cool atmosphere and I'm sure I will go back the next time I visit.

title: Best neighborhood in Vancouver
reviews: This was our favorite neighborhood in Vancouver for walking, restaurants, and people watching. Great variety of wonderful spots for eating or pub crawling. We didn't make reservations, and were able to get in anywhere we went. Loved the old buildings and sense of history, which has been lost in so much of nearby downtown Vancouver.

title: Fun Afternoon
reviews: This area has a lot of cool shops and restaurants. We ate gyros at an outdoor cafe. They were terrific. The steam clock is neat as well. Be cautious walking too far north. Major homeless district with many beggars that actually creep you out a bit. The gaslight area is quite safe and worth visiting.

title: Quaint and old style neighborhood in Vancouver!
reviews: Narrow street and quaint old fashion neighborhood in the city.  Lot to see, filled with a variety of restaurants and retail.  Food, drink and shopping abound.  Make sure you see the oldest steam clock located on the street in Gas Town.  Great picture opportunities for the tourists.  A must neighborhood to visit while in the city!

title: Disappointing for us.
reviews: It was a little disappointing for us to go here. It was more like another tourist trap, with not a lot of interesting things to see except for stores meant for tourism. Our advise is go only if you have nothing else to do and want to kill some time.

title: Love this area
reviews: The west end is usually my favorite place in Vancouver, but on my last visit, we headed to the Gastown district and I just fell in love.  It has an old town feel with beautiful buildings.  The stores and eateries are just so on par.  Each store we went in to, they were really nice and welcoming.  The restaurants were good as well, granted when we were visiting, every single place was packed (I think there was a soccer game on).  So it was hard to enjoy the restaurant itself, but the food was amazing.  I can't wait to come back and visit!

title: Ê≤íÊúâÁÖ§Ê∞£ÁöÑÁÖ§Ê∞£ÈéÆ
reviews: ÊàëÂÄëÁöÑ‰∏ã‰∏ÄÁ´ôÔºåÊòØ„ÄäGastown„Äã„ÄÇGastownÔºåÊòéÈ°ØÂú∞‰∏çÊòØÂõ†ÁÇ∫ÈÄôÂÖíÂë®ÂúçÈÉΩÊòØÊ∞£ËÄåÂëΩÂêç„ÄÇ‰∏çÈÅéÔºåÂ•ΩÂ§ö‰∫∫ÈÉΩË¶∫ÂæóÔºåÈÄô‰∏ÄÂçÄÁöÑÂ∞èÂú∞Ê®ôÔºå„ÄäSteam Clock„ÄãÔºåÊòØ‰ª§Âà∞ÈÄô‰∏ÄÂçÄÂè´ÂÅöGastown ÁöÑÂéüÁî±„ÄÇÂÖ∂ÂØ¶ Gastown ÂèØ‰ª•Ë™™ÊòØÊòØÂè§‰ª£ÁöÑÊ∫´Âì•ËèØÂ∏Ç‰∏≠ÂøÉÔºåÂëΩÂêç Gastown ÊòØÁÇ∫‰∫ÜÁ¥ÄÂøµ‰∏Ä‰ΩçÊ∞£ËàπÁöÑËàπÈï∑ "Jack Deighton" Ëä±Âêç "Gassy Jack"„ÄÇÊú¨‰æÜÈÄô‰∏ÄÂçÄÁ®±ÁÇ∫ Gassy TownÔºåÂà∞Âæå‰æÜÊâçÁ∞°ÂåñÔºåÁ®±ÁÇ∫„ÄäGastown„ÄãÔºåÊ≤øÁî®Ëá≥‰ªä„ÄÇËÄåÊàëÂÄë‰æÜ„ÄäGastown„ÄãÁöÑÁõÆÁöÑÔºå‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØÁÇ∫ÁúãÁúã„ÄäSteam Clock„Äã„ÄÇ

title: The bohemian heart of a multicultural city
reviews: No trip complete without visiting the various shops, cafes, restaurants and bars of Gastown. There is much to like about Vancouver but Gastown is high on that list

title: Great food, Great vibe
reviews: Such a fun part of the city. We just wandered in and out of places one afternoon and loved every second. Food and drinks are awesome. Sort of has a Soho, NYC vibe.

title: Old Town
reviews: Good choice of restaurants and coffee shops, lots of souvenir shops, busy buzzing place to be. Nice place to walk around

title: In one word "Steamclock"
reviews: Fun stop to see and hear the Gastown Steamclock, which can be enjoyed every 15-minutes. Vera's Burgers had delicious black cherry soda; fun little shops. Gassy Jack statue too.

title: Great Neighborhood
reviews: This is an extremely walkable are of Vancouver with tons of restaurants and pubs.  There are plenty of little shops and unique places to stop.  My recommendation is to grab a table outside and enjoy the atmosphere.

title: Mildly interesting
reviews: Took a bus to visit general area  but not a good use of our time. Continued into Chinatown which was bad mistake as streets full of heroin addicts

title: Vibrant
reviews: Fun place to wander around, old buildings great architecture. Filled with shops and so many restaurants and Cafes to choose. You will find affordable to high end shops and dining. Indoor seating or people watch on the terrace. Don't forge to check out side streets. You will encounter a few gems

title: eat at night but walk around in the day
reviews: We ate in Gastown one evening and had a nice meal and a fun time but I wouldn't walk around the area at night I didn't feel it was that safe but it's fine to get a taxi there to eat. Lots of nice restaurants in the area which has a lively buzz. We returned during the day to walk around.

title: Nice!
reviews: Great area for walking! Also a great area to buy some Canadian goods. I especially liked the steam clock on the corner of one of the streets.

title: A Blast from the Past
reviews: Gastown was on our walking tour of Vancouver. Totally enjoyed this historic village with its cobblestone streets and historic buildings. Gastown is walking distance from Canada Place Cruise Port.

title: Steam Clock
reviews: Gas town is worth the visit if just to see and hear the the steam clock.  Has a variety of stores and souvenir shops

title: Cool Place
reviews: I really liked it. It's one of the oldest streets in Vancouver. It's an old street with numerous restaurants, pubs, shops, and lamp posts. Great for strolling and enjoying the evening. It had a European street feel to me.

title: best place to dine out in Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is such an interesting historic section of the city. We took a picture by the famous Gas Town clock. The energy level is very high and we enjoyed just walking around. Definitely recommend the neighborhood for afternoon shopping or evening dining. The Spaghetti Factory restaurant was really good value for the money and great outdoor eating area. Would definitely go back

title: Touristy but at least old buildings saved!
reviews: When I was growing up in Vancouver, Gastown was unknown, a place you didn't go. Then in the late 70s it was revitalised with new street lighting, shops, Gassie Jack, and steam clock. From derelict to high end tourist strip. Fair enough! While the shops are classic tourist traps, it's great to see that the old brick buildings from another time still remain, whereas so much of 'old' Vancouver has disappeared (especially in W. End). Gastown is a fun stroll, lots to see, and enjoy the waterfront buildings/architecture of the past. Gastown today is not the district it once was (i.e., extension of derelict no-go zone spilling over from Chinatown) but it's a safe stroll through beautiful old buildings and tons of tourist traps.

title: Ordinary city area
reviews: The only reason we went to Gastown was to see the STEAM clock. This clock is apparently the only one in the world "operated" by steam. So it is ONE of a kind and worth the walk to see it blow out steam every 30 minutes!!! On the way to this clock and back we did pop into a few shops, but they were nothing special that you do not get in any other city street.We also made the effort to walk a bit further (5 min) to see the statute of "Gassy Jack".

title: Great strolling
reviews: The shops and restaurants here are delightful. Well worth the visit. There are locally sourced items and unique discoveries.

title: Must Do
reviews: There is a lot to see and do in Gastown. Don't miss the steam powered clock, especially on the hour or half hour.

title: Not that great
reviews: Restaurants and food choices are good, but streets and company are seedy.  Would not go out of my way to see this.

title: Nice area.
reviews: Not large, but a lovely cobbled area with plenty of restaurants, cafes etc.. as well as some souvenir shops, and of course the famous Steam Clock which goes off every 15 minutes. Trees lit up at night look very pretty, creates a nice atmosphere.  Quite busy but not rowdy.  Pleasant area to eat in.

title: INTERESTING
reviews: Nice place from a stroll. Lots of history and lots of shops and restaurants. Great place to get a cup of coffee and watch the world go by. There are some unique shops here that you can browse so don't get in a big hurry. Enjoy!

title: Brilliant place to visit
reviews: The famous clock in Gastown is a must see.  The shops of which many are touristy, there are others which have something to offer culturally.  Lots to enjoy if you want a drink, a meal, entertainment in the evening and to soak up the atmosphere anytime.

title: Shops and Restaurants
reviews: Aside from the Steam clock there aren't a lot of attractions here.  Lots of shops and restaurants to do you shopping and to have lunch or dinner.

title: Nice
reviews: It was fun to walk around and we also ate lunch there.  There are a lot of shops and places to get souvenirs.  Plenty of choices of places to eat.

title: Easy and nice sights of Gastown
reviews: We did a lot of walking and picture taking. A great place to grab a beverage and people watch. It was an easy walk from where we were staying.

title: Touristic district.
reviews: Huge density of souvenir shops, restaurants and a few landmarks. Friendly environment. Just be aware of Chine Town two blocks up with its opposite attitude.

title: Pleasant
reviews: A bit touristy but pleasant area to have a browse around and good range of eating/drinking places. The steam clock is a an interesting tourist magnet. Just be careful if trying to walk to Chinatown from here. We ended up in a very dodgy looking area just 1 block east.

title: Day in Downtown Gastown
reviews: Lots of souvenier shops.  Whilst they all seem to have the same tourist type of souveniers, it is worth spending the time visiting each one.The Gas Clock was great to see.Lots of coffee shops, cafes, and pubs to visit if you need a break.Very clean and safe, worth spending a day browsing and taking it all in.

title: A nice area but nothing really special
reviews: It has a lot of boutiques and restaurants. Kinda hipster. But nothing really stuck with me beside the steam clock tower. Maybe we would try it at night time next time visiting

title: Visit Gastown for great shopping experience
reviews: Gastown is great place for shopping and eating.  Had an excellent meal at a French restaurant and shopped till we dropped!

title: Great time
reviews: Gastown is an extremely fun place to visit. Great shopping, tons of eating  options and sites to see.

title: Visit the steam clock
reviews: It is pretty kitsch, a few good eating places. It is very touristy, but do visit the steam clock, just follow the crowds. It plays Westminster on the hour.

title: Good atmosphere, lots of touristy shops
reviews: Good to wander through. Nice bars and restaurants. Take a look at the clock! There are lots of shops although many seem touristy.

title: Gastown is a very fun place.
reviews: Gastown is a must if you visit Vancouver.  There are many very nice pubs with outdoor seating to have a pint and enjoy each other plus people watch.  There are many interesting shops and cool native stuff to check out or buy.  We went there 3 of the 5 nights we spent in Vancouver.  Just a really great relaxing place to enjoy a meal and or pint.

title: People Watcher's Delight
reviews: If you have some free time while in Vancouver, an afternoon or evening in Gastown is a must.  Plenty of shops---some upscale, some not----plenty of restaurants of all types----and plenty of people----nearly all tourists.  It can be crowded, but not overly so.  Just a great place to hang out and take photos.

title: Walked from Hotel at Canada Place.
reviews: Walked from Fairmont Waterfront for visit.  Only 3 blocks and then visited the area, which we found enjoyable.

title: Something for everyone
reviews: Love wandering through Gastown both during the day and evening.Lots of shops to pop into and loads to look at.Busy, vibrant & entertaining.

title: So so
reviews: If you just want to see the sites there, there isn't that much. If you are into expensive shopping or hitting the bars, you will enjoy.

title: Neat area with good things
reviews: This area is a nice filler area good for unwinding after doing everything else. There are plenty of places to eat with good variety. Also, plenty of libations to enjoy.

title: A busy little hub in Vancouver
reviews: My daughter and I enjoyed an afternoon in Gastown.  It is a popular place to shop and enjoy a meal.  It is frequented by many people. We enjoyed seeing the old gas clock.

title: Great for souveniera
reviews: We really enjoyed Gastown because of the historic charm & lovely appearance. If you want souvenirs from your visit, I would suggest taking the time to visit it.

title: The best part of Vancouver in our opinion.
reviews: Gastown is the one part of Downtown Vancouver that hasn't seen it's older buildings pulled down to be replaced by monstrous glass faced sky scraping monoliths. Gastown has character and retains a sense of pride in the city's past. There is a good choice of restaurants and pubs here as well.

title: Avoid
reviews: I hate Gastown.  Yes it is a beautiful area, with lots of cool buildings and some unique shops, but...You do not feel safe here.  I always walk around keeping my bag close to me and trying to avoid the people doing and selling drugs every where.  You also have to be very careful that you don't go too far East because you get into the really bad drug area and prostitute hang out which is literally across the street from the end of GasTown.Go take a picture of the steam clock, but don't hang around.

title: Good for tourists
reviews: Once you've done it not much reason to go back other than the resteraunts, great place for souvenirs and shops, good pub scene, close to transit

title: You Must Visit Gastown!
reviews: The oldest part of Vancouver, the easiest way to see it is simply to walk along Water Street. Gastown has nothing to do with gas; rather its name is taken from Gassy Jack, who opened the first pub! It's full of souvenir shops and restaurants, but key attractions are the the steam clock and Gassy Jack's statue. The Steamworks restaurant and pub is worth a visit. If you don't stop to shop, 30 to 45 minutes is needed here.

title: quaint place
reviews: love the steam clock ..great place for souvenirs . located down harbour end of town.  extremely busy with traffic

title: Gastown
reviews: Checked out the area and enjoyed it as much as always.   The choices of Restaurants and Pubs is always as good as ever. There's always a lot of people from the City mixed in with Tourists new to the area. Shopping is a bit higher-end but a variety of shops available.   Great for locals to check out on 'Stay cations' too!

title: Gorgeous Area of Vancouver!
reviews: I would really recommend visiting the Gas Town district of Vancouver. It is the old part of town with cobbled streets and cute bars and restaurants with nice shops too. It has a really nice chilled vibe to it.

title: Great area for shopping and food
reviews: We ate at two different restaurants and enjoyed walking around the oldest part of Vancouver.  A neat area for bars and nightlife.

title: quirky!!
reviews: stopped off here via the hop on-hop off buss. lots to see, the steam clock is a very interesting piece of machinery! lots of quirky little shops and bars, places to eat. yes. nice!!

title: Some bits are good but others disgusting
reviews: There are some attractive and lively parts to this area and it is worth a quick spin around it although I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to get there. Now the other bit - if you wander 50 yards from the epicentre then you will encounter some of the most vile,  filthy and objectionable beggars and druggies you will ever see. What is worse is that they gather in droves and take over whole junctions and corners.  This is a scar on this city and it needs action.

title: Great wander around town.
reviews: Have a relaxing drink outside in the sun and people watch. Easy walk from other attractions in downtown Vancouver and some window shopping and it wasn't too crowded even though it was a sunny Sunday.

title: just an ok place
reviews: Like the steam clock where it is situated, this was just ok for us. Nothing too fancy nor fantastic about the area.

title: Great spot for brunch
reviews: Very hipster area, mixture of shopping, eating & coffee.  It was a rainy day, so it was somethings to do when the weather is bad.

title: Extremely run down since my last visit !
reviews: I wanted to take friends to Gas Town because I was very impressed with the area when I last visited a few years ago. The area nearest to Canada Place is still good, with excellent shops and restaurants ....... But....... As we ventured further into the area I was dismayed at how rundown and unkempt it had become.....my friends were not happy when they encountered extremely aggressive homeless people lying in doorways in various states of undress and sobriety and asked to leave. I was most disappointed and saddened at what has become of this once charming area !!

title: Old commercial center now bars and shops
reviews: As renovated entertainment districts go, Gastown is not that old ( 1890's buildings) and only interesting when there are a lot of people in the streets. We were there early on a Sunday morning, with little to see. It is only a few blocks deep, then you are in the less charming Chinatown and what seemed like sort of sketchy areas.

title: Well-known tourist area..fun to include in a trip to Vancouver
reviews: We included a walk through Gastown and evening meal as part of our visit.  Because it is one of the places people ask if you visited, it's worth a visit (and a picture with the famous clock).  We were also fortunate it was rainy when we were there.  Crowds were light that afternoon/evening so browsing the street shops was much less crowded than normal.

title: A landmark area
reviews: I guess this is a must-visit for tourists to Vancouver, with old streets and the famous gas clock. Many shops but mainly for oure souvenirs. Near downtown waterfront for a stroll.

title: Eclectic Neighborhood
reviews: Lots to see experience and try.  Great walking the streets with shops services coffee and plenty of restaurants. We did see the gaslight but it was not making its whistle while we watched, pretty amazing piece of machinery.  Hop on off bus takes you through a good portion of the hood. Plenty of less fortunate souls during the day.

title: Interesting part of Vancouver
reviews: Walked the street and went in and out of the shops......Steam clock is here- easy to navigate from Canada Place. Interesting cafes.

title: Gas Town Clock
reviews: We were quite interested by the gas clock and what a beautifull sound when it "chimed" .  Enbelievable clockwork.

title: Wander
reviews: have a wander around gastown... see the amazing clock and strange diverse shops..  we only did a quick visit but there are loads of things to do and see if you have a few hours....

title: Historic Area
reviews: This is a nice place to walk around and visit unique stores and galleries.  Really enjoyed the historic feel of the place.

title: Lively atmosphere!
reviews: This area of Vancouver is full of bars and nice restaurants. The vapour clock is also an attraction. Nice area to visit in Vancouver.

title: Great Part of Vancouver
reviews: Like most cities, they have the "districts" and Gastown is one of Vancouvers.  It is like a village within a city.  Great restaurants, coffee shops and some high end interior/home stores.  Also the famous "Steam Clock". Well worth a visit to while away a couple of hours.

title: Gas town street
reviews: Must must visit and happening place ! Gas town street is having a lot of shops of curious, designer dresses, Canadian jewellery, arti facts, restaurants from India, China, US, Mexico and Canada. It is an ideal place to stroll all the every times. Gas town is unique place with a large old clock popularly known as Gas Clock which erupts steam every hour. Must see place in Vancouver downtown

title: Pretty Average: Don't sweat it if you don't make it...
reviews: I was really looking forward to visiting this area.  I was disappointed in that there was nothing really 'spectacular'.  I thought there would be a lot of restaurants that would be busy, offering food and drink specials, but there was really none of that.Perhaps it was the time of day, but it ended up being just another walk in the inner city.  Lots of begging, not too much excitement.  We went during the afternoon on a week day, maybe that is why it was not exciting.Although it was close to Canada Place which we ended up visiting and watching a couple cruise ships leave.If you have some spare time, go ahead and visit.  Don't cancel anything on your itinerary to visit this place like I did.  I think I would much rather visited the Vancouver Lookout instead.

title: Walking Gastown
reviews: I have not walked through Gastown in many years and thought it might be fun.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  The sidewalks are wide and clean with lots of interesting door fronts to look at.  If you start at Waterfront station and stay on the left you get quite a sense of old Vancouver.  Loved the cobbled streets and old style lamp posts.  Loved the many tourist shops selling "stuff".  Very proud to say that some of the finest Vancouver dining establishments are tucked into the streets of Gastown.  My daughter and I spent some time perusing the many shops and then stopped for a light lunch at The Flying Pig.  Thoroughly enjoyed soup and salad and the great service.  Have to point out a great shopping spot, The Latest Scoop.  It is a "pop-up" store which means its only there for a short time. I loved the style of clothing available, not too  expensive and really nice service from the ladies there.  Generally, great day spent in Gastown.

title: Beautifully re-done area
reviews: This area is a great place to visit whilst in Vancouver. Lots of little quirky shops to see, as well as the famous clock. Feels safe and plenty to see and do.

title: Historic place in Vancouver
reviews: This is a nice place to see some history and how Vancouver was born. Visit the Steam Clock and drink a nice beer from one of the Gastown's area bars. I'd recommend to KEEP AWAY from East Hastings area (drugs and homeless people everywhere).

title: Interesting with a lot of history.
reviews: Do not miss the gas clock.  See at the street lamps, use to be gas powered but the style is the same than hundred years ago.  A lot of restaurants and souvenir stores.

title: Very Interesting Area
reviews: We took a walking tour with the tour Guys.  It was great and we loved the area and the history.  If we had walked there on our own, I am sure we would not found it quite as interesting.

title: Funky area with good bars/restaurants
reviews: We spent the evening in Gastown and enjoyed the unique shops, bars and great dinner at a small restaurant.

title: You have to visit Gastown
reviews: Because it's the historical centre of Vancouver, but the level of street begging has reached third world proportions. Don't sit outside your chosen refreshment stop even if it's a glorious sunny day unless you want your meal interrupted on a regular basis.  And, as the guide books recommend, don't take the direct route between chinatown and gastown.

title: Great
reviews: Great town cool things to see and do . Must go see !!! One must is the steamed powered clock , an important part of the area My family loved it !!

title: Charming!
reviews: This neighbourhood has old world charm with its gaslights and a clock that blows off steam while tooting a tune every few minutes.  Definitely worth a walk around especially if you are looking for souvenirs.

title: Nice for 1\2 hour
reviews: Charming cobbled streets, the steam powered clock interesting. On fringe of sketchy area. I wouldn't visit in the evening due to surrounding area.

title: Great window shopping
reviews: I loved walking around gastown, there are great places to shop at, grab coffee and eat. Just go and enjoy the stroll.

title: great for an afternoon stroll
reviews: Funky, chic neighborhood with cobbled streets, inteesting (non chain) stores, artisan products, good cafes and restaurants. Greenwich Villagey, bohemian feel.

title: Charming
reviews: The old part of the city with many bars, restaurants and shops. Cobbled effect streets add to the charm.  Many historic buildings with individual character attract attention. Busting with tourists creating a nice holiday vibe.

title: Love this
reviews: Great atmosphere with cobbled streets, great pubs and restaurants, really unusual shopping if you want a special something. Free Walking tour information at the library.

title: Shopping
reviews: We found this to be the best place to shop for souvenirs.  What we found here was of better quality and much lower prices.  We also loved watch the steam clock blow!

title: Worth a look
reviews: Gas town is small street along Water Street, a short walk from Canada Place Train Station. Mostly souvenir stores and various restaurants and pubs. Stick to water street as two blocks down on East Hastings you have some very bad areas of homeless people and drug addicts and generally not safe especially at night.  We went here for a look. Everyone said to go there. We walked around the streets a bit and stopped for dinner at The Spaghetti Factory. I wouldn't stay here after sunset, some streets did not seem safe. The steam clock was cool to see but we only spent a minute or so there.

title: Historic Vancouver
reviews: The various tourist shops, steam clock, along with the original road bricks, make this legendary area of Vancouver a sure stop.

title: Another stop on the hop on hop off bus tour.
reviews: A quaint area of Vancouver,basically just shops,but a nice walk from here to Canada Place, where the cruise ships depart is quite nice.

title: Gastown is fun
reviews: Gastown is great for food different beers and clothes. It is fune just to walk around and look at the different shops

title: Must visit place while in B.C.
reviews: Cool little ares of Vancouver,  B.C. that is abundantly charming. Full of shops, restaurants, history and a steam clock that toots every 15min. The towns cobblestone combined with the story of Gasy Jack will take you back to the turn of the century,  20th that is!!! Hop off of the tour bus here and enjoy dinner and shops. Maybe run into a celebrity or two. It's a short walk back to Georgia st, Howe or Robson from Gastown.

title: Interesting
reviews: Gastown is interesting, a lot of cool shops and busy streets. The steam clock was cool. Aside from that I wouldn't go there again unless it was to enjoy the night life. You have to be careful not to go to far east or you will see the poverty in the city.

title: Charming area- must visit
reviews: Beautiful area during the day and evening.Have lots of interesting shops, restaurant and cafes .But at night have to make sure you know which area to visit cause if you cross one more block its quite scary / not save Better ask people / ur hotel staff about thisIn my case i almost stopped at wrong bus station and some people in the bus told me which area better to visit.

title: Crazy mix of cool and seedy
reviews: Gastown is packed with some of the city's best restaurants and definitely its best bars.  It's probably the best area of the city to go out to eat, walk around, find a good bar, and then find another good bar.  If you're a shopper, it's also full of a great range of small shops selling high quality stuff.  If you are a visitor, you may be surprised to see a seedier side of Vancouver as well.  Gastown borders the areas of the East End that have the highest concentration of urban poverty in Canada.  It's not scary, but it is disturbing at times to see this level of poverty in such a wealthy city.  The increasing popularity (and property values) of the area means harder times finding housing for some residents.

title: Too many souvenir stands and very dirty
reviews: Numerous friends had told us we should check out Gastown while on our trip to Vancouver.  While architecturally it is pretty (a bit Parisian), we could not get over how filthy the streets were.  A mixture of bird poo, urine (one owner let his dog squat and urinate right in the middle of the sidewalk, without pause or an attempt to wash it down), grime and dirt.  To add to the disappointment, we were led to believe that there was great shopping in the area.  There seemed to us to be two types of shops.  Furniture galleries (that had some very nice modern pieces), and souvenir shops filled with maple syrup, Mounted police T-Shirts and every other piece of inexpensive made to look Canadian, but made in China piece of tourist crap you might want.Being near the cruise ship terminal it clearly caters to those in town for a short time looking to pick up some trinkets.  We heard that the restaurants in the area were good, but we were not there at a meal time.At the very least, the City of Vancouver should take some pride and clean the area up.  It could be really beautiful - even with the souvenir shops if it were kept clean.I do have to add, the steam powered clock is cool.

title: A cool place to walk around
reviews: Older steampunk part of town - and meant to be that way!  :)  Really fun to just walk around and see the buildings and stores.  Don't miss the clock!

title: Nice old buildings walk it all
reviews: It's a very nice town walk all the way stop in between for the side walk coffee areas sit & have a relaxing time enjoy the beautiful old buildings

title: If you Visit Van and you don't go to Gastown, you're an idiot
reviews: So much to see, so much to eat, so much to buy. Go to Gastown and just walk around. Bought some street art and ate some food. So cool.

title: Well worth a visit
reviews: Gas town is the quaintest part of Vancouver and well worth a visit for the range of eateries and perhaps most importantly that steam clock in the middle of the street. Get there on the hour for the whistle performance of the clock.quaint shops, plenty of touristy items, cobbled streets and you really feel you are back in colonial time.

title: A Nice Walk Of An Evening
reviews: We enjoyed walking through Gastown though it was very busy because of the wonderful weather that day.

title: a Must see
reviews: This is a lovely part of the city. We got a hop on hop off bus and got off here, we had lunch here too which was lovely.

title: No big deal
reviews: Sure wish the city would provide some kind of explanatory plaques on the historic buildings here. A self-guided walking tour would be preferable to the tacky souvenir shops and unappealing food options. Take photos of the steam clock and Gassy Jack and you're done. Check.

title: Okay...
reviews: I strolled from downtown to Gaston and found a small string of boutiques, a cool Steampunk Clock, and a few restaurants.  It felt as if half the area was closed - IDK if there is renovation occurring or so many stores are shuttered.  But, I saw the clock! And that was cool.

title: "A very interesting and historic street."
reviews: During our recent visit in Vancouver, I decided that exploring the city in the early morning hours  ( 4:00 am to 5:30 am ) was an adventure. There are practically no pedestrians on the streets, just taxis and the disadvantaged and homeless souls.  Strolling down the main street of Gastown was unique, since I could view inside each shop, restaurant and store.  The Steam Clock is a must-see-stop along the way.  The tiny steam engine and weights make for an interesting mechanical wonder.  Totem poles, carved figurines and other souvenirs are treasures in one shop . . . that I returned later, during the daylight hours.  Take an early morning walk to the spiral bridge and look back to the skyline of Vancouver.  The photo I took of that scene has to be one of my favorites.  You cannot appreciate the city unless you venture out in the morning, when very few others are up.  It is an experience for the real adventurer.

title: Another beautiful site!
reviews: This is also a great comparison to the French Quarter in N.O.  Very unique sidewalk cafes with rot iron railing.

title: Eclectic area of Vancouver
reviews: Very interesting area of the city.  Restaurants of all types and unique shops.  The people watching was very good as there are literally all types.  We were there in the afternoon, but I imagine the place is hopping at night.

title: Hub of Activity
reviews: Lots if restaurants and shops. Great place to stroll around and see the heritage about Gas Town. Prices at the restaurants are fair. You should check the menus as each place has it's own fare.

title: Gritty and Glorious
reviews: The area of Vancouver is recognized as its oldest neighbourhood. This means means you will in some parts of see trendy shops, but you also get a great historical perspective of the city as well, the final character trait of this neighbourhood is the gritty and authentic parts of it, that also exposes you to some of Vancouver's less fortunate. It offers you a balanced view.

title: Authentic and from the past...
reviews: I absolutely love gastown! From the brick roads it has to architectural structure it has, everything is a time piece and just plain beautiful. Lots of good place to have drinks and eat food! Check out the steam clock as an attraction and be sure to stop by for something to eat or drink as mentioned!!!

title: Ye Olde Gastown. Always Look Up.
reviews: Having grown up in Vancouver, Gastown has always been an exciting place to visit. Now as a tourist I always make time to enjoy and rejoice in this historic area. The architecture offers many insights and photographic encounters. Old timey good times. Of course there is a mix of old and new businesses offering numerous dining and shopping experiences. I appreciate how the younger generation is now making a go of these old storefronts and reinventing the wheel. If you like window shopping, historical architecture, numerous dining offerings, arts, culture and galleries...this is a great place to visit while in Vancouver. Buses are easy to catch and will provide transportation to other great areas to visit including Stanley Park, the Aquarium, China Town, Robson St and such. Remember to look up while strolling. The buildings are fantastic!

title: souvenir paradise
reviews: If you are looking for souvenirs, T-shirts and sweatshirts and other Canadian memorabilia, this is a good place for that. Otherwise, there are a few restaurant/pub places. I wasn't impressed, except for the steam clock. That is worth seeing.

title: A must in Vancouver city
reviews: My second time in Vancouver and I needed to see gastown again. My first time wasn't very nice because of the rain but this time I was very fortunate to have a nice warm sunny weather during my visit. Its a very beautiful street with all the good souvenir shops. I went through most of them which I strongly suggest because they sell the same items all different prices. So just scout for the cheapest first before buying on the 1st store. Lots of very cute and interesting souvenirs. This would be the best place to get them. There are also good caf√©s and starbucks that you can sit and enjoy on that beautiful street. And dont forget to take pictures with the famous clock! :)

title: The Heart of Vancouver
reviews: We traveled all over the City by bus/trolley.  Very convenient and saw all that we wanted to see.  We stopped at Granville Island an walked the shops and ate.  Vancouver itself is a very vibrant city.

title: Great Neighborhood
reviews: Walkable, has great shops, lots of great bars and restaurants! Close to the water and other areas so you can get around pretty easily.

title: Hub of activity
reviews: Restaurants, shops, outdoor bars. Cobble stone streets and old time decor. Live entertainment daily at a few of the bars/restaurants.  Lots of history.

title: A nice collection of shops and restaurants
reviews: We enjoyed dinner at the Steamworks grill right near the steam clock in the center of Gaston.  Great atmosphere, but be prepared for happy and loud folks in the adjoining tables.  This is a favorite spot for locals to come and enjoy a happy hour.

title: We enjoyed Gastown
reviews: We enjoyed Gastown, but it wasn't our very favorite part of Vancouver, so I only gave it 4 stars.  There seemed to be a lot more homeless people living in this area than in other areas of Vancouver.

title: Historical centre with lots of nice bars and restaurants
reviews: Gastown looks very different from the rest of Vancouver and it is an interesting place to walk around. There are lots of bars and restaurants there so is great in the evening.

title: Sightseeing
reviews: This is a very small area and beautiful little town. Lots of restaurants and shopping. One of the place you must visit when you're in Vancouver.

title: Brilliant area for visiting
reviews: Beautiful, historical region of Vancouver with interesting architecture. Lots of shops, bars and restaurants. Easily walkable

title: Quaint
reviews: Lots of shopping..mainly souvenirs...worth a visit.  Famous gas clock interesting.  Easily accessible from hop on bus.

title: Take a walking tour of old Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a historic district of Vancouver with a mix of interesting shops, boutiques, tourist spots and restaurants. The surrounding area continues to be gentrified due to the local real estate boom, and becoming less gritty.  Parking can be scarce and at a premium, so would recommend public transit and enjoy a walking tour of the area.

title: OK to pass the time
reviews: Was fine but nothing to rave about. The steam clock was fun. Don't stray too far down the back streets though as the mood changes

title: Good place to walk around
reviews: There are many souvenir shops with some sales. There you can find the steam clock with is a popular thing to watch but lame

title: Gastown/Chinatown
reviews: Great walking around shopping sights and many eateries everywhere.Only great for daytime walking around/shopping.

title: Gassy Jack
reviews: We liked the story about Gasdy Jack and Gadtown... A little bit back in history about town. We made a few pictures of the old buildings... There are few brewery pubs and shops with the souvenirs...

title: For the Yuppies
reviews: A great place for young people to gather. A great atmosphere at all the cafes and shops. Quirky little alleys and shop fronts are decked out with inviting signs or lures.

title: A must visit in downtown Vancouver
reviews: A great place to visit. Lots of unique bistros and restaurants, shops and bars. A very special flair in this part of Vancouver.

title: Nice walk with shops
reviews: Lots of shops, restaurants, and coffee shops. We enjoyed wondering around. Stores/shops pretty typical tourist fare. There were some specialty shops, but most were very overpriced.

title: Go to Gastown!
reviews: Such a cool little area, lots of shops and restaurants to explore. You can get your obligatory 'tourist' photo at the steam clock, which is a bit of fun.

title: Great place to stroll on a sunny afternoon
reviews: Gaston proved to be a wonderful area to visit, with active and interesting shops, great restaurants, and colorful walking streets.This was an area that we had not visited on a prior trip and it turned out to be most interesting on a Sunday. We started out with a wonderful breakfast in an outdoor restaurant , beside a brick walkway in an inclosed wrought fence. People watching was at it's best with families celebrating Mothers day. We spent the entire day in this beautiful area of Vancouver.

title: Shopping, History and Quirkiness
reviews: We had a lovely stroll in Gastown. Found out that "gassy" as in Gassy Jack, means "talkative". We watched the steam clock blow in the quarter hour and marveled at the inner workings. There are lots of shops and restaurants, worth a couple hours in nice weather. Great people watching!

title: Great places to eat...
reviews: Great place to while away a day/afternoon, we spent a day here waiting for the Canucks game in the evening.

title: Found the tourists and the clock!
reviews: We enjoyed spending a morning in the Gastown area of Vancouver right before we left.  Got to see the clock and also explore some of the galleries.  There seemed to be much more to explore.

title: nice take
reviews: Gas town is an old section of Vancouver where all the glass of the high rise buildings disappear.........

title: Cool area!
reviews: Neat area with tons of great restaurants and interesting history. Not a huge area but an interesting on non the less.

title: Fun place to walk or hangout
reviews: We have been here several times and always enjoy the shops and bars. They also have some great restaurant's in the area. Parking can be tough at times.

title: Neat area.
reviews: Lots of shops, restaurants and clubs. A fun area. Make sure you visit the steam clock, that was well worth seeing.

title: We love visitng 'old town' areas of cities
reviews: This area does not disappoint.  Many shops and restaurants are found here.  Don't miss the old steam powered clock.  Great adventure for us!

title: Ok and guess you should do it
reviews: A true tourist area down by where the Cruise ships leave from. A wander thru the streets reveals little shops and bars and eateries. Most know feature is the steam clock.

title: Lots of great restaurants and shops
reviews: An "In Spot" in Vancouver full of nice restaurants and shops.  A great place to walk around and check out the different shops, have something to eat and drink at one of the many restaurants and then take a walk along the Waterfront.

title: Walking tour through Gastown - a tour organized by Taste Vancouver Food Tours
reviews: Gastown always has plenty to draw a visitor's attention - boutiques, souvenir shops, confectionery, and a huge variety of restaurants and eateries.  It's unique cobbled streets, lamp-posts and of course its iconic Steam Clock make it a must for anyone visiting Vancouver.  Add to that the view across the water to the North shore with its mountains silhouetted against the sky is breathtaking. A photographer's delight.

title: Fun and interesting
reviews: We strolled around Gastown for several hours not looking for anything in particular.   When we stopped to check our map, friendly Canadians would ask "May I help you find something"?   That doesn't often happen in the USA.   The Steam Clock is so interesting in its' history and function.  It draws fairly large crowds waiting for it to 'chime'.   Fortunately, you can hear it for several blocks.  Neat shops and restaurants line up both sides of Water Street.

title: Lively place for people watching, history and window-shopping
reviews: A nice area to wander around and soak up the history of Vancouver and the lively atmosphere.  There are some nicely preserved old buildings that speak of the city's industrial heritage, and of course the famous steam-powered clock.  The area is packed with trendy and generally more upmarket shops and eating places, although there are some cheap souvenir shops there too. Great for people watching and window shopping.

title: Great Place to go for a Look
reviews: Great place to check out the history of the street with the steam clock and other monuments along the way. Heaps of souvenir shops, bars and restaurants too. Very busy, but good to have a wander around.

title: great area downtown - must visit
reviews: Easy walk from downtown or by bus. Some really great restaurants for every taste. Lots of unique shops for browsing & shopping. Must see is the steam clock.

title: Very good! Enjoy gastown
reviews: Gastown is very good, beautiful stores and nice scenery, but its very expensive, have many restaurants and good stores!

title: Definitely worth a visit.
reviews: Gastown is a busy place with lots of tourists. There are some reasonably priced restaurants and the steam clock is interesting. There are a lot of souvenir shops with cheap prices. From there you can walk over to Chinatown.

title: Hive of activity
reviews: The place pumps with lots of bars and eateries. Lots of tourists checking out the souvenir shops. Great area for after work or rhe weekends

title: Quaint part of town
reviews: We enjoyed visiting Gastown while in Vancouver.  I had read a couple of reviews and some said if you do not have the time to skip Gastown...I do not agree....the oldest part of Vancouver and just lovely.  The steam clock was unique.  It is a short walk from the water front with many shops, restaurants and old buildings.  If you do not plan to have dinner there it doesn't take much time at all.  If you love the European feel, then don't miss it.

title: Historic Gastown is a must see for visitors to Vancouver!
reviews: Vancouver has many exciting things to see now, but for anyone who wants to know how and where the city grew from, Gastown is a must see.

title: Gastown - Fun neighborhood for eating & drinking
reviews: No shortage of restaurants and bars to explore here.  Charming cobblestone streets and plenty to do.  A wide variety of cuisine and craft beer.

title: great place for people watching
reviews: great place to walk up and down the street and people watch.  there are also many places to stop for food and drinks

title: Great mix of souvenir shops/bars and restaurants.
reviews: Great way to spend a couple of hours people watching and shopping....a good mixture of cheap and dear shops and mid range to high end food eateries.  Lots of tourists and locals all doing the same...

title: A fun place
reviews: We came here for lunch and liked the area so much we came back for dinner. The area has a lot of character and liveliness. Good vibes.

title: check out the bulbous street lamp posts everywhere
reviews: The steam clock is a must see.  Steam shoots out every 15 minutes.The entire neighborhood is very charming with cobblestone streets.

title: great scenery
reviews: many great shops and eateries here in Gastown and just a classic place to go as a couple or as a family.

title: Enjoyed the steam clock.
reviews: Wonderful area for shopping and people watching.  The unique area of pubs, shopping boutiques and photo opps

title: Over rated and crowded
reviews: Too many people; if you like crowds, you'll like Gastown; there are good restaurants there, however, so if this is your thing, look here.

title: Great area
reviews: Great place to wander around and see all the shops and restaurants. Plenty of coffee shops too. Come the middle of the day the area got buzzing with lots of locals, always a good sign. It's right next to China town so it's easy to combine a visit to both areas.

title: Eclectic Afternoon
reviews: Gastown is an eclectic mix of history,restaurants, bars and shopping. It is fitting that bars figure prominently given Gassy Jack's sordid historical past. Restaurants abound ranging from cheap eats to high end dining. Similarly, shopping ranges from the tourist traps to the high end Fluvog Shoe store. All in all you will enjoy an afternoon of wandering around Gastown. If you lose all track of time, don't worry as the Steam clock will give you the correct time with a flare!

title: Just Okay
reviews: We went to Gastown for a late lunch and maybe that was the problem.  Not a lot of the restaurants were open.  There were quite a few shops. There were also quite a few vagrants that made it a little scary for me.  A friend told us not to go further than the clock and we stayed well within the area.  We did see a couple (2) police cars parked at different points so I guess that was good.  I'm not sure if it's better to go dinner time. It might be best to consult the concierge at your hotel.

title: Go during the day
reviews: We went early evening and there were a lot of homeless people about.  Plenty of good restaurants there to eat.

title: history and cool
reviews: Great shopping and eateries - most fabulous shoe store too.  Nice historical area that is now being treated with respect and care - lots of souvenirs and Native Art galleries

title: This is where Vancouver originated
reviews: On the harbour and five minutes from downtown shopping.   This area caters to cruise ship passengers and is touristy.....but worth visiting.    There are lots of restaurants and some up-scale shops.

title: Old city neighborhood
reviews: Walking down Water street, you will find the steam clock (featuring Big Ben's song every 15 min) and further down Gassy Jack's statue. We then walked to Chinatown via Carrall St, heading to Dr Yat-Sen Chinese Garden. In between, we unfortunately had to witness Vancouver's junkie crowd, which was heartbreaking (not really scary as most people looked weak and intoxicated).

title: Interesting, but several drawbacks
reviews: The city has tried to do a lot with this area, but has only partly succeeded.   Some of the heritage restoration has been done very well indeed, and they obviously had good material to work with.   Signposting and information boards are clear and there is a good walking guide and map available - we picked our up from the bottom of the Vancouver Lookout.There are also some interesting restaurants and pubs and some pleasant-looking shops.That's where the problems start, though,  We found one shop selling identical merchandise at a significantly higher price than the shop three doors down.  Having bought from the first, we arranged a refund after some haggling.The other major problem, common across much of the city, is the number of unfortunate individuals begging and panhandling, some quite aggressively.  Not as many as in Chinatown (which is virtually a no-go area for tourists) but enough to cause unease and discomfort.I certainly would not want to be here after dark

title: this is alvoely eating area with many outdoor restaurant,many boutiques
reviews: this is mainly a young persons eating arena with a few higher quality quieter locations. the shopping is excellent with dozens of small boutiques for clothing. minimal art except one exceptional northwest coast art gallery.

title: Great place to walk, shop and dine...
reviews: After enjoying a lovely stay in Vancouver we decided to spend a few hours in Gastown. Glad we did. There are loads of galleries, unique boutiques and touristy shops. Lots of great places to dine and an abundance of coffe shops. Lots of history too!

title: A quaint walking town
reviews: A nice walking town, lots of shopping,  numerous restaurants and local attraction sites i.e steam clock, Gassy Jack statue.  The cobble stone street, gas lamp style street lighting and various surounding building architectures' has a european feel.  Family friendly activity.

title: Beautiful
reviews: For an Aussie that knows Sydney, this is Vancouver's 'The Rocks' with different souvenirs.  But a good place to wander and take in the sights. Be there at 9pm to see the steam clock go off.

title: Nice walking
reviews: We have been there now several times and it is always beautiful. There is always something new to see and  in each season it also looks a little bit different. But definetly it's a Street you have to walk and see

title: A must see while in Vancouver!
reviews: This street filled with Vancouver history is a must see for all tourists especiallyl those getting off the cruise ships.  Its just a hop, skip and a jump from the cruise terminal.  Walk down the street and enjoy the great shops, quaint restaurants, street musicians, and the steam clock.  Great atmosphere!

title: Loaded with Tourist Shops
reviews: Although there are a few interesting shops in the neighborhood, most seemed to be full of tacky souvenirs.  The interesting shops were worth the hunt and the neighborhood has some interesting architectural features.

title: Lots of shops but area is full of weirdos and bad smells
reviews: Found a lot of tourist shops surrounding one main tourist shop. Saw the clock, but was bombarded with gross smells and people asking for change and then getting angry when we told them we didn't have any. Not really worth the walk.

title: Great old town with the best shopping.
reviews: We love to shop in Gastown and then plop down at an outdoor bar for a good beer and maybe poutine. Very rustic and old looking with it's red brick bulidings and streets.

title: Fun Area to Visit
reviews: If you focus on the architecture and not the myriad souvenir shops all selling the same merchandise, you will enjoy walking the area.  The steam clock is a worthy picture opportunity.  Make sure you are there when the clock reaches the quarter mark.  There are several quality art galleries that merit a visit.

title: All in one must see attraction
reviews: If you are looking for one of the few historical areas in Vancouver and you've hit the jackpot. Lots of cafes, restaurants (all price ranges), bars/pubs and souvenir stores. This is the old downtown of vancouver. Walk on water street it would be a nonstop 5 min walk but recommended to look around since it's not a long street - do not go further than the gassy jack statue due to homeless neighbourhood.

title: Grab Lunch, Souvenirs and History Here
reviews: Multitudes of shops carrying souvenirs, clothing and coffee shops to stop. Two incredible shoe stores Fluevog and La Differencia! Bring your camera!

title: Touristy, yet unique
reviews: Great area for spending the evening, having a drink and some food. Good variety of stores and restaurants.

title: fun
reviews: Right in the hear of DT Van. So much history, culture, food, cafes, shopping. Oh the shopping, waterfront, electric nightlife

title: Nice area
reviews: We revisited Vancouver after a period of ten years and were pleasantly surprised by the redevelopment of Gastown. It is now a thriving buzzing area with many lively bars and restaurants.

title: Enjoyed our trip to Gastown
reviews: Although a lot of the shops are touristy and had t-shirts etc. my sister and I were looking for gifts to take home so we were happy. We also found a jewelry store Artina's that had a wonderful selection of jewelry made by Canadian artisans.

title: Nice place to shop
reviews: Spent some time here on our trip. Nice restaurants, shops, touristy but if you go down side streets lots of independent shops and bars. I would recommend 2 hours to see area.

title: Cute area to walk through
reviews: I came here on a walking tour, and in fact wished I had more time to browse as there are lots of interesting shops as well as tourist shops, plus lots of restaurants.  The clock tower is not old, but is fun to see blow.

title: Shopping time
reviews: You can all the souvenirs you need here for a much better price. There is a great variety of stores and the prices are really good.

title: A beautiful place to visit
reviews: Gastown was walking distance from the Rosedale on Robson hotel so we visited it several times during our visit to Vancouver.  The Steam Clock is a must see, as well as the many shops that sell Native Art.  We purchased a few items from Hill's Native Art at a reasonable price.  They have several floors all packed with beautiful and unique Native Art work.  In Gastown we found a Vegan restaurant called "Meets".  I was amazed at the delicious vegan food they had.  Its definitely worth a visit.  We found it by accident - just walking into all the little nooks and crannies.  I am sure they can be googled.

title: interesting shopping
reviews: this is a lovely part of town easily missed. great quirky shops and lovely atmosphere. Gets you away from the 'high street' type shopping and great places to eat or have a coffee in more relaxed 'Left Bank' style setting.

title: A very cool step back into time...
reviews: Some new trendy shops, but mostly an "old time" feel with the cobblestone street, and the Steam Clock. Quite a few eateries and bars also...

title: Hip & Trendy
reviews: This is the hip and trendy area of the city. It has been redeveloped and has some great restaurants, shops, and nightlife. It's not anything overly special but generally a good place to go hang out for the evening.

title: Sunday Morning
reviews: We only had time to look around here on Sunday morning after a busy weekend in Vancouver.  It is not as much of a highlight as other sites in Vancouver, but it was nice being there on Sunday morning avoiding too much of the pedestrian traffic and instead checking out this district somewhat alone.  There are some good cafes in the area which are worth visiting as well, so while not a highlight, it made for a good Sunday morning activity.

title: Good to re-visit
