reviews: As a frequent traveler to Vancouver, I don't normally go to the typical tourist destinations but as I had some time I took a walk into Gastown again and was pleasantly surprised as it was much better than the previous visit. Shops are not that expensive and restaurants / bars all carry some historic value.

title: Billed as funky....nice, but not funky and not much to do
reviews: They did a good job redeveloping this area.  However, there must be 5 stores that sell Canada tourist stuff (t-shirts, syrup, key chains, etc.) in 4 blocks.  Not really hip.  Pleasant walk from the convention center, just not much there.

title: Historical center
reviews: If you like looking at historical view of old gas lampposts and steam clock and all of charming shops like we did you will enjoy walking around the Gastown.

title: Trendy, Hip Area
reviews: Locals love this place as it is very trendy and hip. There are plenty of nice restaurants and shops. Nothing that is a MUST see or do, but good spot to check out.

title: Blast from the Past
reviews: They have cleaned up Gastown. Looking great. Enjoyed all the little shops  and coffee shops al long the way. I was on a tour with the Tour Guys and learned about Gastown and what was new and old.Again I could stay longer and really enjoy Gastown .

title: Charm and Character
reviews: Just a short stroll from the lookout. The shops seemed the same as anywhere else, but still worth the visit for the remaining character. Remember to stay in main area, as the side streets get a bit seedy.

title: Great place to visit
reviews: Great area to visit with a great bit of history to go along with it. Some good shops along the street which are good for tourists (such as myself) to pick up some souvenirs. Make sure you stick around to have a bite to eat and listen to the steam clock!!!

title: Fun
reviews: so many great places to eat and great happy hour. Great place to bike to from downtown and walk around

title: Great architecture
reviews: Great architecture, but some we walked from downtown and went through some rough areas on the way, get directions.

title: Skip this area.
reviews: I went on a sunday and most stores were closed around the streets. South end area has lots of homeless people and smells. Stay on the North end along Water Street.

title: Lots of great food to eat
reviews: A great area to eat, also lots of souvenir shops. A close walk to the waterfront, Canada place and the convention center.

title: Best shopping area
reviews: Gotta go to Fluevogs. The Spaghetti Factory is great for families. Everyone always stops to get their picture taken with the steam clock.

title: Gastown with reservations
reviews: Beautiful and some wonderful gems if you are hungry or thirsty, like Smart Mouth Coffee or the Flying Pig. At many places menus vary greatly between lunch and dinner so read 'em!What you must watch out for are the shops that sell imported copies of First Nation arts. If a shop has jewelry with no hallmark, no attribution as to tribe or artist, smile and walk away! If you have any doubts, ask one of the super-reputable shops like Hills, Spirit Wrestler or Pacific Coastal Peoples (Bear right when you enter their shop - left will take you a place I cannot recommend).The area is lots of fun at night and on the weekend when locals flood the area too: not just a tourist attraction!

title: Lively, historic, fun and shopping!!
reviews: Great area to walk around. They have the old style street lights, historic buildings, lots of shopping and many restaurants.

title: Fun shopping, historic site
reviews: This is a very small, 2 block radius or so section of town. There are many shops and eateries to choose from. It was great to pick up so authentic maple syrup and other fun souvenirs. The steam clock is beautiful and not at all crowded when we went (mid week)

title: nice for a quick walk close the waterfront station
reviews: 1 hour here is enough to discover the area because is pretty small, or if you prefer as here there are several restaurants some more time and take a dinner. shops are fancy or in other case very touristic ( you can buy souvenir) .

title: Great food
reviews: Not for those on a budget but some of the best eats in the city. Shared one dish at a bunch of places in order to try and sample as much as possible. Come hungry

title: Older part of city has real charm
reviews: This part of vancouver is steeped in history. Full of bars and restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. Features include the world's first steam powered clock. If you use the excellent hop on hop off tourist bus service then take timeout to explore this historically significant part of the city.

title: Old World Meets Modern
reviews: Beautiful and historic part of town full of cool shops, great restaurants, and brick streets. Beware: You are only a block or two from "skid row". Area gets strong pressure from the homeless element. Make sure you stay in the "golden zone", or you will suddenly find yourself surrounded by more homeless than you've ever seen before.

title: Take a walk or dine the evening away
reviews: No trip to Vancouver is complete without a trip to Gastown. Beautiful streets that have maintained the character and charm of yesteryear. Great shopping and excellent dining.

title: Got to visit Gastown!
reviews: I loved my experience at Gastown it is like visiting another time. There is a brilliant cowboy boot shop there (heaven!), the architecture I found interesting and the gas clock. Great and affordable restaurants and cafes all around. It was my favorite area of Vancouver.

title: Lots to see lots to eat
reviews: I think the city needs to be congratulated for having revamped this place. We enjoyed coffee and some unique small shops and good sandwiches in this place. With visiting.

title: Historic Gastown
reviews: Love coming to Vancouver, and always stay in the Gastown area when I do. It has the most charm than anywhere else in the city and it has wonderful shopping and entertainment, restaurants etc.  Don't forget to check out the Japanese gardens and try to ignore our terrible homeless issue as best you can , unfortunately it is right in your face and gives you an idea on how big a problem it is in this port city so ladder with drugs. These people have mental health issues and /or drug addictions , but for the most part harmless and just trying to survive in a country that has stripped away any serviced to help people in these situations, like the powers that be seem to look at this as population control ,or something, because why and how could they let it get to this. Anyway, don't let this discourage you from visiting this amazing part of Vancouver.  It actually will open your eyes to the issues in our own country. Love the Water st. Caf√©, amazing food , and many wonderful culinary experiences with the many great restaurants in this area. üòä

title: Bring your walking shoes
reviews: It is a large area to walk but great shopping and eating..great patios on a fabulous day..the buildings are amazing..bring your camera

title: Old Down Town Charm
reviews: Ignore the travel date it's a long time ago that I visited Gastown but it was a most enjoyable one.  Quirky old world charm and some fascinating little shops. My guess is that the character of the place is unlikely to have changed and I feel confident in saying that if you're in Vancouver it's well worth at least half a day.

title: Mesmerising and full of character!
reviews: This was my favourite place in Vancouver, and makes you feel the character of this amazing city! Go at night, walk on the lamp-lit streets, and try some delicacies from the numerous eating places around!

title: Quick visit
reviews: Seems to be a tourist area with lots of shops selling Canadian souvenirs. Didn't eat here, but looks like it has lots of nice restaurants. Gastown Clock overrated and a bit disappointing as it's quite small and doesn't do much except spurting a bit of water every now and then.

title: Well worth a visit
reviews: We nearly missed going here but luckily we didn't.  It's just amazing to see it all, the history behind it, just wonderful.

title: Characteristic area of Vancouver
reviews: Had a quick look through this lovely area in down town Vancouver, it appears to be rather older than most other parts, slightly run down, yet a little exclusive with its shops, definitely one for a visit to this fine city.I wouldn't have known too much about the city of Vancouver before I came here, but I had heard of Gastown, and particularly the landmark Steam Clock, which to be honest, after years of seeing it on travel TV shows I thought was a little bit disappointing, an oversized grandfather clock that runs on steam, well there was steam coming out of it anyway!Otherwise, Gastown was a very memorable and worthy part of my visit to this fine city.

title: Adorable Place
reviews: Gastown has the famous gas-powered clock and is a very quaint place with restaurants that will make every taste bud happy.We enjoyed the walk through the town and the atmosphere of the streets and restaurants.

title: Nice walk
reviews: My walk through Gastown was a few days before Christmas early in the morning. Not alot open but I didn't mind.The history behind this area is interesting.

title: Quaint place to visit
reviews: Browse the shops and eat in some really tasty restaurants. The Steam Clock blows every 15 minutes and is an interesting sight.

title: Afternoon visit
reviews: Nice place to visit.Good place for a walkthrough if you like to mingle the city with the tourists.Nice tourist shops and easy access point to the rest of the city

title: Ok
reviews: Not many things to see rather than the steam clock and shopping.my friend said that it was made to be old but not really old.

title: Has improved
reviews: It has been many years since we have been to the Gastown district and was surprised to see how much it has changed. There are a lot more boutique fashion stores and restaurants in the area now.

title: Good for tourism but not shopping
reviews: Historian buildings alongside of the road with numerous souvenir shops. The bars are good for hanging out with friends especially at late night.

title: Great food and drinks
reviews: Did a foodie tour to find out great places to visit. Excellent food and drink at several places. Lots of night time activity

title: Food, Fun, Cocktails and.... some strangeness
reviews: Gastown has gone through another revitalization - this time increasing the character.It used to be pretty rough and filled with smoke and souvenir shops (and the ubiquitous 'going out of business rug shops).Now it has become him, cool and a lot more fun. The restaurant choices are very good, Happy Hours are abundant, shopping is "Cool fashion" based and the steam clock still reminds you of the time by blowing it's whistles.The west end of Gastown get VERY busy when the cruise ships are in, so head east an extra block past the clock for a more enjoyable and relaxing experience.  The cocktail culture is alive and well in this neighbourhoods, if you are into that kinda thing. Easy to do a "Cocktail Crawl" beginning at Pourhouse and heading East stopping along the way, sampling then ending at "The Diamond" on the east end.

title: Chinashop
reviews: Black frog eatery was very comfortable atmosphere set for any individual or group. Good and service was excellent the brownies and ice cream was surprisingly nice   Would recommend for any and all

title: Old Town
reviews: It is interesting and has a lot of shops but less interesting and less shops that one would think.  Most of the shops close early (around 6:00 pm).

title: Pleasant walk with interesting shops and cafes
reviews: Close to waterfront, trendy and wide range of shops, retail to cafes and restaurants. Look at the steam clock and see the moving parts, clever.

title: Interesting shops ripper old steam clock
reviews: Spent a few hours wandering around here, found a restaurant, enjoyed a few beers and a feed.Continued walking around. Plenty of shops of all types, the old steam clock is a must visit. There are many international tourists wandering around so ask them to take your photo in front of the clock.Easy to find and get around there is limited parking so maybe leave the car at home and take one of the Evo other rent by the minute cars...Very close to Granville and the cbd so easy to find.

title: Gastown offers all kinds of experiences
reviews: Gastown has history, (see the steam clock, notice the cobblestones and the various styles of buildings), offers some interesting places to eat, and.... the ever present souvenir shops.  In addition, various designer stores are moving into the area.The beginning of Gastown starts at the sky train stain where the original station has been refurbished, and also is where one would catch the seabus across to the Lonsdale Quay, (another great place to explore).  Walking in the opposite direction of Gastown, (past Canada Place), there is a seawalk the heads towards Stanley Park, with numerous places for coffee and snacks along the way, plus amazing views of the water.

title: Gastown--worth discovering.
reviews: Gastown is worth visiting, if you have not done so already.  It attracts a mixture of locals as well as tourists, but it is mainly oriented to the tourism industry.While Water St. (and area) have bona fide historic flavour, it's worth noting that the look of the place is largely cosmetic--a sanitized version of the old Granville Townsite.The real Granville was a bit more gritty, and for those who are historically inclined, you will quickly detect the 19-tens warehouse buildings under an earlier period decorative "icing."Somehow, it all works, and the historic vibe, while not all authentic, is rather fun.  One feature in Gastown that you might want to check out is the Old Spaghetti Factory, at #53 Water St..  The food is nothing spectacular, but the price is not too far out of line for what you get. Inside, you will find the only Vancouver streetcar to have survived intact.  It's the real thing, it was built locally, and it's even reputed to be haunted.  How good is that?  Best of all, you can sit an eat inside of it.There are also a number of great cafes, bars and restaurants to discover, and each of these has a unique flavour to offer.Allow an hour or two for a quick visit, or stop by multiple times if you are passing through Vancouver's downtown.  Gastown is only a block away from Waterfront Station, where you can catch the Canada Line, the SkyTrain, the Westcoast Express, and the SeaBus.  Plenty of signage, so you won't get lost.

title: Great busy place
reviews: Where one could find the Steam Clock. Great to have one's pictures taken with the Sears-Harbor Centre and the Grouse Mountain as backgrounds. Lots of souvenir shops and coffee shops. Another must-see when in Vancouver.  I guess this was my fourth or fifth time to visit this place.

title: Very nice until. .....
reviews: Myself and my girlfriend visited gastown whilst traveling around vancouver .Parts of gastown are lovely for example the steam clock .quite an old retro feel which was nice until we made are way into the rougher part of gastown/Chinatown.  A lot of junkies and homeless which is sad to say. Quite intimating when standing waiting on traffic lights to turn green

title: Fun place
reviews: Fun place to walk around, shop, and grab a bite to eat.  There were numerous street performers while we were walking around.  Touristy, but what do you expect!

title: Abound with good dining and retail outlets....
reviews: Great place for a late afternoon stroll and exploring the many dining outlets.Look out for the steam operated Town clock...unique piece of engineering. After dining...just stroll over to the Canada Place next door where the Cruise ships are docked.

title: Fun place to walk around and shop
reviews: This is a great place to walk around and shop for souvenirs. Kids had fun too. Steam clock is very unique and fun to see chime on the hour. Restaurants and bars are great. Steamhouse is particularly cool and different with great atmosphere.

title: Old Part of Town but Always Traditional and Elegant
reviews: Gastown is a national historic site in Vancouver, British Columbia, at the northeast end of Downtown at the Water Front Station, East end is adjacent to Main St. China Town. The only road paved by red bricks. Many attractions such as Steam Clock, fine restaurants, galleries, You can easily spend a day walking to the different attractions nearby.

title: deep into Vancouver's history
reviews: Gastown is a great neighbourhood to visit. The oldest part of Vancouver, it has some of the most interesting architecture in the city, now housing boutiques, restaurants, pubs, and bars. By day it's fun to shop and grab a coffee or tea at one of the caf√©s. In the evenings, great restaurants and bars are the attraction, along with the cobblestone streets. The steam clock is probably the most famous thing to see in Gastown, but don't limit your visit to Water Street where it is located. Walk up Blood Alley and Gaoler's Mews to see Gastown from a different perspective. I'm a local, so if you have questions about Vancouver, feel free to contact me with questions.

title: Everything is fake - it is the disneyland part of vancouver
reviews: If you are looking for genuine old architecture and streets - don't go there, you will be disappointed... Even the steam clock, which is actually the main and only attraction in gastown is actually from the 20th century (1977).But if you are looking for tourists boutiques all ''made in china'' and super expensive that's your place!

title: Very unusual and
reviews: Unexpected little community surrounded by not so great environment.  Quite touristy but does have some redeeming features involving eating and drinking.  Don't stay too late or you will have to deal with the sad underbelly of Vancouver.

title: Nice shops and galleries
reviews: Tourist area but has some very nice galleries with First Nation art and jewelry. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Has typical souvenir shops. Stay on Water Street as one block over is pretty nasty. Human excrement on the sidewalks and lots of homeless.

title: Great way to spend the day walking around the shops
reviews: Great way to spend a day walking around all the neat shops from Aboriginal / First Nation art shops, to the gift shops (buy maple syrup, maple candy, salmon and ice wines etc from the grocery store way cheaper than the tourist shops).Great selection of restaurants and bars one I have reveiwed called Steamworks which is my go to place when in the Gas Town district.

title: Lots to do
reviews: Love Gastown has lots of great restaurants and little cafes. Good place at night to go for a few drinks.

title: Nothing special
reviews: We walked around Gastown during the day on a Sunday and found it to be mostly junk stores selling trinkets and touristy stuff. I imagine it's a very different scene at night, but we didn't think it was anything special.

title: Funky part of Vancouver
reviews: If you're looking for souvenirs this seems like a good place for tacky/nice gifts depending on what you're looking for! The steam clock is a must to see if you're in the area too

title: We came for the pub and stayed for the sites
reviews: This is a very interesting part of town with hip shops and cafes. Dubh Linn Gate's rear entrance opens up to a patio and mini park with nice condos. The front door has a view of the Train/Bus terminal and of course, waterfront. We walked around and found it had a very San Francisco vibe.

title: Rife with homeless, druggies, and unemployed
reviews: Aside from the one street that has the steam clock, there's really nothing here about other than strung out druggies and homeless people. This is the only part of vancouver I didn't really feel safe in - and I am a big, ugly 50-yr old guy.

title: Great park of Vancouver
reviews: This is one of my favorite parts of Vancouver.  It's historical and interesting.  Lots of different stores.  Very trendy this days.  Fun to walk around.  Great places to eat or have a drink.  It's nice to have been able to see it's transition.

title: Old Town Vancouver
reviews: Go there if you like historical, antique places. Place to see are Gassy Jack statue and Steam Clock. Just hang out there and feel the atmosphere of the old Vancouver....For me - must see :) Steam Clock plays some melodies at the full hours.

title: Shopping and Eating and Seeing Fun
reviews: Bashed around with the family for a fun day.  All kinds of stores, restaurants, buildings to look at, ships to admire, water to gaze upon.  A really great day!  Vancouver is a very international city.  I marveled at the fact that I could walk 100 feet and not hear another American accent beyond my family.  Sometimes no English, period.

title: cool area to check out
reviews: cool area with a lot of different things happening here. variety of stores and eateries. You can get your meds here also if you want. Although there are a few nefarious people running around it is a relatively safe area.

title: Graet little find
reviews: Accidentally stumbled across Gasstown and very glad we did - great eateries and a very scenic part of the town.

title: Great area for a walk
reviews: Gastown was very nice to walk through. Many trendy shops, bars and pubs, and I loved the trees in the street that just started turning green. Great for a walk around and some nice food and drinks.

title: Lots to see and do in Gastown!
reviews: A variety of retail shops and great places to eat and drink. A must do when visiting Vancouver. Unique Jewelry shops and Art Galleries? you bet! Lovely cobblestone walkways!

title: A lovely area
reviews: Well worth a wander around this area, but [in my opinion] I wouldn't walk round here on an evening...it looks a bit dodgy with several "druggies" hanging around. During the day it was fine and you must go and see the steam clock

title: Gastown food tour
reviews: Food was all amazing and the tour guide Heather was also very brilliant, fun and informative. Only thing I was sad about was that the tour on trip advisor has a list of food and drinks you'll be having on the tour which one was supposed to be lobster mac and cheese which we didn't have, but the rest of what was listed was pretty accurate, was really looking forward to the mac and cheese though haha.

title: Must do whilst in Vancouver
reviews: A great area for shopping particularly for the tourist and lots of cafes, restaurants and bars to choose from.

title: Gastown - in Transition
reviews: Historic Gastown is transforming its self into the City of Vancouver's long term vision of a tourist and locals destination. A number of good restaurants, better quality retail stores and bars have located in the area and the locals are now accepting and patronized the entire area. It's been a long time coming but the transition to a popular destination has finally arrived.

title: Fun historic area with nice shops and restaurants
reviews: Enjoyed walking over to Gastown, and learning about the history of the area. Nice shops and restaurants. Convenient to downtown.

title: Unbelievable Character!
reviews: I am a Vancouver local and I have to say Gastown is one of my favourite places in the city.  All of the buildings have history that when it all comes together, tells a story of the past.  Always a great place to get some great food and site-see!

title: Gastown Vancouver
reviews: Beautiful place to visit. Many shops around the clock and it was really nice looking around :)

title: Must Visit
reviews: Great place for a date. Great restaurants, great ambiance.... Friendly crowd. Check it out. The Italian restaurants are really good, there's a few breweries down there, coffee shops and cafes. Worth the visit.

title: love this place
reviews: I love art galleries and shopping . So this is heaven. Lots of shops, quaint places to eat and pubs. Friendly and fun. There was a power outage while we were there and some stores stayed open. The buildings have a lot  of character , its older Vancouver and its a must visit

title: Passed thru, not a lot to see
reviews: Ended up in gas town on the way back to hotel. Felt some areas not so safe to be walking through.  Did not see much to do.   Disappointed in what we found.

title: Full of Surprises
reviews: We strolled thru gastown on a few occasions during our 4 day stay, to do some shopping, Oak and Fort a new clothing oulet was a real find, inexpensive and trendy clothes for men and women, lots of souvenir shops that were expensive compared to a souvenir shop we found on Robson Street.

title: Well worth a visit
reviews: Well worth a visit to see and hear the Big Ben steam clock.  Vibrant area with lots of shops and restaurants and really good to visit at night.

title: You can have a great day out here
reviews: Look out for plenty of coffee shops or a peaceful walk. Avoid Hastings Street where the homeless are. Cool hip art shops wine bars and clubs. Not too easy to get lost but do check it out

title: The birthplace of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is Vancouver's most historic neighborhood. Gastown has numerous specialty shops and gift shops to keep tourists happy. the Famous Steam Clock sits at the corner of Water and Cambie streets. It spews steam every hour and half hour. There are a dozen or so good restaurants in Gastown to suit every taste. Gastown is great in the daytime or evening, but avoid on weekends due to the large club crowd. It is also wise to avoid the panhandlers, as some can be quite aggressive, especially during tourist season. Make Gastown a stop on your trip.

title: most interesting part of the city when it comes to shops and food
reviews: gastown is the only part of vancouver where you feel you are in a city center ---  old cobblestone roads .....   bars and restaurants everywhere, the steamclock and a nice square at powell street ....    and the best restaurant of vancouver  ..BAUHAUS ---- at 1 west cordova with the only michelin star chef working in canada

title: Great for coffee, shopping, and eating
reviews: I really enjoy Gastown.  It's grown up over the years.  There are a lot of nice boutique shops, restaurants, and now 2 great coffee shops - Timbertrain and Revolver.  It's worth the quick walk here just for the coffee.

title: Great and touristy, get your typical souvenirs here
reviews: We visited Gastown on a recent trip to Vancouver. I wasn't sure about it b/c I had read several reviews on here that said it was super touristy and to skip it. I'm glad we didn't. While it is very tourist inclined, the Steam Clock is fun to see and it's an easy walk up and down the street to take in a historic part of Vancouver. We also found a great restaurant (Water Street Caf√©) while we were walking around. We needed some typical souvenirs for family and friends (t-shirts, magnets, and the like) and we did find them here. But, some of the stores also had local items and artwork which was fun to see. It doesn't take long to walk through and see everything if you aren't souvenir shopping, but I'd still take the time to do it. The Steam Clock is pretty neat and a landmark worth visiting. While you're there, walk across the street and have the grilled chicken club and fries at the Water Street Caf√©. If you like bacon and brie, you won't be disappointed.  I had read in several reviews that there are lots of homeless people asking for money which we did experience (We actually got cursed out by a homeless woman, but just chalked that up to part of the experience being downtown). In that respect, Gastown was no different then being in our own downtown. :) I'd recommend Gastown for an easy walk through a historic part of Vancouver. We stayed at the St. Regis and it was only a couple blocks away. So, it was a nice afternoon visit with some fun souvenirs and a great lunch!

title: Remind me of Soho in New York
reviews: Great shopping area of Vancouver...... just make sure you bring your American Express Card. Ton of high end shops and boutiques with cobble stone streets. Definitely a place to visit!

title: Beautiful at night
reviews: Returned due to my great experience last March. Beautiful place overall -- especially at night. The trees are filled with lights -- just enough for ambiance and not so much it looks like Vegas. If you love shoes, check out La Differentia on Water street. Very unique offerings and the gentleman there is very kind.

title: Gastown in down town
reviews: Gastown is worth to visit if you are in Vancouver down town. Nice place to walk, a lot of souvenir shops there. A lot of pubs, this place becomes very lively at night.

title: Fun, Cute, Funky, Walkable Downtown worth a stroll
reviews: Vancouver is just nice, period. Gastown is part and parcel of that and worthy of some time. Its relaxing and enjoyable with lots of friendly people along the way. Get out and enjoy.

title: If you like nostalgia and interesting places to eat,
reviews: It has no impressive view of the beautiful Vancouver harbour or waterfront. But if you are a recent-history buff, and an adventurous gourmet, this is the place. The steam clock and "heritage" buildings, former railroad terminal turned into tourist nostalgic site with boutique shops (aimed at tourists) and all kinds of restaurants and cafes are the main attraction. It is within walking distance from the cruiseship terminal and Vancouver convention center, and can be an alternative walking tour from there (the other is to the west, the Stanley Park).

title: Fascinating area to explore
reviews: Gastown is a trip back in time to the origins of Vancouver and is full of surprising discoveries including the characters that founded the city, great coffee houses and bars, caf√©s, fashion outlets, shops and architecture. The Steam Clock, though not perhaps as old as some of its surroundings is a great visitor attraction and worth hanging around until the mechanism sets off the whistles.

title: Pituresque Area
reviews: At night the atmosphere here is great! The lights and old buildings tell the history of the beginning. Lots of tourist shops for souvenirs. The Steam Clock is beautiful and really original.

title: Unique Canadian Experience
reviews: West is indeed the best. Even when it rains. Gastown is a cosmopolitan place whose historical landmark is its steam clock. On the hour it makes a noise like a calliope . Red brick roads that line restaurants and shops make this a great place to visit. I would recommend not to venture past the red roads as the demeanor of the town really becomes questionable... all the same it is worth seeing

title: Not My First Choice of Attractions
reviews: So overall, Gastown can be a fun area to visit for an hour or so for just about any age group or family situation. Easy street walking, impossible to get lost, plenty of good restaurants with a wide range of cuisine, some fun, family-friendly attractions like the Prohibition Hall with renactments. There are plenty of cheesy tourist shops and it's a less than beautiful area when compared to other parts of greater Vancouver. Skip it if you're short on time.

title: A little bit of everything
reviews: One of my favourite places to eat or enjoy a night out, not to mention the beautiful architecture. Gastown is a must for anybody visting Vancouver. The many quaint restaurants offer a amazing food and a wonderful atmosphere. And, if you're looking for a spot to take pictures, the steam clock and cobblestone road are perfect.

title: to be visited
reviews: Nice old Vancouver area. You find allots of attraction there, restaurants, shopping for Native arts and it is very close to Canada place and the Convention Center. For a nice afternoon walk.

title: Gas Town
reviews: Very unique area and the Steam Clock is a really must see.  Good eateries and coffee shops as well as antique shops

title: Fun, but Shady at Night
reviews: Charming area and great restaurants. I enjoyed the area, but had concerns for the safety of my wife during night hours. She would probably be okay, but the area was iffy enough for me to be uncomfortable with her being in that part of town.Other then that, no qualms.

title: the steam clock is fun
reviews: very diverse place to visit, lots of interesting shops and places to eat, fun for all ages and safe for walking around

title: Loved it
reviews: Loved walking down here, some shops, plenty of cafes and bars, eateries, good for a night out with friends

title: Where are the shops?
reviews: I used to come here all the time on holiday...but now it is small dining and many of the shops sell the same choch.

title: Lots to see and do in Gastown.
reviews: Take the Skytrain to Waterfront Station, then walk east. We were in Gastown for an escape room adventure at smartypantz.ca, then dinner at nuba.ca.

title: Steam clock is a highlight
reviews: I last visited Gastown 20 years ago and was disappointed to see a lot of changes.The main highlight is still the Steam clock but there seems to be less shops and more restaurants. It is a beautiful part of town and important part of Vancouver's history.On a less positive note - We were approached by a number of homeless people begging for money quite vocally in only half an hour at about 11 am in the morning.

title: A real experience
reviews: Yes Gastown is a must visit place in the day but as a Vancourite I'm starting to really enjoy Gastown as a go to place for dinner. The area used to be a bit sketchy at night but The plethora of eateries and establishments that have opened up over the years have really made it a lively place at night. It has enough grit and heritage architecture to make it an authentic urban experience. Not too gussied up and clean, but not too sketchy either.

title: My favourite neighbourhood for a nice dinner and cool bars
reviews: Gastown is definitely my favourite hood for a nice dinner and cool bars on my Fridays and Saturdays night. It is a historical site, where Vancouver started. Everything looks old school and it is very charming. It is my number one recommendation for a nice dinner or drink in Vancouver

title: Beautiful part of the town
reviews: This area has lots of art galleries, pubs, gift shops, alternative clothing. And it's a historical part of downtown. Here you can see the steam clock and the place where the city was founded.

title: Fun town
reviews: I so loved wandering around here......safe during the day and evening üòÑPerfect for meals with or without family. Great choice from inexpensive to top rating restaurants. Stopped here before and after cruising....üòÉüá¶üá∫‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Not sure what the attraction is???
reviews: Many of our friends said Gastown was a must.  Not sure why?  It is filled with your typical souvenir shop (one after another) and several pubs.  Also filled with panhandlers. The best thing I can say is the steam clock which was interesting to see.  So, unless we missed something, I'm not sure what the fuss is all about!

title: A Gas at Gastown
reviews: I liked Gastown but to be very truthful other than the clock it was no  different than the rest of the city.  Shopping is the same and be careful where you go..not far is a bad area and lots of homeless people who are begging for money.  Lots of police presence and at times very very uncomfortable.  Go to Victoria a much better place to visit.

title: Fun
reviews: Lots to see and do ... Touristy and not as historic as it seems. Great places to eat, shop and walk.

title: Wish we would've found this area earlier in our trip!
reviews: We only saw a small portion of this area/neighborhood as we had dinner here the last night of vacation.  It is a cool area, with a great vibe.  Would've loved to have spent more time here.

title: Good place if you want to take photos
reviews: A trendy hipster area that's worthwhile checking out - whether you are a local or a tourist of Vancouver!

title: A Must See!!
reviews: Important for all who are visiting Vancouver...the famous clock, lovely shops and good food. Check it out after a day of roaming around Vancouver ' s downtown sights!!

title: Disappointed
reviews: Went to visit  the street  Vancouver is known for and boy was I disappointed. Half the shops closed or turned into restaurants instead.  Having been to Gastown  area 20 years ago the change was disheartening

title: Exciting Atmosphere
reviews: We got swept away in the momentum of a post Canucks game crowd last night ended. The fact that we lost was immediately forgotten as soon as we reached this vintage and classical feeling area. The crowds were enthusiastic and positive, even those waiting outside the clubs for entry. It felt as if we were a part of a relaxed yet motivated swarm of leisure seekers. Of course the wide variety of boutique style shops and restaurants were overwhelmingly plentiful. Gastown made for a great cap to our night.

title: Very cute little shopping district!
reviews: Love bringing people here! Cobblestone streets, great little cafes and the perfect souvenir shopping stores! Make sure to stop by the steam clock on the hour to hear it sing and read about "Gassy Jack".

title: Unique place
reviews: what a nice place and wicked old original Vancouver,,, The Gastown Clock is the star attraction here, very cool to watch and was ushered by a local street fella who we tipped for his time and a really great story about the Clock itself.

title: A Good Place to Browse
reviews: Over a month ago my wife and I took my son and his wife (who now live in Toronto) for a quick tour of Gastown.  This a great place to browse in all the different 'tourist traps"  Steam Clock, after a long absence was also working wel!!!

title: Not a cool area
reviews: It seems they tried to revive this old neighborhood, but it looks dirty, beggers and drunks around. Better places to go in Vancouver.

title: A great part of Vancxouver
reviews: I stayed less than 10 minutes walk from here and wished Id discovered it sooner. Its got a great feel to it and you really connect with the city in Gastown. There was filming going on, shopping to be done, eating and drinking aplenty. This shouldn't be missed. More for couples and business travellers than families though.

title: Hipster coffeeshops
reviews: I asked several people in this area what they recommended me to do here. They all pointed me at interesting stuff OUTSIDE of Gastown, the only thing you can do here is drink coffee while surrounded by hipsters with iPhones. Visiting Gastown was a total waste of time.

title: Stroll In the Evening!
reviews: We walked all over Gastown in the evening. Seeing the famous steam clock and all the restaurants illuminated by light was fascinating and beautiful. We didn't come here during the day so we don't know how it looks like daytime but evening was very lovely. There were so many tourists that we didn't feel unsafe. Lots of pub breweries.

title: Fav in Vancouver
reviews: My newest favorite Neighborhood in all of North America.  So cool and unique with an old fashion feel. But it is modern and very cool.  Just park and walk everywhere.  You don't even feel like you are in the city anymore.

title: OK for a stroll
reviews: Sorry, but we weren't overly enthralled by Gastown. It was OK for a walk to buy some souvenirs and perhaps window shop, but otherwise what else is there?

title: Oldest part of the town
reviews: A must visit area for any tourist. This is the oldest part of the town with its famous steam clock  and lots of restaurants, cafes and cute shops. You can easily spend couple of hours here and relax in one of the countless coffeeshops.

title: Nothing special, actually not a very large section of town
reviews: Definitely worth a visit when touring Vancouver, and more so for people interested in the town's history - this is where Vancouver began. But other than that, not much else to mention. it's near the poorer parts of town, so you have to be careful when meandering away a couple of blocks -- you will run into a lot of homeless and disabled folks on the streets. Panhandlers are not limited to this area, so that's not a particular concern as panhandlers tend to congregate where there is a lot of foot traffic, which of course is pretty much anywhere in the nicer parts of Vancouver.

title: Nestled between the water, downtown and the dodgy end of town
reviews: Gastown is the edgy end of Vancouver. Located near the east Hastings desperados zone, this is a gorgeous gentrification of a tough part of town. Thriving with really interesting bars, cafes and shops, this is a great place to hang out and chill. There are some interesting tidbits of history, the "gassy Jack" statue and steam driven clock are a must see. Take a walk near the wild side... oh, a watch out for the full blown tourist stuff, there is always a souvenir store handy but you can turn a blind eye to that :)

title: taek a walk, Back in time
reviews: I loved walking the streets in Gastown, felt like I had gone back in time. So many aboriginal art shops, jewelry and more. Only had a short time there, and would have loved to spend more time to see it all.

title: Something different
reviews: Not really what I expect from the rest of downtown Vancouver but in a good way. Lots of First nation art which was very nice to see. Many touristy shops which were shockingly cheap compared to the tourist traps of Britain!

title: Cool area
reviews: It was a nice area to walk around. Good food, shopping, and home to the worlds first steam clock. It makes noise on the hour. Worth looking at if you find yourself in the area.

title: Curious clock
reviews: Considered. As the first steam clock. People come here and enjoy the memorable sound.  It is history now.

title: Shopping haven
reviews: Visitors can find a lot ofCanadian souvenirs inGastown. Some shops will absorb tax so prices can be slightly cheaper. Look for cured salmons, maple syrup, buffalo skin bags ang wallets which are made in Canada since most souvenirs are imported from China

title: Cool place
reviews: Lots of independent retailers and cafes. At night, it is especially nice to walk around as the trees are lit up and with the area becoming more up-market / trendy, there are many shops still open and it is a lovely stroll. Watch out for gassy Jack's statue at the intersection !

title: Wow'd by this area; kept returning daily!
reviews: I adored this area of Vancouver. Each day from the convention centre I would find lunch, do a little bit of shopping and enjoy the scenery. Such a beautiful and very safe area. A MUST see!!!

title: Nice old time feel, good for finding presents
reviews: Lots of boutiques, restaurants, bars as well as trinket/souvenir shops. Nice change to the scrapers of down town nearby

title: History and hipsters meet
reviews: Gastown is full of cool shops and cafes full of bored-looking hipsters, but there's plenty of history there too. Check out the flatiron building, various monuments and nearby Chinatown to feel as though you've stepped back in time. We've visited a number of times because we like the mixed vibe.

title: Beautiful part of town!
reviews: Nice area to stroll around, lots of quirky shops and some fantastic places to eat! Lovely at night too as the trees are light up too.

title: Wwwlovely to visit
reviews: Used to go and eat here regularly. Lots of interesting places to go. Also get the flavour of Vancouver

title: Celebration
reviews: Gastown with a clock that is run on Steam is an interesting part of Vancouverwith lots of shops old streets and  variety for travellers to enjoy.travel in the city is good with buses Skytrain and Ferry to North Van,regular flights of  light airplanes zoom from the river  and photographs are there for the camera lover.

title: Tourist shopping strip
reviews: -There is several shops offering the same merchandise along the street that you would have in any city. -There are also a few unusual shops that offer one of a kind gifts that may be of interest if you are looking for these type of gifts.-Allow a couple of hours to visit both streets if you go into every shop.-They have a couple of eatery's dotted around the place.

title: A bit expensive area
reviews: I still love the street of Gastown. Not very much to see but just the atmosphere in this area of Vancouver are very nice. There are alot of nice bars to with I love.

title: Fun and trendy
reviews: Spent a few hours and walked around looking into the very unique shops.Great restaurants and shopping as well many art galleries, we truly enjoyed ourselves, highly recommend.

title: One of the best neighborhood in Vancouver.
reviews: Very nice neighborhood in Vancouver. It feels like the old European street. Lots of food places here and looks fantastic at night. It's very near the Vancouver lookout tower. So u should come here, the tower, convention centre and the Olympic torch all together in the same walk at night

title: History
reviews: Best thing about this walk was to learn something about the city's history. Loved it. Wish I had had more time to spend there.

title: A quick drive through.
reviews: Just a quick drive through while on a small tour bus but it was fascinating to hear about the history behind this small town.

title: Awesome
reviews: Great historical place to see and visit. Cobblestone roads...how cool. Good restaurants and stores. Recommended.

title: Very cozy!
reviews: Gastown is very beautiful and cozy, it's in Vancouver downtown, at night you can see the lights and the famous steam clock, last time I saw they shooting a scene there , it was awesome!

title: Very interesting area
reviews: We walked around Gas Town and had dinner here.  The shops are great and finding a restaurant was easy. We actually had lunch and dinner in the same restaurant

title: A place with character, a romantic place at night.
reviews: I like walking around Gastown. the stores are interesting and full of character. But I love the most about this place is at night. When the old lamps lit up at night, the place becomes very romantic, especially when you are holding the hand of your love.

title: Reall atmospheric area
reviews: This old area, named after the man who started the first bar her, is full of really nice old buildings with interesting architecture.  The old Art Deco garage is particularly appealing to me and the old red brick warehouses are now buzzing as galleries, shops, bars and restaurants.   Well worth the visit.

title: Old Vancouver
reviews: This is the place if you want to know how  Vancouver was before, the pioneer character of this particular street keep the historic elements like Cobblestones , the structure of the old style buildings, the souvenir stores are in this street, they have the spectacular view on North Vancouver, and the famous Steam powered clock....point for take photos. The restaurants really good in that area, you can choose in a block, have 3 our 4 restaurants, nice for walk... our in summer time is beautiful place for a coffee with friends, don't miss this part if you can walk star for Gastown and finish with Canada Place.

title: Poverty amongst the glamour.
reviews: Worth the visit as long as you stay to the main street.Smashing array of shops & restaurants but sadly there are quite a few homeless people in the back streets.Never felt unsafe just sad to see.

title: a beautiful area - unique gem
reviews: This is a beautiful eclectic street area to walk around, with the cobbled streets and historic elements - it seems removed from the modern city, yet its not.  Lovely shops and great restaurants.

title: Typical tourist area
reviews: What can i say, its a typical tourist area, but found there was not a lot to see.  Lots of tacky souvenir shops, and street people begging for money.  To us thats about all, could have passed it over and not miss a thing.  Unless you really have to see the steam clock.

title: Good walk-through and wonderful view on North Van
reviews: Gastown is a lovely part of Vancouver but also there's not so much to do anymore. There's a bunch of good restaurants, bars and boutiques. On the other hands it's covered with souvenir stores, useless products and shops. I like the clash of Gastown and Hastings which makes it more interesting.Take the chance and walk east towards Railtown and enjoy the view on North Van when the sun is rising or setting.

title: Lovely place to take photos
reviews: Really enjoyed walking round here and visiting the famous steam clock Ate twice in gas town in a week

title: Very Different
reviews: Was a little crowded as we wandered down the streets.  Barriers were up for a cycle race around the streets.  This seemed to add to the atmosphere.  Plenty of souvenir shops and eateries.  Stop to watch the gas clock as it strikes / pipes the hour.

title: Steam clock
reviews: We had 3 days in vancover .... Lots to see, we had dinner at the old spaghetti factory, mounted police shop,pretty good souvenir shops. Gassy jack & old railway station.

title: Get a feel for what Vancouver used to be like
reviews: Nice shops and restaurants on either side of the streets.  Loved watching the steam clock do its thing at 11 am - folks gather there to watch the show.  Beautiful street lamps, and shop signs.

title: Full of character.
reviews: This area has some great bars and restaurants and the steam clock has to be seen on the hour - it whistles!

title: Won't make or break your experience. Drop by if you have some time
reviews: Almost didn't have time to see this area as I had little time on my trip. However manage to squeeze it in. Nice and scenic. Good for a few photos. Lots of little restaurants and things there too. I wouldn't say this is the quintessential part of a Vancouver trip. But still worth seeing.

title: Great Area to Spend Some Time
reviews: A walk through Gastown is a must when in Vancouver.  There is a variety of shops and eateries and the people watching is worth every step.

title: An Unpleasant Mix of Dirty Urban and Touristy
reviews: Everything that I had read about Gastown made it sound like it would be a fun place to go. It wasn't. My experience of Gastown was an unpleasant combination of the dirtiest urban setting I've ever been in and an overpriced and overcrowded tourist trap. Vancouver is an incredible city with so much more to offer. I recommend skipping Gastown and checking out the other things this amazing city has to offer.

title: Walking and touring Gastown
reviews: Love this place.  My son and I came across the Gastown while just walking around the area.  We also did some shopping.

title: Lovely
reviews: A great place to have a look at especially at night,the streets are lit with cute little lights.Be prepared for beggars asking for money and the constant smell of canabis.Otherwise GREAT!

title: Trendy
reviews: A different side of Vancouver. Cobblestones, cool boutiques, decent restaurants, inviting coffeeshops, and of course---that darned steam clock all make for a great experience.

title: Beautiful area
reviews: Just a 7-8 mins walk from Caanda Place this area is full of history, architecture and the famous gas clock. An abundance of restaurants and pubs make this a favourite with tourists and locals alike. For a budget diner....the Spaghetti Factory is superb.

title: Charming glimpse of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a must-see stop in Vancouver- at least if you like to shop or have a good, leisurely meal. We wandered through today on our way through town, first looking through some shops, then stopping for a very good lunch. The only downside was the cold and rain. I prefer Gastown on a sunny summer day, it just has a different energy to it. However, if you don't have the luxury of choosing a nicer day, it's still worth the detour. Go check out the famous steam clock, make a pilgrimage to the Fluevog shoe store (we did...), or have a pint at a restaurant.

title: Perfect for a stroll and lunch or dinner
reviews: Of course you want to make sure to visit the gas clock, but more than this Gastown is a lovely couple of cobbled streets with plenty of cute restaurants, bars and shops with several offering items by First Nations artists. A trip to Vancouver is not complete without a visit to Gastown.

title: Great place to find trendy clothing and shoes - and grab a beer/wine
reviews: Gastown is close to everything downtown and has a lot of stores - many are just touristy t-shop/souvenirs (at decent prices) but others are local vendors offering wonderful shoes, clothing and bedding/furniture/decorating items. If you cannot take them home in your suitcase you will get good ideas anyway. There's a steam clock you should stop for a photo of, and the streets are cobbled and quaint. Be warned that Hastings street which passes on the outside of the area is really seedy as you go away from the downtown - and is where you will find all the druggies and people out of their heads (not fund to walk through unless you're not worried about projectile vomiting, or worse). But the area itself is safe if you stay away from there.

title: Upscale dining and shopping
reviews: Gastown is a really neat area of town, very different from the rest of the city. We tried a couple of restaurants and did some window shopping. All of the restaurants were very busy, but not too difficult to grab a couple bar stools and cozy up to the bar for a drink and some appetizers. I would suggest doing a little research and make a reservation somewhere before heading there to eat, though.

title: Over rated
reviews: Would not waste my time going there again. A few tourist shops selling the usual, a couple of nice looking restaurants but the streets are quite dirty and we were confronted on several occasions by beggars. The clock was interesting but that's all.

title: Quaint with some great beer and food!
reviews: A must-see in Vancouver, the original part of the city, renovated and kept old and quaint for tourists.  See the Gas Clock on Water Street, eat at Chill Winston and buy your souvenirs here.  Catch the Hop on Hop off bus here if it's too much of a walk from Canada Place.  Visit!

title: Nice to walk around, but rather small
reviews: There are many great restaurants in the area, however, they are all very overpriced. While i did enjoy the look of the area, it seemed overrun with tourists from the cruise ships. Go to check it out, butdon't expect anything breathtaking.

title: Great to see
reviews: Living in Vancouver my entire life I take the city for granted.Lots of history to be seen in Gastown and  if you can book a tour I am sure you could learn lots about this area that I don't know. I think Forbidden Vancouver Walking Tours does one in the area (did another tour with them and it was great). Lots of great places to eat, party at night or shop during the day. Lots of specialty shops, so I am sure the prices reflect this, but also a lot of little hidden gems in this area.

title: Basic of Vancouver!
reviews: I live in Vancouver.So, I can see many visitors.If I want feel like a traveler on Europe I just going to the Gastown.And then I can see many restaurant and caffe.I love this place.I used go on driving, when rain come down!

title: A place for history
reviews: The place is very famous but I did not spend veey much time. The steam clock has been there foe over 100 years which makes me respect for it. I saw the clock puffed slowly at 3.45p.m. which is a beautiful scene.

title: Cool area. Touristy though
reviews: Lot's se see, eat and do in this area.  I think this is really grand central for Van tourism.  Which in this case isn't really a bad thing.

title: smallish but fun
reviews: Lots of nice restaurants and shops plus the Steamclock! Nice to visit during Christmas with all the lights

title: Great places to eat and shopping
reviews: Gastown was a close walk from my hotel near the convention center.  We went there to eat a couple of times and to just walk around and shop.  One lucky night we were there for a charity event involving choral competitions of Christmas music.

title: Most impressive and beautiful at night time
reviews: This relatively small part of the city is nice at day time, nice restaurants, lost of souvenir shots and most famous the steam clock.At night time it has a special flair. Very beautiful.

title: More Window Shopping
reviews: Finding parking can be tricky here - Jeff on a Bike - told us we could park in this one area - although the posted signs said commercial parking only. He informed us it was a holiday and all of the other people parking there were ok too - he said he would watch our car and come find us if there was trouble... We came him a Twoney and off we went...  We were coming out of Starbucks about an hour later and Jeff said he was looking for us - we had to hurry back as parking patrol was writing tickets...  My husband hurried back to the car just in time as to not get a ticket - some of the other parkers were not as lucky.  Of course Jeff wanted a little something to get something to eat as he had "saved us from getting ticketed!"  I reminded him we gave him $2 when we parked the car...

title: Expensive
reviews: It's worth seeing just because it's so old, but really just a bunch of expensive stores ready to gauge Patrons just because of the location.  Found Shoes that were $500-$700 (Really?)   Also, found more Street People than anywhere else.

title: Gastown
reviews: We just drove through the neighborhood briefly as we were pushed for time. Many quaint shops and restaurants we wished we could have explored and tried. If we ever get back to Vancouver, Gastown will be an area we will revisit!

title: Of course it's touristy. They go there for a reason
reviews: This is a fun and surprisingly trendy part of Vancouver. Great boutique shops plus lots of bars and restaurants, all inside well-restored vintage buildings from Vancouver's ancient past (about 80 years ago). I go to Vancouver every month or two and I always end up here for dinner or shopping.

title: Lovely people watching here.....Go.
reviews: Classic tourist stop....but worth your time. We tried excellent coffee, and killer bread, along with a baby boutique....Just and hour of messing around....got to learn a little Vancouver history.

title: Nice old houses
reviews: It is nice to stroll around the Gaston district. Nicely renovated houses and quite a lot speciality shops and of course several tourist shops. Good for lunch and dinner as well.

title: Another very unique part of Vancouver
reviews: There are a lot of fantastic restaurants and she's in this area also.  There is a huge clock right in the middle of gastown which is the older part of Vancouver

title: Trendy place with history
reviews: We visited Gastown in a rainy winter day. Still really enjoyed the shops and restaurants around.Very trendy place with homewear shops and the iconic Gas clock.  I guess that summer days would be even better to visit here.

title: The heart of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is more or less the centre of the city of Vancouver - it has many touristy/souvenir shops, bars and restaurants and at the heart is the famous Steam Powered Clock. It is a short walk from here (2/3 blocks) to the Lookout, Vancouver's panoramic 360 degree viewing platform. Ironically you can't see the steam clock from the Lookout as it is covered by the trees that line the streets in Gastown.

title: Interesting But Not Exciting
reviews: We walked to Gastown from the hotel as it was only a short distance. It seemed to me to be a little "touristy" and not very exciting. The steam powered clock is worth a look when it it chimes. Apart from that, bit of a yawn.

title: fun area!
reviews: my husband and I walked thru gastown a couple times during our 5-day stay in Vancouver.  plenty of cute shops, pubs/bars, and dispensaries (if you're interested).  very relaxed vibe, and there is an amazing taco place out there...I cant remember the name right now, but def go there! ;-)

title: Trendy
reviews: We were told to go to Granville island over Gastown. Did both and enjoyed Gastown more. Great vibe. Unique shops

title: Beautiful place
reviews: The architecture around gastown is so great, wander around the place and take it all in. Stop and visit some shops or bars to feel the great vibe this place has.

title: Must visit
reviews: Our favorite part of Vancouver. We stayed near Canada Place, lots of business folks around. Gastown has shops, restaurants, etc. without all the convention traffic. Don't miss it!

title: Gas town a must when visiting Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is a few block area that has retained a unique flair. Inviting stores that present northwest coast art and artifacts, local clothing designers and great tourist souvenirs flanked by wonderful restaurants and a lively pub. Public transportation is at the door and it is an area that is easy to walk.

title: Very unique area of the city.
reviews: Very nice to be able to walk around and see many unique "one of' stores and restaurants. There are too many good places to choose from for a meal.

title: see the clock
reviews: this is a great part of revitalized and refurbished Vancouver with neat art galleries and wonderful shopping  and touristy things too,  must see the gas clock  look it up  great discount shopping too.

title: The touristiest part but still OK
reviews: Lots of people, lots of shopping, lots of eating - a true tourist trap, but still fairly nice. Strolling through shouldn't be missed, not the clock either :)

title: Romantic walk and nice shops
reviews: Whenever you are feeling for a romantic walk around, this area is perfect to do so. Nice shops to visit, nice places to have a bite. or have a drink. Do not miss the Whistling Clock with music and smoke on a corner of the main street. And you can buy wine at liquor store to take-home afterward...

title: Edgy, fun, creative
reviews: From the architecture, to the edgy creative shopping (no boring chain stores here!) featuring local designers, to the fantastic selection of food - this neighborhood is the cool, edgy, trendy place in Vancouver as opposed to the hiptsters of Main street, the psuedo-hippies of Kitsilano and the beautiful people of Yaletown.  As close to avante-garde as Vancouver comes.

title: Worth a visit
reviews: Such a cool and hip spot within downtown Vancouver.  There are so many little shops and restaurant and it looks like a movie set.  Great spot to see some sites.

title: Place to visit including the Steam Clock
reviews: Lots of history in the area with a large choices of eating and other stores. The steam clock is a marvel (for those who marvel at such things); be there at the hour "chime". Checkout how many times it "strikes" as we think it blew 13 times at 11am!

title: Blend of the Old and New
reviews: I like walking through Gastown, watch the steam-clock, browse around the souvenier shops, and end up sitting in a cafe. Its a great pleasure when the weather is good and people flock there. There are a lot of shops and also eateries .

title: Has a distinctive smelll and feeling of old
reviews: Possibly the most charming district of Downtown Vancouver, our walk around Gastown definitely give us a feeling of old charm with some wonderful quirky items on display specifically the Steam Clock

title: A Charm of It's Own
reviews: I meet my daughter in Gastown once a month.  It has a charm all of it's own! Always lots of hustle and bustle, lots of tourists and many great places to eat and drink.  And shopping...some quaint shops, high end shops, designer shops and of course, Canadiana and souvenir shops.  The steam clock is a hit, fun to people watch from Water St. Caf√©. Even though I work in downtown Vancouver, it always feel like a special day when I go to Gastown!

title: Kind of bohemian area. Some decent shops and coffee bars.
reviews: An old town like setting.  Tourist oriented.  Some panhandlers and street people there, but they were well behaved.

title: Touristy area in Vancouver
reviews: Gastown has a nice feel to it with its cobblestone streets and lampposts. It is only a block from the Vancouver port where the cruise ships dock in the downtown Vancouver area. It is full of souvenir shops and restaurants. The famous steam clock is there as well for free pics and viewing. There are some homeless on this street but they are harmless. I wouldn't let that stop you from seeing this area. I work in this area.

title: It has Everything
reviews: Amazing shopping and food area ‚Äì can't figure out the big deal about the steam clock but it certainly seems to be a tourist attraction ‚Äì really enjoyed eating at the flying pig!

title: Must see and easy
reviews: Go see the steam clock as well as the nice little shops and restaurants around the area. Very Kincaide like downtownish area

title: Beautiful Gastown
reviews: An excellent place to visit. Was walking distance from our hotel so walked there for meals. Lots of nice souvenir shops and nice restaurants. It's very much a tourist area but well worth going to.

title: Nightlife and shopping
reviews: Gaston unique to Vancouver.  An older part of town that has been renovated into restaurants and bars with some nice shopping thrown in for good measure.  The sites include an antique steam powered clock and an interesting statue of gassy Jack.  Did I mention restaurants and bars - plenty to suit most any taste.

title: My Gastown Experience
reviews: The very economical ($2.75 (CAD) Skytrain to get there. The Waterfront Station is merely 3 minutes away from Water Street. Gastown is full of non-traditional cookie cutter shops and restaurants. I'd ended up buying souvenirs and eating at the Flying Pig. What a wonderful experience.Make sure you see the Gassy Jack Statue and the Steam Clock!

title: Vancouver's #2 Tourist Zone
reviews: Gas Town is named after a local drunk and saloon owner nicknamed "Gassy" Jack for his flatulent nature, and it was the scummy end of the city until they cleaned it up 25-30 years ago. Water St. is the main thoroughfare lined with bars, restaurants, souvenir shops and many stores, some quite funky and some quite pricey. It's right downtown and it's considered one of the entertainment districts, Downtown Vancouver has 4 of these. Gastown runs parallel to Cordova street from 1 block East of the SeaBus/Skytrain Station and down towards Carrall St. where there is a round, cobblestoned plaza and more drinking establishments to the South. Beyond that you enter the lower bowels of this city, full of druggies, hookers, weirdos and petty thieves all the way to Main St. (and beyond) at the North end of Chinatown. Surprisingly, it's quite safe and the sights are quite shocking at times. Check out the Steam Clock, dine on expensive, day-old pasta at the Old Spaghetti Factory, have a drink at the Blarney Stone Irish Pub and don't forget the camera.

title: One of the big attractions in Vancouver has worlds only working Steam Clock with Westminster Chimes.
reviews: I had to wait around till the top of the hour to hear the Westminster Chimes blown in steam whistles. Lots of neat little shops and eateries in Gastown as well, a really nice attraction.

title: Day tour
reviews: I always love Gastown! Everytime I go there, it's seems like I'm in different era or place that I really love. Lots of good restaurants and different shops that I really like. Sometime I just go there to have some coffee and relax and enjoy the ambiance.

title: It'll take 10minutes, but skip it anyways
reviews: Homeless everywhere. All the shops are basically the same Korean/Chinese run tourist traps with all the same merchandise. Streets were dirty and we felt unsafe in the middle of the day! I suggest, catch a taxi to take a picture with the steam clock and then get out of there!

title: The funkiest place to be!!
reviews: I love Gastown its alive and kicking.  Classy eateries and high octane bars.  The architecture is spectacular.  Its safe and friendly place to spend money and enjoy time simply watching the people walk bye.  I Love it !!!

title: Historic Area with Good Restaurants
reviews: I loved this area. The brick buildings are so pretty, and there are a ton of good restaurants in the area.

title: Gassy Jack and the steam clock
reviews: Interesting place, easy to walk around and plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. Novelties such as the Gassy Jack statue and a steam powered clock! Plan your route if traveling in on foot, make sure you avoid East Hastings as this street/area has hundreds of homeless people, drunks and druggies (sad really) and is best to avoid

title: Not-To-Miss While in Vancouver
reviews: Even though Vancouver has a lot of other wonderful sightseeing places such as the Stanley Park, the Robson Street and Canada Place... Gastown was my absolute favourite. It's quaint and colourful and trendy, offering terraces and cute shops and a unique, older and charming buildings frontage. Walking through, all the way, was an absolute delight. This is where one can also see (and listen to) the Steam Clock, a nice piece of history and engineering, located somewhere midway on Water Street. The moving mechanism inside is visible through its glass enclosure and the clock itself stands proud proof of the city's past.

title: Fun place to visit
reviews: The Gastown area of Vancouver provides you with some great places to shop and eat. Always make sure you check with someone local to ensure you don't venture into the wrong areas,

title: Love it
reviews: Gastown is in kind of a sketchy area of downtown Vancouver.....but as long as you are not there in the wee hours of the morning there are lots of people about..... and at no time did I feel unsafe. There is a terrific selection of great restaurants and Bars......well worth the visit.

title: Must go
reviews: This is one of the place my friends and I got visit when we were in Vancouver. I gave 5 stars here not because of the historical facts (which are nice) or because of the expensive souvenirs lol but because of the nice bars we found there. They have cheap beer and cool places. Besides, it is near Canada Place and if you're there for Canada Day, you can enjoy the beer in one of the Gastown bars and then you just walk a few blocks when enjoy the fireworks.

title: Great looking streets - a bit over-priced
reviews: The streets have a classic look and the steam-clock completes this street with an old-timey feel. However the bars and shops of the area are a bit pricey.

title: Great area.
reviews: This is a great area in a great city, there are numerous wonderful eateries and the area is very close to the departure docks for the ocean cruises.

title: Had a good time there and it has a very nice environment.
reviews: Did a photo shoot in Canada with my friend and we spent some time in Gastown and had a good time, plenty of local color and restaurants.

title: It's OK
reviews: It's just a small lane. But I guess we went in the day so there wasn't much happening. And the Steam Clock was not there as it was sent away for maintenance. What was funny was that a few groups of tourists still took pictures of where the clock was supposed to stand, although covered by cloth :) Across the street where the clock stands there is a $2 store  (gotta cross a wide traffic light). Many things in there worth buying. We bought many snacks from here,especially the maple syrup cookies. They were very good.

title: meh
reviews: nice area of town if your extremely rich! A lot of the shops have some very interesting things in them, but the majority of the place is way over prices. Its not a place for the average person. The steam whistle is cool

title: A must see in Vancouver
reviews: Old parts of cities are usually interesting for tourists. This one is no exception: it feels local, but you can also clearly tell its a hipster/young area. Many cool bars.

title: Nice to walk around, shop, eat.
reviews: it's a nice and trendy neighbourhood, good for people watching, shopping, eating and the steam clock is in the main street of gas town. I was there for about an hour and it was relaxing.

title: Overrated
reviews: For me (a budget friendly gal) this was a bit overrated. The souvenir shops were fun and there were a few items on sale, but most of the shops seemed gentrified and overpriced.  Same for the restaurants. If you're a history buff this place is great for historic walks and eating and shopping.

title: The torrential rain didn't help
reviews: We generally had a bad time in Vancouver, from the taxi to the hotel to the horrid rainfall on our first day, so to say that Gastown was a letdown could be too much, as we darted in and out of shops attempting to keep our wet cold bodies a little more comfortable. The clock was much smaller and less impressive than you think, but it's still a pretty cool thing to see when you know how it works.

title: Great Walking
reviews: made for a great afternoon to walk around and visit the many shops, you might walk into some unsavoury areas if you go a bit off the path, but hey who doesn't need a little bit of adventure and some cheap native cigarettes in their life??

title: A trendy self-conratulatory district with a few highlights
reviews: Gastown sounds cools and has a cool history and the steam clock is delightful and it's on the edge of homelessness and shopping carts and full of the chest-heave of gentrification as redemption, etc. blahblahblah and while it is a pleasant way and place to shop and wander for a while, it's website claim to be "the epicenter of independent deisgn, culture, food and fashion" strikes me as both grandiose and silly. Like in most tourist districts the too-many souvenir shops all have essentially the same stuff and the only advantage of visiting more than one is to possibly save a few bucks on the same merchandise. Nonetheless, there are some nice fine art galleries and public houses and coffee shops, so if you enjoy a leisurely stroll through a part of town that is more focused on being a shopping district than a historic district, which is to say if you enjoy shopping in an area that isn't a cookie-cuttered mall, you'll enjoy Gastown. We did. Possibly because we spent more on drinks than souvenirs.

title: Gastown has it all
reviews: Every time I visit Gastown there is something new and usually wonderful to experience. It has changed so much in the past few decade, all good. Water Street was once full of tacky tourist shops, and thankfully replaced by terrific clothing stores with many local designers. Gastown is also the best place in town to dine, diverse selection of restaurants, from budget to mid-range. And a great place just to stroll with the dog.

title: Old-time quirkness
reviews: One of the oldest part of downtown Vancouver, Gastown is also the coolest part that you should check out! Named after a "Gassy" man who opened the salon here that sparked the area's growth, this neighborhood is a quirky, nostalgic view either day or night. This area also has some cool restaurants and shops to check out so that can be also an incentive to go, but no matter what, you should definitely check out the iconic steam clock that is the symbol of Gastown. Maybe if you are lucky or timed right, you will see it tote its steam!Anyway, parking can be a logistic (and pricy) nightmare so consider using public transportation but definitely make your way to check this old-time downtown out!

title: Think I missed something
reviews: I think Gastown wasn't really for me or I just don't understand the hype.  Went to Gastown but it was mostly just souvenir shops and restaurants.  It wasn't for me.  I think if I would've had a guided tour I would've gotten more out of it.

title: Variety of shops is amazing
reviews: Wander these streets and experience products and artwork Made in Canada.  We even enjoyed the best crepes at Chou Chous a food truck. Eyeland Frameworks is a must stop if you want custom eyewear.

title: Get a guide
reviews: To appreciate Gastown, I would recommend using a local guide. There is quite a deal of history to embellish this experience. If you just go to look, you will miss a lot.

title: Not What We Expected
reviews: Cab driver who picked us up from the airport recommended Gastown so we gave it a go. It is basically one street of shops, many of them overpriced, and a clock. We accidently strayed from the main street and were thrust into a scene from a futuristic disaster movie. We were accosted by beggars, had to step over people lying in the streets and saw lots of money changing hands for what we assumed were drugs. One street in particular was the trading centre for all the homeless, drug addicts and alcoholics. It looked like a dump. Police were there arresting one man, while all the underworld goings on continued around them. It was scary stuff. The few shops and eateries in the main street did not make up for it. Vancouver seems to have a very high tolerance of these people, but it really detracts from what should be a beautiful historic section of the city.

title: Disapoining
reviews: Struggling to remain as a tourist attraction but dirty and shows no real attempts to clean the area.

title: Love Gastown
reviews: Gastown has so much to see.  Just strolling the streets is enjoyable.  many little shops and restaurants and the steam clock.  Have been there twice and liked it more the second time.

title: spend a couple of hours
reviews: We went to the Inuit Gallery and thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful artwork.  There are many small shops and boutiques as well as places to grab a bite.  Check out the old train station.

title: OOT and Aboot
reviews: This charming area of Vancouver is part of the city tour or the hop-on hop-off bus. You will see a statue of the founder of Gastown. Do some shopping. Have a bite to eat. And, especially take photo opportunities next to the gas clock.

title: The Clock!!
reviews: My hostel was in gastown the the town is just perfect for shopping. You can shop in very cheap prices.. There are so many great stores. Also the clock!! Be around that clock at certain every hour beginning. It'll whistle. :D You can rest in cafes around the town.

title: Back to the future.
reviews: This area of the city is where many of the old warehouses and merchant houses previously plied their trade. Whilst retaining their original exteriors, the majority of the buildings have now been converted to more modern uses. Cafes, boutiques, shops  and bars abound, all unique. Many of the buildings have plaques indicating their historical significance and providing a brief history. As a contrast to the more modern city center, this area is worth a walk around to soak in the atmosphere and enjoy the uniqueness.

title: Gastown rocks!
reviews: Visiting for the first in years, my wife and I were stunned at how Gastown has matured into a world class destination. Especially around Gassy Jacks statue, there is a multitude of excellent stores, amazing restaurants, and wonderful welcoming folk everywhere you turn. We have returned and will continue to do so - great place.

title: Happening place!
reviews: Upbeat, modern, happening place to be. Gastro-pub dining for hipsters, residents and tourists alike. A bit of everything for everyone at different price levels. Cool energy and great patios everywhere. Very busy and sometimes difficult to get a table. Just walk around, you'll find something you like. Different from the classic downtown area, yet still affluent. A cool-type of affluent though...

title: Great for shopping and bar hoping
reviews: Enjoyed our walk into Gastown. Many great little shops and taverns to visit. I was intrigued by the steam clock and would have loved to stay and watch it "go off".

title: Gorgeous
