reviews: this is a must see, especially beautiful lit up in the winter's evening.   good idea to book a dinner reservation as our family of five found it hard to rock up and get a table.

title: Restaurants, shopping and that clock
reviews: I like this place. It borders on east Hastings which is a stark contrast to the many quaint shops and restaurants in Gastown. It is a bit touristy, with its requisit T shirt and souvenir stores but there are many stores offering unique items and art. There is a nice selection of restaurants if you are hungry. And yes, there is that clock which seems to be one of the attractions one must see.

title: Hop on hop off bus
reviews: We took the hop off hop on bus and toured Vancouver, it was Awesome!The bus driver was very nice and knowledgeable

title: Fun Place to Stroll Around
reviews: Strolling around the Gastown area provides one with a visual feast.  The restaurants, bars, clothing stores and other shops are worth a close look.  The district is historic and well-frequented by visitors and locals alike.  This is a great place for people-watching.

title: Contrast between richesse and poverty
reviews: We visited Gastown as part of a Cycle City Tours bicycle tour. The area, really mostly Waters street between hotel l'Europe en the Harbour centre, has been nicely gentrified. After it became clear it would not be sacrificed to develop a highway. Stark contrast with Hastings street just two blocks south, where hundreds of homeless people live.

title: Pleasant part of the city
reviews: The most typical part of Vancouver, small restaurants, small bars, good souvenir shops, very human part of the city without all the modern skyscapers

title: Gastown
reviews: amazing shopping so much to see after shopping lots of different shops to look at, you can walk to Vancouver Lookout

title: One of my favorite spots in Vancouver!
reviews: Visited Gastown at night and it was absolutely beautiful!  A nice spot for an evening walk with lights in the trees along the street and colorful lighting on the buildings and a variety of shops and restaurants.  The steam clock was also brightly lit and a great photo backdrop!

title: Nice street to walk through
reviews: A forgotten plca that starts to revive. From nice boutiques to old fashioned shops. It's all there to see

title: Love it!
reviews: This is the Soho of Vancouver. Trendy, chick, brownstone buildings with classic beginning of the century buildings. Checkout the steam clock, powered by steam. Great restaurants, and boutiques.

title: Window shopping
reviews: Gastown has a historic heart but the modern day version is all about shopping; either spending your tourist dollars or browsing the windows and flying the breeze (relaxing). It's worth a few hours to see the tat being sold, with the odd gem selling really good souvenirs.

title: Lots of shops
reviews: It's well worth the stroll down the street to see it all.  I found that it's becoming geared more toward the tourists with several of the shops carrying the same "Canada" souvenier clothing and keepsakes.  It's still an interesting place all the same.

title: Love the details
reviews: Really enjoyed walking through this area of town, especially in the evening.  The details like the cobblestone streets are really neat. The stores were okay. Could have used a greater variety of restaurants.

title: Great shopping
reviews: Great place to walk around.  So many cafes & shops.  The Steam clock is worth waiting around to see it go off on the hour.  Beautiful hanging baskets everywhere.  Go up some of the alleyways also as there are some really nice little shops to explore also

title: Good place to visit and check out but saturated with homeless people
reviews: Really cool area to check out, lots of different pubs, stores, etc. But it does have a really high population of homeless people so it can make people a little uncomfortable but that shouldn't stop you from checking out the area!

title: Beautiful place!
reviews: We didn't know about this place and stumble upon it getting lunch. WHAT A BEAUTIFUL PLACE!!! Had lunch at the Old Spaghetti Factory. Walked around. Saw ships leaving. Really pretty place!

title: Cute, fun area
reviews: The cobblestone streets and numerous eateries and shops make it a great place for both tourists looking for souvenirs and dinner and locals. It is a great place to walk around if you're visiting Vancouver.

title: Area is changing...much safer than previous years
reviews: Strolled through this area and had lunch.  Lots of eateries and coffee places.  Lots of shops to attract tourists and a great little shop for bc jade.  Worth spending some time in this part of Vancouver.

title: Vancouver Trip Fall 2015
reviews: Visited the Souvenir Shops, lots of great pubs, cobblestone paths are really nice. The Steam clock is very unique.

title: Interesting area to explore
reviews: This area has many shops and restaurants.  The architecture is  interesting. It's a fun area to explore.

title: Interesting shops and food
reviews: Tourist central in Vancouver with lots of quirky shops, tourist shops, and odd clothing. The area is safe and easy to access, but unfortunately dotted with many homeless and drug addicts. Quite sad really. Walk with items protected.

title: A night out on the tiles with the boys in Gastown
reviews: I had a surprise visit from number one son who is a captain pilot with a private airline from overseas. He and his crew had a few days off before returning. He suggested a visit to Gastown, as his crew and never been there and I had been there a couple of years ago. So off we went and parked the car rental in nearby parking,I am partially disabled and we used my special parking pass and got a space very close  to two well known pubs we were to visit. We choose "Steam Works" for a late afternoon snack lunch which was very substantial,great service,good pub food and well filled . The main eating area was at a lower level than the sidewalk and I had to enter carefully as the steps were everywhere with handrails,but was enjoyable.My son's crew wanted to see the Blue Jays baseball final game on Sports TV. So off we walked past the famous Steam Clock on the sidewalk taking pictures like every tourist does,many tourists were there at the same time as us. After about one block walk we reached a another well known pub,'The Lamplighter' also a restaurant and bar,but with a great sports TV area with many TV sets at different heights and sizes,We managed get to a good seat,using me as a pawn to get a good spot. The boys saw the baseball game and  had a few drinks and enjoyed the atmosphere which was electric.It should be noted that the Gastown area has many good restaurants,pubs,bars,cafes,tourist type shops and just a fun area to walk through. We finished our visit and on leaving  I did not notice the change in level using badly lit steps and fell into the arms of a guy and his gal to end our evening in a blaze of glory. Gastown is a definite must for a tourist to visit and spend a few dollars and is near the convention centre and waterfront area of Vancouver City

title: Step back in time
reviews: Older part of Vancouver with shops, restaurants and the Steam clock which is a definite must see.Find out why it is called Gastown by visiting the pub with the statue outside.

title: Shopping trip and walk through Gastown
reviews: After a walk near False Creek, we drove and parked in Gastown. This is a fantastic must visit for out of town Vancouver visitors. In the center of this area is a statue of Gassy Jack and an unbelievable steam operated clock that you must see and hear. We visited a few great shops: Hudson Bay, Hills Native Art, and Rogers Chocolate( we buy their chocolate every year for our East Tennessee friends). I highly recommend any Vancouver visitor to spend an hour or two in this area.

title: Getting 'sketchy'
reviews: Gastown is nice with its historical buildings, some nice restaurants and various bars and stores. However, on this last visit we found it to be less desirable than in the past. There are a lot more homeless begging and high who are hanging around the sidewalks and on the benches. Not a place I would want to walk alone in the evening. The steam clock is still there and nice to see it go off!

title: Don't Bother
reviews: Contrary to many reviews we found it seedy, overrated, underwhelming, full of beggars (some aggressive and persistent) and down-and-outers and I would expect drug dealers as well. Didn‚Äôt feel safe or comfortable. It did have some character but overwhelmed by poor points. Good Points ‚Äì Steam Clock and Steamworks Brewing Co which was interesting and a good place to eat. Not at all impressed, would not go back.

title: Old school and full of life
reviews: Lots of history here, and lots of places are built around the old style. Plus most of the building around here are heritage or old enough to be that.

title: Lots too eat
reviews: Great food and atmosphere in Gastown.  I always have a great time grabbing dinner in this area.  I would suggest it as the first stop on your night on the town.

title: Worth a Visit
reviews: The Gastown area is worth spending some browsing time. There are many and varied shops and restaurants and the historic character of the area makes for an interesting few hours. The steam clock attracts the crowds when it lets off its steam on the hour.

title: Not my sort of place
reviews: I think this is an important place to visit as it shows the more historical side of Vancouver with its ethnic diversity. But altho  it had an authentic feel, for me it felt too uncomfortable and just a bit sleazy.

title: A little gruby
reviews: We walked around gas town before joining our cruise  ship . I'm glad we dident make a special journey to visit the area as we found it dirty and there were a lot of beggars around .

title: Nicest part of Vancouver for food and restaurants
reviews: Really nice neighbourhood in Vancouver. Go there for the coolest (or hipster) restaurants and craft beers.

title: Old buildings, ocean views, sidewalk eaters
reviews: Many great restaurants, like the Steam Boat Pub, many gift shops, but building's should look more attractive with street entertainment like San Francisco. Gets a little dark, cool if sun is not shining on the street. Pan Handling should not be allowed! But near the cruise docks, North Shore ferry and Heli pad. Definitely worth the walk or visit. Softsand-13.

title: great way to spend a day & night
reviews: As you leave Chinatown you enter Gastown. So many different sights to see and places to enjoy a drink and then a meal. The Black Frog or the Steamworks are both great pubs  A multiple of choices the eat at, El Porto is a great fine dining restaurant, recommend reservations. Take the whole day for Gastown, you will need it.

title: Nice and interesting
reviews: It's nice to walk around see the place, the restaurants, cafes, the steam clock and the people around you

title: Watch out for beggars
reviews: The beggars have moved in and are there in plenty at night.  The cobblestones are really just 20th century concrete colored pavers.  The street lights look great plus have the lovely colourful hanging baskets.  not as many restaurants as we thought there would be although the very popular Steamworks Brewing Company supplied a great meal at reasonable prices.

title: Old beauty
reviews: This old part of Vancouver has maintained its brick buildings well with fun tourist shops.  Felt safe and clean, even with street people around.

title: Nice, but not so nice
reviews: This area is on the Hop on Hop off schedule and very convenient to shops and resturants.  All that I visited where very nice, but what made the area awful were the homeless people.  While eating my lunch at a patio resturant, two men stood within 3 ft of me and begged for my lunch, this was very uncomfortable.  While walking around the different shops I was approached by over a dozen people asking for money, one actually threw her cup at me.  Definitely will not be back.

title: Great find
reviews: Discovered Gastown as a result of visit the restaurant The Flying Pig.  Gastown was a great find and very enjoyable to walk around. Yes it has its fair share of tourist shops, but the quaint setting (particularly in the early evening and the variety of dinning options makes it a must visit.  Yaletown has a bigger restaurant selection, but Gastown's main street creates the feel of a small European town.

title: Fell in love with Gastown
reviews: I wasn't  sure what to expect, but we had been told to go there when we were in Vancouver. Wow, some of the best food can be found here. There are also several places to purchase souvenirs at reasonable prices. We were there at the beginning of fall and it is just so pretty. I thought Gastown was all about the clock, but I was wrong, it is so much more.  Gastown is unique, beautiful and a must see for everyone, you will spend hours looking at the many little shops, drinking coffee, eating some amazingly good food and just enjoying all this area has to offer.

title: A trendy place to shop,eat or just meander
reviews: This is one of the older parts of Vancouver and takes it's from a guy who,in order to get a saloon built,offered the workers all the whiskey they could drink. He had his saloon in 24 hrs. His nickname was 'gassy '  hence the town name. There is a statue of him and his barrel featured in the main street. There are lots of eateries and funky shops. The seamier side of life is also evident in the number of homeless people scattered about.A big attraction is the steam clock designed and built by Robert Saunders .It looks like a big grandfather clock and tho' once driven by steam now relies on electricity .The 'steamy' Big Ben chimes are quite amusing and the belching steam make it look authentic.

title: Great little neighborhood
reviews: Very quant, great cafes and cobble stone streets. What is not to love? The steaming clock is just another charming site.

title: living right on Water street means I rarely use the car. Walking everywhere. tons of fun unique places to grab foodrants
reviews: Walking is the way to go. Dip in and out of shops and when you're hungry there are dozens of choices. No Burger King or Mcd's. Much better Soup, sandwich shops, wraps and wood fired pizza, and the best craft beers anywhere!!Very safe. Just avoid East Hastings. I have lived here for years and the homeless don't bother you. They know better. The police are everywhere and it is very safe. Great shops for unique clothes. Well made and trendy. You can always find a souvenir but really it is soooooo much more!! Friday and Saturday nights the bars are packed so come early or be ready to tip the doorman.

title: Steamclock
reviews: Only thing to see is steam clock and lots of over priced tourist shops.  Quite a trendy place for food and bars but not much else going on there. Wouldn't recommend as a place to go.

title: Great artsy street with steam clock
reviews: Gastown is pretty much a nice artsy street with the operating steam clock few blocks down. It has very unique and reasonably priced jewelry and souvenir shops.

title: Very cool... great for souvenirs
reviews: Gastown was a lot of fun to walk around. I actually made two stops into Gastown during my trip. If you are looking for cheesy souvenirs it is for sure the place to go! That is why I made my second trip was to do some shopping. Michelle's in Gastown was actually my favorite shop. They had everything you could want. The Steam Clock is very cool and you can hear it all over Gastown. I would suggest for people to make the trip into Gastown you have to at least see the clock and get some shopping done!

title: Crack Heads roaming the street
reviews: Gastown better clean itself up.  We were confronted several times by wide glassy eyed 20 somethings begging for money.  Is losing it's charm with me.  I no longer have a desire to come back here.

title: The area to eat
reviews: A beautiful area with flowers everywhere. A very pleasant place to stroll around and have a coffee or lunch. Very busy at the weekend. Make sure you watch the big clock as it is the main attraction. Food is good too. We had a progressive lunch across three cafes.

title: A must Visit
reviews: A great place to walk around.Excellent shopping and marvellous eateries .The most wonderful bakery's I have been in.

title: A Lively Place to Visit
reviews: Although Gastown is a tourist trap it is a lot of fun with a wide variety of shopping and restaurants.  There is a wonderful steam clock that sounds every 15 minutes and charms and fascinates kids!

title: Shopping
reviews: Not my favorite place in Vancouver. If you have limited time, i would skip it. East Hastings street iis near here and is to be avoided as it has alot of drug addicts

title: Nice cobble stone streets area
reviews: Nice cobblestone street end area with trendy restaurants and stores.  The stores seemed a bit more pricey this time around but I didn't go to shop. Just to eat and wander around.  I like the lighting.  Cute little place for a stroll.

title: Meals...
reviews: There were SO many restaurants and cuisines to choose from in this area.  We were often here "just to eat".  It was especially nice to see the clock toot and spew steam too!

title: Gastown - has potential
reviews: This is the original area of Vancouver & has potential to be a really nice area to visit. But apart from the clock & a few nice shops & cafes it's nothing much really.

title: Cute neighborhood
reviews: I love to stroll down the streets of Gastown at night. Cute cobble stone streets and beautiful streetlamps as well as the trees are lit up which just adds to the charm. One of my favourite spots in all of vancouver.

title: Cool shops and food
reviews: This area can be a little rough if you step out of the tourist parts but full of funky Canadian designers and hard to find shopping that is actually from Canada.

title: Quaint Historic Precinct
reviews: This is such a pleasant tourist precinct to stroll, take in and admire the historic buildings along the beautiful tree lined vista and admire the historic Gas Clock. There are so many restaurants and coffee shops to choose for a relaxing meal. I visited here in 2012 also and would do so again.

title: Fun stroll in Gastown
reviews: Great little stores and local designer boutiques! Lots of cafes and bars for people watching! Could easily spend days here!

title: A bit overrated
reviews: If you have never been to Vancouver,  by all means, walk through Gastown. Nothing much to see, simply lovely walk.The only attraction is the Steam Clock, it's nice to hear it 'singing' We went there in the early evening and the place was swarming with beggars.Not just sitting there but pestering the people walking by.Not very pleasant experience

title: Tourist area for sure
reviews: If you are looking for souvenirs and typical tourist fare, this is the place.   We actually enjoyed Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Classical Chinese Garden much more.

title: Nice and cozy!
reviews: Nice place, where you can breath the past. Houses, colors, lights on the trees, the steam clock... It really deserve a stop and a picture, one by day and one by night. Also good for local souvenirs and a quick bite.

title: My kind a Place
reviews: This i think is the hipster area of Vancouver with the film university in the middle and really good restaurants around. This is a must visit to chill and relax.

title: Didn't Live Up to Hype
reviews: This area is ready for another facelift. First time in Vancouver and have always heard how great Gastown area was. While it definitely has character it also has a grimy seediness that worsens at night once most of the many tourist souvenir gift shops close and the bar crowds rev up. We did venture to a restaurant there the first night but only went to the area during the daylight the rest of the week.

title: Loved going there.
reviews: Arrived in the evening looking for a place to eat. Wonderful area, small shops many bars and some restaurants. There is a car park but we managed to find a place on the street (with a meter and many coins). Try and find the gas clock on the hour - it gives a little show.

title: Walking tour
reviews: Gas town has wonderful stores and restaurants . Walking is the way to see everything .trenday little shops and pubs plus high end clothing and furniture

title: Good to visit
reviews: We came upon the amazing clock in Gas town.  It is run on gas and  strikes on the 1/4 hour.  Some really nice shops, cafes and restaurants in this area too.

title: Very Fun
reviews: If you are visiting YVR, you have to visit Gastown. Quaint shops, cafes, unique ambience make for a very pleasant visit.

title: It was small
reviews: The steam clock was really cool. It look like alot of stores closed early and the few Bars that were open had a line. The maple pops were really good.

title: Great bars
reviews: Some great bars and restaurants in the area, and of course the smoking clock is a must see.  Shame we're not here longer as would certainly have visited in the evening.

title: Loved it.
reviews: After spending a couple of hours in Stanley Park, we then walked back to the area of Gastown.  We saw the steam clock and walked along the main streets to see the wonderful shops and original commercial buildings.  We stopped often to read the historic descriptions of the buildings and were very impressed at the way Gastown has been restored to reflect how the old city of Vancouver must have looked as it was growing into a major port city.  Although many of the stores were designed to attract tourists, there were a number of very unique stores selling unique items.  Unable to buy anything because of luggage and weight restrictions, I nonetheless loved walking through this area.  One could spend a great deal of time just browsing in the antique stores.  We suggest that one sees Gastown as a separate attraction on a separate day, and not after hours spent walking through Stanley Park.

title: Overrated!
reviews: Go pass gas town one to many blocks and you will end up in the worst parks of Vanocuver that you really do NOT want to see.There are some shops, restaurants, steam clock, cobble stone for window shopping, but thats really it. Would rather spend my time near the sea wall and in Coal harbor.

title: Place to Visit any time of the year !
reviews: Unique climate of this street attract people from around the world,to shop here , dine here or enjoy  walk. The steam clock the most photographed clock in the world is located on this street.

title: Nice atmosphere, Restaurants
reviews: Go at night. It's so pretty. Take a nice, romantic walk through Gastown on your way to a restaurant.We also went during the day, and felt it was just so much better at night.

title: Nothing special
reviews: I wouldn't say this is an attraction. We walked over from our hotel and couldn't even tell where Gastown began. Also it was hard to find a good restaurant

title: Iconic
reviews: This is a must see the old town of Vancouver with the gas clock, amazing. streets and shops all quaint original takes you back in time. so worth a visit.

title: Fabulous
reviews: Went to Gas town in the daytime and evening too.  Loads to see places to shop eat and of course the Steam Clock.

title: Gentrified Area Bordering Decay
reviews: Gastown is worth a visit, with its well-maintained streets. Be careful not to venture too far to the east, where the social and economic decline is abrupt.

title: beautiful
reviews: The oldest part of the town, so beautiful! especially at night, when all the lights are burning *.*definitely a must-see in Vancouver

title: all in walking distance
reviews: there are many souvenir shops where one can take memories of Canada. also one must look at the steam clock besides the road, people watch it at the stroke of every hour as steam comes out and there is nice sound .

title: Interesting and historical place
reviews: My wife and I were here with another couple, wandering around Chinatown, Canada Place, and Gastown.  It has historical places that are interesting.Lots of interesting shops here, carrying Canadian products including RCMP store. Of course, the Gassy Jack statue and Steam Clock are "must-see" attractions.

title: Nice area
reviews: Nice and cosy area of Vancouver, was there during the day, but can imagine it being really nice in the evening.

title: A must-do in Vancouver
reviews: Gastown is easy to reach by foot or public transit and is worth the trip. Lots of interesting shops and restaurants/coffee houses. Beautiful old streetlamps and cobblestone roads add to the charm and of course, the clock.

title: Good to drink wishes and beer
reviews: There are many good bars at This area you can drink wishes and beer . Prices are reasonable the problem is This area is not as Clean as the othe sides of the city.

title: Vancouver Must See
reviews: You can't visit Vancouver without checking out Gastown. This historic area is filled with great restaurants  and interesting stores. If you like historical old towns, this is the place for you.

title: Gassy Jack Steam Clock
reviews: As Seattle‚Äôs Pioneer Park is the site of the original settlement, Gastown is Vancouver‚Äôs place of origin, named for John ‚ÄúGassy Jack‚Äù Deighton (1830‚Äì1875). Born in Hull, England, Deighton worked a California gold mine, until 1858. Unsuccessful in the Canadian gold rush, he opened the popular Globe Saloon (and other subsequent bars), and earned the nickname Gassy Jack, thus Gastown became known are the area around Gassy‚Äôs bar. Established in the Victorian era, electric streetlights now resemble the multi-globe lamps operated by‚Ä¶um, gas. Even the iconic Steam Clock that whistles every 15 minutes is operated by gas.In 1886 the Great Vancouver Fire destroyed all but two buildings, but the newly incorporated city of Vancouver rebuilt. Predictably, as with all original settlements, the area known as Gastown devolved into a seedy area. A restoration and regentrification period began in the 1960s, preserving much of the Victorian flavor of Gastown. All that said, this area is an excellent daylong adventure. Enjoy!

title: A great corner of the city!
reviews: This is a very special part of vancouver, and I advise all people to visit....but only at night!. Less tourists, and much more of a vibe. Great restaurants, clubs, and a more local vibe than the daytime. Of course the shops arent open so if you like to shop, there are some nice art galleries and stores you can cruise during the daytime. But the tourists are in abundance. So if thats not your thing, wait till the sun goes down!  This part of the city also have some great breakfast and weekend brunch spots! Dont discount it if some streets look sketchy. Its a great place to hang out and its unique to the city!

title: Very enjoyable
reviews: This is the most historic area in Vancouver and we had a great time walking around and exploring. Make sure you spend the time and visit the steam powered clock.

title: Nothing special except the clock
reviews: The area has deteriorated in recent years. The steam clock us still beautiful. Good pace to walk through but we did not find much to do there.

title: Steam driven clock the highlight
reviews: This clock plays whistles each 15 minutes getting longer at each quarter until the full tune on the hour. The street is full of restaurants and souvenier shops.

title: a walk through Gastown
reviews: Walking through Gastown would be a wonderful way to spend several hours during the day.  The streetlights are beautiful....all round, white globes on wrought iron poles.  There are many shops and restaurants and it's a "happening place" in the evenings.  We stopped off to watch the Steam Clock at 10:00 AM before leaving Vancouver.  What a lovely, quaint area of town.  We had dinner at a great little Italian place in an alley off Water Street.  There are plenty of choices.

title: Gastown
reviews: Okay to see but lots of store space is empty and very crowded with people on the sidewalks.  Some great restaurants to eat at and neat to see the steam clock in the center of town.

title: Picturesque - with interesting sights
reviews: We visited on foot - simply because we knew it was on the tour routes.  Started out right - with quick, tasty lunch at Chill Winston'.  Saw the Steam (powered) Clock, and ended at Vancouver Lookout

title: Nothing special
reviews: We had a wonder through Gastown this afternoon after spending the morning in Stanley Park. It's quite a pretty area with the unique lamps, tree lined streets, and of course the steam clock.There were a few boutique shops around, but they're maybe better for the locals (furniture!), some nice looking clothes shops, and nice eateries. There were a lot of souvenir shops selling tat which ruins the vibe though!Maybe we've been spoiled by London, but for us Gastown was nothing to write home about. Don't go out of your way to visit!

title: Fun day in Vancouver
reviews: We went to Vancouver to take a break from packing our Aunts condo.The shops are what you would expect. Old buildings mostly the same tourist item. We were looking for Canada sweatshirts for our grandsons. We had a very Tasty fish & chips lunch at a nice restraint. Parking was by meter outside. I think there is a parking garage also.

title: Touristy trap - more of a go-between
reviews: I was really disappointed in Gaston. I tagged along on my husband's business trip, so while he was conferencing, I was adventuring. I thought I would be able to spend a day -- or at least an afternoon -- ambling through Gastown and Chinatown (often billed in the same neighborhood area). What a chump. Talk about a tourist trap. Because it was so touristy, restaurants were really crowded or pricey, and the shops were all over-priced. In the end, it wound up adding steps to my daily hikes, so for that I appreciated it.

title: Good night out
reviews: Full of atmosphere, loads of bars and restaurants.  The steam clock is interesting even tho a local resident told us that it is no longer steam powered

title: Nice place to visit early evening
reviews: Interesting place to walk. We went in the evening and the lights where on. Very pretty . Lots of shops to visit so good for tourist looking for gifts . We enjoyed looking in the many shops .

title: So much history
reviews: What a stunning place to visit. The old style shops and the steam powered clock. Very pleasant walk.

title: Buzzing, historical centre
reviews: great destination to see "old" Vancouver. Lots of quirky little shops and places to eat.Lovely cobbled streets and antique lamp posts.  Try the Cork and Fin for some truly excellent food. The best we had in Vancouver, with top notch service.the guided walk after dark is meant to be good (and a little bit spooky)

title: Historic Gastown
reviews: Recently visited Gastown with my partner and enjoyed wandering down the cobblestone streets with the old gas lamps.  Visited the original train station, took in the views of the waterfront, had a look through the Old Spaghetti Factory restaurant which had a rather unique old world charm about it., Gastown has been updated but kept its original ambience and the Old Steam Clock is a must to go and watch the intricate workings of it and the Steam coming out from the top. We had no trouble walking through the streets and were not hassled by beggars etc.  We continued our walk down to Canada Bay.  Nice tourist area to visit. Jubeesydney

title: Quaint "Village" Atmosphere
reviews: Lots of international tourists milling about.  Comfortable atmosphere and plenty of pedestrian space.  Shops are primarily souvenir.  The Gastown clock is worth several minutes viewing.

title: Worth a look
reviews: Lovely old cobbled streets packed with cute shops and cafes. The steam clock was great and attracted a lot of attention. Great area for a morning's browsing.

title: ok
reviews: the only real reason to go to gas town was to see & hear the Gas clock chime &  with the steam pouring out the top it is indeed worth seeing but other than that its just another nice tree lined avenue with shops.

title: Tree-Lined Oasis
reviews: Gastown was a revelation. We were warned that near it is an area which we should not venture to walk through so we went on the Hop On Hop Off bus service.  Gastown has as its main attraction the steam clock which is indeed interesting, but the area itself is a tree-lined oasis in a busy town.  There are a whole variety of eateries and pubs and some very good furniture shops.  It made a really diverting afternoon trip for us.  Thoroughly recommended.

title: Charming...and a Steam Clock
reviews: This is a good area to visit and walk around being the older part of Vancouver.  The area has been developed in the last few years and is now a pleasant tourist hotspot.  The original train station is worth a visit and the Steam Clock is very popular.

title: A great place to wander as a tourist
reviews: As other people have said, it is the steam clock that draw the tourists.  The big coaches pull up and disgorge lots of tourists who take pictures and get back on the coach.  The best time is when there are no coaches and it is great to wander down the street, drop in for a coffee and/or restaurant and visit some of the shops (including souvenir shops) - and yes, admire the steam clock.

title: Loved the steam Clock
reviews: A very unique steam clock for all to see in Gas Town. Some could st for hours to watch the clock and wait for the steam whistles every quarter of an hour and the big one on the hour.

title: Nice place for shoping and to meat people.
reviews: God shopping ,nice restaurants,and all nice people we met.Strongly recomended.A perfect place for a family or on your own.

title: Steam Clock is interesting
reviews: Gastown has a lot of tourist things to look at. The main attraction is the Steam Clock, but not before you have passed a lot of souvenir shops and restaurants to visit along the way.  I have to say that this is not one of the most comfortable areas to visit, and I rarely go much further than the steam clock.

title: The clock was worth it
reviews: Visited primarily to see the clock and not disappointed other than it struck the hours (11) at 10.45.? Just watch out for all the beggars and panhandlers who harass you while walking Water St.

title: Excellent spot
reviews: Vancouver without Gastown is less than Vancouver, so come, enjoy the history, the shops and the restaurants!

title: Rather quirky
reviews: We walked to this area easily from the centre along West Cordova Street.It is a small, rather quirky area, with a variety of small shops and restaurants there is an interesting, working, steam clock and a statue further on of Gassy Jack, after whom the area is named.

title: Charming Neighbourhood Worth a Visit
reviews: This neighbourhood had a lot of charm and character. There's just something about those old-fashioned gas lamps! Great boutiques, bars and restaurants. Not so great giant tour buses parked on the street and letting streams of tourists flood the sidewalks. Vancouver should prohibit tour buses from dropping off/picking up tourists in this area.

title: Tourism at it worst
reviews: Well it's worth a look just for the clock but other than that it is just the same old Chinese run tourist shops selling the same old stuff and that is without running the gauntlet from the beggars that constantly harass you . Just have a quick look at the clock and go elsewhere.

title: Awesome
reviews: Nice for walking and window shopping and finding everything you want. The clock is a must. Good for walking both at day/night time

title: Still a good place to find some good eats and drinks
reviews: Gastown is a neat place to visit.  It has lots of shops, although many are the same sort of thing, and lots of independent bars and restaurants.  One of our favourites is The Alibi Room, just a little west of Gassy Jack.  Gastown is not so much a destination of itself anymore but a location to find a good place to eat and/or drink.

title: Found it a bit dodgy!!! üò≥
reviews: We were told that you had to be careful if visiting this area and to not flash your cameras or cash!! Having now been I understand why.  Loads of beggars and unsavoury types.  Found a great place for coffee but sat watching the beggars harass two Japenese girls.  If you go be aware of your surroundings and take extra care of your possessions if my advice.

title: Homeless hangout
reviews: Slightly disappointed on our visit to gas town. We were very much looking forward to seeing the famous clock and getting a picture with it, but was disappointed that the clock had been temporarily removed for renovation. A lot of homeless people set up on street corners, found ourselves crossing the street quite a few times to avoid them as we found it quite intimidating. I really couldn't really think of another reason why I would want to visit gas town again apart from seeing the missing clock

title: Interesting tourist area with history and a Steam Clock!
reviews: This area is a mix of eclectic stores, furniture stores, places to eat, the Film Institute, and the world's only steam clock. It also is home to the homeless, and felt a bit less safe than most other areas of Vancouver. It is steeped in history, and makes an interesting outing for an afternoon.

title: Fun Place to People Watch
reviews: Great place for a walk, shopping and people watching.  Lots of places to EAT! I would be glad to take new visitors hers.

title: Awesome shops and dining options.
reviews: Great area of town to walk around and enjoy the sites.  Great restaurant options from fine dining to pizza.  Parking is a bit of a concern in the evening, but overall a great area to visit.

title: Cute
reviews: After visiting the Tower headed into Gastown. Cute cobbled streets and boutique shops. Didn't stop as time not on our side. Would definitely recommend and go back.

title: Great food and shopping
reviews: Enjoyed this beautiful part of Town. Gastown clock was quite interesting as it blows off steam. Loved all the outdoor dinning and shops. Great place to just spend the day outside strolling.

title: Gastown Vancouver
reviews: Apart from the steam clock and the ststue of gassy Jack there is nothing special about gas town. A tourist trap. A few eating places and souvenir shops.

title: Tourist Tourists
reviews: great aerea to stroll through, many small shops seling l soveiners  great aerea for outdoors dinning, lots of tourist as it is close to cruise ship terminals at Canada Place

title: Trending
reviews: Fun and hip. This trendy part of Vancouver offers a lot of shops and restaurants! Great for just spending the day walking around town!

title: Perfect for walking round
reviews: You can easily pass a good couple of hours walking round here, there are so many interesting sights specially the Steam Clock

title: good service great food
reviews: good choice of shops, restaurants and bars very good value for money. Try the original spaghetti factory for the best Italian food ive tasted in a long time great friendly service

title: A little touristy but fun just the same
reviews: A must see: the steam clock. Great quiet coffee houses and good sandwiches. No chains or fast food was a delight. Great people watching and easy walking

title: A bit disappointing
reviews: Although Gastown was brightly decorated with hanging baskets and had its share of quirky shops, it was very crowded with tourists and, as a result had drawn a considerable number of beggars. Compared to other parts of Vancouver it seemed quite dirty.

title: A small town, with good old street.
reviews: 5-6 blocks, old buildings. A lot of restraunt and bars. We do not have time pressure, just would like to spend some time over here. Walk through it and find a Starbucks and drink teas for 2-3 hours. The sun is beautiful today. We could see a lot of tourism groups passing by. Must be a famous place.

title: Ok if you like lots of tourist shops.
reviews: We enjoyed the Steam clock and were fortunate to arrive right on the hour and caught it playing it's steamy tune. Other than that, we  found the area a bit over rated, just touristy.

title: Great Area
reviews: We stayed only a couple of blocks from the center of Gastown and spent a lot of our six days in Vancouver in the Gastown area.  On one edge of Gastown is Chinatown and on the other is Harbour Centre and Waterford Station. Gastown is a foodies heaven and when you aren't eating there are a large range of shops to visit. It is also the main stop for the Vancouver hop on hop off bus. The Flying Pig rates in our top three happy hour places world wide ---- 4 to 6 PM seven days a week.

title: Historical and Picturesque
reviews: One of the few remaining areas in Vancouver with a number of historical buildings. Many popular restaurants, bars, and clubs everywhere make Gastown buzz at night, but its character and beauty shine through the day. Lots of shops that cater to visitors, but little for city dwellers unless you're young or a big restaurant goer.

title: Interesting Place
reviews: This is an interesting and eclectic neighborhood to stroll through. Lots of opportunity to eat, shop and people watch. Only downside is the many panhandlers.

title: Gastown great for afternoon walk
reviews: The gastown is a quaint area along the waterfront with tree lined streets that extends for the better part of a mile and is loaded with shops, bars/pubs, galleries and restaurants.  There are even two cigar shops that sell cubans.  Many of the shops are quite pricey but the Gastown is certainly worth the walk.

title: Spend some time here while visiting Vancouver
reviews: This area is loaded with shops and some very nice restaurants.  It is very safe to stroll both in the day and at night.  If you are not into the walk though it is a quick and inexpensive taxi ride from the downtown hotels, such as the Marriott.  As in any big city you will see some "characters" but they did not bother us.

title: Gastown is a great for a walk about!
reviews: I once worked and lived in Gastown and have made many trips back to have a nibble and a nip in one of Gastown's many artisan retro boutique hotels and eateries. Lots of original buildings are now being utilized. A great place to wander in and around. All the streets are user friendly and if you notice a little of Vancouver's dark side residents and you shouldn't be alarmed, they have been around since day one. Considered by the local residents as being atmosphere. Lots of hidden gems when you walk the old alleys and don't forget to look up at the roof tops. The Roger's Sugar building, the first jail in the mews. Once there was a thriving community that lived below the streets. Can be read about on Google. The steam clock, the polished floors of the Sinclair building and the Sea bus and Rail Station Architecture. Good foot wear and be ready for boat loads of tourists. I like the heather for a beer and a Scotch egg. Gastown is what it is, a great walk about!

title: nice part of town
reviews: Great place to visit to get some of the city's history especially the steam clock which goes off every 15 mins

title: Great for strolling
reviews: Gastown is an older district of Vancouver that has been allowed to stay largely true to its architecture and ambiance. We previously visited there about 20 years ago and it's really great to see that it has been revitalized since then. The steam clock is unique and a tourist draw. Much better to access Gastown by public transportation than to drive there, as streets are small and often stuffed with cars. Great walking area, though, and near the waterfront. Truly a must-see part of Vancouver. Only drawback is the seemingly endless t-shirt shops, but there are a few good quality stores here & there to check out.

title: A good lively spot
reviews: A good place to visit if you are a young person as its frequented by a young set, lots of bars and cafes. fashion shops and that sort of thing

title: A must in Vancouver
reviews: Fun to poke around.  It is what there is to see in Vancouver - take a tour to hear the stories and stay for lunch

title: Good choice
reviews: lots of choice, we tried the Spaghetti Factory, a great 3 course meal and very good value. Also tried the steamworks brewery which is a great pub with a huge selection of food and enjoyed both equally although very different. However, if you don't like either of these there is a huge variety of places to choose from

title: Nice on a bike
reviews: We did that on a bike that we had rented. I can advise you to do that. You get a wonderful impression of Vancouver and its very entertaining.

title: A very intersesting district of the city full of good restaurants, coffee shops and uh... junkies.
reviews: This part of Vancouver has many attractions and I think it's a very interesting place but I'd suggest not spending too much time here even though it's a good place for food and coffee. There are a lot of great restaurants here that have sprung up, but also there are a lot of people with drug problems that frequent the area, so I'd suggest you be prepared for that reality if you go here. They're not aggressive or dangerous. If you make eye contact with them they often look away and leave the area quickly. It's actually quite sad, but there is little you can do for them and if they ask for spare change you can decide to give it or not. I usually do if I have some. Overall I think it's an interesting part of the city and worth seeing, but don't stay too long, it's not really dangerous, more depressing after a prolonged visit. See for yourself.

title: A great experience
reviews: Lovely  souvenir  shops awesome  seeing  the gas clock with the steam go off every hour. The hop on hop off bus is a must would recommend

title: Very pretty location
reviews: Easy to walk to and worth a visit.  Very pretty at night with all the lights and lots of good eating places.

title: Nice area
reviews: Nice way to spend a couple of hours. Getting to the area from downtown Vancouver means being passing through a number of beggars but not in gas town itself. Nice arty shops and interesting gas clock and main square. Loved the shop in the main square selling cowboy boots and hats!

title: Vibrant area and worth a visit if in Vancouver
reviews: good to walk through.  Go late to see the lights but beware the street vendors and "helpful" people on the street who ask for tips.  Spend some time viewing the clock

title: Charming Area to Explore
reviews: What a FUN neighborhood to Explore when visiting Vancouver!  We had a great time wandering around the streets and checking out the shops and restaurants and sights.  Looked so beautiful at night with the twinkle lights in the trees lining the cobblestone streets..... so enjoyable!

title: Interesting blend of History, shopping and eating
reviews: This area has all the markings of a Tourist Trap, but with the fine dining and interesting historical items it is a place to see, shop and eat.  The kids will enjoy the trinkets, the wife the Fine shopping and everyone the food.  Be sure to see the steam clock when it "Chimes" on the hour.

title: Gastown has everything in walking distance.
reviews: Stopped at Gastown by using the HOP on Hop off transportation.  Walked from one end to the other, then walked back to the Four Seasons.  Gastown has everything, even a clock that runs on steam.  They have a large variety of shops and restaurants.  A lot of the area is brick, so you do need to watch your step a bit.

title: Enjoyable stroll on the Gastown strip
reviews: Great stroll down Water St and stopped to see the Steam Clock. Some interesting shops and resturants. Note that its advisable to stay on Water St and really not venture  a block up as its no where as nice as Water St. Hopefully the revitization expands but for now its just the one strip.

title: Fantastic part of town
reviews: What I love about Vancouver is there are so many little places that feel like their own little city.  Gastown does not disappoint.  Plenty of restaurants to chose from.  Kind of a hippy,  artsy feeling to the area.  At night the trees are lit up with white lights which is a nice touch.  It's very clean,  safe and friendly. Probably one of my favourite places in Vancouver.

title: Great part of Vancouver
reviews: Gastown has an awesome feel about it so many cafe's and good restaurants lovely place to wander around look in the shops and enjoy the village atmosphere

title: Vancouver streetlife with charming historical notes
reviews: this is worth a couple of hours on a nice day or one with a little rain.  The shops vary from high end furnishings, art and designer wear to funky little shops kids will love.  people watching is good from many of the little cafes.  Steam clock is a special delight.

title: Just OK
reviews: Not sure what we were expecting.  The Gastown area had bars and restaurants, sure, but I guess we were expecting more.  And we may have missed it, but essentially it is a couple of streets trending to the tourist side to us.

title: Great place to people watch
reviews: We chose to stay in an hotel about 2 blocks away from Gastown as we were only in Vancouver for one night and it looked like an interesting area online. It didn't disappoint us. We strolled around the area and had lunch at a bar, then did the tourist trolley bus in the afternoon, which we were able to book on a street corner. In the evening we walked back to Gastown and got a seat sitting outside at the Water Street Restaurant and watched the tourist gawping at the steam clock on the opposite corner. Great fun was had as they tried to get a photo every time the clock struck the quarter hour and steam came out of the top. Altogether a lovely area and not so many homeless people here - something we saw a lot of in other areas of the city and found very sad.

title: Nice place to visit
reviews: Fun place, lots of shopping and places of interest. Steam clock not to be missed. Some good restaurants. Lets of tourist junk as well.

title: The most toristy area of Vancouver
reviews: A nice, but very touristy area given its proximity to the Cruise Ship Terminal at Canada Place. This area feels less safe than the rest of Vancouver- there was a large number of beggars and addicts on the streets on the day we visited. The shops are mostly souvenir type shops, though some good restaurants

title: Good for a stroll
reviews: You need a dry day to do this place justice unfortunately it was pouring down when we visited would have loved to stroll round without getting soaked it's a very historical place lots of cafes and souvenir shops

title: OK if you are looking for a place to buy sourineers
reviews: Very touristy. Lots of t-shirt and trinket shops. But there are a few hire-end stores and restaurants here and there. The Steam clock is cool, but mostly a disappointment.

title: worth a look
reviews: ignore the "homeless" and this is a very nice area to have a wander around.  loads of neat shops and places to eat,gets really busy when cruise ships are in.the steam clock is a must see

title: Very Interesting
reviews: lovely area for a leisurely stroll and heaps of shops. The steam clock is beautiful. The streets were very clean and a pleasure to see.

title: interesting atmosphere
reviews: A completely different atmosphere from central downtown Vancouver.  Smaller more specialist shops, with the Steam Clock as a main attraction.

title: Steam clock.
reviews: enjoyed this district with shops and tourist. had lunch at The Flying Pig restaurant. waited on the corner for the Steam clock to whistle.

title: Nice Buildings but not easy to walk through
reviews: Found the area to be filth with trash, crowded with homeless people.  Stay away from Vancouver. It had only a few nice stores and restaurants but the place is too dirty.

title: One of many wonderful areas to visit in Vancouver!
reviews: Nice area with shops and restaurants. The oldest area in Vancouver. We walked there from our hotel in the West End.

title: The Steam Clock is nice
reviews: The Steam Clock is nice, but otherwise the place is crowded with homeless people, and you do not feel safe walking there at night

title: Gastown Worth a Visit While in Vancouver
reviews: We went to this area while in town after concluding a cruise to Alaska, and enjoyed walking through this historical area of quaint shops.  Really we came for the Cuban cigars, but ended up purchasing some other items that we found.  If you have a couple of hours to spare, this is a good walking area of Vancouver's downtown district.

title: Boot Shop and Lamplighter Too
reviews: We found the Gastown area of Vancouver to be so fun while exploring Vancouver.  Be sure to stop into the Boot shop at the mainl intersection and the Lamplighter Bar at the Dominion Hotel...tell the nice manager at the former and Bernie and Samantha at the latter, I sent you!

title: Happening Place
reviews: Great area to do some walking around and have a meal.Be sure to see the steam clockThere are many shops and restaurants so allow yourself some time to explore.

title: Gastown - no - no to hobos
reviews: An interesting shopping district spoilt by dozens of hobos.Interesting steam driven clock and also many cafes

title: Canadian holiday
reviews: Brilliant area. Lots of hanging pots full of beautiful flowers. Lovely buildings with lots of eateries and shops

title: Like Soho/Greenwich in NY
reviews: I like this part of Vancouver reminding me of NY - not very big - just about 2 or blocks but lovely buildings. Granville Island the Seawall and Gastown were my favourites.

title: The atmosphere is the best and the friendly staff
reviews: love the old clock and statue of gassy jack. Shops are trendy and the dining is good down there as well.

title: End of Holland America Triple Denali tour
reviews: Tourist area, of specialty shops and ethnic restaurants.  We walked through on a Wednesday mid day.  Sidewalks passable. Lunch at Irish Heather was good.

title: Historic but could be made better
reviews: Attrractive old downtown Vancouver with lots of bars and restaurants. However although there are some historic places labelled more could be made of this history. Perhaps consider a guided tour

title: Tourist attraction spot
reviews: Definitely one of the tourist attractions~ Gastown is big, at least a few blocks. Many gift shops and restaurants/bars. Great place to eat/drink & shop!!It was very interesting to check out those historic buildings. They have their own characters.

title: Atmosphere Plus!
reviews: Explored the Gastown area and admired the steam clock which goes off 1/4 hourly.  It sounds like a train which is all part of the novelty.  It is an awesome piece of kit!  Loved the craft brewed beer that was abundant in Gastown.  There were plenty of restaurants and bars.  A likely and thriving area of Vancouver.An attractive area of the city, lovely street lamps and floral baskets.  We came back here several times just to enjoy the atmosphere

title: what a delightful neighborhood!
reviews: we were directed to visit this area as part of the puzzlers convention, so we arrived knowing nothing and expecting nothing.  Ended up spending 3 hours just being there!  sidewalk dining (tasty, friendly) art galleries, book stores, interesting people - as much as I liked the other Vancouver neighborhoods we visited, gastown would be my first choice for hanging out on a return visit to vancouver

title: Reminded me of Georgetown.
reviews: Really nice place.  Very pretty with the light posts and flowers.  We watched the gas clock steam it's "chimes" at 6:00.  Some very good and affordable souvenir shops.  Lots of shopping, eating, and drinking available.  Good people-watching area.

title: Walked through on way to T
reviews: Very touristy area but fun shops to browse among.  The steam clock goes off every 15 minutes if this is your thing.  Lots of restaurants and interesting people watching.

title: One of those place you have to visit
reviews: Everyone says "go to Gastown".  We were even told we were "crazy" if www didn't.  So we did, mostly because there are some native galleries there that we wanted to check out and we wanted to see the steam-powered clock (that was weird, but very cool).  There is really just one street to walk, Water street I think, but it's a good way to spend a few hours.  Shopping consists of touristy stuff for the cruise ship crowd, to upscale galleries of First Nation art.  One thing to be aware of, this is were the homeless will hit you up for money.  They are not abusive, but they are there.  To be honest, it was pretty sad,

title: Greta atmosphere
reviews: Lovely atmospheric part of Vancouver. Great restaurants and shops selling First Nation art. Can get quite busy though.

title: Beautiful !
reviews: The only problem with this section of town is that there isn't more of it!  We thoroughly enjoyed wandering in and out of the shops and galleries.  We didn't dine here but there are plenty of spots and they seem to be filled all day long.  Beautifully gentrified, maintaining historical architectural integrity.

title: Not the best part of Vancouver
reviews: Not my favourite place in Vancouver due to the large number of itinerant drug users.  There are much nicer places to visit in Vancouver.

title: GasTown
reviews: what a fantastic area- lovely shops and trendy shops with great coffee shops , a nice flat area to walk around

title: Awesome walking area
reviews: Gastown is a wonderful area of Vancouver.  Easy walking to many shops, restaurants and cocktail bars which we visited with gusto.  The steam clock is a must as well.

title: Be here on the hour
reviews: The steam clock and Gassy Jack's statue are a must on any visit to Vancouver and, if you time your visit right, you will hear the lovely melody from the clock (on the hour).  Nice tourist shops here as well.

title: Shops and restaurants
reviews: Gastown is a busy street with lots of little shops. A typical tourist hotspot. It is close to Canada place. It was nice walkning around and do some shopping. Go and see for yourself, I think you will like it.

title: Somewhat disappointing
reviews: Over crowded and over priced area with surprisingly little choice.Went to the Lamplighters which was OK but very busy

title: Gastown
reviews: Interesting historical street! A few quirky shops with home grown designers together with souvenir shops & restaurants!Worth a walk!

title: Wanted to stay longer!
reviews: What a great place to stroll and eat. Wish we had more time to explore this area. Looks like the coolest part of the city.

title: Nice area to stroll around
reviews: If you are tired of the downtown area, look for Gastown just a short walk away. Not too hard to find and a few blocks from the Chinatown area. A few blocks of tree lined streets with lots of shops selling just about everything and plenty of places to eat and drink. Just strolling around this section of town was a pleasant experience.

title: Gastown
reviews: Gastown is quaint, some nice places to eat, some great pubs, alot of souviner shops, and of course the steam clock

title: Interesting area of Vancouver
reviews: We like Gastown area because of the way it looks. The tree lined brick paved streets set if off from the asphalt streets of Vancouver. The area has a mix of restaurants, souvenir shops, jewelry shops and professional businesses. Some of the shops were pretty pricey. The steam clock is the main attraction of Gastown.

title: Hstoric and heart of Vncouver
reviews: I  liked the gas watch and the restaurants , souvenirs  shops and it is very interesting when you visit in evening it is near Canada place and many tourist attractions as well.

title: Pleasant to walk about but pricey
reviews: Very touristy and expensive but nice to walk around.  You can see it all in about 1hr there are some nice coffee shops but lots of those tourist shops too which we all get drawn into one way or another!  The steam clocknis nice and some of tgevred brick buildings are nice to see.  Worth going for an hour or two and not really out of the way either.

title: Many things to see and do.
reviews: We found this area of Vancouver very interesting while staying a couple of days after our cruise.  Many restaurants and shops in the area.  Found the steampowered clock very interesting.  A nice visit.

title: Very enjoyable
reviews: A nice old fashioned area with lots of eateries & pretty buildings especially as the sun goes down & the street lights go on with the lovely hanging flowers baskets, be sure to visit the gas powered clock.

title: Lively
reviews: Lively neighbourhood, full of bars and restaurants. But also beggars and funny people who want money, some offer peculiar services, like telling you a funny joke :) we need to go back again.

title: Lots to do!
reviews: Gas town has tons of excellent restaurants to explore and its a hop skip and step to Canada place. Parking can be expensive though. Go with a underground parkade for safety too. Tip: all the fun stuff is to the west heading towards the sea bus terminal.

title: Cool part of town worth checking out.
reviews: A reasonably cool collection of funky and eclectic shops and eateries, braced by the gassy Jack statue and the steam clock.The folks in the area seem to maintain a pleasant and chill vibe.

title: Cool area with awesome restaurants and fun shops
reviews: Stop by here a little before dinner at some new or well-known hotspot and enjoy the shopping, people-watching and bar options.  This neighborhood has a little bit of everything so you will be able to please a wide variety.

title: Great buildings
reviews: A nice walk in the evening. We loved the old buildings and the overall atmosphere. Grab a bite to eat at one of the many restaurants in the area.

title: It's changed and that's a hood thing
reviews: In the 70s Gastown was the happening spot in Vancouver. Woodward's went out of business and the slide began. It has rejuvenated in a big way. Lots of terrific restaurants now and a lot less of the squalor. The hokey steamclock and Gassy Jack persist but don't hold that against it. It's a happening place again and if you're visiting Vancouver it's got a lot going for it.

title: historical
reviews: loved walking round Gastown as it is an older part of the city, has a great brewery and many restaurants and bars also.  defo this is a place to vist when in Vancouver

title: not a big deal
reviews: unfortunately, gastown abuts an area that is occupied by homeless, junkies and prostitutes. the clock is fun to watch in action and there are some nice stores...but not much beyond that

title: Don't make a special effort
reviews: If you're in the area, fine, but it should not be a destination.  We ate at a trendy restaurant/brew pub and it was ok, but pricey. Decent view, but not as "historic" as you're led to believe.

title: Gastown - Gasclock
reviews: Lots to see here-shops and lovely places to eat and of course the Gas Clock which is a must especialy when it chimes on the hour

title: Any time of year
reviews: I love gastown, just spending the day wandering around, looking in all the shops and restaurants. Chill out in a coffee shop, watch the crowds roll by. Great way to spend the day, rain or shine.

title: Gastown
reviews: An amazing place to just wander up and down the street. The Gastown clock is one of a kind and worth seeing as it plays a tune using steam.

title: Happening!
reviews: Immediately after checking into our hotel, we walked to Gastown and felt as though we'd dived right into the cool section of town.  There are endless shops to explore, and the number of restaurants to choose from was dizzying.  One definitely has the sense that Gastown is not just for tourists, which is lovely, and makes for very interesting people watching.

title: Interesting Gastown
reviews: Very cool, historic district with the famous Gastown clock! Lots of really nice shops/galleries - HOT TIP! great place to buy souvenirs, don't hold off to buy them at the Vancouver airport - the international departure duty free shopping is truly disappointing with absolutely no local artLoved the street entertainment, bars and eating places were good tooIf you are walking to Gastown, be careful to avoid Carrall and Hastings streets - this is three blocks where homeless people congregate/live/deal/survive (just) and can be very intimidating to stumble upon, many taxi drivers are called in to 'extract' people that unintentionally find themselves there

title: nice place to visit and shop
reviews: Very pleasant streets with small shops and eateries.  You can stop for a drink and people watch or have a snack.  Check out the Flying Pig for a really good bite to eat or happy hour.

title: Ok afternoon
reviews: Interesting walk after the lookout. Check out the Steam Clock. Not massively inspiring otherwise as the town has a bit of a kitschy feel, while it may be perfectly authentic.

title: Nice place but homeless people everywhere
reviews: Homeless people everywhere drugs addicts etc safe nice place nice rest and bars etc close to waterfront sky train etc U2 drank at a bar there right next to waterfront station

title: Fun Part of Vancouver, BC
reviews: Gastown is an up market area with great shops, restaurants and plenty to look at.  This revitalized area is great for gawking, meeting friends and just plain having fun.  Plan on at least a couple of hours plus some time for a nice sidewalk lunch.

title: Nice, but has changed over the years
reviews: Last time I was in the Gaslight district prior to this trip, was in 1993. It really changed a lot!  It is very nice now, a lot of the buildings have been renovated and lots of nice shops, restaurants and pubs.  The clock tower seems to blow steam much more often (used to be only on the hour), so that is nice.  However, there are a lot more beggars than I ever remembered. They are actually quite aggressive.  We gave and the same people kept asking again. They would wait outside the restaurants as you exited and beg. It was a sad commentary, and one that I noticed as different from years past.

title: Cool shops to browse theough
reviews: Here on a Sunday and was fun to look at steam clock and other interesting pieces of Gastown history along with hoards of others. Great shops, easy to get around.

title: Touristy
reviews: Lots of gift shops and cafes but just down the road looks like a doss house with homeless and beggers. I could smell weed and urine - not great.  Saw the steam clock and the time on it is wrong!

title: A must place to visit.
reviews: Good shopping and great places to eat and drink. I recommend Al Porto restaurant. Make use of "happy hour" as food and drink is generally cheaper. Beware of beggars.

title: Interesting Neighborhood
reviews: An area of reconstructed old buildings just east of downtown Vancouver, Gastown has become a favorite of residents and tourists alike. Some interesting shops mixed in with a diverse set of restaurants make it a place for a good stroll during the day or into the early evening. Check out the steam clock and wander along the northern edge for a full view of the harbor.

title: Nice historical part of town with interesting up-market shops and eateries
reviews: This area has a slightly contrived feel as of historical interest when it is only a couple of years old and the steam clock is a bit of modern addition. However it is a pleasant part of town to stroll through and browse the shops and eateries/coffe bars. 1 note of caution is that beyond Carrall St the nice area ends and there are a lot of homeless people so it can feel a little unsafe. We even saw drugs being dealt on a street corner which was an education for my 15 year old that I would rather not have had so stick to the main areas.

title: Not as fun as other places... but...
reviews: We walked around and shopped a bit but really there's not much to do. Its kinda dirty here and there were lots of homeless begging for change.

title: Historic neighborhood with plenty to see
reviews: There are some great tourist stores and some great more contemporary stores.  The historic steam clock, the old railway station and lots of great restaurants can be found in the Gastown area which is an easy walk from most downtown hotels.

title: Gasps Town
reviews: We took the hop on hop off bus and  got off at Gas Town,lovely little place very quaint and lots of shops to visit,nice touristy shops ,really enjoyed the story about Gassy  Jack  and the steam clock is beautiful ,well worth a visit

title: Should walk through Gastown
reviews: You should walk through Gastown.  It is ok andv ery busy.  Everyone stops to see the steam clock!  Lots of restaurants but we didn't eat there.  It was just too crowded.  Seems to be very fun and everyone enjoys themselves - A good thing!

title: Worth spending time in Gastown.
reviews: Loved taking  a walking foodie tour if Gastowm. Our guide was full of information about the area. Lots to see, shop and eat.

title: Good place to walk around
reviews: Very nice a few streets to walk around, lots of restaurants and shop. Allots for tourists. Take pictures

title: Gastown
reviews: We took a hop-on hop-off bus ride ($39 for seniors) and alighted at Gastown - named after a guy called Gassy Jack who talked a lot. There's a statue of him on the town. There's a steam-powered elaborate-looking clock that chimes the hours and quarters, which is quaint. There are a few "touristy" gift shops but also a lot of more discerning shops too. Some nice jewellery at Artina's not far from the stopping point for the bus. There are several art galleries specialising in First Nations art, and a contemporary gallery next to the clock where you can buy limited edition photographs. There are several places to eat, and it is a bustling and vibrant area.

title: A very pretty and quaint little area of the city.
reviews: We visited this area as part of the Hop-on Hop-off bus tour of Vancouver. A very pretty and quaint little area of the city. The steam clock was very interesting.  It is well worth a visit and a stroll around the tourist area. There are many good restaurants to choose from, plus lots of tourist shops.

title: Must see
reviews: Gastown is a must see if you are in Vancouver. With its quaint shops, narrow streets and lots of diverse restaurants you will want to spend all day walking around. Gastown is an easy walk from the cruise ship terminal taking only 10 minutes to get there at a leisurely pace...

title: A good place for lunch
reviews: This lovely little village is the original Vancouver. Lots of lovely restaurants and shops.  A great place to have lunch.  A very old clock run on steam is a great attraction.

title: Nice area with interesting shops
reviews: You can easily walk around in the area of Gas town, where you can see the steam clock and many nice shops.

title: Relaxed even though busy.
reviews: Lively by night, we chanced on a weekend car cavalcade of vintage American cars . An easy walked small area, but notable for polite panhandling , begging to us English tourists.Some venues were very full. The restaurant we ate at had people discreetly waiting inside for our outside table !Booking in advance is probably advisable. A good relaxed atmosphere throughout.I only glanced at the shops.

title: Home of steam clock
reviews: Nice area of Vancouver for a walkabout, have a meal or shop.  The steam clock is an amazing and fascinating machine.

title: Great food choice in abundance
reviews: Great range of shops and eateries here, lots of choice and price point too. The place comes alive at night when the twinkling tree lights come on, well worth a visit and great food in abundance. Just give the beggars a body swerve, lots of em!

title: Enjoyable
reviews: Great location in Vancouver. We enjoyed the restaurants and just walking around. It was a perfect summer Saturday evening.

title: so Awesome!
reviews: I love the old buildings and the brick walkways. Gastown had a really really friendly laid back feel to it. It was a really fun day!

title: Fun and funky historic neighborhood
reviews: This historic neighborhood has become a haven for the hip, with lots of trendy stores and restaurants.  We had dinner at at cafe just across the street from the famous Steam Clock‚Äîan oddball mix of clock and calliope that toots the quarter hours instead of chiming them‚Äîand strolled around the narrow streets for a while.  You can spend a pleasant hour or so here, and probably should.

title: Charming
reviews: Wonderful place just to wonder around and window shop.  Quint shops and some very good restaurants or just stop and have a cup of coffee.

title: Great place for eating out.
reviews: I love the atmosphere here. There are some great restaurants to choose from and lots of shops. There are a few homeless people hanging about but the police do try and move them on. The Vancouver trolley bus actually picks up and drops off here too. Don't miss the amazing steamclock!

title: Couzy
reviews: Great restaurants and bars. Food around is delicious. Perfect for a romantic date. Historical place, unique old street type.

title: Tired of Questions
reviews: I recommend staying at this facility, but definitely NOT COMPLETING ANOTHER QUESTIONNAIRE.  Please accept my earlier comments and let it go at that

title: Tick Tock!
reviews: Lots of restaurants and shops line the sweet main street of Gastown (Water street) - And of course everyone will tell you to stop and look at the old steam clock.  Lots of tourist in this area

title: Gastown By Night
reviews: Gastown is beautiful at night with the street lights and trees lit up.  Tons of shopping and restaurants for many blocks.  We enjoyed the Forbidden Vancouver tour of Gastown and learned about the early beginnings of this quaint village.

title: Nice Area for Night Life
reviews: This is a very nice area for bars and restaurants in downtown Vancouver.  It was walking distance from our hotel.  Be mindful as some of the fringe parts of this section of the city are a little "rough".  Should not be a problem if you are in a group.

title: Nice part of Vancouver
reviews: A nice place for strolling and probably for eating too (I didn't, but everything looked very nice). Famous steamwatch, cool, but very busy with tourists. But then, that's what we are, tourists, right? ;)

title: A dreamy town
reviews: Walked into Gastown in the evening, while street lights are up, glowing in amber-colored hues, the town is an antique entirely by itself. Irish-pubs lined up by the street, hidden in the shades of the dark trees. Noises are coming out from every open door, reflecting on the cobblestoned walk ways. I felt like walking in a European town, back in the mid 20th century. It is a dreamy place if you are searching nostalgic feeling in you soul.

title: Don't miss the clock
reviews: Don't miss the steaming clock on your trip here as you take in the history of the area plenty of shops and eateries too

title: Shopping central
reviews: Great place to shop!  Lots of fantastic bargains. A must see to stop at the steam clock, chimes beautifully each hour.

title: Tourist street
reviews: The street is filled with tourist shops  and cafes/restaurants.   The steam clock is interesting and worth reading the plaques.  The road has been paved to resemble cobbles of old I guess.  We were accosted several times by beggars and homeless.   I am surprised Vancouver allows this in a tourist area, as it became annoying.  If you are looking for souvenirs, this is the place.

title: What a Gas!
reviews: This is a great place to visit, lots of activity and good shopping, Lots of native art galleries and great pubs. Just a note of caution, it is obvious that there are large numbers of drug users and street beggars in this are, don't walk alone at night.

title: Loved it!
reviews: Love the historic aspects and shops. It has a great feel and is the best part of Vancouver. It also features a great ghost tour!

title: Very Small area
reviews: We walked here very easily from our hotel. The area is small not much is left of the older Vancouver what surprised us was the high amount of down and outs called derelicts in Canada they seemed to be on every road in this area I suppose because it is full of tourists many off the cruise boats who might give them a handout. The area was much toted but frankly was a let down some good restaurants around though.

title: a romantic day and evening with my wonderful lady
reviews: had a great time walking the streets and shopping the shops, with my newly acquired  girl friend had a great time/and good food at the old spaghetti factory and all the other things we ate.

title: A hopping area; a place to meet and enjoy a drink, a lunch, or a dinner
reviews: Since this area was close to our hotel we covered on many occasions. We dined in a number of the eateries and ventured into many of the local shops - clothing, souvenir, gelato, etc.

title: Nice Area
reviews: Nice area with shops, bars and of course the steam clock but be careful if you you walk from Chinatown, the 3 blocks between can be difficult. a very run down area.

title: good food and shopping
reviews: Has many shops and great eating. We ate at the Spegghetti house and it was fabulous a must do and gift shops galore

title: Mat visit Vancouver spot
reviews: Mix of touristy souvenir shops and really nice shops.  Good pubs, but can be busy.  Easy walk from downtown.

title: Worth a visit
reviews: Always a fun place to visit - quaint stores, convenient parking, nice to walk around. The steam clock in the middle is interesting!

title: Great part of town
reviews: We booked a free walking tour of Gastown via Tour Guys Vancouver and we are glad we did.  We got to learn facts about the area and history that we would not have known otherwise.  Lots of shops and eateries in the area.  It is especially pretty at night time with all the white lights in the trees and the lamps illuminating the streets.  Seems like a cool place to hang out and have a drink and dinner.

title: Overrated
reviews: Far too many passed out chemically addicted folks for my taste.  Very aggressive beggars too. There is five to six blocks to walk and see the statute.  After that, time to move along. A lot of the restaurants with bars won't allow under 21 so not real family friendly.

title: A place to hang around
reviews: The nicest part of Vancouver in my opinion. You can find lots of trendy fashion shops, jewellries and souvenir shops. Behind impressive skyscrapers, streets are charming, lined with floodlit trees and gather both cheap and axpensive restaurants.

title: A historic and rapidly updating area.
reviews: What a great little part of Vancouver.Just outside of the main waterfront transit station, gas town is awesome.  A great slice of Vancouver.It's very touristy during the day, with the steam clock and souvenir shops.Though there is plenty for the locals as well.  Great eateries and clubs and pubs for night life.

title: Busy
reviews: Very busy. A lot of the tourist shops are full of the same stuff.  Enjoyed a beer at Steamworks.  Ate at the Old Spaghetti Factory.

title: Pretty
reviews: Great old part of town, nice lamps and flowers. Up market shops as well as pubs, restaurants, coffee shops etc.Don't stray too far as there is a very undesirable area just a few blocks away.

title: A must visit place in Vancouver
reviews: Love this place!  Great bars, restaurants and cafes all located in a small section of Vancouver.  Wonderful vibe!

title: Great place
